description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Feb. 2 (AP)  The South Korean command acknowledged today that four Vietnamese civilians were killed by Korean marines last April in an incident south of Danang, but said their deaths were accidental.

title: JAVITS PROPOSES MIDEAST MEETING
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2Sen ator Jacob K. Javits proposed today that a regional Middle East peace conference be con vened, including Moslem states such as Turkey and Iran along side the militant Arab govern ments and Israel.

title: L.I.U. Sinks Seton Hall
description: Walter Jones, a sophomore, tallied a game high of 24 points to lead Long Island University to a 6655 victory over Seton Hall University last night at the winner's court in Brooklyn.

title: New Books
description: FICTION

title: Killer of 2 Escapes On Way to Court; Faced a Life Term
description: A 21yearold prisoner who had pleaded guilty to two hold up murder charges and faced a life sentence raced past his guards yesterday and escaped from the basement of the State Supreme Court Building in the Brooklyn Civic Center.

title: PATRIOTS REFUSED AGAIN BY HARVARD
description: The Boston Patriots, pro foot ball's orphans, remain without shelter. The Harvard Corpora tion, the sevenman governing body of the nation's oldest uni versity, turned down yesterday for the second time in a week the Patriots' plea to rent 65 yearold Harvard Stadium for seven home games next season.

title: Saigon to Free 1,324 at Tet
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Feb. 2 (UPI)President Nguyen Van Thieu announced tonight that the South VietnameseGov ernment would free 1,324 polit ical prisoners for Tet, the threeday Lunar New Year holi day that begins Friday. The official broadcast over the Government radio and televi sion network said other prison ers would also be freed.

title: Goldberg Gets CityU.N. Post
description: Mayor Lindsay yesterday an nounced the appointment of former Supreme Court Justice Arthur J. Goldberg as a mem ber of the United States United NationsNew York City Host Country Advisory Committee. The appointment was made jointly by the Mayor and Charles W. Yost, United States Representative to the United Nations, who along with Mr. Lindsay is cochairman of the committee.

title: Court Approves 3Way Railroad Merger
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2The Supreme Court cleared the track today for the merger of three of the nation's most prof itable railroads  the Great Northern and the Northern Pacific and their joint affiliate, the Chicago, Burlington & Quincy Railroad.

title: Lindsay Says Nixon Policies Hamper Housing
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2May or Lindsay told a Congres sional committee today that the Nixon Administration's anti inflation policies had not worked and were endangering local housing programs.

title: U.N. Big Four Talks
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Feb. 2Ambassadors of the United States, the Soviet Union, Brit ain and France continued their consultations about the Middle East today. They decided to meet again Feb. 12

title: SWIDLER IS SWORN AS P.S.C. CHAIRMAN
description: ALBANY, Feb. 2Joseph C. Swidler was sworn in today as chairman of the muchcriticized Public Service Commission and quickly pledged an effort to as sure that consumers would have a voice in the regulation of the state's utilities.

title: 6 Named to Men's Team
description: LEAVENWORTH, Wash., Feb. 2 (AP)  Midwesterners have won all six places on the United States men's skijumping team selected to compete in the world Nordic championships Feb. 14 to 22 in Czechoslovakia.

title: Power to Restrict Imports Advocated For the Presidency
description: MIAMI BEACH, Fla., Feb. 2 The authority to limit imports must rest in the hands of the President and not Congress, Senator John D. Pastore, Demo crat of Rhode Island, declared here today.

title: L.I.R.R Riders Are Docile as Usual
description: The new Long Island Rail Road fares, which went into effect for most riders yester day, were accepted by com muters with the same calm ness with which they accept airconditioning on the trains in the winter and heating in the summer.

title: 3 Plead Not Guilty in Yablohski Slaying
description: CLEVELAND, Feb. 2 (UPI)  Three Cleveland men accused of conspiracy in the slaying of Joseph A. Yablonski pleaded not guilty at their arraignment in Federal court here today.

title: Columbia Selects McGill, Psychologist, as President
description: William J. McGill, chancellor of the University of California at San Diego, was named presi dent of Columbia University yesterday.

title: City Highway Chief Named
description: City Transportation Admin istrator Constantine Sidamon Eristoff yesterday designated Vincent J. Gibney as Acting Commissioner of the Depart ment of Highway. Mr. Gibney had been deputy commissioner of the Department of Marine and Aviation.

title: Excerpts From Recent Addresses by Dr. McGill
description: The following excerpts are taken from recent addresses of Dr. William J. Mcaill, Chancellor of the University of California, San Diego, who was appointed yesterday to be president of Columbia University:

title: Jordan of Packers Retires
description: MILWAUKEE, Feb. 2 (AP) Henry Jordan, a fourtime all pro as a defensive tackle for the Green Bay Packers, said today he was retiring from football to become an execu tive in promotional work. The 35yearold Jordan was named an executive sales director for the Milwaukee World Festival Corporation.

title: Boston Theater Aide Fined; Minors Saw Fanny Hill
description: BOSTON, Feb. 2 (AP)Vin cent H. Hamelin, 48yearold manager of the Astor movie theater here, was convicted to day on two counts of showing an obscene filmFanny Hill to persons under the age of 18.

title: STOCKS IN LONDON REGISTER LOSSES
description: Prices on the London Stock Exchange fell yesterday. De pressing factors included Fri day's weakness on Wall Street and official statements on the forthcoming British budget.

title: Other Producers of Metals Say Results Vary
description: The International Nickel Company of Canada, Ltd., re ported yesterday that a strike, which closed most of its capacity for three months last year, caused a 19 per cent drop in earnings for the year.

title: Alaska Airlines in Offering
description: Alaska Airlines, Inc., an nounced yesterday plans to of fer stockholders the right to purchase 928,000 additional common shares on the basis of one new share for each four held. The First California Com pany is to be the underwriting manager.

title: Nixon Meeting 4 Governors
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2 (UPI) President Nixon and some members of his Cabinet will meet with four Midwest Repub lican Governors in Chicago Fri day to discuss environmental problems. Governors scheduled to attend are Richard Ogilvie of Illinois, William Milliken of Michigan, Warren Knowles of Wisconsin and Edgar Whitcomb of Indiana.

title: SENATORS PRAISE TRANSIT AID BILL
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2The Senate began today discussion of the Urban Mass Transporta tion Assistance bill of 1969 with a demonstration of sup port that seemed to assure passage within the next few days.

title: Pope's Viewpoint
description: During a canonization cere mony in Rome last week, Pope Paul VI expressed his preference for the forms of life among religious orders de veloped over the last two cen turies.

title: Wind and Rain Whip Traffic as Temperature Rises
description: The temperature rose to 56 degrees at 11:20 last night, breaking the old record of 55 for the date, set in 1933. By remaining at 56 until shortly after midnight, it broke an other record51 degrees set on Feb. 3 in 1927.

title: Kentucky Tops Auburn, 8483, With Basket in Last 11 Seconds
description: AUBURN, Ala., Feb. 2 (AP) Terry Mills's 25foot field goal with 11 seconds remaining to night gave secondranked Ken tucky an 8483 victory over Auburn in a Southeastern Con ference basketball game.

title: PRICE RISES SET BY DIAMOND SALT
description: The Diamond Crystal Salt Company announced yesterday that it plans to raise prices on salt products for industrial users by about 6 cents a hundred pounds, while prices of many other high grade and specialty salt products will be raised 7.5 to 11 cents a hun dred pounds. Certain farm and consumer items are expected to be raised about 8 cents a hun dred pounds.

title: Defiance Is Predicted
description: BATON ROUGE, La., Feb. 2 (UPI)Gov. John J. McKeithen told the Nixon Administration today that Louisiana would defy courtordered desegrega tion if it was forced upon the state.

title: Harold LeVine, 78, Founder Of Queens Brick Concern
description: Harold LeVine, founder and former president of the National Brick Company in Long Island City, Queens, which was sold in 1953 to the United States Plywood Corporation, died Thursday in Hollywood, Fla. He was 78 years old.

title: U.S. INDUSTRIES ACQUIRES ROMAR
description: U.S. Industries, Inc., an nounced yesterday the acquisi tion of Romar Tissue Mills, Inc., Wheelwright, Mass., and Hamil ton Industries, Inc., Chicago, the nation's largest maker of lamps and lampshades.

title: Parks
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2If Congress appropriates all that President Nixon has asked for the land and water conserva tion fund, the National Park Service will get more money next year for new land acquisitions than it has since the fund was created in 1965.

title: LongTime Faculty Member Named Rector at St. Paul's
description: CONCORD, N. H., Feb. 2 William A. Oates, administra tive vice rector and a member of the faculty for 28 years, has been elected the eighth rector of St. Paul's School.

title: TALKS ARE RESUMED IN RAILWAY DISPUTE
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2 (UPI) Negotiators seeking to avoid a nationwide rail shutdown next week met for two hours today, and the chief Govern ment mediator expressed hope that some progress might now be possible in the stalemate.

title: DUTCH BISHOPS SEEK DIRECT PAPAL REPLY
description: THE HAGUE, Feb. 2The eight Roman Catholic bishops of the Netherlands refused today to accept as the final word the Pope's pronounce ment upholding priestly celi bacy.

title: In Memoriam
description: ROSENTHALFrieda G. 2/3/64. Remember ing our magnanimous and exquisite Frieda.

title: PIANIST PERFORMS RARE BEETHOVEN
description: It alight be said of Beetho ven's Diabelli Variations that never have so many notes been owed to so few. This hour long work, which grows out of a harmless little waltz by Dia belli like an oak tree out of an acorn, is one of the great piano nieces. Since it is not to every one's taste, it is not played in publics very often. Last night it made one of its rare appear ances in a recital by Blanca Uribe at the Grace Rainey Rogers Auditorium of the Met ropolitan Museum of Art.

title: Theater: Paris Is Out!
description: RICHARD SEFF'S play Paris Is Out! has opened after its own odd fashion at the Brooks Atkin son Theater. The audience I caught it at a Saturday Matineegave every evi dence of loving it. Speaking for myself, I pitied it more than I disliked it. It is not at all an unlikable play. It is however, regarded from any decent critical standards, almost totally pitiable.

title: Church Head Installed
description: MILWAUKEE, Feb. 2 (AP) The Rev. Robert V. Moss of New York was installed last night as the new president of the 2millionmember United Church of Christ. He expressed support for the antiwar sym pathies of young persons, and called for desegregation of parochial schools.

title: Assembly Renames Regent
description: ALBANY, Feb. 2 (AP)Ever ett J. Penny was reelected by the Senate today to a 15year term on the Board of Regents. The Assembly is expected to follow suit Tuesday.

title: STRIKE IN NEWARK SHUTS 30 SCHOOLS
description: NEWARK, Feb. 2A teach ers' strike in defiance of a court order closed about 30 of Newark's 84 public schools to day and brought teaching and classroom activity almost to a standstill in the remainder.

title: Boston Museum Starts Birthday Party
description: BOSTON, Feb. 2A sign outside the Museum of Fine Arts here announces that Phase IV of the museum's expansion program is being planned and that it needs your support. To this some one has added in crayon to continue depleting the rest of the world's art treasures.

title: FRANCE LISTS RISE IN MONEY RESERVES
description: PARIS, Feb. 2 (Reuters)The Finance Ministry said today France's monetary reserves rose $52million to $3.88billion after debt repayments of $410mil lion.

title: SIGMOND de BARANOVSKY
description: Sigmond de Baranovsky, an artist, formerly of 254 East 33d Street, died Saturday in Belle vue Hospital. He was 78 years old.

title: Corporation for Public Broadcasting Seeks Funds
description: Then Corporation for Public Broad&thing reported yester day after its first full year that it believed it was performing its mission As outlined in its char ter trom Congress. But, it cautioned, if public broadcast ing is to realize its full poten tial, greater funds and a larger effort will be required.

title: An Egg Crate? Not Really
description: THAT giant egg crate standing in the corner of David and Barbara Hirsch's living room represents unorthodox mathematics but sound economics and design thinking.

title: Sports of The Times
description: FORMAL announcement of the election by the special oldtimers' committee of three new members to the Hall of Fame was made the other night during the 47th annual midwinter bash of the Base ball Writers Association's New York Chap ter. Those voted enshrinement at Coopers town, N. Y., were Earle Combs, Yankee center fielder during the Murderers Row era; Jesse Haines, Cardinal pitcher, and Ford Frick, former commissioner.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: LATE last month in his State of the Union ad dress, President Nixon made a stirring appeal for an envi ronmental cleanup, directing the nation's already awakened concern to what may be the major domestic effort of the 1970's.

title: Military
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2The Adminis tradition's $71.8billion military budget, which represents the lowest share of Federal spending for defense in the last 20 years, reflects these basic, under lying decisions:

title: Memorial Services
description: ARTHURWilbur. A memorial service for Wilbur L. Arthur of 200 Drum Hill Read, Wilton, Connecticut who died on January 30th will be held on Friday February 6th at St Matthews Church, Route 7, Wilton at 2 p.m. Please omit flowers.

title: Space
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2The space agency's spending, employment and op erations would be reduced to their lowest level since the United States set its course for the moon almost a decade ago under the budget proposed by Pres ident Nixon today.

title: NASSER EXHORTS ARABS TO FIGHT ON
description: CAIRO, Feb. 2 (AP)Presi dent Gamal Abdel Nasser of the United Arab Republic de clared tonight that the Arab countries had no alterna tive but to fight for the re covery of territory occupied by Israel in the war of June, 1967.

title: Britain Asserts CS Gas Is Not Banned
description: LONDON, Feb. 2The British Government took the position tonight that international con vention does not bar the use of CS disabling gas.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: ACTIVITIES. Nixon sent his economic and budget mes sages to Congress.

title: Judy A. Mullins, Kenneth Kohorn Planning Bridal
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Feb. 2The engagement of Miss Judy Ann Mullins, who teaches nursery school at the First Congregational Church of Old Greenwich, to Kenneth Von Kohorn, a graduate stu dent at Tulane University, has been announced by Mr. and Mrs. Frederic John Mullins, parents of the future bride.

title: Housing
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2George Rom ney, Secretary of Housing and Urban Development, said today that his de partment's budget for the next fiscal year had been cut to the bone, and he was glad that it had.

title: EXECUTIVE CHANGES
description: Raymond M. Anrig has been elected executive vice president of the DuffyMott Company, Inc., food processors. He for merly was vice president for marketing.

title: Textile Trade Loss Rises
description: A projected textile trade aer icit of $1.4billion last year, up sharply from the $1.1billion deficit in 1968, helps explain why there is pressure in the United States to curb textile imports.

title: Lord & Taylor Names Eight Top Executives
description: Lord & Taylor, the largest store division of the Asso ciated Dry Goods Corpora tion, announced yesterday the appointments of a new executive vice president, four senior vice presidents and three vice presidents.

title: Life Insurance Gains Made
description: The Northwestern National Life Insurance Company of Minneapolis reported yesterday that sales of life insurance last year rose 37 per cent to $1.01 billion from $742.19million a year earlier. Assets on Dec. 31 totaled $617.7million.

title: BROADWAY TO GET VALL'S NEXT PLAY
description: Seymour Vall, who was in volved in the production of seven shows off Broadway last season, has had to switch his stage activities to Broadway this year because of a shortage of suitable little theaters.

title: Latin Talks Resume Feb. 23
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2 (Reu teurs)  El Salvador and Hon duras will resume talks in Costa Rica on Feb. 23 to try to reach a settlement to their differ ences, the Organization of American States said today.

title: Sampling of Russell's Thoughts
description: Following are excerpts from the writings of Lord Russell on a variety of topics:

title: Crime Laws With Rights
description: The Senate actions to toughen Federal laws against organized crime and the flow of dangerous drugs call needed attention to the interstate and even interna tional aspects of loathsome criminal activities that reach into homes and streets the country over.

title: Mrs. Jonathan Wainwright, 82 Widow of the War Hero, Is Dead
description: COLORADO SPRINGS, Feb. 2 Mrs. Adele H. Wainwright, widow of Gen. Jonathan M. Wainwright, died in a hospital here Saturday after a long ill ness. She was 82 years old.

title: Keystone Funds Director
description: Shareholders of Keystone Custodian Funds, Inc., a Boston mutual fund concern, elected Erwin D. Canham a director at the annual meeting yesterday. Mr. Canham is editorinchief of The Christian Science Monitor.

title: For Elderly Shutins, a Day's Meals at the Door
description: SEVENTYEIGHTyearold Miss Frieda Frey hasn't set foot on the street below her small, secondfloor apart ment on East 96th Street for the four years since her hip fracture.

title: Met Museum and the City Will Meet to Avert Strike
description: The Metropolitan Museum of Art and city representatives will meet this week with Local 1503 of District Council 37 of the American Federation of State, County and Municipal Employes in an effort to avert a strike by the museum's guards, attend ants and maintenance men.

title: WatermanBic Pens Split With Ted Bates
description: The WatermanBic Pen Cor poration has written off Ted Bates after nine years and gone to oneyearold Kurtz, Kambanis, Symon, Inc., founded by three former Tinker men. Bic bills $4mil lion, just about enough to double the size of the agency.

title: Columbia's New Head
description: LAST October the Academic Senate of the University of California at San Diego met in extraordinary session to discuss academic freedom. The main speaker was the San Diego chancellor, Dr. William J. McGill, who was named president of Colum bia University yesterday.

title: North Korea Bars Return Of 51 on Hijacked Plane
description: PANMUNJOM, Korea, Feb. 2  North Korea rejected today a request that the 47 passen gers and four crew members aboard a South Korean airlin er that was hijacked to the North on Dec. 11 be returned before the Lunar New Year holiday Friday.

title: C.E.F. JONES, HEADED PULP SALES AGENCY
description: C. Eric Ford Jones, who re tired two years ago as chair man of International Pulp Sales Company, a subsidiary of Inter national Paper Company, died here Sunday after a long ill ness. He was 67 years old and lived at 32 Tisdale Lane, Scars dale. N. Y.

title: Poverty
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2To the na tion's 24 million poor people, the first Federal budget developed entirely by the Nixon Administration will mean the following things:

title: Corsica Votes and Votes
description: CORTE, Corsica, Feb. 2 (Reu ters)Corsica's history of elec toral irregularities continued today with the disclosure by officials that 9,647 votes had been declared in a municipal election for which only 4,303 people were registered.

title: Panthers Disrupt Proceedings As Case Against 16 Opens Here
description: Shouts from 16 Black Pan thers scheduled to go on trial disrupted arguments on pre trial motions in Supreme Court here yesterday as hundreds of their supporters marched out side demanding their freedom.

title: PROTEST AT CONCERT LAID TO HOOLIGANS
description: MOSCOW, Feb. 2 (AP)The Soviet Government newspaper Izvestia charged today that the hairy figures who dis rupted the New York concert of David Oistrakh and Sviato slov Richter were only front men for Zionist organizers.

title: Tug Strike Cuts City Refuse Disposal 25%
description: Garbage collection was cut by 25 per cent here yesterday as the strike by 6,000 tugboat workers went through its sec ond day.

title: Smokey Bear Cools Fire And Garners Cold Cash
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2  Smokey Bear not only douses hot coals but also garners cold cash for the Federal Gov ernment.

title: Rise in Unemployment Is Predicted in Budget
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2 President Nixon's budget in directly hinted today about how much the Government expected unemployment to rise as a result of the eco nomic slowdown.

title: Warriors Seek to Sign Beaty
description: Zelmo Beaty, a hulking cen ter, became further involved yesterday in the brewing play erjumping battle between the National and American Basket ball Associations.

title: Liner Docks Here Without Aid of the Striking Tugs
description: The master of the Ameri kanis inched the cruise ship into dock without the help of tugboats yesterday to become the first captain of a large passenger liner to complete the delicate maneuver in the cur rent boatwide strike of tugboat workers.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: In The Nation: Mr. Nixon and the Environment
description: WASHINGTON  Suddenly, the new American concern for the environment is evidenced everywhere from student activ ists teachins to the speeches of the big industrialists. This concern even got official rec ognition in President Nixon's State of the Union Message. The Everglades have been saved, against all odds, and Mr. Nixon says he will now spend all the money Congress has ap propriated to clean up the waters.

title: Transportation
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2Despite some modest evidence of new priorities in aviation, transit and the Merchant Ma rine, the new budget makes it clear that highway construction remains the heart of the Government's transportation pro gram.

title: 12 Riot Deputies Indicted For Actions at Berkeley
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Feb. 2 were indicted by a Federal gra?? of their authority during the P??  Twelve sheriff's deputies ??nd jury here today for misuse eople's Park riots in Berkeley last May in which one man was killed, one blinded and scores were injured. The me le erupted on May 15, when a rally in Sproul Plaza at the University of California turned into a march toward People's Park, a tract three blocks away that the university had acquired, cleared, and then left unused.

title: Tennessee Beats Vanderbilt
description: NASHVILLE, Tenn, Feb. 2, (UPI)scored 12 points in the second overtime period tonight and defeated Vanderbilt. 7772 in a South eastern Conference game. Dickie Johnston clinched the victory with six free throws in the final 90 seconds.

title: Rumanians Reject Russian Criticism On Ties With West
description: VIENNA, Feb. 2The Ruma nian Communist party today endorsed increased cooperation with the West and rejected knew the Soviet concept of a guiding center for the interna tional Marxist movement.

title: Terms Used in Budget Message
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2Following is a glossary of the main technical terms used in the Federal budget:

title: Fighting Is Stepped Up by Syria and Israel on the Golan Heights
description: JERUSALEM, Feb. 2Fight ing between Israel and Syria grew in intensity today as the Israeli Air Force joined in a fourhour tank and artillery battle on the Golan heights.

title: Pollution
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2 President Nixon said in his Budget Message today that he would ask Congress to au thorize $4billion in grants to states and cities over five years for waste treatment plants.

title: News Summary and Index
description: TUESDAY, FEBRUARY 3, 1970

title: Chinese Pledge Support
description: HONG KONG, Feb. 2  Pre mier Chou Enlai of China has expressed his Government's firm support for the Arab struggle against Israel in a let ter to President Gamal Abdel Nasser of the United Arab Re public.

title: Market Place
description: IT would be hard to find anyone who wants to see the stock market go lower unless you count short sellers.

title: RATE OF ABSENCES OF TEACHERS IS UP
description: A study now circulating among top officials of the Board of Education shows that absenteeism among the city's 60,000 public school teachers has risen 50 per cent in the last three school years.

title: FOUR ARE INDICTED IN FIRE LOSS CASE
description: Calling the case the tip of an iceberg, Bronx District At torney Burton B. Roberts an nounced yesterday the indict ment of four men on charges of filing an inflated claim of loss with a fire insurance com pany after a fire in a Bronx butcher shop.

title: Monthly Magazine Closed By Radio Free Europe
description: Free Europe, Inc., the non profit corporation that spon sors Radio Free Europe, said yesterday that it had suspended tis monthly magazine, East Europe, with the January issue due to financial considera tions.

title: Mississippi Opposes Plan
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2 (AP) The state of Mississippi asked the Supreme Court today to block the Federal Government's school desegregation directives. Attorney General John N. Mitchell and Robert H. Finch, Secretary of Health, Education and Welfare, were named de fendants.

title: Cruz to Miss Laguna Bout
description: PANAMA City, Panama, Feb. 2 (UPI)Carlos Teo Cruz will be unable to meet Ismael Laguna in a lightweight boxing bout scheduled Saturday be cause of an injury suffered yes terday in his training camp, Cruz's manager said today. Ef forts were being made to sign a substitute to meet Laguna at Panama Saturday night.

title: Figueres, Advocate of Social Reform, Wins Handily in Costa Rican Election
description: SAN JOSE, Costa Rica, Feb. 2  Jos Figures Ferrer, a leader for democratic social re form in Latin America, has won the Presidency of Costa Rica by an impressive margin, ac cording to official returns from yesterday's election.

title: Dick Jensen Sings Hawaiian Soul at Copa
description: And now we have Hawai ian soul.

title: SAMUELS PRESIDES AT RACIAL MEETING
description: NEWARK, Feb. 2Howard Samuels, New York industrial ist who is running for the Dem ocratic nomination for Gover nor of New York, presided to night at a meeting called to improve communication be tween Newark's black and white communities.

title: Negro on Westchester Bench
description: NEW ROCHELLE, Feb. 2 (UPI)For the first time in Westchester's history, a black man has been appointed to a city court judgeship. Mayor Al vin R. Ruskin of New Rochelle appointed Richard Baltimore to the court as a temporary acting city judge, beginning today. He will sit until midFebruary when the regular acting city judge as sumes court duties.

title: Continental Can's '69 Earnings and Sales at Highs
FEW SCHOOLS OBEY SOUTH'S DEADLINE FOR INTEGRATION
description: ATLANTA, Feb. 2A Fed eral Court deadline for total school integration in more than 40 Southern districts passed to day with little change in the racial composition of their classrooms.

title: Confusion on Nigerian Aid
description: Nigeria is a sovereign nation, understandably sensi tive about advice from abroad. It is not for the United States to tell Nigeria how to help the hungry, the pen niless and the sick in the aftermath of civil war.

title: Lawyer Pleads Not Guilty In Abortion Package Deal
description: SPRINGFIELD, Mass., Feb. 2 (AP)  A lawyer who helped organize an agency offering a package deal for abortions in England pleaded not guilty in Springfield District Court to day to charges brought against him and his agency by the state.

title: Marcos Warns Students Against Renewed Riots
description: MANILA, Feb. 2 (AP)  President Ferdinand E. Mar cos said today that the situa tion in Manila was returning to normal, but he warned that if students rioted again, they must bear the consequences.

title: Philippine Hamlet Chief Says Wide Corruption Breeds Discontent
description: MASILI, the Philippines, Feb. 1If change can be peaceful, that would be best, old Rai mundo Guevara said. But if things go on like this, I'm afraid the only way to get change is going to be by revo lution.

title: Baseball Signings
description: NATIONAL LEAGUE

title: G.I. DIES AFTER FIGHT WITH BLACK SOLDIER
description: HEILBRONN, West Ger many, Feb. 2 (AP)Specialist 4 Carl Saylors, 22 years old, of Helena, Ark., died of a brain hemorrhage at an Army hospital yesterday, six days after he was injured in a fight with a black soldier, the Army an nounced today.

title: Moroccan King Sees Pompidou In New Atmosphere of Accord
description: PARIS, Feb. 2  Further ef forts to consolidate French po sitions in North Africa and the Mediterranean began here to daywith a meeting between President Pompidou and King Hassan II of Morocco.

title: Two Oil Tankers Ordered
description: The Bethlehem Steel Cor poration announced recently that it had received a contract from the Standard Oil Com pany of California for two more 69,800ton tankers. The on com pany ordered the first such vessel last April. California Standard intends to use the 15knot vessels in its Alaska West Coast operations.

title: Belgian Pleads Guilty Here In Missile Equipment Case
description: Pierre M. Stevens, a 35year old Belgian electronics techni cian, pleaded guilty yesterday to three counts of attempted unlawful exporting of equip ment called strategic for guided missiles.

title: Birth Notice 1  No Title
description: LOST AND FOUND

title: Books of The Times
description: IF, as I suspect, we no longer kill the messengers who bring bad news, but merely refuse to buy their books, La Raza and Sal Si Puedes will probably be more reviewed than read. Oh, no, not the Mexican Americans! How can the citi zen who already worries about Green Berets, Black Panthers and Uncle Toms find time to brood on Brown Berets, Bronze Culture and Tio Tacos? A population ex plosion of problems threatens to disperse the social consciousness: a particle of at tention adhering to a, an atom of anguish attached to z, an emotional vacuum in between. We will read the reviews, switch on for half an hour our tsktsk machine, and perhaps (like my boycott of South African diamonds) resolve not to order table grapes the next time we telephone Gristede's.

title: 2 Reservists With Long Hair Denied Court Help With Army
description: BOSTON, Feb. 2 (AP)The United States District Court here declined today to issue an injunction to stop Army officers from marking two 22yearold reservists absent because of their long hair.

title: Cities
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2  When the Democrats left office a year ago, their plans called for close to $1billion a year to be spent for Model Cities.

title: CITY HALL BLAST HURTS 14 IN OHIO
description: SHAKER HEIGHTS, Ohio, Feb. 2 (UPI) A violent explo sion leveled the Municipal Building in this Cleveland sub urb today, injuring at least 14 persons, one of them critically.

title: MRS. DON K. PRICE JR.
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Feb. 2 Mrs. Margaret Helen Gail breath Price, wife of Don K. Price Jr., dean of the John Fitz gerald Kennedy School of Gov ernment at Harvard University, died today at Stillman Infirmary of the university, after a short illness. She was 60 years old.

title: Antiwar Leaders Sue to stop Dow's Output of War Chemicals
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2  Sixtyfive members of the anti war movement filed suit against the Dow Chemical Com pany in district court today, charging that Dow supplies the United States Government with the instrumentalities to violate international law and should be made to stop.

title: JUSTICES REJECT POWELL'S PAY BID
description: JUSTICES REJECT POWELL'S PAY BID

title: Con Edison Plant Shut 3 Days to Stop FishKill
description: The Consolidated Edison Company closed its Indian Point One nuclear plant at Buchanan, N. Y., for three days last month because a very substantial number of fish were killed when they were drawn from the Hudson River into conduits that sup ply water to the plant.

title: Most of Increase to Go For Existing Programs
description: WASHINGTON Feb 2By the fiscal year 1975, the Gov ernment should be collecting $64billion more in taxes of all kinds than it does now, with out any further changes in the tax laws.

title: Signalman Is Arrested as Argentine TrainCrash Toll Is Put at 160
description: BUENOS AIRES, Feb. 2 (AP)The police arrested a signalman today in the crash last night of a crosscountry express and a stalled com muter train in which 160 were said to have been killed and 250 injured.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
BANK REPORTS
description: FIRST BANK SYSTEM, MINNEAPOLIS

title: Reapportionment in Indiana Blocked by Supreme Court
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2 (AP) Acting on a plea by Gov. Edgar D. Whitcomb, the Supreme Court today temporarily block ed the reapportionment of all state legislative districts in In diana.

title: Gary Smith to Wed Valerie Van Houten
description: Miss Valerie Van Houten and Ens. Gary Scott Smith, U.S.N., graduates of the Uni versity of Vermont, plan to be married this summer.

title: Highlights of the Budget
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2 Following are the highttghts of President Nixon's budget. Detailed reports on these subjects are on Pages 22 and 23.

title: James Fagan, 58, Headed Jersey Labor Committee
description: SHORT HILLS, N. J., Feb. 2 James E. Fagan, a member of the Newark law firm of Yauch and Fagan and an au thority on labor law, died to day in St. Mary's Hospital, Orange. He was 58 years old and lived here at 37 Kean Drive.

title: Medicare and Medicaid
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2The new budget forecasts substantial changes in the Medicaid programs that underwrite health care for the poor, a system the Nixon Administration regards as an al most bottomless pit for money.

title: $70,000 CONTRACT FOR STOTTLEMYRE
description: The way Mei Stottlemyre ex plained it, the recent rains in the. State of Washington raised the level of his favorite streams and give the fish much more room in which to hide.

title: LOANS ARE ASKED TO AID MINORITIES
description: In a threepronged move to prod more activity into the loan program for minority operated businesses, Senator Jacob K. Javits, representatives of New York area commercial banks and officials of the Small Business Administration met yesterday to announce plans for some chances.

title: New Moscow Play Portrays Roosevelt as Hostile to Soviet in 1941
description: MOSCOW, Feb. 2Franklin D. Roosevelt, usually described by Soviet writers as a friend of the Soviet Union, is portrayed in a new play here as having ordered development of an atomic bomb to give the United States domination over the Soviet Union and the rest of the world.

title: GEN. D. H. HUDELSON, DISSIDENT ON KOREA
description: PALM SPRINGS, Calif., Feb. 2 (AP) Daniel H. Hudelson, the major general who left ac tive duty because of his dis agreement with Korean War strategy, died here Friday. He was 67 years old.

title: Research
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2In its pro posed budget for research, the Admin istration is making a special effort to put its money where its hopes and fears are.

title: Tonga Is Said to Plan Independence on Jane 4
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Feb. 2 The Kingdom of Tonga, a British protectorate since 1900, will become the sec ond independent Polynesian state of modern times in June, according to informa tion received here from Nu kualofa, the capital.

title: RESPONSE IS BRISK IN U.S. REFUNDING
description: The President's Budget Mes sage and the innate appeal of an 8 per cent interest rate on Treasury notes gave the gov ernment bond market a sub stantial lift yesterday after noon.

title: Chicago Lawyer and Judge Clash Over Abernathy
description: CHICAGO, Feb. 2Judge Julius J. Hoffman closed the defense case in the Chicago conspiracy trial today minutes before the Rev. Ralph David Abernathy arrived to be its last witness.

title: Katharine A. Adams Is Engaged To L. G. Walker, Princeton '70
description: ORANGE, Conn., Feb. 2 Mr. and Mrs. John Farnham Adams have announced the engagement of their daugh ter, Miss Katharine Alcott Adams, to Laurence Gordon Walker, son of Mr. and Mrs. Charles Allen Walker of Ham den.

title: J. H. Karger Fiance Of Devra B. Schoen
description: Miss Devra B. Schoen, a senior at Rider College, plans to be married in June to Jef frey H. Karger, a public school teacher in New York and a doctoral candidate at New York University. The future bride is the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Joseph S. Schoen of Yonkers, where her father is a grocer.

title: Queens Klein's Robbed Again
description: For the second time in six weeks, burglars have broken into Klein's department store in Flushing, Queens. But the robbery last weekend netted only $1,000, compared with nearly a quarter of a million dollars stolen the weekend of last Dec. 2021.

title: NIXON SAID TO GET REPORT BY SOVIET ON NEW U.A.R AID
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2The Soviet Union was reported to night to have advised the United States of its intention to increase substantially and im mediately its shipments of weapons, including advanced jet aircraft, to the United Arab Republic.

title: 40 ITEMS TRIMMED
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2Pres ident Nixon presented to Con gress today a $200.8billion budget that he said begins the necessary process of re ordering our national prior ities.

title: ROBERT LINDQUIST, CAPTAIN OF LINER
description: SARASOTA, Fla., Feb. 2 Capt. Robert E. Lindquist, form er master of the luxury liner Constitution, died today at his home here. He was 59 years old.

title: Loyal Legion Plans a Dance
description: The songs will have the faraway ring of the Civil War and the toasts will be to the memory of Lincoln aid Grant on Feb. 12 when smile 300 members and friends of the Military Order of the Loyal Legion of the United States gather at the Plaza for a dinner dance cornmemorat ing the birth of Lincoln.

title: A Summary of Supreme Court Actions
description: Affirmed a lower court rul ing that a state may regulate the location and rates of com munity antenna television (CATV) stations, despite the fact that the Federal Commu nications Commission also regulates some aspects of CATV operations (No. 214, TV Pix, Inc. v. Taylor).

title: Cleveland Police Chief Denies Mafia Lawyer's Payoff Charge
description: CLEVELAND, Feb. 2Wil liam P. Ellenburg, Cleveland's police chief for one week, de nied today reports published here and in Detroit over the weekend that he had accepted payoffs to shield a Detroit abor tion operation.

title: HERBERT C. HAUTH
description: Herbert C. Hauth, the head of the H. C. Hauth insurance company here, died of a heart attack in Del Ray Beach, Fla., yesterday, while op vacation. He was 70 years old and lived at 419 Stewart Avenue, Garden City, L. I. Mr. Hauth founded the company, which specializes in construction insurance.

title: TIES REPORTER GETS A SUBPOENA
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Feb. 2 Earl Caldwell, correspondent for The New York Times in the newspaper's bureau here, was served today with a subpoena requiring his testimony before a Federal grand jury that has been investigating the Black Panther party.

title: WheelingPittsburgh Steel Corp. Steps Up Officer to Presidency
description: PITTSBURGH, Feb. 2Rob ert E. Lauterbach, 51 years old, today was named president of the WheelingPittsburgh Steel Corporation, it was announced by Allison R. Maxwell Jr., chair man. Mr. Lauterbach succeeds Donald C. Duvall, who died Jan. 5. Mr. Lauterbach also was elected a director.

title: JUICE CONTRACTS SHOW FIRM TREND
description: JUICE CONTRACTS SHOW FIRM TREND

title: NELSON ROSENBAUM
description: Nelson Rosenbaum, an assist ant corporation counsel here in the nineteenthirties and during World War II, died Saturday of a heart attack in Beth Israel Hospital, Boston. He was 66 years old and lived at 50 Park Terrace East.

title: Miss Nagel Is Second in Slalom But Captures Combined Honors
description: ABETONE, Italy, Feb. 2 (AP) Ingrid Lafforgues of France barely beat little Judy Nagel of the United States today in the women's special slalom of the Foemina Cup, the last event be fore the world alpine ski cham pionships.

title: Judge in Britain Rules Surgery Cannot Alter a Person's Six
description: LONDON, Feb. 2 (AP)  A High Court judge who is a physician ruled today that sur gery could not change a per son's sex.

title: Mikhail L. Mil, Designer Of Soviet Helicopters, 60
description: MOSCOW, Feb. 2Mikhail L. Mil, Soviet helicopter de signer, died here Saturday after a long illness. He was 60 years old.

title: ABM INQUIRY SET
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2The disarmament subcommittee of the Senate Foreign Relations Committee laid down a new challenge to the Administra tion today by questioning Pres ident Nixon's decision to ex pand the Safeguard missile de fense system.

title: City Bar Association, Turning 100, Wonders How Effective It Is in 1970
description: When workmen blast at a construction site on West 43d Street these days, a sec ond rumble can occasionally be heard across the street in the stately marblepillared library of the building that houses the Association of the Bar of the City of New York. It is the sound of large legal tomes tumbling off the shelves from the impact of the blast.

title: Text of President's Message to Congress on Federal Budget for Fiscal Year 1971
description: WASHINGTON Feb. 2Following is the text, photograph ical reproduced, of President Nixon's Budget Message as presented to Congress today:

title: Nixon's View of Budget: This Is an Honest One
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2For several weeks President Nixon and his top economic officials have been saying that his new budget would be credible, and the President repeated to day in formally signing the budget that it was an honest one.

title: Reaction in Wrong Places Closes 3 Plays in Prague
description: PRAGUE, Feb. 2The author ities today canceled the perfor mance of three plays, including Edward Albee's A Delicate Balance, because the audiences reacted in the wrong places.

title: Saigon Proclaims 24Hour CeaseFire on Thursday for Lunar New Year
description: SAIGON, Tuesday, Feb. 3 (AP)  The South Vietnamese Government said today that its troops would observe a 24hour ceasefire beginning at 6 P.M. Thursday for Tet, the Lunar New Year.

title: Tear Gas Bombing at Ohio U.
description: ATHENS, Ohio, Feb. 2 (UPI)  A homemade tear gas bomb exploded late yesterday outside campus police headquarters at Ohio University, where demon strations Friday over increased fees resulted in 47 arrests.

title: WHITE HOUSE STAFF ON A TRUE PAYROLL
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2 Credibility begins at home.

title: NEGOTIATORS ACCEPT AN OFFER BY MACY'S
description: Macy's made a contract of fer yesterday that the union rep resenting 9,000 of the compa ny's employes at six stores said it would recommend to mem hers.

title: Penn Defeats Columbia, 5752, and Takes Ivy League Lead With 60 Mark
description: Pennsylvania's strong basket ball team, making a big move toward an Ivy League cham pionship, survived a terrible start and a nervous finish last night while beating Columbia, 5752, in what could be called a key game in more than one sense.

title: British Soccer
description: AMATEUR LEAGUE

title: Cemetery Strike Continues
description: Representatives of local cem eteries and striking gravedig gers have been summoned to a meeting today to stimulate negotiations to end a three weekold strike that has halted most burials in the metropoli tan area. The meeting was called by Vincent D. McDon nell, chairman of the State Mediation Board. He called for a joint meeting between the labor and management repre sentatives at 10 A.M. in the offices of the mediation board, 270 Broadway.

title: HAWKS OVERCOME PISTONS, 125121
description: GREENVILLE, S. C., Feb. 2 (AP)  The Atlanta Hawks moved back into a virtual tie for the National Basketball As sociation's Western Division lead tonight by defeating the Detroit Pistons, 125121, on a neutral court here.

title: Cruelty in the Graveyard
description: The strike of gravediggers is now in its fourth grisly week. Several thousand unburied bodies lie in vaults, garages, tents and other storage places at cemeteries in the metropolitan area. For anguished families the pain of this humiliation to the dead grows daily more insupportable.

title: MOORE DEFEATED IN INDOOR TENNIS
description: PHILADELPHIA, Feb. 2 (AP) Haroon Rahim of Pakistan, an unheralded player, upset Ray Moore, the South African pro fessional, 75. 76, in the open ing round of the $60,000 Inter national Tennis Players Associ ation indoor open tournament at the Spectrum today.

title: State Senate to Vote on Aid for Parochial Schools
description: ALBANY, Feb. 2The Senate Judiciary Committee sent to the Senate floor today a bill that would repeal the state's con stitutional ban on financial aid to churchsponsored schools.

title: Championing Puerto Ricans in the City
description: NO! That's the shocked reaction Mrs. Mariano Guerrero gets when, in the Spanish accent she would hate to lose, she tells people she's Puerto Rican.

title: Vietnam Casualties
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2 (UPI) The Defense Department to day listed the names of the following servicemen from the New York area as having been killed in Vietnam:

title: An Inadequate Budget
description: President Nixon has produced a budget for fiscal 1971 that does not measure up to the needs of the nation on either economic or social grounds. His cramped and barely balanced budget is the result of an inordinate giveup of tax revenues for which both the Nixon Administration and the Congress are responsible.

title: Nixon Writing Rates C
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2 (AP) President Nixon signed his eco nomic report and the new Fed eral budget today and said that he had flunked penmanship in the first grade and had never learned to write since. The President said that after he had vetoed an appropriation bill on television a few days ago teacher had written and said she would give him a C in penmanshipbut an A in statesmanship.

title: LOCKHEED OMITS QUARTER'S PAYOUT
description: Directors of the Lockheed Aircraft Corporation voted yes terday to omit the first auarter dividend.

title: Columbia Finds Its Man
description: The appointment of Dr. William J. McGill as presi dent of Columbia University brings to a successful conclusion a search in which trustees, faculty and students joined in effective cooperation. Their pains taking task was complicated by the need for over coming the apprehensions that linger after months of campus confrontation and hostilities in 1968.

title: 2 U.S. Banks Join Plan For Australian Financing
description: HONG KONG, Feb. 2 (UPI) Two United States banks have joined with two other banks to help provide financing for enterprises in Australia, New Zealand and elsewhere in the Pacific, it was announced today.

title: William Donahey, Creator Of TeenieWeenies Strip
description: CHICAGO, Feb. 2 (AP)Wil liam Donahey, the cartoonist who areated and for more than a half a century drew The Tee nie Weenis a comic strip, for the Tribune Syndicate, died yesterday. He was 86 years old.

title: Warburg Group Forms A Venture Capital Firm
description: The formation of a new ven ture capital firm, with initial subscribed capital of $20mil lion, was announced yesterday by Lionel I. Pincus, president of E. M. Warburg & Co., Inc.

title: Reputed Aide of Luchese Draws Jail Term in Nassau
description: MINEOLA L. I., Feb. 2 (UPI) A reputed henchman of the late Thomas (Three Finger Brown) Luchese drew an 18 month term in the Nassau County jail today for refusing to testify before a grand jury investigating organized crime in the county. The defendant, Carlo Piccioli, 39 years old of 69 Wright Avenue, Lynbrook, L. L, pleaded guilty in Nassau County court to two indict ments that alleged criminal contempt of the grand jury.

title: Crime
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2The Nixon Administration, convinced that it has found an effective way to combat crime by concentrating on narcotics, organized crime and aid to state and local govern ments, plans to accelerate its spending on all three.

title: STEEL PRODUCTION EDGES UP IN WEEK
description: Steel production last week was 1 per cent higher than in week before, the American Iron and Steel Institute reported Yesterday.

title: Husband Is Stricken
description: MALAGA, Spain, Feb. 2 (Reuters)  Arthur Corbett is unconscious in a hospital here after having been found uncon scious a his villa in nearby Warbella. Friends speculated that he might have had a heart attack as a result Of the strain of the court case.

title: U.S. SOCCER LEAGUE FORMS 2 DIVISIONS
description: ATLANTA, Feb. 2 (AP)  The North American Soccer League will operate in two di visions during the 1970 season, the league's executive direc tor. Phil Woosnam, said today.

title: Rally on Amex Snips String of Losses
description: The American Stock Ex change ended in the plus col umn for the first time in seven sessions yesterday on slightly steppedup trading.

title: U.S. JUDGE DENIES A HEARING TO KIRK
description: DAYTONA BEACH, Fla., Feb. 2A Federal judge in Jackson ville refused to grant Gov. Claude R. Kirk Jr. a hearing today on the issue of forced busing of school children.

title: 2 Congressmen Lose Decision Before They Can Don Gloves
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2 Angelo Dundee, the manager and trainer, is the author of one of the ultimate maxims of boxing: In the life of every fighter, there comes a time when you've got to put him in with somebody that can fight.

title: Paris Welcomes Anouilh Satire About a Dramatist Taking Stock
description: PARIS, Feb. 2Jean Anouilh's latest play, Les Poissons Rouges (The Goldfish) is re ceiving an enthusiastic wel come from the critics.

title: PANHANDLE LIFTS EARNINGS TO PEAK
description: The Panhandle Eastern Pipe Line Company and its sub sidiaries reported yesterday new highs in sales of natural gas, revenues and net income for 1969. W. K. Sanders, chair man and chief executive of ficer, pointed out that natural gas sales topped the trillion level for the first time reach ing 1.33trillion cubic feetor 6 per cent over the 1968 level of gas sales.

title: 91Day Bill Rate Olf to 7.754%; 182Day Discount Dips to 7.718%
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2 Treasury bill rates declined at today's auction from last week's levels, the Government reported today.

title: Bridge
description: WHEN two promising lines of play suggest them selves, it may not be easy to decide which to adopt, espe cially in a tournament, when overtricks are a consideration. This was South's problem on the diagramed deal played in a Westchester tournament.

title: Frenchman Scores Knockout
description: PARIS, Feb. 2 (AP)Jean Claude Bouttier stopped Pedro Miranda of Cuba tonight in the second round of a scheduled 10round middleweight contest. Miranda was floored three times.

title: High Court Rejects Sinatra Challenge Of Jersey Subpoena
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 3The Supreme Court refused today to prevent the arrest of Frank Sinatra for declining to answer a subpoena from the New Jer sey State Commission of In vestigation.

title: Rep. Rivers to Run Again
description: CHARLESTON, S. C., Feb. 3 (AP)Representative L. Mendel Rivers, Democrat of South Carolina and chairman of the House Armed Services Commit tee, who has represented his state's First District for 30 years, announced yesterday his candidacy for another term. Mr. Rivers, 64 years old, defeated George Payton, a Negro lawyer from Charleston, in the Demo cratic primary two years ago put had no opposition in the general election.

title: DICK BUTTON HIGH ON U.S. SKATERS
description: Dick Button went skating the other night for the first time in a long while. Before he left the ??ce, he fell twice and ripped his pants once.

title: Security Money Interest For Tenants Is Optional
description: Charges by State Attorney General Louis J. Lefkowitz that the owners of the Park chester apartment complex in the Bronx were defrauding their 12,000 tenants of inter est payments on $1.2million in security deposits were dis missed yesterday.

title: Italian Divorce Bill Gains
description: ROME, Feb. 3 (Reuters)A bill to legalize divorce in Italy cleared another hurdle today when a Senate committee de dided it did not run counter to the Constitution. The way now is clear for the bill, passed by the Chamber of Deputies in No vember, to go before a full ses sion of the Senate.

title: Leukemia Society Election
description: Eads Poitevent, president and chief executive officer of the International City Bank and Trust Company of New Orleans, has been elected president of the Leukemia Society of Amer ica, Inc., it was announced here yesterday.

title: A Palestinian Leader To Live in Jerusalem
description: TEL AVIV, Feb. 3A ma jor Palestinian Arab leader, Musa Alami, has received a special permit from the Is raeli Government to resume residence in the former Jordanian sector of Jerusalem, an official of the Interior Ministry said today. He add ed that Mr. Alami would be issued an Israeli identity card, which will permit him to live anywhere he wants in Israel.

title: Urban League Guild Plans Feb. 13 Ball
description: It's Carnival Time will be the theme of the National Urban League Guild's Beaux Arts Ball, to be held in the the Grand Ballroom at the WaldorfAstoria on Feb. 13. The ball will salute the many carnivals held in other coun tries.

title: Dawkins, Westbury Reinsman, Doubles in Role of Blacksmith
description: WESTBURY, L. I., Feb. 3 The downpour that nearly inundated half of Nassau County and all of Roosevelt Raceway today eliminated any chance for anyone to train a horse this morning. To be sure, there was the usual ninerace program later at nightit would take more than a mere deluge to stop that moneymaking merry goroundbut, so far as jog ging or conditioning a stand ardbred was concerned, the morning was a complete washout.

title: Cofone Indicted in Slaying
description: BRIDGEPORT, Conn., Feb. 3 A Fairfield County grand jury indicted Louis Cofone Jr. yes terday for firstdegree murder in the killing of Mrs. Carol Diack, a mother of four chil dren, who was strangled in her home in Wilton on Jan. 7. The 31yearold Cofone, a paroled convict, appeared before Super ior Court Judge Otto H. LaMac chia and pleaded not guilty and requested a trial by jury.

title: RESERVES OF BRITAIN UP BY $50.4MILLION
description: LONDON, Feb. 3 (AP)Brit ain announced today that gold and currency reserves backing the strength of the pound rose by $50.4million in January, to $2.57billion.

title: News Media Heads Cite Their Concern On U.S. Subpoenas
description: Executives of major news gathering organizations ex pressed criticism and concern here yesterday in response to recent Government subpoenas of reporters' notes, tape record ings, news film and unedited files of news media.

title: FULBRIGHT PANEL RENEWS CRITICISM OF VIETNAM POLICY
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 3 With Senator J. W. Fulbright setting a critical tone, the Sen ate Foreign Relations Commit tee reopened the Vietnam de bate today. Vice President Ag new, who was criticized at the hearing, accused Democrats of casting about aimlessly for a way to discredit the Admin istration.

title: Body of Bertrand Russell To Be Cremated Tomorrow
description: LONDON, Feb. 3The body of Bertrand Russell, who died yesterday at the age of 97, will be cremated on Thursday with out religious ceremony and in strict privacy.

title: Dubcek Presents Credentials
description: ANKARA, Turkey, Feb. 3 (Reuters)Alexander Dubcek, the former Czechoslovak lead er, presented his credentials to day as Ambassador to Turkey to President Cevdet Sunay.

title: Brooklyn's Magnolia Tree Nears Landmark Status
description: A beautiful, 85yearold mag nolia tree in Brooklyn...

title: Laird Takes Steps For Racial Harmony In Armed Services
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 3 (AP) Spurred by a service race prob lem, Secretary of Defense Mel ??in R. Laird ordered today crea tion of a special study group and other measures to promote racial harmony and close communications gap between black and whites in uniform.

title: FORD FUND AWARDS $4.2MILLION GRANTS
description: The Ford Foundation an nounced $4.2million worth of grants yesterday, including $1.2 million for private groups seek ing to improve housing for low income and moderateincome families.

title: Todd Gets Navy Contract
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 3 (UPI) The Naval Ships System Command has awarded a $12, 437,412 contract to Todd Ship yards, Erie Basin, Brooklyn, for repair and modernization of five minesweepers.

title: Lagos to Oust 32 Missionaries Held on Illegal Entry Charges
description: LAGOS, Nigeria, Feb. 3 (Reu ters)  The Nigerian Govern ment decided today to deport 32 Roman Catholic missionaries who were tried and sentenced to prison terms last week for having entered Nigeria il legally.

title: U.S. Amateur Boxers Set for Moscow Bouts
description: In a reverse version of The Russians Are Coming, 13 American amateur boxers will present their talents against the Soviet national squad in Moscow's Palace of Sports next Wednesday night.

title: BLOOD BANK PLANS HEPATITIS SCREEN
description: The New York Blood Center will begin within the month to use a fast new technique to screen out routinely donated blood that may transmit serum hepatitis.

title: ALICE DOWLING, 70, LED ADOPTION UNIT
description: Mrs. Alice Bevier Hall Dow ling, a prominent figure in New York society and a founder and former president of the Spence Chapin Adoption Service here, died Monday at the Lenox Hill Hospital, which she entered last August. She was 70 years old.

title: OHIO NEGRO FILES FOR SENATE SEAT
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Feb. 3 The warm race for the Demo cl atic nomination for the Unit ed States Senate grew hotter today with the entry of Dr Kenneth W. Clement, a Neero.

title: PRICES OF BONDS IN A SPIRITED RISE
description: The bond market took Treas ury David M. Kennedy's words to heart yesterday. Prices ad vanced in a spirited rally, and interest rates declined.

title: Liberal Party Bids Albany Retain Blaine Amendment
description: The Liberal party urged the Legislature yesterday not to re peal the socalled Blaine amendment to the State Con stitution. The amendment for bids state financial aid to churchrelated schools.

title: STOCKS IN LONDON IN MIXED PATTERN
description: Prices on the London Stock Exchange were mixed yester day. Government bonds ex tended Monday's gains, but in dustrial issues were lower.

title: BONNIES ROLL UP 13164 TRIUMPH
description: OLEAN, N. Y., Feb. 3 (UPI) Bob Lanier scored 28 points to night as St. Bonaventure set school scoring record in routing little Belmont Abbey of North Carolina, 13164.

title: Vatican Says Nuns' Move To Quit Was Inevitable
description: ROME, Feb. 3  Vatican of ficials said today that the de cision of 315 California nuns to leave the 400member Sisters of the Immaculate Heart of Mary and form a lay com munity became inevitable last year.

title: TV: Vanessa Redgrave
description: BE patient with television. In time it should make children born out of wedlock the in thing and the old ritualistic society pages can be quietly assigned to journal istic antiquity.

title: B.&M. DEFAULTS ON DEBT PAYMENT
description: The financially ailing Boston & Maine Corporation, which operates the Boston & Maine Railroad, has defaulted on the interest installment that was dueMonday on its $46million of outstanding 6 per cent first mortgage bonds.

title: Unitas Voted Top Star Of 60's in Pro Football
description: Johnny Unitas of the Balti more Colts was named pro football athlete of the decade yesterday in a special poll taken by The Associated Press.

title: Mrs. P. A. B. Widener 2d Dead; Owner of Famous Race Horses
description: Mrs. Peter A. B. Widener 2d, prominent international race horse owner, died here yester day of a heart attack. She was 71 years old.

title: POPE AGAIN BACKS RULE ON CELIBACY
description: ROME, Feb. 3Pope Paul VI strongly reiterated today his opposition to any basic modifi cation of the rule of priestly celibacy but opened the door slightly to a future discussion by Roman Catholic bishops of limited emergency exceptions.

title: Mrs. Agnew Backs Speeches
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 3 (UPI)  Mrs. Spiro T. Agnew said today that her husband speaks for himself when he makes his speeches. But she added, I usually agree with him. The Vice President's wife also told newswomen in the Agnews' Sheraton Park Hotel apartment here that the controversy sur rounding her husband's pro nouncements about the news media and antiwar protesters did not bother her.

title: Reagan Tax Reform Program Is Proposed as His New Budget Is Presented
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Feb. 3 A massive tax shift was pro posed today by Gov. Ronald Reagan and Republican legis lative leaders, aimed at easing, local property taxes to offset increases in various state lev ies and the elimination of tax loopholes.

title: Books of The Times
description: HEREWITH the first Annual PreWash ington's Birthday Reading List in Recent Escape Literature (Hugger mugger Unlimited): The Laughing Police man by Mai Siwall and Per Wahl is the fourth Martin Beck roman policier by Swedish husbandandwife writing team. It is also their best, a cut above John Creasy and, I am tempted to say, even a cut above Nicholas Freeling. Simenon himself would have been proud of it.

title: Guatemala Requests O.A.S. To Monitor Voting in March
description: GUATEMALA, Feb. 3 (AP) The Guatemalan Government has asked the Organization of American States to send ob servers to the March 1 election of a president and a legislature.

title: TROOPS IN EUROPE STIR U.S. DEBATE
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 3The State Department, the Penta gon and the Senate are staking out their positions for a major foreignpolicy debate focusing on how many United States sol diers will be required in West ern Europe over the years to come.

title: Juan Carlos Looks to a Democratic Spain
description: MADRID  Juan Carlos de Borbn, the curlyhaired, reti cent Prince whom Generalis simo Francisco Franco named heir six months ago, has begun to let his acquaintances know that he does not accept the role apparently chosen for him that of a docile successor.

title: Moscow Invites Disaster
description: The implied Soviet threat to send additional arms to Egypt is an ominous response to a humiliating situation that is largely of Moscow's own making.

title: Miss Orthwein Is Making Plans For June Bridal
description: Mrs. George Yandes Wheeler 2d of Watch Hill, R. I., and James Busch Orthwein of St. Louis have announced here the engage ment of their daughter, Miss Katherine Gatch Orthwein, to James McClelland Snow den Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Snowden of New York and Watch Hill.

title: Mrs. Nixon Back in Capital
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 3 (UPI) Mrs. Richard M. Nixon was back in the White House today after leaving her ill daughter, Tricia, well on the road to re covery at Key Biscayne, Fla. The President's wife returned to Washington late last night. Tricia, 23 years old, was ex pected to remain in Florida for an indefinite time, to recuperate from a combination of measles and flu.

title: Ellis Learns Ropes Can Be Tricky Sparring With Brother
description: Boxing's two world heavyweight champions shared the Felt Forum as a training site for the first time yesterday as they resumed preparing for their Feb. 16 showdown at Madison Square Garden.

title: A Group Combining Dance and Theater Performs in London
description: LONDON, Feb. 3Pictures of American astronauts on their way to the moon begin Geoff Moore's Accumulator, given by his dancetheater group, Moving Being, at The Place last night.

title: Mayo Recalls How Cabinet Squeezed the Budget
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 3 (AP)  The Federal budget was still above $202billion when, on Jan. 13, President Nixon told his Cabinet that he wanted pro posed spending figures recon sidered once more.

title: CAPITAL PUBLICATION NAMES A NEW EDITOR
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 3  Thomas N. Schroth resigned to day as editor of The National Journal and director of the Center for Political Research. He was succeeded as editor by Cliff Sessions, who has been managing editor.

title: Boy Is Sought as Suspect In Blast in Shaker Heights
description: SHAKER HEIGHTS, Ohio, Feb. 3 (UPD)The authorities said today they were seeking an unidentified boy who may have planted a bomb that ex ploded in and demolished the, municipal building in this sub urb of Cleveland.

title: Agnew Ready for Debut as Hope Golf Starts Today
description: PALM SPRINGS, Calif., Feb. 3With Vice President Spiro Agnew slated to be a participant and the most elaborate seating accommo dations on the professional tour available for tired gal leryites, the $125,000 Bob Hope Golf Classic begins here tomorrow. The Vice President is to team with Hope and Senator George Murphy of California in a oneround, 18 hole appearance on Saturday. The tournament has the most unusual format on the circuit with 544 con testants, the largest field of the year, of whom 136 are pros.

title: SENATE VOTES BILL TO ASSIST CITIES ON MASS TRANSIT
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 3The Senate passed the $3.1billion mass transit bill today, 83 to 4, and increased the amount of discretionary funds that would be available to the Secretary of Transportation.

title: Announcers Widen A Credibility Gap With Racing Fans
description: SOME day we'll all be watch ing races at a track where the paying customer gets a fair shake. Of course not even Heaven Intercelestial Speed way will he perfectcaptive audiences will still be detense less against the assault of gasoline commercials over the loudspeakers. Let it pass. The important thing is that the H.I.S. pub licaddress system will give the fan accurate informa tion. In a compli cated race like last weekend's Twenty  four Hours of Day tona, the fans' information came only from a trained scoring crew. The conveying media of that information are the scoreboard and the track announcer. There is no really good scoreboard anywhere in racing. Which brings us to the announcer.

title: Aeronautics Board Agrees To Show a File to Nader
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 3 (UPI) Ralph Nader, the consumer advocate, won a battle with the Civil Aeronautics Board when the agency agreed to let him see its consumer complaint file.

title: Foreign Affairs: From the Seine to the Nile
description: ROMEIn considering the new phase of diplomatic move ment in the Mediterranean, sight should not be lost of one possible longrange conse quence of France's Libyan in itiative. By accidental fallout if not deliberate design, per haps this could ultimately help persuade President Nasser that Egypt's primary interests lie southward and westward in Africa rather than eastward and northward in Asia.

title: DR. MAX HAMBURGER, AUTHOR, TEACHER, 72
description: Dr. Max Hamburger, a phi losoipher and educator, died in Roosevelt Hospital yesterday. He was 72 years old and lived at 626 West End Avenue.

title: Palme Safe in Mishap
description: STOCKHOLM, Feb. 3 (AP) The right tire of a Swedish] Air Force jet plane with Pre mier Olof Palme aboard blew out during a landing tonight, but the pilot managed to bring the plane safely to a halt.

title: U.S. AIDE PRESSES FOR RAIL ACCORD
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 3 (AP) A Government official pressed today for a peaceful railroad wage settlement after warning that President Nixon would ask Congress for special legislation to halt any renewed threat of a nationwide rail shutdown.

title: M'CORMACK IS TOLD OF CONFIDENCE CALL
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 3 (UPI)  Representative Je rome R. Waldie, Democrat of California, served formal no tice on Speaker John W. Mc Cormack today that he would ask a vote of no confidence in the House leadership at the next caucus of Democratic members.

title: Bullfighter Killed in Crash
description: ZACATECAS, Mexico, Feb. 3 (Reuters)Jaime Bravo, a 36 yearold bullfighter, and Man uel (El Cattereyta) Silva, an ap prentice matador, were killed early today when the car in which they were riding rolled over several times near this northern state capital. Bravo, a former ?? artist, appeared in a bullfight exhibition in the ?? in 1966

title: Senate Committee Approves A Rise in Airline Ticket Tax
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 3 (UPI) The Senate Finance Commit tee approved today a bill rais ing the 5 per cent tax on airline tickets to 7.5 per cent and im posing a $3. tax on each ticket for flights abroad.

title: Hapoel Bazaar Set
description: Nurseries, kindergartens, and vocational training schools for girls in Israel will gain from the annual bazaar to be held by the Hapoel Hamizrachi Women's Organi zation from 1 to 10 P.M., Feb. 16 and from 10 A.M. to 10 P.M. the next day, Mrs. Lee Goodstein and Mrs. Yetta Weg, national chairman, are in charge of the event to be held at the Flatbush Terrace, 1475 Flatbush Avenue and Glenwood Road, Brooklyn.

title: Hoffa Lawyer Found Dead Of SelfInflicted Wound
description: NASHVILLE, Feb. 3 (AP)  Z. T. Osborn Jr., 50 years old, one of James R. Hoffa's de fense lawyers, was found shot to death in a garage at his home here today.

title: Bal Polonaise To Aid Exiles
description: The 14th annual Bal Polo naise will be held at the Pierre on Saturday to raise money for Polish Assistance, Inc., which was founded to help Poles driven out of their country by Hitler and pre vented from returning by Stalin.

title: CONSUMER CREDIT LAGS AS IT RISES
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2 (AP) Consumer installment credit rose $415million in December  the smallest increase since January, 1968  the Federal Reserve Board reported Tues day.

title: Con Edison Says It Is Solving FishKill Probleme
description: BUCHANAN, N. Y., Feb. 3 The Consolidated Edison Com pany said today that at least 150,000 fish had been killed accidentally since Jan. 12 at its Indian Point One nuclear plant here, hut that temporary alterations appeared to have reduced the fishkill to an in significant number.

title: Jessie J. Fanshawe Dies at 92; Prominent as Social Secretary
description: Jessie J. Fanshawe, a social secretary here for many years, Eittd a society figure in her own right, died at the Lynwood Nesing Home Sunday night after a long illness. She was 92 yeats old and formerly lived at 136 East 64th Street.

title: SCHOOLS CURBED ON BOARD VOTING
description: The Board of Education an nounced policies yesterday to insulate the schools from poli tical activity during the cam paign for election of commu nity school boards.

title: Value of Community Stressed By Columbia's PresidentElect
description: LA JOLLA, Calif., Feb. 3  William J. McGill, the presi dentdesignate of Columbia University, said today that one of his first priorities would be to make the uni versity an integral part of the future of New York City, pro viding a full range of educa tional opportunities an urban university must provide for its surrounding community.

title: Kennedy Talk Sends Stock List Soaring
description: The stock market staged an explosive rally yesterday after noon after David M. Kennedy. Secretary of the Treasury, said a decline in interest rates may be closer to hand than most people realize.

title: New Books Today
description: FICTION

title: Theater: Comedie's Fete
PROPOSAL MADE TO KEEP PATRIOTS
description: William H. Sullivan Jr., the president of the Boston Pa triots who has been vainly seeking a permanent home for his football team for the last decade, entertained another last chance stadium plan yes terday that would keep the franchise in New England.

title: Bonwit Teller Appoints 2
description: Miss Helen Galland and J. Daniel Zarem have been ap pointed vice presidents of Bon wit Teller. Miss Galland is merchandise managur of acces sories and Mr. Zarem becomes fashion director for all Bonwit store in addition to continuing the merch?? men's shop.

title: Burden Backs vanden Heuvel
description: William vanden Heuvel was endorsed yesterday in his cam paign for Governor by City Councilman Carter Burden and the two called for prison re forms. They said that the state should assume responsibility for all persons sentenced to six or more months in prison to re lieve overcrowding in city prisons.

title: Yacht Unit Changes Name
description: The Owens yacht division, a Brunswick Corporation subsid iary, has changed its name to the Concorde yacht division.

title: ARGENTINA REDUCES TOLL IN TRAIN CRASH
description: BUENOS AIRES, (AP)The Argentine Government reduced by 100 tonight the official cas ualty figures in the train crash Sunday, saying that 136 per sons had been killed when a luxury express train rammed the rear of a stalled commuter train.

title: CITIES' PROBLEMS HIT APPAREL SALES
description: MIAMI BEACH, Fla., Feb. 3 Problems of the cities and the movement of population to the suburbs will directly affect the growth of the women's ap parel trades, according to speak ers today at the annual meet ing of the National Board of the Coat and Suit Industry.

title: DR. CAMILLO ARTOM
description: WINSTONSALEM, N. C., Feb. 3 (AP)Dr. Camillo Ar tom, a biochemist and profes sor emeritus at Bowman Gray School of Medicine at Wake Forest University, died today at his home in WinstonSalem. He was 76 years old.

title: PHOENIX TO OFFER 2 PLAYS AT ONCE
description: The Phoenix Theater, which dissolved its partnership with the Association of Producing Artists last year, will be repre sented off as well as on Broad way this season.

title: Nixon's Farm Bill, Modifying Ceilings, Goes to Congress
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 3 (UPI) The Administration today sent Congress a proposed new consensus farm bill that in cluded a $110,000acrop ceil ing on Federal support pay ments to big growers.

title: Lindsay Attends Opening Of Queens Health Center
description: Mayor Lindsay cut the rib bon yesterday to open a new community health care center at the Mary Immaculate Hos pital in Jamaica, Queens, that will provide health services for entire families under the city statefinanced ghetto medi cine program.

title: Stokes Starts Inquiry
description: DETROIT, Feb. 3 (AP)The Mayor of Cleveland, Carl B. Stokes, opened an office in Detroit today as he began personal investigation into al legations that his new chief of police took payoffs while highranking Detroit policeman. In Cleveland the new appointee, William M. Ellenburg, who de nied the allegations, continued as the city's top policeman.

title: CONSUMER CHIEF PRAISES BUDGET
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 3 President Nixon has redeemed his promise of an expanded budget for his special assistant for consumer affairs by pro jecting expenditures of $810, 000 in the budget for the 1971 fiscal year.

title: NEW TESTS MADE ON AUTO CRASHES
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 3The vulnerability of modern auto mobiles to costly damage in runofthemill crashes has been further pointed up in filmed tests sponsored by the insurance industry.

title: Brooklyn Gallery In Fiscal Squeeze
description: When a militant black group called F I.C.E. (Fed erated Institutes of Cultural Enrichment) stomped into the Brooklyn Museum one clay, demanding a place to show art produced by its mem bers, the museum came up with a fast solution. It set up the Community Art Gal lery, a showcase for local talent that is the first of its kind in a major United States museum.

title: Senate Panel Urges the End of Virtually All Draft Deferments as Inequities
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 3A 91 page report urging that the Se lective Service System eliminate virtually all deferments and im pose a system of uniform na tional standards was issued to day by a Senate subcommittee.

title: Alexander's Stores Survive 2 Bombs With No Damage
description: Incendiary devices that did no damage were found in two Alexander's department stores last night in Manhattan and the Bronx.

title: PRICES ARE AHEAD IN JUICE FUTURES
description: Forecasts of more inclement weather for Florida created a strong demand for frozen orange juice concentrate yes terday on the New York Cot ton Exchange here.

title: L.I.R.R. OBSERVERS NO LONGER ON TRAINS
description: The Long Island Rail Road pulled its management observ ers off the trains before the evening rush hour yesterday after it became apparent that the commuters posed no threat to the trainmen.

title: 2 LARGEST UNIONS RATIFY G.E. PACT
description: Both unions holding national contracts with the General Electric Company announced last night that their members had ratified new 40month agreements that would end 100day strike.

title: Sunday White House Pastor
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 3 (UPI) The Rev. Henry Edward Rus sell, pastor of the Second Pres byterian Church in Memphis, brother of Senator Richard B. Russell, Democrat of Georgia, will conduct religious services at the White House Sunday.

title: PRESIDENT OFFERS COMPROMISE PLAN ON SCHOOL FUNDS
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 3 President Nixon has sent to Congress detailed recommenda tions for revision of the health, education and antipoverty appropriations bill be vetoed last week.

title: Bronx Zoo to Spend $10Million To Build 30Acre Asia Exhibit
description: The New York Zoological Society announced plans last night to transform 30 acres of undeveloped land at the Bronx Zoo into a $10million simula tion of tropical Asia to display the wildlife of that areafrom orangutans to tigersin what will appear to be their natural environment.

title: St. John's Game Put Off Because of Wet Court
description: KINGSTON, R. I., Feb. 3 The basketball game between St. John's University and Rhode Island was halted to night when Walter Rooney, the referee, discovered it was raining inside the Frank W. Keaney Gymnasium.

title: Donaldson Names Officer
description: Donaldson, Lufkin & Jen rette, Inc., the institutional brokerage concern, announced yesterday the appointment of Richard L. Schall as vice presi dentfinance, a new position. Mr. Schall had been executive vice president and a director of MetroGoldwynMayer, the motion picture concern.

title: Whose Forest Primeval?
description: A projected raid on the national forests, up for vote in the House this week, is reminiscent in some ways of the lumber baron days of the nineteenth century though much more subtle. The socalled National Timber Supply Act would allow these great tracts of nationally owned timberland to be subjected to heavy cutting pressure in contravention of established Forest Service practices and in disregard of longrange con servation alms.
