title: Fire Destroys Brooklyn Cafe
description: A threealarm fire burned out a bar and grill at 3200 Emmons Avenue, in the Sheepshead Bay section of Brooklyn last night. Several bungalows also were destroyed in the tear of the structure.

title: CRESPIN RECITAL AT MUSEUM OF ART
description: A definite downshift, as they say in sportscar circles, is re quired of an operatic soprano who steps out to sing a song recital, and not simply in vocal production. The modulation into an intimate form of address is one not easily managed by an artist temperamentally attuned to addressing large theatrical rallies of the sort held in opera houses.

title: Air Base 15 Miles From Saigon Struck by 10 Vietcong Rockets
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Wednesday, Feb. 4 (AP)Viet cong gunners fired 10 rockets into the Bienhoa air base, 15 miles north of Saigon, late yes terday. There were no Ameri can casualties and damage was light, a United States spokes man said.

title: JAIL INSTEAD OF BAIL FOR DE CARLO DENIED
description: NEWARK, Feb. 3 (UPI)  A Federal judge refused today to put Angelo (Gyp) De Carlo, a reputed Mafia leader, into jail to await sentencing on six counts of loansharking.

title: Flood Asks for Injunction to Make Him a Free Agent Immediately
description: After hearing two hours of argument on a motion to make Curt Flood a free agent im mediately, Judge Irving Ben Cooper reserved decision yes terday in Federal Court here.

title: SAVINGS STAMP SALE TO BE ENDED JUNE 30
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 3The savings stamp program, which has induced schoolchildren and adults to purchase savings bonds for 29 years, will be abandoned June 30.

title: Nixon Programs Criticized
description: ATLANTA, Feb. 3 (Reuters) Whitney M. Young, Jr., na tional head of the Urban League, accused President Nixon today of adopting token programs instead of taking constructive steps in dealing with the prob lems of face and poverty.

title: New Bridge Over Taconic
description: A bridge over the new north bound lane of the Taconic State Parkway in Yorktown will open to traffic at 11 A.M. to day. The stew crossing will per mit traffic on State Route 129 to travel east and west free of parkway flow, since there are no connecting ramps between the Taconic and the state route, according to John L. Beers, acting executive director of the East Hudson Parkway Authority.

title: Taiwan Is Reported to Bar Aide of Prisoners Group
description: A Columbia University pro fessor, who represents Amnesty International, an organization that seeks the release of prisoners of conscience, said yesterday that he had been refused a visa to visit Taiwan.

title: Stokes Starts Inquiry
description: DETROIT, Feb. 3 (AP)The Mayor of Cleveland, Carl B. Stokes, opened an office in Detroit today as he began personal investigation into al legations that his new chief of police took payoffs while highranking Detroit policeman. In Cleveland the new appointee, William M. Ellenburg, who de nied the allegations, continued as the city's top policeman.

title: BREWER OF WINGS CONTROLS TEMPO
description: Carl Brewer, who speaks in parables, and Bob Nevin, who speaks hardly at all, will be making their presences felt in their fashions at Madison Square Garden tonight.

title: BRITISH ARE SEEKING COLORED POLICEMEN
description: LONDON, Feb. 3Of more than 90,000 policemen in Brit ain, exactly 19 are colored.

title: State Gets High Grades for Its Support of the Arts
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 3One of the most comprehensive Congressional inquiries into the condition of the arts resumed today, with the picture looking rosiest in New York State.

title: LIQUIDATION IS SEEN FOR SILVER HOLDINGS
description: The liquidation of huge silver holdings by speculators and in vestors will act as a restraining force on silver prices in 1970, Handy & Harman said yester day.

title: Theft of Rockets Confirmed
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Feb. 3 (Reuters)  The United States Embassy today confirmed the theft of 12 rockets from the United States Air Force base at Udorn, 400 miles north of Bang kok

title: Israeli and Egyptian Jets Strike Again Across the Suez Canal
description: JERUSALEM, Feb. 3Israeli and Egyptian jets attacked each other's positions in the area of the Suez Canal today.

title: COMPANY'S BOARD FACING PROXY BID
description: A meeting of the board of directors of the General Dy namics Corporation apparently has been scheduled for today to discuss the threat of a pos sible proxy fight and alleged dissatisfaction by institutional lenders over the declaration last week of the regular quar terly dividend.

title: Knicks Trounce Warriors, 11898, at Gardeur for Ninth Straight Triumph
description: Blooming with good health, the New York Knickerbockers methodically took advantage of a San Francisco Warrior team that was badly crippled and posted a 11898 National Basketball Association victory last night at Madison Square Garden before a crowd of 17,488.

title: U.S. Softens Ruling on Hiring Minorities in Nonbuilding Jobs
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 3 (UPI)  The Government backed away today from a controver sial proposal that would have required all major Federal con tractors outside the construc tion industry to hire minority group members in direct pro portion to the local population makeup.

title: LeRoy Ireland, Art Dealer And Artist, Is Dead at 80
description: PHILADELPHIA, Feb. 3Le Roy Ireland, an artist and art dealer, died at his Rittenhouse Square apartment here yester day of a heart attack. Retired since 1958, he was 80 years old.

title: Conference on Sonic Boom Told Noise Can't Be Designed Away
description: PARIS, Feb. 3  The first major intergovernmental con ference on the sonic boom came to the cheerless conclusion to day that little can be done through aircraft design to abate the thunderous clap, up to 50 miles wide, that trails aircraft flying faster than the speed of sound, roughly 745 miles an hour.

title: Gromyko and Brandt Aide Hold Their Second Meeting
description: MOSCOW, Feb. 3 (Reuters)  West Germany and the So viet Union discussed the possi bility of a nonaggression pact for nearly 3 hours today, a West German source said.

title: Cab Industry Aims To Abolish Abuses
description: ON a rainy morning last week, two women, grip ping valises, hailed a taxicab at Lexington Avenue and 34th Street. They clifthed inside and asked to go to the West Side Airlines Terminal on 42d Street at 10th Avenue.

title: Market Place
description: IT DOESN'T help the stock market  or the savings banks for that matterthat some of th ebest opportuni ties for capital appreciation at present are to be found in the bond market.

title: Greek Official Urges Penalties For Music Aping Hippie Tunes
description: ATHENS, Feb. 3A leading member of the militarybacked Government of Greece has called for action by the state to discipline those Greek artists who, he said, were imitating the decadent imported music composed by drugaddicted hippies.

title: Letters to the Editor of The Times
description: To the Editor:

title: TAPE OF INTERVIEW IN BRIBE CASE LOST
description: A reel of tape with a re corded interview between a lawyer and his clienta police man indicted on charges of re ceiving a $5,000 bribe from Montgomery Ward, Inc.was stolen from the lawyer's office, it was reported yesterday.

title: President Would Not Sit For a Portrait Painting
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 3 (AP) President Nixon, receiving a gift of an oil painting of his two daughters, said to day that he would never sit for a Presidential portrait.

title: Gerould Play to Open
description: The Chelsea Theater Center will present Daniel C. Ger ould's Candaules, Commis sioner on Feb. 6, 7, 13, 14 at 8:30 P.M. at the Third Theater of the Brooklyn Academy of Music, 30 Lafayette Avenue. The play, which is making its debut here, is an anticolonial ist satire set in a mythical Asian country. Robert Andrew Bonnard is directing a cast that includes Katie DrewWilkinson, John Newton and Martin Brennan.

title: Nebraska Educator to Run Against Senator Hruska
description: LINCOLN Neb., Feb. 3  The chairman of the University of Nebraska's Department of Economics, Dr. Wallace C. Peterson, has declared his can didacy for the Democratic nomination to the United States Senate.

title: State Exploring Incentives to Banks to Aid Housing
description: ALBANI, Feb. 2  The Rockefeller administration is exploring the possibility of ex tending tax incentives to banks as a means of making more mortgage money available to home buyers in the state, Su perintendent of Banks Frank Wille said today.

title: Christopher Cohane to Marry Sibyl Fulenwider on May 23
description: CHADDS FORD, Pa., Feb. 3  Miss Sibyl Fulenwider and Christopher Barry Co bane will be married May 23 in Wilmington, Del.

title: Latins Integrating in Jersey Town
description: Se Habla Espanol, the sign in the window of a shop in New Jersey says. Inside, three young girls wend their way through the aisles of clothing, chatting with the sales girl in Spanish.

title: Rail Merger Date Set
description: The socalled Northern Lines  the Great Northern and Northern Pacific  announced yesterday that they planned to put their merger with the Chicago, Burlington & Quincy Railroad into effect on March 2. The merger of the three sys tems was approved Monday by the United States Supreme Court.

title: PRAGUE VERIFYING ROLLS OF PARTY
description: PRAGUE, Feb. 3The Czech oslovak Communist party to day opened a drive to weed out unrepentant liberals from its rank and file.

title: City Council Delays Money to Provide Raise for Members
description: The City Council's Finance Committee yesterday delayed approving funds for Council men's salary increases as well as $230,750 for the office of the new third Deputy Mayor, Robert M. Morgenthau.

title: Ohio Pickets Defy Court
description: CINCINNATI, Feb. 3 (AP) About 200 striking city work ers picketed City Hall today in defiance of a court injunction. The strike by 1,500 workers, which was 30 days old today, has left the city without gar bage collection and street and water system maintenance.

title: Ward and Container, Units Of Marcor, Name New Chiefs
description: Montgomery Ward & Co. and the Container Corporation of America, divisions of Marcor, Inc., elected new chief execu tives yesterday.

title: 13 Auto and Truck Makers Named in Antipollution Suit
description: PHILADELPHIA, Feb. 3 (UPI) The city filed a damage suit in United States District Court today, charging conspiracy in violation of the Sherman Anti trust Act by 13 major automo bile and truck manufacturers and their trade association to restrain the development and installation of antipollution de vices on vehicles.

title: INFORMERS' FUND MISSING IN JERSEY
description: TRENTON, Feb. 3The chair man of the State Commission of Investigation charged today that over the last 10 years $58,000 had disappeared from fund in the Monmouth County Prosecutor's office that was used to pay underworld informers.

title: Engelhard Cuts Prices
description: The Engelhard Minerals and Chemicals Corporation an nounced yesterday it was re ducing the selling price for rhodium and iridium by $5 a troy ounce. The company es tablished a new price range of $215 to $220 per troy ounce for rhodium, and a range of $155 to $160 per troy ounce for irid ium. Both materials are used as hardening agents in alloys of other precious metals.

title: Soviet Sub Damaged In the Mediterranean
description: GIBRALTAR, Feb. 3 (Reu ters)  A Soviet submarine, with a crew of 90 to 100 men, has had part of her bow sheared off in an accident somewhere in the Mediter ranean, it was reported to night.

title: U.S. Military in Europe Disagrees With Mansfield Plan
description: WILDFLECKEN, West Ger many  As two American in fantrymen on maneuvers la bored through the snow lug ging a 50caliber machine gun, a colonel watched them and said:

title: Mussolini's Medals Sought
description: ROME, Feb. 3 (Reuters)Ro mano Mussolini, youngest son of the late Italian dictator, to day began legal proceedings for the return by the Italian Trea sury Ministry of a strongbox containing his father's military decorations and medals.

title: Card Producers Set Hearts on Feb. 14
description: What can I say to a Valentine Who has so much charm, per sonality and talent? Except we've got a lot in com mon!

title: LAYER CONQUERS STILWELL, 62, 63
description: Philadelphia, Feb. 3 (AP) Form held up today in the In ternational Tennis Players As sociation $60,000 indoor open championship as Rod Laver, Roy Emerson, Tom Older and Manuel Santana advanced to the third round in singles.

title: AIDES IN OAKLAND DEFEND DEPUTIES
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Feb. 3 County officials here defended today 12 sheriff's deputies and denounced the Federal prose cutor whose investigation led to their indictment on charges of shooting demonstrators and beating prisoners.

title: Advertising: The Senator Asks Some Whys
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 3 Senator Frank E. Moss, a leading champion of the con sumer in Congress, came be fore representatives of the nation's advertising commu nity today and failed to drop any bombshells. He did how ever, ask an interesting ques tion.

title: Bank of England Plans Operational Changes
description: LONDON, Feb. 3  The Bank of England, the leading symbol of London's financial power, will shortly make changes in its operations on the advice of American effici ency experts.

title: 5 ON L.I. INDICTED INLAND DEAL CASE
description: RIVERHEAD, LI., Feb 3A grand jury that has been in vestigating land deals in the Town of Babylon today in dicted the director of the Suf folk County Sewer Authority, two town officials, the town leader of the Republican party and his brother.

title: Financing Is Planned For Trans Caribbean
description: American Airlines, Inc., and Trans Caribbean Airways, Inc., which announced a merger, agreement last month, said yesterday they had entered into an agreement to obtain $10mil lion in interim financing for Trans Caribbean.

title: Kosygin Note on Mideast Termed LowKey by U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 3The Administration began pre paring a reply today to what it described as a lowkey letter from Premier Aleksei N. Kosygin of the Soviet Union on tensions in the Middle East.

title: PRICES ON AMEX EDGE AHEAD AGAIN
description: An afternoon rally reversed earlier losses on the American Stock Exchange yesterday and gave the list its second con secutive gain in active trading.

title: Rain Closes Narragansett
description: PAWTUCKET, R. I., Feb. 3 (UPI)Narragansett race track was closed today and will re main closed until Friday be cause of heavy rainfall that prevented workers from groom ing the race course. Portions of the track were under water and a freeze was expected to night.

title: NEW PHONE OFFICE SET FOR MIDTOWN
description: The New York Telephone Company yesterday agreed to occupy all the space in a 53 story skyscraper to be built on the Avenue of the Americas opposite Bryant Park as part of its efforts to upgrade services.

title: Mrs. Lindsay Net Chairman
description: Mrs. John V. Lindsay, a ten nis player and fan, will he honorary chairman for the $5,000 international women's tournament opening Monday night at the Vanderbilt Club. A UniTurf playing surface is being installed for the event.

title: NASSAU STUDENTS SERVE AS TUTORS
description: FREEPORT, L.I., Feb. 3  Maria Elena Duarte, a 16year old junior at Freeport High School who was born in Cuba, wrote the words el gato and el perro on the blackboard of a classroom of the Bayview Elementary School here for small group of Spanishspeak ing pupils.

title: BILL TO ALLOW SUITS IN POLLUTION BACKED
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Feb. 3 (UPI)  Several Massachusetts conservation groups have an nounced support for legislation allowing private citizens to bring suit against anyone pol luting the environment.

title: Treasury's Chief Hopeful on Rates; Talk Lifts Stocks
description: David M. Kennedy, Secretary of the Treasury, said here yes terday that a break in the na tion's inflationary psychology and a resultant drop in interest rates may be closer to hand than most people realize.

title: MRS. HANS C. SONNE, AIDED WAR VICTIMS
description: Mrs. Carol Mulford Sonne died at Doctors Hospital Mon day after a short illness. She was 61 years old, the wife of Hans Christian Sonne.

title: Tempers Flare During Debate In Albany on City School Plan
description: ALBANY, Feb. 3Two years of resentment and antagonism growing out of legislative wrangling over New York City's school decentralization boiled to the surface today when the Senate majority leader accused liberal Manhattan Democrats of racist thinking.

title: Profit Record Set By A. T. & T. in '69
description: The American Telephone and Telegraph Company achieved new highs in operating rev enus and net income in 1969, it reported yesterday.

title: Miss Manning To Be a Bride
description: GREENSBORO, N. C., Feb. 3  The engagement of Miss Barbara Belle Manning, a sophomore at Hollins College, to Thomas Oliver Bear, a jun ior at Washington and Lee University, has been an nounced by Mr. and Mrs. Wil liam Sinkler Manning, parents of the future bride. Her fianc is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Carl Webster Bear of Mont gomery, Ala.

title: FORDHAM BEATEN BY CONNECTICUT
description: Defying the law of averages, Robert Taylor of Connecticut stood on the freethrow line with five seconds left last night and sank two shots that gave the Huskies a 6664 victory over Fordham in the Rams' gymnasium in the Bronx.

title: Some Georgia Teachers Threaten to Quit
description: ATLANTA, Feb. 3  The threatened resignation of more than half the white teachers in one racially troubled Georgia county contrasted sharply to day with the smooth, trouble free integration of faculties in a neighboring community.

title: Many Students Stay Home From Plainfield School
description: PLAINFIELD, N. J., Feb. 3 (AP)  More than half the students at the high school here stayed away today follow ing a racial brawl the previous day that had closed the school.

title: Subpoenas on the Press
description: If the press is to fulfill the independent role guar anteed to it by the First Amendment, the line of separation between it and the Government must be kept unmistakable. That line is jeopardized by the subpoenas various news magazines, television net works and newspapers, including The New York Times, have recently received from Federal authorities for notes, files, film and other material. Times, have recently received from Federal authorities for notes, files, film and other material.

title: Coast Guard Airlifts 6
description: NAHANT, Mass., Feb. 3 (AP) Six men were rescued today by a Coast Guard helicopter from a pilot boat that lost two masts in winds and high seas off the Massachusetts coast.

title: Whites and Negroes in Daytona Beach Face Changes in Habits Today as School Integration Begins
description: DAYTONA BEACH, Fla., Feb. 3  The throaty rumble and whine of expensive racing engi nes glutted the air here over the weekend. The skyblue Por sche roared around the track at Daytona International Speed way enough times within a 24 hour period to fend off the challenge of a sleek red Ferrari and win an endurance race watched by 35,000 fans.

title: Mishap Delays Subway. Penn Central Train Stalls
description: There were intermittent de lays on various transit lines yesterday, including a 45 minute stoppage at the Junction Boulez and Station in Queens at 6:45 A.M. when a woman fell off the platform. The woman, Augustina Rodriquez, 25 years old, of 4110 97th Place, Coro na, Queens, was listed in fair condition at Elmhurst General Hospital.

title: NONNUCLEAR PACT SIGNED BY JAPAN
description: TOKYO, Feb. 3  Japan signed today the treaty to pre vent the spread of nuclear weapons.

title: 6 Students Get 3 Months In Takeover at Boston U.
description: BOSTON, Feb. 3 (UPI)Six Boston University students were sentenced today to three months in jail on contempt charges in connection with the December takeover of a univer sity building.

title: Vietcong Flag Is Chicago Trial Issue
description: CHICAGO, Feb. 3The color of the Vietcong flag became the latest point of contention at the Chicago conspiracy trial today.

title: Heavy Rain Wrecks Racing Program at Hialeah
description: MIAMI, Feb. 3A tornado warning was issued for the Miami area this afternoon and though the storm failed to materialize, Hialeah Race Course was a disaster area at the end of the day. A tornado couldn't have done much more damage than the rain that inundated the track at noon.

title: Cox Buys Uruguayan Horse
description: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Feb. 3 (UPI)  So De Mayo, a top Uruguayan horse, will be flown to the United States to morrow after being bought by an American horseman Mark Cox 3d. So De Mayo, winner of the grand sweepstakes, Jose Pedro Ramirezthe country's major horse race  will con tinue racing in the United States.

title: LAG ON RAIL CARS ASSAILED BY REID
description: Representative Ogden R. Reid has sent a blunt letter to Governor Rockefeller complain ing that footdragging on the purchase of new Penn Central commuter cars means that the cars cannot be delivered, under normal procedures, for two or three years of more.

title: U.S. Agrees to Setting Up of Trade Unit to Hear Latin Complaints
description: CARACAS, Venezuela, Feb. 3  The United States has agreed to the formation of a new interAmerican negotiating unit on trade that will hear Latin  American complaints against United States protec tionism and consider proposals for United States trade conces sions. tionism and consider proposals for United States trade conces sions.

title: Cullman Renamed Chairman Of U.S. Open Tennis Event
description: TUCSON, Ariz., Feb. 3 (UPI) Joseph F. Cullman 3d of New York was reappointed today chairman of the 1970 United States Open Tennis champion ship.

title: Visiting Soviet Editors Received by Rogers
description: WASHINGTON,  Feb. 3 (AP)  Secretary of State William P. Rogers met today for more than an hour with 11 Soviet newspaper editors visiting the United States as guests of American publishers.

title: Lodge and Kissinger Meet
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 3 (Reu ters)Henry Cabot Lodge, for mer chief United States nego tiator at the Vietnam peace talks in Paris, held an unan nounced meeting at the White House today to discuss the stalemated negotiations. White House aides said he had con ferred with President Nixon's adviser on national security, Henry A. Kissinger.

title: Cornell Wins 16th in Row
description: UTICA, N. Y., Feb. 3Cor nell scored four times on power plays to top Colgate tonight, 52, for the unbeaten Big Red's 16th straight hockey victory. Brian McCutcheon got two goals as Cornell bombarded John Haney with 85 shots. Dan Lodhoa, a defenseman, also scored twice.

title: Newark Teachers' Strike Continues as an Impasse Is Reached in Talks
description: NEWARK, Feb. 3  More than three hours of negoti ation aimed at ending the Newark teachers' strike end ed fruitlessly today after a reported impasse over the control of teacher assign ments and promotions.

title: Hijacker on Hunger Strike
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Feb. 3 (Reuters)Christian Below, the 27yearold Frenchman who hi jacked a Trans World Airlines jetliner to Beirut Jan. 9, went on a hunger strike today to pro test his continued detention, informed sources said.

title: Dr. M. J. Joachim. Served Presbyterian Church Unit
description: RIDGEWOOD, N. J., Feb. 3 (AP)The Rev. Dr. Melvin J. Joachim, executive secretary of the Hudson River Presbytery from 1958 to 1965, died today of a heart attack in Valley Hospital. He was 65 years old.

title: Compensatory Financing
description: Businessmen today are prob ably more wedded to compen satory financethe notion that Government will step up spend ing whenever business goes into a downturn  than they ever were to balanced budgets. Herbert Stein, now a mem her of President Nixon's Council of Economic Advisers, has said that people often ex press themselves in favor of big, traditional, conservative generalizations. Public opinion polls but seldom translate these into votes for or against can didates or issues.

title: CYANAMID NET UP WITH SALES IN '69
description: The American Cyanamid Company reported yesterday that its earnings last year came to $89.870,000, or $2.02 share, up from $85,760,000, or $1.93, in 1968. Sales were record $1,087,098,000, against $1,023,231,000 in 1968.

title: ALBANY VOWS RISE IN BIG CITIES' AID
description: ALBANY, Feb. 3On the eve of the Big Six cities' plea for additional state aid, Governor Rockefeller estimated today that under his proposed budget the cities would receive 13 per cent more aid in nonschool categor ies than they did now.

title: Senate Unit Delays Action on Carswell In Procedural Snarl
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 3 Judge G. Harrold Carswell's Supreme Court nomination became enmeshed today in a complicated parliamentary procedure that appears to have stalled further action on the nomination until the Judiciary Committee sched ules a vote on an unrelated proposal.

title: Loss at Bache Disclosed
description: Bache & Co., Inc., the nation's second largest brokerage house, lost $3,837,632 in the fiscal nine months ended last Oct. 31 and probably ran deeper into the red during the rest of its fiscal year, which ended Jan. 31.

title: Japan's NonNuclear Pledge
description: Japan's signature on the nuclear nonproliferation treaty gives new impetus to the SovietAmerican drive to gain adherence of the other potential nuclear powers, without which the pact will remain largely meaningless even if most countries of the world join.

title: Mayor's Speechwriter Quits on a Light Note
description: Jeff Greenfield, the May or's 26yearold speechwriter, resigned yesterday with this hope for Mayor Lindsay: May your future be as clean as a street in East Queens after the first snow.

title: Erratic Weather Plays Havoc With Travel in the City
description: The metropolitan area was besieged by fog, inundated by rain and warmed by record temperatures early yesterday, only to be buffeted by high winds, freezing rain and snow late last night.

title: Federal Agency is Termed Unprepared for Emergency
description: ROANOKE, Va., Feb. 3 (UPI) An official of a floodruined county in Virginia has accused the Office of Emergency Pre paredness of being unprepared for emergencies.

title: Grand Jury Is Checking Financial Records of a U.M.W. Local in Tennessee
description: CLEVELAND, Feb. 3 (UPI)  A Federal grand jury delved today into the financial records of a United Mine Workers local in Tennessee where Joseph A. Yablonski, the slain U.M.W. of ficial contended the union had illegally spent $3.7million.

title: Soviet Said to Press for Big 4 Guidelines on Mideast
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Feb. 3The Soviet Union has asked the Big Four to stop debating and get down immediately to the drafting Of an agreed posi tion on guidelines for an Is raeliArab settlement, informed Soviet sources said today.

title: Valerie Heller, Michael Libman Engaged to Wed
description: SHORT HILLS, N. J., Feb. 3Mr. and Mrs. Philip Heller have announced the engage ment of their daughter, Miss Valerie Heller, to Michael L. Libman, son of Mr. and Mrs. Max L. Libman of Reston, Va.

title: Tug Strike Starts Costing City $50,000 a Day Extra on Refuse
description: The threedayold tugboat strike yesterday started costing the city $50,000 a day.

title: News Summary and Index
description: WEDNESDAY ??

title: If You Detest Washing Cutlery, a Splayd May Be the Thing
description: SYDNEY, Australia  If I have it my way, said Mrs. Suzanne McArthur, Splayds will he putting food into American mouths by the million.

title: Ghislaine deGive Will Be Wed To Royce Hoyle 3d, a Teacher
description: Mr. and Mrs. Paul de Give of New York and Southamp ton L. I., have announced the engagement of their daugh ter, Miss Ghislaine deGive, to Royce A. Hoyle 3d, son of Mr. and Mrs. Hoyle Jr. of Glencoe, Ill.

title: Syntex in Japan Deal
description: The Syntex Corporation and flounced yesterday it had agreed to form an equally owned joint venture with Ta nabe Seiyaku Company, Ltd., to make and market drug prod ucts in Japan.

title: Obituary 1  No Title
description: DAVID ZIRINSKY

title: Playwrights Unit Lifts Curtain on Success
description: The play arrived unsolic ited, as many do, at Richard Barr and Edward Albee's Playwrights Unit, a work shop for new writers. The author was an unknown named Rayne Endars.

title: Spying on the Press
description: Defense Department explanations of why four Government investigators were issued press creden tials in Saigon are confused, incomplete and evasive. In the absence of a more credible accounting, it hard to escape the conclusion that undercover inform ers were used to try to spy on reporters and their news sources. Such a practice would constitute an intolerable threat to press freedom.

title: SONICS CONQUER BULLETS, 120115
description: BALTIMORE, Feb. 3 (AP)  Playercoach Lenny Wilkens's layup with 50 seconds left stalled a Baltimore Bullets rally and the Seattle Super Sonics posted a 120115 victory tonight in the second game of a National Basketball Associa tion doubleheader.

title: Tate Case Trial Postponed
description: LOS ANGELES, Feb. 3 (AP) Susan Denise Atkins today won postponement until March 30 of her trial on murderconspira cy charges in the death of the actress Sharon Tate and six others. Miss Atkins, 21 years old, is one of six codefendants in the case.

title: Jourdan of Florida Injured And Withdraws From Meet
description: The University of Florida and the Knights of Columbus track and field championships lost a star performer yesterday. Ron Jourdan, a 22yearold senior from Pensacola, was forced to withdraw from Friday night's high jump event in Madison Square Garden because of an injury.

title: 26,515 at StrikeDelayed Santa Anita Opening See Rising Market Score
description: ARCADIA, Calif., Feb. 3 (AP) The Santa Anita race track, shut by a strike that consumed 27 racing days, finally opened today under sunny skies, and the winner of the opening feature for the second straight year, the $38,200 San Carlos Handicap, was Rising Market.

title: Brazil Says 18 Planned Kidnapping of U.S. Envoy
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, Feb. 3 The Brazilian army announced today that 18 persons, four of them under arrest in Brazil and facing trial by military courts, had planned and carried out the kidnapping of the United States ambassador last Septem ber.

title: AUSTRIA OPENS SITE FOR WAR STOCKPILES
description: VIENNA, Feb. 3  Austria opened a secret underground installation somewhere in the Alps today to stockpile vital supplies for such an emergency as an invasion.

title: Abortion Reform Opportunity
description: Assemblyman Albert H. Blumenthal of Manhattan has once more introduced a bill at Albany to liberalize this state's cruel abortion law, which permits abortion only when the mother's life is in danger and in no other circumstance.

title: COUGARS TRIUMPH OVER NETS, 10591
description: GREENSBORO, N. C., Feb. (AP)  The Carolina Cougars took an early lead tonight and only lost it once before beating the New York Nets, 10591, in an American Basketball Associ ation game.

title: PROFITS DECLINE AT AMERICAN CAN
The Washington Record
Tobacco Research Proposed
description: FRANKFORT, Ky., Feb. 3 (UPI)State Senator Thomas O. Harris has proposed that a halfcent tax be imposed on a pack of cigarettes to pay for state research to determine if smoking is hazardous to health. Mr. Harris, a tobacco farmer, said Monday that the tax would provide about $2million an nually that would be ear marked exclusively, for tobacco research.

title: Hospital Corp. Elects
description: John A. Hill, who took early retirement as president of Aetna Life and Casualty last month at age 62, was named yesterday to the executive com mittee and board of the Hospi tal Corporation of America. The company has 23 hopsitals with a total of 2,700 beds. Ten more are being built and 10 planned in a $65million program, J. C. Massey, chairman, said.

title: Nixon to State Africa Policy
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 3 (AP) President Nixon will issue statement on United States policy toward Africa following a tour of that continent this month by Secretary of State William P. Rogers, the White House announced today.

title: The Women Who'd Trade In Their Pedestal for Total Equality
description: IT'S RATHER disconcerting for a middleaged, securely middleclass American businessman or professional to be confronted at a cocktail party by a blithe young creature who calls him, in a wellmodulated, girlish voice, an oppressor, a male chauvinist and a sexist. It's been happening lately.

title: Tenants Willingly Agree To a Rent Increase
description: The owner of a rentcon trolled rooming house on the upper West Side recently asked his tenants to accept voluntarily a 15 per cent rent increase and to his surprise, most have agreed rather than have building services re duced.

title: Police Say Man Slays 3 And Himself in Brooklyn
description: A 27yearold man killed his wife, his small daughter, hisl fatherinlaw and himself in thel Sheepshead Bay section ofj Brooklyn yesterday evening, the police said.

title: Boycotting College Students Give Up Protest in Oregon
description: PORTLAND, Ore., Feb 3  After three days of faculty and student meetings at Reed Col lege, most of 250 students who had refused on Friday and Sat urday to register or pay tuition for the spring term did so to day.

title: Fistfight Breaks Out At Panther Hearing
description: Fists flew and bruises were inflicted yesterday when a melee broke out in the second day of pretrial hearings for 13 Black Panthers charged with plotting to bomb public places in New York City.

title: Motel Fire Routs 100
description: BREWTON, Ala., Feb. 3 (UPI) More than 100 persons were forced to leave their rooms in subfreezing weather early to day as firemen battled a blaze at the Colonial Ma nor Motel.

title: W.E.B. DuBois Club to Join 2 Communist Youth Groups
description: The W. E. B. DuBois club announced plans yesterday to merge with the Communist Party Youth and Independent Marxist Youth in the formation of a new revolutionary or ganization.

title: Negro Colonel Is Named To Public Affairs Post
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 3 The appointment of Col. Daniel James as Deputy As sistant Secretary of Defense for Public Affairs was an nounced today by Melvin R. Laird, Secretary of Defense.

title: Israel Eases Changes on Who Is Jew
description: JERUSALEM, Feb. 3  The Israeli Cabinet seemed to have bowed to public opinion today in easing some of the changes it planned to make in reversing a High Court decision defining a Jew.

title: Wachovia Realty Concern Makes $65Million Offering
description: A $65million offering of 3.25 million shares of beneficial interest in Wachovia Realty Investments was made yester day by an underwriting group led by Merrill Lynch, Pierce, Fenner & Smith, Inc. The offer ing was priced at $20 a share.

title: After Annotated Look at Infidelity, Author Discusses Affairs and Marriage
description: WHEN Morton Hunt and his wife go to a dinner party these days, he has to be very careful not to dominate the evening. The slender, bearded author of The Affair, a por trait of extramarital love in contemporary, middle  class America, has discovered that his topic is incendiary.

title: Bridge:
description: OMAR SHARIF'S Circus suffered an upset in four days of playing in Los An geles that ended late Sunday night. The Circus was de feated by a 10man team revresenting Los Angeles by score of 123 international match points to 109. In the match of 112 deals the Cir cus tied the Dallas Aces, the United States representatives in the world championship.

title: Witter Takes to the Stage
description: Dean Witter & Co., the brokerage house, presented an Off Broadway multimedia show with a message on Wall Street yesterday.

title: Security Ban on Engineer On Nixon Train Decried
description: WILMINGTON, Del., Feb. 3 (AP)President Nixon's Jan. 24 Metroliner ride to Philadelphia has provoked a union protest over an engineer who was tak en off the highspeed train at the last moment because he lacked Secret Service clear ance.

title: Adrienne Roby Damast Affianced
description: KINGS POINT, L. I., Feb. 3 The engagement of Miss Adrienne Roby Damast to Stephen Jay Wilson, son of Mr. and Mrs. Norman Wilson of New York and White Meadow Lake, N. J., has been announced by the future bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Abraham Damast. A wedding in the summer is planned.

title: Bond Club Dinner Set
description: John N. Mitchell, Attorney General of the United States, will speak at the annual dinner of the Bond Club of New York on Feb., 10, Robert A. Powers. president, announced yester day. The dinner will be held at the WaldorfAstoria Hotel.

title: Back at the Helm in Costa Rica
description: SAN JOSE, Costa Rica, Feb. 2Jos Figures Ferrer, better known to his country men as Pepe Figures, is now a tame version of the young planter who led an armed uprising here 22 years ago to defend democratic rule in Costa Rica.

title: LTV DROPS PLAN TO ABSORB A UNIT
description: Plans for the LTV Aerospace Corporation to become a wholly, owned subsidiary of its parent company, LingTemcoVought, Inc., were canceled yesterday by the boards of both com panies.

title: Son of Wildwood's Mayor Indicted in Loansharking
description: CAMDEN, Feb. 3 (AP) Three men, including the son of the Mayor of Wildwood, were indicted here today by a Federal grand jury on loan sharking charges.

title: Alberta Crude Up in Week
description: CALGARY, Alberta, Feb. 3 (Canadian Press)  Crude oil production in Alberta averaged 1,022,086 barrels a day during the week ended Jan. 26, the Alberta Oil and Gas Conserva tion Board reported yesterday. Production in the previous week was 1,010,737 barrels day. Daily production in Janu ary was expected to average 1,009,403 barrels compared with 725,034 barrels in January, 1969.

title: Rockwell Growing Abroad
description: LONDON, Feb. 3 (AP)The North American Rockwell Cor poration is planning to spend $100million on international expansion within the next two years, Willard Rockwell, chair ?? yesterday.

title: No Progress Reported as Talks In Cemetery Walkout Resume
description: Mediators brought both sides in the cemetery strike together yesterday for the first time in over a week in an attempt to end the walkout that has halted most burials here since Jan. 12.

title: Sports of The Times
description: JIMMY ELLIS didn't even get a feeling of satisfaction from it. When he was training for a fight last summer with Henry Cooper in Europethe fight never came offJimmy boxed every day for al most a month with as polished a sparring partner as any boxer ever had. His foil was a certain Cassius Clay, a somewhat unemployed heavyweight champion.

title: Alternative Lines Help Jersey Riders Bypass Bus Strike
description: Forty thousand Northern! New Jersey and upstate New York commuters whose regular routes to the Port Authority Bus Terminal on West 41st Street are strikebound found other ways yesterday for the second successive weekday.

title: Businessmen's Alliance Fills Operations Post
description: The National Alliance of Businessmen has named Gerard M. Peterson as ex ecutive vice president of operations, it was announced yesterday. Mr. Peterson is an assistant secretary of the group insurance division of Aetna Life and Casualty.

title: Books of The Times
description: WERE one to synopsize Brigid Bro phy's new novel, one might simply say: Evelyn Hilary O'Rooiey ar rives at London's Heathrow Airport in time to participate in a revolution that, for various reasons, aborts. Lesbians and TV panelists and professors emeritus and King Arthur and Peiry Mason are all involved, as well as the history of fic tion.

title: Obituary 1  No Title
description: Announcements of deaths marriages births and engagements may be tele phoned to Oxford 53311 until 11 P.M. in suburban offices. 9.00 A.M. to 4:30 P M. Monday through Friday Newark (201) Market 33900: White Plains. (914) WHite Plains 95300; Hempstead (516) IVanhos 36650; Commack (516) 5135400; Stamford (203) 3187767.

title: STATE AIDE QUITS JOB AS LOBBYIST
description: ALBANY, Feb. 4Within hours after a $25,000ayear state official's name was pub lished in a list of registered lobbyists here today, he noti fied the Governor's office that he would resign the lobbying job immediately.

title: FOE SAID TO LOSE 48 IN RAID ON U.S. BASE
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Thursday, Feb. 5 (AP)North Vietnamese infantrymen as saulted a remote United States fire base north of Saigon yester day, then regrouped and at tacked an American patrol sweeping the perimeter.

title: Woolworth Sales Advance
description: The F. W. Woolworth Com pany announced yesterday 14.7 per cent sales gain in the five weeks ended Jan. 31 to $164,938,664 compared to $143, 859,060 in he similar period last year.

title: West Point Skiing Thrives, but Title Won't Come Easy
description: WEST POINT, N. Y., Feb. 4Skiing continues to be, a big item at the United States Military Academy. Every afternoon after classes, when conditions are favor able, hundreds of cadets can be found whizzing down the reservation's modestsized slopes.

title: 'Looking Glass War,' a Le Carre Spy Story
description: ESPIONAGE is a devious enough business without a studied, elliptical and sketchy screen treatment rendering it even more so and a spy protagonist who sticks out like a lighthouse. Such is the case with Columbia's "The Looking Glass War," which arrived yesterday at Loew's State and the Orpheum Theaters.The color picture is generally as odd, mannered and unconvincing as young Christopher Jones, flanked by a predominantly British cast in the European-made drama derived from another cat-and-mouse thriller by John Le Carr.The opening portion, with the clipped accents and some furtively cryptic vignettes, obliquely indicates that British Intelligence needs photographs of a new rocket from East Berlin. This eventually becomes clear enough, as Ralph Richardson, Paul Rogers and Anthony Hopkins (fine actors, all) stalk, then initiate their derelict recruit, young Jones.And it takes a full hour, about half of the picture, under the obtusely staccato direction of the scenarist, Frank R. Pierson, with some footnoted domestic scenes of the strategists and a hovering concern for their mission recruit, apparently a symbol of new-generation independence.At any rate, the new spy sneaks under barbed wire (killing a guard, in the film's one solidly moving moment) and thereupon slouches across enemy territory with bland indifference, toting a large rucksack (complete with wireless), wearing dark glasses, staring morosely and finally entering a tender but conventional liaison with lovely Pia Degermark ("Elvira Madigan").A climactic outburst indignantly suggests young Jones, whose all-American mumble is coated with a Polish accent, as a typical sacrifice of cold war machinations. Could be.The real question is this: Why would Jones, or anybody, have to risk his neck to photograph a rocket loudly trundled through the city streets as obviously as a transported whale? Back home, why didn't they simply watch it on television?

title: In The Nation: Ideology, Yes
description: BERKELEY, Calif., Feb. 4 The hillside campus of the Uni versity of California at Berkeley has been quiet this week, and for some time. The sunlit plaza in front of Sproul Hall, which has seen so much drama and confusion, was crowded as usual at noontime; a familiar local evangelist held forth on the sidewalk nearby, and the kinds of organizations that en liven the Berkeley scenethe Radical Students' Union, the Gay Liberation Front  were doing a brisk pamphlet trade. But political orators were no table by their absence.

title: Government Eases Demand for Newsmen's Files
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 4The Justice Department disclosed today that it would not insist on obtaining all of the material that it had demanded from newsmen in a recent series of subpoenas.

title: Louise Bogan, 72, Noted Poet Who Wrote About Love, Dead
description: Louise Bogan, one of the most distinguished lyric poets in the English language, died yesterday at her home at 709 West 169th Street. She was 72 years old.

title: Pesto Tastes Best in Genoa
description: HARRISBURG, Pa.To visit Genoa and not dine on pesto is tantamount to visiting champagne country and drinking still wines; visiting Bangkok and missing the floating markets. Pesto is, of course, that marvelously insin uating green sauce made with basil, pounded in a pestle and blended with oil and other good things, and it is so much part of the Genoa scene, Gianni Peri was saying this week, the Gen oese grow basil in hothouses to insure a supply all year long.

title: Executive Changes
description: A. R. Gale has been elected senior vice president and a member of the board and of the executive committee of American Export Industries, Inc. Ralph R. Weiser has been named president of Na tional Equipment Rental, Ltd., a subsidiary of A.E.I.

title: Sports of The Times
description: I FIGURE it like this, said Jimmy Archer, his eyes bright in the backroom dusk of a Third Avenue bar. I'll get a fight in New York, up at the Audubon. I win and they match me in the Garden, and once I fight the Garden everybody wants a shot at me for the pay day. They'll sell me short, they'll think I'm too old, out of shape, not serious, they don't believe it, and ail of a sudden....

title: National Airlines and Union Still Talk: Strike Continues
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 4 (UPI) Negotiations supervised by the National Mediation Board continued today between Na tional Airlines and the strik ing Air Lines Employes Asso ciation.

title: Some U.S. Resisters Find Canada an Uneasy Haven
description: VANCOUVER, British Co lumbiaIn the cold empty store that is the office of the Committee to Aid American War Objectors, half a dozen youths sat on chairs and stools, their hands thrust in to their pockets or between their thighs for warmth. They were draft dodgers and deserters, a few of the thousands of Americans who have moved to Canada to escape military service, war, social pressures, academic failures, parentseven them selves.

title: CROWELL COLLIER NAMED IN U.S. SUIT
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 4 (AP) The Justice Department filed a civil antitrust suit today to require Crowell Collier & Mac millan, Inc., to divest itself of C. G. Conn, Ltd., and Uniforms by Ostwald. Inc.

title: J. & L. Loses Money At Pittsburgh Works
description: PITTSBURGH, Feb. 4A spokesman for the Jones & Laughlin Steel. Corporation confirmed here today that its Pittsburgh Works, which ac count for nearly a third of the company's total output, lost money last year.

title: U.S.Chinese Talks Reconvene Feb. 20 After Only a Month
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 4 Another meeting between the United States and Communist China has been scheduled in Warsaw for Feb. 20, only one month after the first formal contact between the two gov ernments in over two years.

title: VIOLIN, PIANO DUO HEARD IN A RECITAL
description: Viviane Bertolami, violinist, and Norine Harris, pianist, who have been performing to gether for five years and who have appeared previously in New York, came to the New York Cultural Center last night to play Beethoven's Kreutzer Sonata, Stravinsky's Suite Ita lienne (a chambermusic version of the ballet Pulcinella) and Enesco's Sonata No. 3 in A minor.

title: Accused Police Chief Quits in Cleveland
description: CLEVELAND, Feb. 4  Wil liam P. Ellenburg, Cleveland's chief of police, resigned after 10 days in office today, con tinuing to deny charges that he took money from a Mafia attorney while a member of the Detroit police force.

title: Vietnamization or Negotiation
description: The Vietnam hearings of the Senate Foreign Rela tions Committee are taking place in the wake of an onthespot staff study that emphasizes many previ ously expressed doubts about President Nixon's policy of Vietnamization.

title: RESTRAINTS SEEN ON FIBER IMPORTS
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 4Sec retary of Commerce Maurice H. Stans and his chief textile official both predicted today meaningful restraints on im ports of textiles this yearif not by a voluntary internation al agreement, then by action of the Congress.

title: Hillel Foundation at Penn Approves Draft Sanctuary
description: PHILADELPHIA, Feb. 4The Hillel Foundation at the Uni versity of Pennsylvania has voted to establish a draft sanc tuary in its campus building here beginning tomorrow.

title: NASSER GIVES U.S. WARNING ON ARMS
description: LONDON, Feb. 4President Gamal Abdel Nasser of the United Arab Republic said to night that he was ready to ask the Soviet Union for more arms if the United States supplied more Phantom and Skyhawk jets to Israel.

title: Penn Central Promises Better Commuter Service
description: Governor Rockefeller an nounced yesterday that he had won a series of stopgap com mitments from the Penn Cen tral to alleviate the deplorable conditions on the Hudson and Harlem commuter divisions within weeks or months.

title: Personal Finance
description: At a time when the cost of living runs high, one price that older persons must pay is moving down. The Equitable Life Assurance Society has just announced a 2 to 2 per cent cut in the cost of a life or refund immediate an nuity. This comes at a time when a number of older per sons have been discouraged by the action of their stocks or mutual fund shares.

title: Millionaire to Oppose Kirk
description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla., Feb. 4 Jack Eckerd, the millionaire owner of a chain of 166 drug stores, 15 department stores and other businesses, an nounced today his candidacy for Governor. He will oppose Gov. Claude R. Kirk Jr. in the September primary.

title: Clark Terms Broad Subpoenas To Reporters a Shift in Policy
description: Former Attorney General Ramsey Clark expressed sharp disagreement yesterday with a Justice Department contention that Government subpoenas for reporters' notes, unedited films and other records of the news media represented no departure from past policy.

title: Zero Agrees to Buy Rossmoor Corp.
description: The Zero Manufacturing Company announced yesterday it had reached an agreement in principle to acquire the Rossmoor Corporation and its subsidiaries and affiliates for 2.7million shares of Zero com mon stock valued at about $25 million.

title: Flutist and Harpist Join In Recital Hall Program
description: Edith Kongshoj, flutist, and Lise Nadeau, harpist, who played at Carnegie Recital Hall last night, have plenty of or chestral experience, according to the notes on their program.

title: Alice J. Elstein Plans Nuptials
description: Miss Alice Elstein, a senior at Russell Sage College, plans to be married in June to Joseph Y. Rudnick, a student in his third year at Albany Medical Catem.

title: J. G. Cressaty Marries Susan Rice in Phoenix
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., Feb. 4 Miss Susan Kennedy Rice and Jacques Gael Cressaty were married here this afternoon in the Resurrection Chapel of Trinity Episcopal Cathedral by the Right Rev. Joseph M. Harte, Bishop of Arizona.

title: Cahill's Son Freed in Bail After Philadelphia Hearing
description: PHILADELPHIA, Feb. 4The son of Gov. William T. Cahill of New Jersey was released on $200 bail today, charged with legal possession of marijuana.

title: Thompson's Goal at Buzzer Wins for Pipers, 110109
description: PITTSBURGH, Feb 4 (AP) George Thompson sank a 24 foot jump shot with no time showing on the clock tonight to give the Pittsburgh Pipers a 110109 victory over the Miami Floridians in an American Basketball Association game.

title: Judge Anthony Giuliano Dead; Under Indictment in Newark
description: NEWARK, Feb. 4Municipal Judge Anthony Giuliano, who was under suspension from the bench here following his indict ment last December on charges of income tax evasion, con spiracy and extortion, died early this morning of a heart attack at his home, 364 Rose ville Avenue. He was 72 years old.

title: West German Aide Flies To Poland for Formal Talks
description: WARSAW. Feb. 4 (Reuters)  West German and Polish representatives met for 65 minutes today as a prelude for formal discussions tomorrow aimed at healing acrimony that has existed between the two countries since World War II.

title: Rumania Joins Nuclear Ban
description: LONDON, Feb. 4 (Reuters) Rumania became the 26th country today to deposit her instrument of ratification of the international treaty to prevent the spread of nuclear weapons.

title: MISS HAYDEN DANCES BALLET IMPERIAL
description: It is hard to believe that the New York City Ballet has waited 20 years for Melissa Hayden's local debut in the ballerina role of Ballet Im perial, but that was apparently what took place at the State Theater last night.

title: Opposition to Timber Bill Grows
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 4After a scheduled two hours of de bate tomorrow, the House of Representatives will vote on bill authorizing increased cut ting of timber in the national forests.

title: CARMEN ON L.I.R.R. APPROVE A STRIKE
description: A strike against the Long Island Rail Road has been au thorized by 98 per cent of the members of Lodge 886 of the Brotherhood of Railway Carmen of America in a mail ballot, Anthony F. D'Avanzo, the unit's general chairman, an nounced yesterday.

title: Sylvia D. Dillon Engaged to Wed Aide at I. B. M.
description: ARDSLEY, N. Y., Feb. 4 Mr. and Mrs. Jeremiah V. Dillon have announced the en gagement of their daughter, Miss Sylvia Dudley Dillon, to Robert Holley Jr., son of Mrs. Holley of Cherry Hill, N. J., and the late Mr. Holley.

title: 62 FOR YARAVICH AS L.S.U. TRIUMPHS
description: GAINESVILLE, Fla., Feb. 4 (UPI)Pete Maravich, sinking 53 per cent of his shots, scored 52 points tonight in leading Louisiana State to a 9775 bas ketball rout of Florida.

title: The Shift to Multilateral Aid
description: One bright spot in President Nixon's otherwise dis appointing proposals for foreign aid in his 1971 budget message is the President's plan to shift more foreign assistance to multilateral agencies.

title: Robert Leeds to Wed Kathy Lynn Roskind
description: Edward Roskind, president of NuMaid Hosiery Mills, and Mrs. Roskind of New York and Bal Harbour, Fla., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Kathy Lynn Roskind, to Robert G. Leeds, son of Mr. and Mrs. Lawrence Leeds of New York. The father of the future bride groom is president of Western Pines, Inc., lumber whole salers.

title: Benny Carter, His Sax and Trio Give Lively Concert at Princeton
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Feb. 4 Benny Carter, the alto sax ophonist, band leader and arranger who was a major influence in jazz in the 1930's, made one of his rare appearances last night in the East ?? he settled in Los Angeles 25 years ago.

title: 3YEAROLD DEBUT IS IMPRESSIVE ONE
description: MIAMI, Feb. 4For the first five furlongs of the $32,350 Bahamas Stakes at Hialeah to day, John Rotz felt he had the race won with Silent Screen. But when he turned for home, he said to himself, I'm beat. He was wrong. Silent Screen, without being hit with the whip, ran down George Lewis in the last two strides to win by a head.

title: 5 Rangers Score in 51 Rout of Wings
description: Frightening the wits out of the Red Wings' goalie, and in general barreling past anyone in an enemy uniform, the Rangers continued their domi nance of the Detroit club with a 51 victory last night that could have served as a howto lesson.

title: Theater: La Mama Presents Gloria
Manhattan Edges Fordham In Swimming Meet, 5549
description: Manhattan defeated Fordham in swimming, 5549, at the Rose Hill pool last night.

title: AUXILIARY BISHOPS ARE NAMED HERE
description: The appointment of two priests in the New York Arch diocese as Auxiliary Bishops to Cardinal Cooke was announced yesterday by Archbishop Luigi Raimondi, the apostolic dele gate to the United States.

title: WHITE HOUSE ROLE ON FUND BILL SEEN
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 4The Investment Company Institute decided to stop fighting legisla tion that would force many mu tual funds to reduce their charges to investors only after it was told that the White House would refuse to help kill the bill, it has been learned.

title: Reporter License Urged by Member Of Violence Panel
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 4 (AP) Government licensing of re porters was suggested today by a member of the National Com mission on the Causes and Prevention of Violence.

title: American Motors Reports Loss for the First Quarter
description: DETROIT, Feb. 4  The American Motors Corporation reported today a $15,663,000 loss for its first fiscal quarter, ended Dec. 31. The loss equaled 64 cents a share and was blamed on a fall strike. It con trasted with a profit of $4.54 million, or 24 cents a share, the year before.

title: SelfMade New Yorker Heads Puerto Rican Migration Agency
description: A New Yorker of Puerto Rican parentage who began work as a delivery boy and rose to head a television com mercial business with sales of $23million a year has be come director of a government agency serving the 1.5 million Puerto Ricans on the mainland.

title: FRANCIS C. FRARY, ALCOA SCIENTIST
description: PITTSBURGH, Feb. 4  Dr. Francis Cowles Frary, who founded the research staff of the Aluminum Company of America, died today at the Presbyterian Home for the Aged in Oakmont, a Pittsburgh suburb. He was 85 years old.

title: Squash Racquets
description: METROPOLITAN LEAGUE

title: RAO TO OPPOSE KOCH IN PRIMARY ELECTION
description: Paul P. Rao Jr., a former New York City Tax Commis sioner, announced yesterday that he would challenge Rep resentative Edward I. Koch for renomination as the Demo cratic candidate in the 17th Congressional District.

title: Market Summary
description: Wednesday, Feb. 4, 1970

title: Charter Carriers Protest Cuts In Major Airline Group Fares
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 4  The supplemental, or un scheduled charter, airlines made their last stand today against reduced group fares to Europe on the major scheduled carriers.

title: A Protesting Deputy Is Ejected by Knesset
description: TEL AVIV, Feb. 4In an other stormy episode punc tuating the Israeli debate of who is a Jew, an Opposi tion member of the Knesset, or parliament, was lifted out of his seat today by ushers and carried out of the cham ber in Jerusalem. The eject ed Deputy was Uri Avneri, leader of the tiny Haolam Hazeh party.

title: The Screen: Patton: Salute to Rebel
Insiders' Stockholdings

title: Sir Noel Coward Due Today for a Visit Here
description: Sir Nol Coward, as he has been known since becoming a Knight on Jan. 1, arrives at Kennedy International Airport at 8:45 tonight.

title: Education Bill May Shift Emphasis to Civil Rights
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 4The Senate began work today on the largest Federal education aid measure in Congressional history, a $35billion fouryear package with heavy emphasis on special schooling for slum children.

title: First Lady Dons a Uniform to Take Girl Scout Post
description: Mrs. Richard M. Nixon was installed as honorary presi dent of the Girl Scouts yes terday, following a tradition for First Ladies since Mrs. Woodrow Wilson became honorary president of the organization in 1917.

title: John M. Hopkins Dies at 54; EngineeringLaw Specialist
description: John M. Hopkins, secretary treasurer of the ParsonsJurden Corporation, and a specialist in engineering law, died Monday at the BeekmanDowntown Hos pital. He was 54 years old and lived at 151 Heritage Hill Road in New Canaan. Conn.

title: TAPPAN INCREASES APPLIANCE PRICES
description: The Tappan Company, a large appliance manufacturer, announced yesterday it planned to increase prices on all dealer products by about 3 per cent, effective Feb 16.

title: PRICES ON AMEX FALL AFTER GAIN
description: The twoday advance on the American Stock Exchange end ed abruptly yesterday as the list mostly declined in quiet trading.

title: 90 Discharge Forms Used by Navy Found In a Raid by Police
description: The New York City police and two Federal agencies have joined in a search for the source of a number of blank Navy discharge papers and, drivers' license forms that turned up recently in a raid on an East Side apartment.

title: In Memoriam
description: GOULETHarry. 13th Anniversary. Happy Birthday In Heaven. Always in our hearts.

title: Record Association Elects
description: Jarrell F. McCracken has been elected president of the Record Industry Association of Amer ica. He is the founder of Word Records, Waco, Tex., and the association's 10th president since its organization 18 years ago. Other, officers elected were: Larry Newton, senior vice president and treasurer; Rose Rubin, vice president and assistant treasurer, and Thomas J. Valentino, vice president. Henry Brief was reelected as the association's executive di rector and Ernest S. Myers as its general counsel.

title: PACT SIGNED BY G.E. AND 2 MAJOR UNIONS
description: The General Electric Company and its two biggest electrical unions signed formal agree ments yesterday, ending strikes that began last Oct. 27.

title: NEW BUS STRIKE AVOIDED IN JERSEY
description: A lastminute wage offer to mechanics of the InterCity Transportation Company avert ed a strike against the New Jersey bus company yesterday.

title: PATRIOTS SHUNNING BIDS ON FRANCHISE
description: BOSTON, Feb. 4 (AP)Bill Sullivan, president of the Bos ton Patriots, said today the club generally was discourag ing applications for transfer of the pro football franchise un til all efforts to remain in Bos ton were exhausted.

title: Tug Strike Brings Shift in Terminals For Containerships
description: The economic toll of the tug boat strike here mounted yes terday as the United States Lines, a large containership op erator, found it necessary to shift ship terminalsat extra costas a safety measure.

title: Shaker Heights Police Find Arms in Suspect's Home
description: CLEVELAND, Feb. 4 (AP) Shaker Heights policemen re moved a large box of explo sives, a carbine and several boxes of ammunition tonight from the suburban home of a 21yearold man believed to have bombed the Shaker Heights Municipal Building Monday night, the police chief said.

title: HIGH J. FERRY, 85, OF PACKARD MOTORS
description: DETROIT, Feb. 4 (UPI)Hugh J. Ferry, former president and board chairman of the defunct Packard Motor Company, and civic leader here for many years, died yesterday. He was 85 years old.

title: Music: Boston Symphony
description: WEBERN's Five Pieces for orchestra had been scheduled, but Franco pona toni's Puppenspiel No. 2 instead turned up. Claudio Abbado, guest conductor of the Boston Symphony last night in Philharmonic Hall, made the lastminute substi tution.

title: East Berlin to Get Fiddler This Year
description: During a brief, hurried trip to New York, Walter Felsenstein, Intendant (man aging director) of the Kom ische Oper in East Berlin, has completed arrangements for a production of Fiddler on the Roof in his East Ger man theater this year.

title: SEYMOUR NAMES 2 KEY ASSISTANTS
description: United States Attorney Whitney North Seymour Jr. picked two former members of his predecessor's staff yes terday for the first two ap pointments he has made since taking office last month.

title: ELTRA IS ENTERING REALESTATE FIELD
description: The Eltra Corporation, en gaged in automotive equipment, graphic arts and aeronautical, marine, agricultural, military and food products, is entering the real estate development field through a joint ownership with a private company. Eltra also added last week a 25 per cent interest in a small laser company, ATI, Inc., of Los An geles.

title: HUDSON, HAZZARD SPARK ATLANTANS
description: ATLANTA, Feb. 4  The At lanta Hawks, goaded by Lou Hudson and elusive Walt Haz zard, savored sweet revenge tonight by handing the New York Knickerbockers their worst defeat of the National Basket ball Association season, 11196, before 6,551 delighted fans at Alexander Memorial Coliseum.

title: The Screen:'Start the Revolution Without Me' Bows
description: "START THE REVOLUTION WITHOUT ME," which opened yesterday at the Trans-Lux East, is a comedy of errors about two sets of identical twins, mismatched at birth, who meet 30 years later on the eve of the French Revolution. The characters include people with real names (Marie Antoinette, Louis XVI), and people with funny names (Duke d'Escargot, Count Henri Mancini, Marie Montage) and lovable old Orson Welles, who appears as himself in the role of host-narrator.The film was directed by Bud Yorkin with a cast of British (Donald Sutherland, Hugh Griffith, Billie Whitelaw), American (Gene Wilder) and Swedish (Ewa Aulin) actors, mostly on actual French locations (the Chateau de Rochefort, Notre Dame). Period farce is not the easiest of movie genres under any circumstanstances, and the beautiful settings in "Start the Revolution Without Me" seem to have had an inhibiting effect on everything from comic inspiration to camera movements.I couldn't care less that 20th century automobiles can sometimes be seen in the background of scenes shot outside Notre Dame, but I do care that the mad chases in and around Rochefort seem choreographed largely to avoid breaking objects d'art and denting the architecture.The performances are desperate, without being in any way memorable, thus matching the wit of the screenplay. "Do you know who I am?" asks the imperious Duke De Sisi. "The scrounge of Corsica?" answers the peasant. "That's scourge," says the Duke.

title: Economics, Samuelson, 8th ed.
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass.  For those who must learn eco nomics the easy wayfrom a bookthe switching hour approaches.

title: Common Market Reports Deficit in Trade for 1969
description: STRASBOURG, France, Feb. 4Raymond Barre, vice presi dent of the executive commis sion cit the European Economic Community, said today that the group had a trade deficit of about 8100million in 1969 compared with a surplus of $1.75billion in 1968.

title: SOVIET MUSICIANS PLAY AT CARNEGIE
description: Carnegie Hall wasn't quite an armed camp last night for the program by David Oistrakh, violinist, and Sviatoslav Rich ter, pianist, but it almost looked it.

title: AVON STOCK GIVEN FOR A FOUNDATION
description: A gift of $136million worth of stock in Avon Products, Inc., was given late last year to fund a new private foundation by W. Van Alan Clark, the retired chairman of the company, and his wife.

title: U.S. ENVOY QUESTIONS REDS' BERLIN STAND
description: BERLIN, Feb. 4The United States Ambassador to West Germany, Kenneth Rush, today challenged Communist asser tions that West Berlin was on East German territory or within its borders.

title: TV Review
description: THE LAST OF THE WESTERNERS, adapted from a book by John M. Myers, was a pitifully inept halfhour documentary in comparison with the recent Project 20 review of the paintings of Charles Russell on the passing of the fron tier.

title: Shell Blast Kills Sculptor
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Feb. 4 (UPI)  Mario J. Maida, a 22 yearold sculptor, was killed when an antiaircraft shell ex ploded in his workshop in the HaightAshbury district. The po lice said Mr. Maida had been using the shell, which he as sumed had been unarmed, in metal art work and touched it with a welding torch.

title: Coast House Falls 20 Feet
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Feb. 4 (UPI)One of 20 homes threat ened by earth slippage plunged 20 feet down a hillside today, coming to rest in one piece.

title: Advertisers Display Community Projects
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 4  While the advertising people meeting here were hearing what government was doing or planning to do to them, they took some time out to find out what advertising was doing for local communities.

title: ObsceneMail Curb Gains
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 4 (AP)  The mailing of obscene material to minors, or to adults who normally object to re ceiving it, would bring criminal penalties under a bill approved today by the House postal operations subcommittee.

title: RALLY BY STOCKS RUNS OUT OF FUEL
description: The brief market rally pow* ered by the remarks of David M. Kennedy, Secretary of the Treasury, ran out of fuel yes terday. Leading stockmarket in dicators, after showing token strength in the first hour and a half, staged a mild reversal for the rest of the session.

title: ALLEGHENY POWER INCREASES EARNINGS
description: The Allegheny Power Sys tem, Inc., announced yester day 1969 preliminary net in come of $39.3million, or $1.90 a share. This was 13.6 per cent higher than the year earlier level. Earnings in 1968 were equal to $1.79 a share on net income of $34.6mil lion.

title: NIXON CITES RISE IN LATIN AID FUND
description: CARACAS, Venezuela, Feb. 4 President Nixon sent a mes sage to the InterAmerican Eco nomic Conference here today saying that he had asked Con gress for substantial new funds to help finance LatinAmerican development.

title: Israelis Are Pushing Road Through Tough Terrain From Elath to Sharm el Sheik
description: ELATH, Israel  The road south from this port city, an apparent road to nowhere, has been carrying a lot of traffic these days.

title: Screen: The Undefeated
Nixon's New Liaison
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 4 When William Evan Timmons works long hours and worries a lot, he tends to overeat. At 200 pounds he feels that he is carrying around 20 pounds more than his sixfoot frame should bear, but he is destined for even longer hours and more worrying. Presi dent Nixon named him today to be his assistant for Congressional re lations, a job that will require the chunky, 39 yearold native of Chatta nooga to win votes for such controversial measures as the President's family assist ance plan and phase two of the Administration's anti ballistic missile program.

title: ASHE STRUGGLES TO TOP PAKISTANI
description: PHILADELPHIA, Feb. 4 Arthur Ashe had a desperate fight tonight to avoid elimina tion in the $60,000 Interna tional Tennis Players Associa tion indoor open tournament.

title: PRESIDENT ORDERS HALT IN POLLUTION BY FEDERAL UNITS
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 4Pres ident Nixon issued today an Executive order that he said would eliminate air and water pollution caused by Federal agencies.

title: New York Contest Quickens
description: As the list of candidates seeking the Democratic party's nominations for Governor and United States Senator grows longer, so does the need for state elec toral reform. A dozen or so men prominent in public life have been mentioned by Democratic leaders as good primary prospects. The risk is that present laws, which fail to provide for runoffs, will thwart the will of the voters. In a large field, a distinctly minority candidate could emerge as the victor.

title: DEMOCRATS TO GIVE TV UNION MESSAGE
description: Congressional Democrats will present their own State of the Union Message to the nation Sunday afternoon in a telecast to be carried by the three ma jor networks.

title: 70 Days of Fasting Planned In Capital by Peace Groups
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 4 (AP) Two national peace groups are making plans for 70 days of fasting in Washington to protest the war in Vietnam.

title: THANT'S OBSERVER REPORTS ON NIGERIA

title: Storm Slows Motor, Air, Rail and Foot Travel

description: ALBANY, Feb. 4Governor Rockefeller's new $7.3billion budget drew criticism today from Mayor Lindsay and Nas sau County Executive Eugene H. Nickerson.

title: Political Repression Charged at Southeastern Massachusetts
description: NORTH DARTMOUTH, Mass., Feb. 4 We ask that you reply to these charges within a period of a week, the speak er said after listing a series of sweeping complaints against the president of Southeastern Massachusetts University here. A rally of students and pro fessors cheered wildly.

title: Earnings for '69 Do Not Show $126Million in Railroad WriteOff
description: The Penn Central Company yesterday reported that its consolidated earnings on a pre liminary basis for 1969 dropped to $4,388,000, or 18 cents a share. This contrasted with restated 1968 earnings of $86, 961,000, or $3.77 a share.

title: Observer: The Looneyville Trolley
description: They have a very funny rail road here in New York. It is called the Long Island.

title: IRON MINERS' STRIKE IS ENDED IN SWEDEN

About 4,800 workers at Kiruna, Svappavaara and Malmberget accepted their strike committee's recommen dations and returned to work although they had not won any of their demands for a sub stantial pay raise, lower pen sion age and improvements in working conditions.

title: Political Infighting Among State and City Agencies Complicates Unified Fight on All Types of Pollution
description: No longer can we treat in aividual problems of air, water and land pollution separately, Governor Rockefeller said re cently. We have to recognize that these problems are bound, up togetherand must be at tacked together.The Governor was speaking in support of legislation to create a new State Department of En vironmental Con servation. His plan Is to take the environmental health sections, which handle air, and water pollution, out of the Health Department and merge them with the Conserva tion Department, which is re sponsible for the state's fish, game, forests and other natural resources.

title: Washington: For the Record
STOCK PRICES UP ON LONDON BOARD

The Financial Times index of 30 industrial stocks gained 1.9, to 407.5. The 500stock index closed at 157.73, up 0.96.

title: A Visit to the Beauty Salon, and You Can Be a Moppet

At the House of Revlon, instead of cakefrosting confections, they're promoting a hairdo that looks as though it's been combed with the fingers. Sebou. Revlon's stylist, calls this new creation the Moppet and feels that its casualness is just the right note in this season of fashion schizophrenia.

title: SIX MAJOR MEETS ON WEEKEND CARD
description: Less than 20 years ago, there was only one major indoor track meet on most weekends and runners either ran in that meet or stayed home. Now, there are more meets on some weekends than there used to be in a month.

His Phoenix office said Senator Goldwater admitted himself Sunday when she began to feel the effects of two days hiking in the Grand Canyon.

He said this was the pattern set in recent contracts with the dress industry and said it should prevail in the other agreements his 400,000member union will make with the ap parel trades.

title: 9 Men Sentenced, 4 to Life, In Bombing Plot in Greece
description: ATHENS, Feb. 4A special military tribunal in Salonika today sentenced four Greeks to life imprisonment for planning bomb explosions to protest the militarybacked regime and United States installations in Greece.

description: Between his American con cert debut in 1963 at Carne gie Hall and his oneman show, called simply Charles Aznavour, which began a threeweek run at the Music Box Theater last night, the French singercomposer has grown stronger as a per former.

description: Bernard Cornfeld, who heads a $2.5billion overseas mutual fund complex, charged yester day that the securities indus try in this country has come under a powerful and possibly disastrous attack that could cripple its effectiveness and cause severe damage to the economy in general.

description: On the portable record player near where Joe Fra zier was punching the speed bag, The Temptations were punching, too. The song was I Could Never Love Another (After Loving You) and their music was flowing not only through the Felt Forum, but also flowing through Joe Fra zier's muscles.
