description: FORT BENNING, Ga., Feb. 9 The commanding general of Fort Benning and two of the high officers of this infan try training center denied em phatically today that President Nixon and the Pentagon had in fluenced the decision to bring First Lieut. William L. Caney Jr. to general courtmartial for the alleged massacre at Mylai in South Vietnam.

title: The Arabs Against Themselves
description: The thud of Israeli bombs on the outskirts of Cairo, where the leaders of five frontline Arab nations met over the weekend, underscored the folly of the policy of militant confrontation with Israel that the meeting vaingloriously reaffirmed. By rejecting Presi dent Nixon's plea for a renewed ceasefire, the Arab leaders merely invite further humiliating punishment and make more difficult the prospect of ever regain ing their lost territories.

title: MRS. KALMANOWITZ
description: Mrs. Annie Kalmanowitz, motherinlaw of opera singer Jan Peerce, died Sunday at the Kingsbridge House in the Bronx, of a stroke, after a long illness. She was 85 years old, and lived with her daughter, Alice, and the tenor at 370 Beechmont Drive, New Rochelle, N. Y. She was a native of Minsk, Russia, and was the widow of Jakob Kalmanowitz, a restaurateur.

title: Basketball Polls
description: COACHES' RATINGS

title: Strike by Jersey City Teachers Closes 34 Schools
description: JERSEY CITY, Feb. 9 A teachers' strike in Jersey City led today to the closing of all 34 schools here, while a stale mate continued on the eighth day of a teachers' stoppage in Newark.

title: Nixon Budget Seeks Increases In U.S. Shipbuilding Subsidies
description: The $426million request in President Nixon's budget for the Maritime Administration in the coming fiscal year contains the largest regular appropria tion request for shipbuilding subsidies since World War II.

title: Jewish Leaders Are Asked to Fight Arab Propaganda
description: The president of Hadassah called on American Jewish leaders last night to cooperate in an effort to acquaint Jewish college youth with the perni cious Arab propaganda di rected against Israel and the entire Jewish people.

title: Albany Democrats Give Plans to Fight Addiction
description: ALBANY, Feb. 9The Dem ocratic minority leaders of the Legislature announced today a program to combat drug ad diction, which they described as the 1970 bubonic plague.

title: Assembly Bill Would Cut The Voting Age in 3 Steps
description: ALBANY, Feb. 9A resolu tion that would reduce the vot ing age in the state to 18 in three steps was introduced in the Assembly today with strong Republican backing.

title: Norwegian Protester Gets Year's Jail Term in Soviet
description: LENINGRAD, Feb. 9 (Reu ters)A Norwegian student to day was sentenced to a year in a labor camp for distrib uting leaflets outside a Lenin grad store protesting the de tention of Soviet dissidents.

title: Books of The Times
description: BECAUSE I am unfamiliar with the paintings of Jan CremerAmster damned exProvo and supersalesman of his own sexual prowessI can't report authoritatively on whether this second volume of his autobiographical trilogy is just a waste of the trees it took to publish the thing or, perhaps, the inspired piffle of a genius. If Mr. Cremer is any good on canvas, then the elephantiasis of ego to which his books testify will some day titillate the scholiasts of art: Gee, this must be exactly what he did before (or after) painting that tree full of phalluses or that DayGlo orgasm...

title: Letters to the Editor of The Times
description: Demands on M.T.A.

title: SIERRA CLUB ROLE DISPUTED BY U.S.
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Feb. 9 The Government argued today that the Sierra Club, a 70,000 member conservation organiza tion, had no standing to object to the proposed Walt Disney Resort at Mineral King Valley in the High Sierra.

title: PHILIP SEES CRISIS IN POLLUTION WAR
description: STRASBOURG, France, Feb. Representatives of 24 Euro pean nations met in conference here today in an anxious search for ways to shore up the quality of their environment.

title: Revising Rent Control
description: No city can afford to throw away housing units at a rate of 33,000 annually and survive. That grim truth is set forth by Dr. Frank S. Kristof, perhaps the best informed of all experts on New York City housing, in a study for the Institute of Public Administration.

title: Liza Minnelli Charming Empire Room Audiences
description: Liza Minnelli, glowing with brighteyed youth and vital ity, is working very hard at the Empire Room in the WaldorfAstoria  and she has to.

title: Decision Withheld On De Sapio's Plea For a New Trial
description: The hearing on Carmine G. De Sapio's motion for a new trial on charges that he was part of a conspiracy to bribe former Water Commissioner James L. Marcus continued yes terday, without reaching a con clusion.

title: Screen: Antonioni's Zabriskie Point
Landlord Is Ordered To Rent Apartment To Negro He Barred
description: WHITE PLAINS, Feb. 9The Appellate Division has ordered a Yonkers landlord to void the current waiting list and to re port all vacancies in a building where a Negro prospective ten ant was denied an apartment more than two years ago.

title: Weather Hot Line Is Sign of 70's
description: WASHINGTON  On the third floor of a bleak, factory like building in Suitland, Md., in a room cluttered with re cording devices and facsimile machines, sits a table with two red telephones.

title: PRESIDENT RECEIVES OILIMPORT REPORT
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 9 (AP) President Nixon received to day a report from a task force on oil imports, which is report ed to include a proposal to sub stitute tariffs for quotas on oil imports.

title: Observer: Glimpses Into the First Executive Mind
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 9The stories that President Nixon be came interested in new uni forms for the White House Po lice only after his recent Euro pean trip are pure nonsense, inspired no doubt by the Dem ocratic National Committee.

title: Bridge:
description: CANBERRA, AustraliaThe touring American team comprising Robert Jordan, Arthur Robinson, Bill Root, Dorothy Hayden and this writer had to fight hard for victory in a match in Aus tralia's capital city last week. The team built up an early lead but the local team played with great steadiness and the final margin of vic tory in a watch of 32 deals was 14 international match points.

title: Neurotic L.I.R.R. Rider Files Claim for $50,373
description: MINEOLA, L. Feb. 9A Freeport advertising represent ative filed a notice of claim today against the Metropolitan Transportation Authority and the Long Island Rail Road, seeking $50,000 for bringing on commuter neurosis and $373.15 for breach of contract.

title: Bus Smoker Ban Asked
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 9 (UPI) Following up his campaign to end smoking on airliners, Ralph Nader, the consumer crusader, asked the Interstate Commerce Commission today to ban smoking on interstate buses. The Federal Aviation Administration has not acted on Mr. Nader's petition to ban smoking on airliners.

title: Libya to Administer Property Of Jews Who Left Since '67
description: TRIPOLI, Libya, Feb. 9 (UPI) The Libyan Government has empowered a public custodian to administer the funds and properties of Jews who left the country to live abroad in definitely, it was announced today.

title: RIBICOFF ATTACKS SCHOOLS IN NORTH; SUPPORTS STENNIS
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 9  Senator Abraham A. Ribicofi called on his fellow Northern liberals today to drop their monumental hypocrisy on the segregation issue and concede that their school systems were just as unbalanced racially as those in the South.

title: U.S. Sees No Challenge From Hanoi To a Continuing Withdrawal of Troops
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 9  The leading officials of the Nixon Administration are con fident that the military situa tion in South Vietnam is now good enough to permit the un interrupted withdrawal of most United States ground combat forces over the next 18 months.

title: VINCENT J. DOYLE, A POLICE CAPTAIN
description: BAYONNE, N. J., Feb. 9 Retired Capt. Vincent J. Doyle of the Bayonne Police Depart ment, who was instrumental in setting up the first twoway police radio system in the coun try in 1933 in this city, died Saturday at his home here.

title: Drug Education Urged
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 9 (AP)  A Harvard medical school! professor recomemended today that drug education he made a part of regular classroom in struction for young people. The professor, Dr. David C. Lewis, made his suggestion in a speech to a convention of the National Association of Secondary School Principals.

title: Weather Bureau Now Gives FiveDay Forecasts Daily
description: The Weather Bureau has an nounced that it is now issuing daily forecasts covering re gional weather conditions for fiveday periods. Such ex tended forecasts previously were issued only three times a week.

title: 400,000 Dimes Spilled On Bay State Turnpike
description: AUBURN, Mass., Feb. 9 (AP)About 25 maintenance men from the Massachusetts Turnpike Authority used large vacuum cleaners and mud suckers today to clean up $40,000 in dimes that spilled onto threequarters of a mile of the Massachusetts Turnpike.

title: Irate Subway Rider Bills City; Beame Pays Full 66c Himself
description: An irate woman subway rider recently filed with Con troller Abraham D. Beame a 66cent invoice for extra ex penses incurred because of a disruption in subway service. Her terms: Net cash at once.

title: Devoted Wife, as Ever, at 85
description: INDEPENDENCE, Mo. (UPI) Bess Wallace Truman will mark her 85th birthday Friday, devoting most of that day, like all others, to her husband.

title: LEVY IS APPOINTED CITY'S TAX CHIEF
description: Mayor Lindsay announced yesterday the appointment of Norman A. Levy to succeed Benjamin G. Browdy as presi dent of the City Tax Commis sion, effective March 1.

title: LAOTIANS TO FIGHT DELAYING ACTION
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 9The United States and the Govern ment of Laos have agreed that Laotian forces in the Plaine des Jarres will not try to hold the plain against attacking North Vietnamese and Pathet Lao forces but will fight a delaying action and fall back in an or derly fashion.

title: DAVID W. TRIMBLE
description: WESTFIELD, N. J., Feb. 9 David W. Trimble, sales direc tor of the Harvard Printing Company, East Orange, and husband of Mrs. Mrs. Gail W. Trimble, editor of The West field Leader, died yesterday at his home. He was 47 years old and lived at 201 Dickson Drive.

title: 3d Rosenkavalier, With 3 Newcomers, Sparkles at the Met
description: Richard Strauss's Der Rosen kavalier had its third perform ance of the season at the Metropolitan Opera last night and it went even better than it had before.

title: Tate Trial Is Due March 30; Manson Loses Dismissal Bid
description: LOS ANGELES, Feb. 9 (AP) Charles M. Manson's trial in the killings of actress Sharon Tate and six other persons was set today for March 30. The same trial date was set for two female codefendants.

title: Barbara P. Nevling Prospective Bride
description: Miss Barbara Patterson Nevling, a graduate student at the University of Pennsyl vania, plans to be married in June to Michael Howard Por ter, a doctoral candidate at Cornell who teaches at Rut gers.

title: POLLUTION LAID TO 11 COMPANIES
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 9The Justice Department charged 11 companies today with polluting waterways in the Chicago area.

title: Marion Dean, Headmistress At Barnard Girls' School
description: Marion A. Dean, headmis tress and trustee of the Bar nard School for Girls, died Sun. day of a heart attack at hei home, 116 Pinehurst Avenue Her age was 73.

title: H. WENDEL BURCH OF U.P.I. IS DEAD
description: H. Wendel Burch, director of international services for United Press International since 1959, died yesterday in New York Hospital after a long ill ness. He was 61 years old and lived at 11116 75th Avenue, Forest Hills, Queens.

title: A.A. U. Increases Allowances in Effort to Avert Boycott of Its Garden Meet
description: OCHO RIOS JamaicaAus ten J. Thomas, a native Jamaican who lives at Green glades, Stony Hill, outside Kingston, has been a sport fisherman all his life, but in recent years his energies have been devoted to increasing the harvest of food fish in under developed countries.

title: Broadway Director Filming in Spain
description: ALMERIA, SpainEdwin Sherin, who staged the Broadway hit The Great White Hope, is getting his first taste here of directing a film. Valdez Is Coming.

title: Ferguson Is Hospitalized
description: MINNEAPOLIS, Feb. 9 (AP) John Ferguson of the Mon treal Canadiens was in satisfac tory condition in a Minneapolis hospital, today with a possible cheekbone fracture. Ferguson was injured in a game with the North Stars Saturday night.

title: Legend of the Graf Spee Serves as a Focus for Rightist Activity in Argentina
description: BUENOS AIRES, Feb. 9 Nearly every day, fresh red and white flowers are heaped up before a swastika at the German Cemetery in Buenos Aires.

title: Roberts Co. Links Reorganization Bid To Export Orders
description: Difficulty in effecting collec tions on export orders has forced a leading manufacturer of textile machinery to seek reorganization under Chapter X of the Bankruptcy Act.

title: Second Conviction Appealed
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 9 (UPI) Former Representative Thom as F. Johnson, Democrat of Maryland, appealed his second conviction for conflict of inter est to the Supreme Court to day. The Court reversed his first conviction because the evidence included a speech he made in the House. In his appeal, Mr. Johnson contended that the second indictment was invalid because the grand jury heard evidence about his Con gressional speech.

title: JUDGE DENIES A STAY IN SCHOOL ELECTIONS
description: A Federal judge in Brooklyn denied yesterday an applica tion for a temporary injunction against New York City's local school board elections sched uled for March 19.

title: Text of Communique by Arab Leaders
description: CAIRO, Feb. 9 (Reuters) Following is an unofficial translation of the text of the communiqu issued after the conference of Arab confron tation countries:

title: BOOKSELLERS GIVING NIXON 250 VOLUMES
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 9Pres ident Nixon will get 250 new books for the permanent White House home library tomorrow, a gift from the American Book sellers Association.

title: STUYVESANT TOWN UPHELD ON RENTS
description: The city lost its suit yester day to rescind an average 10 per cent rent increase that went into effect Oct. 1 for 7,716 tenants of Stuyvesant Town.

title: OneWeapon Economics
description: Though the unemployment figures are somewhat unreliable on a monthtomonth basis, it now seems clear that President Nixon's prescribed slowing pains are starting to affect the labor market. The season ably adjusted unemployment rate climbed from 3.4 per cent in November and December to 3.9 per cent in January and will probably go higher.

title: Sports of The Times
description: TO an ailing Frank Leahy in a Chicago hospital it had to be a more revivify ing than a transfusion. The onetime football coaching marvel at Notre Dame had just been notified that he had been elected to the collegiate Hall of Fame. No one ever doubted that he rated the distinc tion. The mystery has always been why it took so long.

title: Computer Language Course
description: DETROIT, Feb. 9 (UPI)Oak land University announced to day that, beginning with the 1970 winter term, students who want to learn a computer's technical language can substi tute that for the traditional foreign language requirements.

title: Bill Introduced in Albany To Protect News Sources
description: ALBANY, Feb. 9 (UPI) Legislation to protect reporters from being cited for contempt if they refuse to reveal sources of information was introduced in the Legislature today.

title: Tested Carpeting Called Hazard in Fire Fatal to 21
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 9Car peting that meets a pending Federal standard under the Flammable Fabrics Act was singled out at a Senate hear ing today as a major hazard in a nursing home fire in which 21 elderly patients died.

title: Boston ExMayor's Will
description: BOSTON, Feb. 9 (AP)The onepage will of former Mayor John B. Hynes, leaving a pro bate estate totaling $3,000, was filed today with the Suffolk County Registrar of Probate, Louis F. Mausco. The will, signed in August, 1943, left the estate to his wife, Mrs. Marion H. Hynes. Mr. Hynes died last Jan. 6.

title: SOUTHERN CROSS II TAKES YACHT RACE
description: PALM BEACH, Fla., Feb. 9 (UPI)  Norman Booth, sailing Southern Cross II, used his knowledge of local conditions today to win the Craven Filter invitation race for 5.5Meter yachts off Palm Beach.

title: Philip Morris Shifts Personna to Burnett
description: Philip Morris, U.S.A., is moving its Personna Ultra Chrome doubleedge and in jectorrazor blades out of Wells, Rich, Greene and into Leo Burnett, Chicago. Billing figures were not available, obtainable or disclosed.

title: Jersey Court Bars Congress Prayers As School Reading
description: MORRISTOWN, N. J., Feb. 9 Superior Court Judge Joseph H. Stamler ordered the Netcong school board today to cease immediately the daily class room reading of prayers from The Congressional Record.

title: STEEL PRODUCTION RISES 0.6% IN WEEK
description: Steel production last week edged 0.6 per cent above output the week before, the American Iron and Steel Institute reported yesterday.

title: Dr. Arthur H. Steinhaus, Writer On Exercise and Health, Is Dead
description: EAST LANSING, Mich., Feb. 9  Dr. Arthur H. Steinhaus, author and visiting professor of physiology at the University of Michigan since 1966, died yesterday. He was 72 years old.

title: Democratic Council Asks Pullout Within 18 Months
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 9The Democratic Policy Council, the party's official voice on policy matters, called today for a firm and unequivocal commitment to withdraw all American military forces from Vietnam on a definite time table.

title: $480,000 Stolen in London
description: LONDON, Feb. 9 (UPI) Masked men armed with shot guns burst through the side door of a bank in northeast London today and made off with more than 200,000 ($480,000) in cash.

title: Trudeau Cites Need for Real Sacrifices
description: OTTAWA, Feb. 9A two day national conference to persuade Canadian business leaders to restrain price rises this year, even if it means lower profits, opened today with an appeal for sacrifice by Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau.

title: REV. C. B. DONOHUE
description: MEDFORD, L. I., Feb. 9 The Rev. Christopher B. Dono hue, pastor of. St. Sylvester Roman Catholic Church since 1963, died yesterday of a heart attack in the rectory. He was 61 years old.

title: Southland Royalty Fights Offer by Mesa Petroleum
description: The Southland Royalty Com pany, which is fighting a tender offer by the Mesa Petroleum Company, filed suit in Federal Court yesterday asking that Mesa be blocked in its take over attempt. In the suit South land Royalty, based in Fort Worth, charged that Mesa had illegally conditioned the market for its tender offer and then made misleading statements comparing the earnings of the two companies.

title: SITARIST ATTRACTS RAGA ENTHUSIASTS
description: The rage for raga, which spread through the Western musical community a few years ago with the help of the corn biried influences of Ravi Shank ar, Yehudi Menuhin and the Beatles, has receded somewhat, leaving Eighth Avenue pawn shops well stocked with sitars that young musicians hurried out to buy and try to learn to play in an easy lesson or two. But, if the fad is faded, Indian music still exerts strong ap peal here, as last night's well attended program at Alice Tully Hall showed.

title: George Burger, 101, Dies
description: POINT PLEASANT, N.J., Feb. 9George J. Burger, believed to be the oldest retired police man in the nation, died at Point Pleasant Hospital yesterday at the age of 101. He joined the Newark Police Department in 1895 and retired in 1920 at the age of 52. In recent years Mr. Burger lived with a daughter in Toms River. He is survived by 2 daughters, a son, 9 grand children and 20 greatgrand children.

title: Accord in Canadian Strike
description: VANCOUVER, British Colum bia, Feb. 9(Canadian Press) Union negotiators and em today signed a fourth contract aimed at settling a strike by 3,200 longshoremen that has closed six British Co lumbia ports. Terms of the pro posed agreement were not dis closed. It is expected to be sub mitted, to members of the Inter national Longshoremen's Union for ratification within three days. The members rejected three previous contracts.

title: City's High School Newspapers Face Extinction as Funds Drop
description: New York City's 91 high school student newspapers are in serious financial trouble and some of their faculty advisers predict that within a year many will be out of business unless outside assistance is forthcom ins.

title: The Concerns of Elie Wiesel: Today and Yesterday
description: I think our generation is privileged and cursed, said Elle Wiesel, the author. We are privileged to be a wit nessto be able to say I was there, I saw it; I was at Sinai; I was in Jerusalem when it was liberated.

title: Lindsay Urges Town Officials To Seek More Aid From State
description: Mayor Lindsay called on town governments yesterday to join the big cities in formu lating new statewide strate gies for broadening state and local aid.

title: Appeal to Robber Succeeds
description: HAMMOND, Ind. (UPI)  A Western Union telegraph clerk told a wouldbe robber that she would lose her job if he took money from her cash box. Be nice, she said. Don't rob me. I won't, the man said, and walked from the office.

title: JERSEY SALES TAX WILL RISE TO 5%, STARTING MARCH 1
description: TRENTON, Feb. 9Gov. Wil liam T. Cahill signed tonight a measure increasing New Jersey's state sales, tax from 3 to 5 per cent. He gave his approval shortly after final action on the legislation by the Senate.

title: Fortune Magazine Fights Subpoena of Data for an Antitrust Suit
description: Another Justice Department subpoena for confidential jour nalistic files became known yesterday. In this, the Antitrust Division has sought materials dealing with a Fortune maga zine interview with James J. Ling, head of a conglomerate whose sales exceed $3billion a year.

title: NIXON NOMINATES ENVOY TO MOROCCO
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 9 (Reu ters)President Nixon today nominated Stuart W. Rockwell, a career diplomat, to be the new United States Ambassador to Morocco.

title: 5 ARAB COUNTRIES VOW TO FIGHT ON; U.S. WARNED ON OIL
description: CAIRO, Feb. 9 The five Arab confrontation countries vowed today to fight on for the recovery of lands captured by Israel, thus implicitly rejecting endeavors by major powers to restore the 1967 ceasefire be tween the United Arab Republic and Israel.

title: Western Union Gains
description: The Western Union Corpora tion and its subsidiaries re ported yesterday gains in operating revenues and net in come for 1969.

title: ISRAELIS IN PROTEST ON NATIONALITY BILL
description: JERUSALEM, Feb. 9Thou sands demonstrated noisily and a handful violently at the Knesset today while the Israeli legislature debated a bill de fining who is a Jew.

title: El Cordobes Quits Hospital
description: BOGOTA, Colombia, Feb. (UPI)The Spanish bullfighter Manuel Benitez, known as El Cordobes, who was gored in the jaw and throat last Satur day, left Marl Clinic today against the advice of his physi cians. El Cordobes said he wanted to convalesce at his hotel.

title: SANTANA, SMITH GAIN TENNIS LEAD
description: HAWTHORNE, N. J., Feb. The four topranked tennis players in the United States and four foreign stars, each the champion of his country, began a twoday roundrobin tourna ment tonight at the Hawthorne Center of National Indoor Ten nis for $7.500 in prize money.

title: PRIMA DONNA TOPS IN WORKING CLASS
description: There was a pleasant sort of competition at the 94th West minster Kennel Club dog show in Madison Square Garden last night when a new wire fox terrier, Holmwire Tudor Reli ant, arrived unheralded from Denver to become the first to qualify for best in show.

title: LANDLORDS SEEK A 25% RENT RISE
description: Four major landlord organ izations offered a plan yester day to replace the city's 27 yearold rentcontrol law with a measure that would allow substantial rent increases in the 1.3 million controlled apart ments here, but would force owners to put some of the added revenue into building improvements.

title: TANKER GROUNDED OFF WARDS ISLAND
description: A 664foot oil tanker ran aground on a small island in the East River last night while negotiating the tricky currents of the Hell Gate.

title: DR. LOUIS M. CANTOR
description: Dr. Louis M. Cantor of New Haven, president of the Con necticut State Dental Commis sion and Board of Examiners from 1945 to 1950, and former president of the New Haven Dental Society, died last Wednesday in Miami Beach. He was 75 years old.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: Excerpts From Ribicoff Rights Speech
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 9 (UPI)  Following are ex cerpts from a speech today by Senator Abraham A. Ribi coff, Democrat of Connecti cut.

title: Market Place:
description: IT'S just a voice in the I wilderness, but at least one investor was so unhappy about the move to shortcir cuit First National City Bank's program to serve sub stantial investors that he called this newspaper.

title: Britons Impressed With Garden, Comparing Show With Crufes
description: The most enthusiastic group at the opening day of the Westminster dog show yesterday was a delegation of 93 Britons almost all of whom had shown at Cruft's on Friday or Saturday.

title: AGNEW'S UNKIND CUT COSTS SANDERS $200
description: LINCOLN, Neb., Feb. 9 (AP) Vice President Spiro Agnew believes the $200 Doug Sanders won in the Bob Hope Desert golf classic will just pay San ders's doctor bill.

title: YANKEES INCREASE MICHAEL'S SALARY
description: Gene Michael and Stan Bahn sen were added yesterday to the list of New York Yankees who have signed their 1970 contracts. The most strik ing feature of this development was the fat raise Michael earned by becoming the regu lar shortstop late last May.

title: The Proceedings in the U.N. Today
Point Reyes, the Big Moment
description: The House of Representatives has a chance today to do more for the improvement of the American environment than deplore its deterioration. By passing H.R. 3786, favorably reported out by its Committee on the Interior, the House can make certain that Point Reyes National Seashore, north of San Francisco, becomes a reality. At the moment that potentially rich and rewarding project is a patchwork of acquired acreage threatened by the everpresent possibility that the remaining land required for the park will be sold to commercial interests.

title: STOCKS ON AMEX EDGE AHEAD A BIT
description: Most issues on the American Stock Exchange managed to finish in the plus column yester day although selling pressure in the last hour of trading re duced earlier gains.

title: Clay Backs Old Mate, Picks Ellis in 8
description: The voice wasn't as enthusiastic as it once was, but it sounded as positive as ever.

title: ROGERS EXPRESSES CONCERN ON LIBYA
description: TUNIS, Feb. 9Secretary of State William P. Rogers and Moroccan officials expressed mutual concern today over re ports that Egyptian influence was growing In the new mili tary Government of Libya, in formed sources said.

title: DeCavalcante Changes Lawyer, Gains a Delay in Start of Trial
description: NEWARK, Feb. 9Simone Rizzo (Sam the Plumber) De Cavalcante, reputed boss of Mafia family, has engaged new lawyer for his extortion trial.

title: Cemetery Workers Endure 4Week Strike Calmly
description: The city's cemetery workers are finding that the hardships of a fourweek old strike have not changed their style of life to any great extent.

title: Harvard and Builder Sign Pact For Minority Hiring Minimum
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Feb.  Harvard University an nounced today that it had signed what it believes to be the first construction contract in the United States that obli gates a builder to hire a speci fic minimum number of minor ity workers.

title: Psychedelic Subways?
description: Art for subway's sake has appeared on the walls of the Lexington Avenue's 68th Street stop. The pretty orange leaves and flowers, footprints walking on the ceilings and rhythmic daubs and exclamation points on the beams were painted by students celebrating Hunter College's centennial. They were not a show of appreciation for the Metropolitan Transportation Authority's artistry in extracting another dime from the straphangers.

title: Javits Says Civil Rights Are Imperiled by 2 Bills
description: The high responsibility of bench and bar, Senator Jacob K. Javits said last night In speech at The Association of the Bar of the City of New York, is to hold fast to the Bill of Rights when the strong winds of public opinion may cause even the Congress to sway.

title: New Fever Virus So Deadly That Research Halts
description: American doctors have dis covered a virus so virulent that they have stopped their research into its mysteries.

title: Free Boating Course
description: The North River Power Squadron will offer a 10to12 week course in piloting at the Downtown Athletic Club, 19 West Street, starting today at 6:30 P.M. Admission is free.

title: Most States, Fearing Resentment of Voters, Are Holding Line on Tax Rises
description: Fears of voter resentment in the wake of a record number of state tax increases last year are causing most state govern ments to hold the line this year on new levies.

title: STOCKS IN LONDON SHOW AN ADVANCE
L.I.R.R. to Test New Cars for 1,000 Miles Before Buying Them
description: The state agency that op erates the Long Island Rail Road has adopted new procedures for testing new commuter cars, which have been plagued by mechanical problems since they were introduced on the line a little over a year ago.

title: ACQUISITION SET BY WHITE MOTOR
description: The White Motor Corporation announced yesterday it had agreed to buy the assets of Alco Engine, Inc., and Alco Products Service, Inc., from Studebaker  Worthington, Inc., for stock valued at more than $15million.

title: CAIRO AIDE AT U.N. DOUBTS U.S. JET SALE
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Feb. 9The Egyptian delegate, Mo hammed Hassan elZayyat, to day declared that he could not bring himself to believe that the United States would decide to sell a large number of jet fighterbombers and fighters to Israel.

title: Bond Rate Drops For Utility Issue; Buying Is Sluggish
description: Interest rates yesterday took another goodsized step downhill, away from the peaks they reached in Decem ber and January.

title: WHEAT FUTURES CLIMB IN CHICAGO
description: Wheat futures rose sharply on the Chicago Board of Trade yesterday and Influenced firm er prices for other grains in the closing minutes of the res sion.

title: In The Nation: Fearsome Foursome
description: Vice President Agnew, Gov. Ronald Reagan, Mayor Sam Yorty and S. I. Hayakawa share a striking trait. Heard one on top of anotherall four in three days, during a recent California excursion  each demonstrated the kind of simple plausibility that in these baf fling days Americans seem most to desire from their poli ticians.

title: Shaving Tied to Electricity
description: BANGALORE, India (AP) Male residents of Tumarikop in Mysore State have vowed to let their beards grow until the Government brings electricity to their vilage.

title: Hijack Suspect Surrenders
description: MADRID, Feb. 9 (AP)A man who identified himself as Lawrence Malhou Rhodes gave himself up to United States mil itary authorities in Spain today as the hijacker of a DC8 air liner forced to land in Havana on a ChicagoMiami flight nearly two years ago. United States Embassy officials in Ma drid confirmed that Mr. Rhodes, who said he was an American, told officials he hijacked a Delta Airlines plane, with 102 pas sengers aboard, on Feb. 21, 1968.

title: FRANK TAYLOR OUT AS M'GRAW EDITOR
description: Frank E. Taylor, for five years the editor in chief and general manager of the trade book division of the McGraw Hill Book Company, is leaving to open his own publishing company.

title: White Plains Judge Is Woman On Spot
description: When Anna Katherine Nicholas of White Plains, wearing an iceblue, knee length, beaded evening gown, dramatically pointed to the best in show last night, it was only the third time in the 94 years of West minster that a woman ever had judged the final.

title: SENATOR QUESTIONS INSURANCE LOBBYING
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 10  Tactics employed by some lead ers of the insurance industry in fighting regulatory legislation that Congress is considering were questioned and defended today at a Senate hearing.

title: Dorothea Sironen Planning Nuptials
description: JERICHO, L. I., Feb. 10 Mr. and Mrs. Frank V. Siro nen of Jericho and Biaooklyn have announced the engage ment of their daughter, Miss Dorothea May Sironen, to Al berto Valenti, son of Mr. and Mrs. Matteo Valenti of Tra pani. Italy.

title: RACIAL GAME LAID TO SCHOOL BOARDS
description: A conference on collective bargaining in education was told yesterday that sonic of the nation's school boards played a very vicious game of racial polarization to weak en teachers' unions.

title: ERVIN BLOCKS VOTE ON BUSING MEASURE
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 10 Senator Sam J. Ervin, Demo crat of North Carolina, staged a miniature filibuster in the Senate and successfully pre vented a vote today on an anti busing amendment to the aid toeducation bill that is being debated.

title: Nixon Pins Star on Doctor
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 10 (AP) President Nixon pinned the star of a brigadier general on the uniform of his White House physician, Dr. Walter R. Tkach, in a private White House cere mony yesterdaythe doctor's 53d birthday. General Tkach is an Air Force officer from Mo nongahela, Pa.

title: PAKISTANI TROOPS REPORTED SERVING WITH JORDANIANS
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Feb. 10 Pakistan has quietly moved an infantry regiment into Jordan, high officials close to King Hus sein's palace in Amman said today.

title: BorgWarner's York Unit To Raise Prices About 5%
description: The York division of the BorgWarner Corporation said yesterday it would increase prices by about 5 per cent on airconditioning and refrigera tion products and on machin ery used to make such prod ucts.

title: Saigon Frees 176 P.O.W.'s
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Feb. 10 (AP)The Government re leased 176 prisoners of war to mark the Lunar New Year, the Government press agency, Viet nam Press, said today. It said 93 prisoners had been freed at the provincial prison in Hue and 83 in Tamky.

title: Player Vote on Starting Line alp Makes Coast Coach a Success
description: BERKELEY, Calif., Feb. 10 Picture the New York Jets holding an election to deter mine their starting line  up.

title: Mrs. Louise C. Timpson Dead; Former Duchess of Argyll, 65
description: Mrs. Louise Clews Timpson, the former Duchess of Argyll, died yesterday in her sleep at home in Rhinebeck, N. Y. She was 65 years old.

title: Foreign Affairs: Just a Spiffy New Tailor
description: ROMEThe crucial question in Italy's latest political crisis the 31st since World War II is whether the Communists can be excluded from government by another centerleft coalition or whether extreme left fac tions among the Christian Dem ocrats and Socialists would pre fer to make a deal letting the Communists in.

title: PENTAGON PLANNING IS SCORED AS COSTLY
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 10 (AP) The General Accounting Of fice charged today in a report to Congress that the Pentagon had often gone ahead with new weapons development without reasonable expectation of suc cess.

title: Miss Elizabeth McKey Affianced
description: WINTER GARDEN, Fla., Feb. 10Announcement has been made by Mr. and Mrs. James Fulmer McKey of the engagement of their daugh ter, Miss Elizabeth Clare McKey, to James Nicholas Casesa, son of Dr. and Mrs. Philip R. Casesa of Brooklyn and Breezy Point, Queens, New York. A June wedding is planned.

title: Radio
Business Leaders Of Canada Accept Pricing Restraint
description: OTTAWA, Feb. 10  A na ticinal conference of Canadian business leaders adopted today an unprecedented but highly qualified statement on price re straint.

title: Protest on Heatless Homes in Bronx Sent to Mayor
description: More than 200 teachers, ad ministrators and teachers aides at Public Schools 20 and 150 on Fox Street in the Hunts Point section of the Bronx asked Mayor Lindsay yester day to declare the neighbor hood a disaster area.

title: Bridge:
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Feb. 11 The American tour of Australia began eight days ago with a social game in Brisbane. Robert Jordan and Arthur Robinson of Philadel phia were in fine form, win ning a section of a team event in spite of a 19month rest from the game and the fact that all the visitors had had 27 hours on a plane from New York.

title: Letters to the Editor of The Times
description: Quality in Education

title: SANTANA DOWNS SMITH IN JERSEY
description: HAWTHORNE, N. J., Feb. 10 With everything to his liking the slow surface, the fast scoring and the $2,500 first prize  Manuel Santana of Spain defeated Stan Smith of Pasadena, Calif., 65, 62, to night in the final of the Schae ferJaycee Classic at the Haw thorne National Indoor Tennis Center.

title: Penn Central Acts to Aid Commuter
description: The designation of Edward P. Frasher as general man ager for commuter services was announced yesterday by the Penn Central Company. He will have jurisdiction over the company's three com muter linesthe New Haven and the Hudson and Harlem divisions.

title: BIG BOARD WEIGHS SPECIAIST SHIFTS
description: The New York Stock Ex change has under consideration rule changes that, in effect, would facilitate the absorption of its specialist units by large investment houses.

title: Grenades Miss Dayan Son In Arab Attack in Munich
description: BONN, Feb. 10Three Arabs armed with grenades, in an ap parent attempt on the life of the son of Defense Minister Moshe Dayan of Israel, killed an Israeli airline passenger and wounded 23 persons in attacks yesterday on a bus and a lounge at the Munich airport.

title: Philip to Tour Space Base
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., Feb. 10 (UPI)Prince Philip of Brit ain will tour the space center here Saturday and inspect the Apollo 13 rocket being pre pared for launching to the moon in two months.

title: Jerusalem: The MiddleEast Underground War
description: JERUSALEM, Feb. 10The military history of the last 25 years seems to suggest that even small nations, welltrained in the black arts and dirty tricks of subversive or guerrilla warfare, can challenge and even defeat large nations if they have willpower, fire power and geography on their side.

title: ELEANOR LE MAIRE, A DECORATOR, DIES
description: Eleanor H. Le Maire, a na tionally known businessinterim designer, died of cancer Mon day at her East Side apart ment. Her age was 72.

title: 3 Pedestrians Killed on East Side When Auto Goes Out of Control
description: Two women and a man who were walking on the sidewalk at 59th Street and Third Ave nue were killed yesterday by a limousine that jumped the curb and plowed into the window of a restaurant.

title: CITY INSPECTORS SCORED BY AUDIT
description: ALBANY, Feb. 10  New York City housing code inspec tors are caught in a bureau cratic tangle that cuts work ing time in half and creates a serious lag in inspection of boilers, plumbing and eleva tors, according to state audi tors.

title: EQUATION WINNER OF FLORIDA RACE
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., Feb. 10John Potter's 57foot cutter, Equation, proved more than equal to such famed sail ing yachts as Windward Pas sage and Ondine today by emerging as the overall winner of the 370mile St. Petersburg to Fort Lauderdale race.

title: Imported Death
description: The discovery of the virus of Lassa Fever, which killed three of the first five Americans infected by it, is a sobering event. It is a reminder that even today's advanced medical science does not know all the viru lent organisms nature has in its biological warfare arsenal. The list of such organisms can never be com plete, if only because viruses are constantly mutating, and a mutant virus can pose dangers its parent stock did not. The happy note in the Lassa Fever story is that, once there was an individual who had recovered from that ailment, her blood could be and was used to provide antibodies that saved a subsequent victim. that, once there was an individual who had recovered from that ailment, her blood could be and was used to provide antibodies that saved a subsequent victim.

title: NO DECISION MADE ON SEATTLE CLUB
description: CHICAGO, Feb. 10 (AP) American League club owners met this afternoon and tonight without decision on the trou bled Seattle franchise, then ad journed their meeting until 10:30 A.M. tomorrow (New York time).

title: Democratic Council Asks Rejection of Carswell
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 10  The Democratic Policy Council urged the Senate today to re ject the nomination of G. Har rold Carswell to the Supreme Court and opposed expansion of the Safeguard antiballistic missile system.

title: Article 1  No Title
New Bank in Austria Set To Back EastWest Trade
description: Vienna, Feb. 10 (Reuters) Banking spokesmen said a new East  West trade  financing bank, Aussenhandelsbank, would start operations next month with a share capital of 75 million schillings (2.925mil lion).

title: Market Place:
description: YOUR name is Cincinnati Milling Company and you are beginning to diver sify out of this rather prosaic but profitable business. How do you dramatize the fact?

title: Alison Taylor, Robert Fastov Plan to Marry
description: DALLAS, Feb. 10Mrs. Baker Taylor has announced the engagement of her daughter, Miss Alison Blair Taylor, to Robert S. Fastov, son of Mr. and Mrs. Charles Fastov of Rockville Centre, L. I.

title: Text of the President's Message to Congress Proposing Action Against Pollution
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 10Following is the text of the message on the environment that President Nixon sent to Congress today:

title: CELANESE BUYS A SWEDISH UNIT
description: The Celanese Corporation an nounced yesterday that its Netherlands subsidiary, Cel Euro, N.V., had bought all the common stock of the Columbia Cellulose Company, Ltd., owned by Svenska Cellulos Aktie bolaget of Stockholm in a transaction valued at more than $20million.

title: SENATE IN ALBANY VOTES STATE SHIFT ON PAROCHIAL AID
description: ALBANY, Feb. 10  The Senate, by an overwhelming majority, took a first step today toward repealing the strict language of the State Constitution that prohibits di rect or indirect state financial aid to schools with religious affiliations.

title: KARL HALLDEN DIES; INDUSTRIALIST, 85
description: THOMASTON, Conn., Feb. 10 Karl W. Hallden, an indus trialist and philanthropist, who made many contributions to Trinity College in Hartford, his alma mater, died yesterday at the Morton F. Plant hospital in Clearwater, Fla. He was 85 years old and maintained homes in Florida and here.

title: Volpe to Meet Auto Makers
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 10 (AP) Secretary of Transportation John A. Volpe said today he was going to Detroit to discuss pollution and safety with the nation's auto makers.

title: Disorder in the Courts
description: The pattern of disruption, threats and sporadic violence in the courtroom that has marked the Chicago conspiracy trial and is now being acted out in the case of the Black Panthers here constitutes a direct attack on the administration of justice.

title: CURBS SUPPORTED BY RESERVE HERE
description: The Federal Reserve Bank of New York provided some valu able insight yesterday into the debate in the Federal Open Market Committee, which is under heavy pressure from the Administration to ease its credit policies soon.

title: STOCKS IN LONDON MAKE SOME GAINS
Anita Carol Ackerman Betrothed
description: OAK PARK, Mich., Feb. 10  Mr. and Mrs. Joseph Bluestein have made known the engagement of Mrs. Blue stein's daughter, Miss Anita Carol Ackerman, to Dr. Ste phen Frank Winer, son of Mr. and Mrs. Arthur Winer of Huntington Woods.

title: Will Jason, 59, Composer Of Songs, Dies in Mexico
description: Will Jason, a song composet who had written for motion pictures, died of cancer yes terday at the MexicanAmeri can Hospital in Guadalajara, Mexico, where he had been liv ing for the last 10 years. He was 59 years old.

title: CITY PLANNING UNIT CHIDED BY BEAME
description: The City Planning Commis sion was criticized yesterday for proposing to spend more money than the city would have available to spend on con struction over the next five years.

title: Colorado Atom Plant Is Called Radiation Hazard
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 10A group of Colorado scientists contends, on the basis of its investigations in the Denver area, that one bf the nation's key atomic bomb manufactur ing plants has been releasing dangerously radioactive pluto nium into the air, water and soil.

title: Merrill Lynch Profit Down 41% in 1969
description: Merrill Lynch, Pierce, Fenner & Smith, Inc., the nation's larg est brokerage house, announced yesterday that its profit in 1969 plunged nearly 41 per cent because of rising costs and shrinking volume.

title: Justice Murtagh's Warning
description: Following are excerpts of remarks made yesterday by Supreme Court Justice John M. Murtagh at a pretrial hear ing of Black Panther members:

title: Family Aid for the Jobless
description: Strong support has developed in Albany for revising the state unemployment insurance system to provide extra benefits for jobless workers with families. Such a revision would breach the strict tie to prior wages that has governed unemployment payments for more than three decades, but it would reduce the danger that jobless fathers would have to turn to public welfare to supplement their jobinsurance checks.

title: TIMES REPORTER WINS JURY DELAY
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Feb. 10 The Department of Justice has indefinitely delayed its attempts to require Earl Caldwell, a New York Times correspondent, to appear before a grand jury in vestigating the Black Panthers, Mr. Caldwell's attorney said today.

title: Earl's 3 Goals Help Colgate Down Princeton Sextet, 53
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Feb. 10 Tom Earl, a right wing, scored three goals tonight to lead Col gate's hockey team to a 53 victory over Princeton.

title: WALDMAN, VIOLINIST, DISPLAYS EXPERTISE
description: Although not without a few ups and downs, Yuval Wald man's Carnegie Recital Hall concert last night revealed a young violinist of unquestioned technical expertise and sound musical instincts.

title: Betty Zimmerberg Prospective Bride
description: HIGHLAND PARK, N. J., Feb. 10The engagement of Miss Betty Zimmerberg, a junior at Radcliffe College, to Robert Bruce Sonenthal, a senior at Harvard, has been announced by the future bride's parents, Dr. and Mrs. Hyman J. Zimmerberg. The prospective bridegroom's pa rents are Mr. and Mrs. Paul Sonenthal of Jackson Heights, Queens

title: Suns Snap Celtic String
description: BOSTON, Feb. 10  Connie Hawkins paced the Phoenix Suns to a 122117 National Bas ketball Association victory over Boston tonight. The loss snapped the Celtics' threegame winning streak.PHOENIX (122)BOSTON (117)

title: Mrs. Grant Reiterates City Stand on Chickens
description: Mrs. Bess Myerson Grant, the city's Commissioner of Consumer Affairs, held a news conference in a Long Island City poultry terminal yesterday to announce a new department regula tion that, in fact, has been department procedure for many years.

title: TRUE BLACK COUNT URGED IN CENSUS
description: Thirteen civil rights and community service organiza tions announced yesterday that they would conduct a special drive to assure that all black perons are counted in the 1970 census.

title: MRS. KING BOWS TO VIRGINIA WADE
description: Virginia Wade of England defeated Mrs. Billie Jean King of Long Beach, Calif., 46, 61, 86, and Rosemary Casals of San Francisco downed Peaches Bartkowitz of Hamtramck, Mich., 86, 61, in the quarter finals of the $5,000 women's international tennis tourna ment at the Vanderbilt Athletic Club last night.

title: Record Rain Falls in City Area, Snarling Road and Rail Travel
description: A centuryold weather record for a Feb. 10 was swept away yesterday by a rainstorm that drenched the metropolitan area, flooding streets and highways, disrupting road, air and rail traffic and causing some streams and rivers to overflow their banks.

title: Frazier 61 in Title Fight
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., Feb. 10 (AP)Oddsmakers here rate Joe Frazier 61 to beat Jimmy Ellis in the heavyweight cham pionship fight next Monday. They report little action at that price.

title: MONDAY NIGHT FIGHT
description: BostonBobby Covino, 168 pounds, Somerville, Mass., out pointed Jim Cherrico, 177, Brooklyn, 8 rounds.

title: Advertising: A Magazine for Negro Wornen
description: Some of the best brains in publishing and advertising have contributed to the cre ation of Essence, a magazine for Negro women due for publication April 28. A dum my of it was unveiled yester day and a handsome piece of work it is.

title: Baseball Transactions
description: CLEVELANDSigned Jack Heidemann, short stop; Gary Sprague, third baseman; Ron Allen, outfielder; Larry Doby Johnson, catcher; Vince Colbert, Rich Tidrow, right handed pitchers.

title: Maureen Hanafin to Be a Bride
description: ENDICOTT, N. Y., Feb. 10  Miss Maureen Elizabeth Hanafin and Charles Shipley Hall will be married in May.

title: U.S. Pact Expires in Fall
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 10A spokesman for the State De partment said today that the United States would begin ne gotiations with Spain on a new agreement on military bases and assistance in the near future.

title: More Aid to Arts Urged By Stern and Heckscher
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 10  America will become an in dustrial complex without a soul unless Congress en courages the arts, the lasting evidences Of our civilization, Isaac Stern warned today.

title: I British Football Results
description: ENGLISH LEAGUE

title: DR. S. H. WARSHAWSKY
description: ASBURY PARK, N. J., Feb. 10 Dr. Samuel H. Warshawsky, a dentist here for 40 years, died yesterday at Jersey Shore Medical Center, Neptune. He was 69 years old.

title: Tunisian Sees Rogers and Assails U.S. Over Mideast
description: TUNIS, Feb. 10The Premier of Tunisia, Bahi Ladgham, said todayafter a conference with Secretary of State William P. Rogersthat further United States sales of jet aircraft to Israel would be a kind of prov ocation that would add insult to injury to the Arab coun tries.

title: Harris Proposes Alternative to Nixon's Welfare Plan
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 10  Congressional Democrats put forward today their first alternative to President Nixon's controversial welfare reform program, an ambitious income maintenance plan that could cost the government $20billion a year.

title: Truce With Nature?
description: Perhaps if President Nixon had promised the country less in the way of environmental reform, his message to Congress on the subject would seem more far reaching than it does.

title: VIETNAM SECURITY REPORTED TO HOUSE
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 10 (AP) A House subcommittee re ported that the Vietnam paci fication program substantially increased security in the South Vietnam countryside last year but did not seriously counter Vietcong political activity.

title: Concert for Harlem School
description: A concert for the benefit of the Harlem School of the Arts will be given on Sunday at 3 P.M. by the Smith College Glee Club, the Haverford College Glee Club and the Howard Uni versity Choir and Brass En semble. The concert will be at the St. James Presbyterian Church, 14Ist Street and St. Nicholas Avenue, adjoining the school. The program will in clude works by Gabrieli, Faur6 and Dello Joio. Ticket prices range from $5 for sponsors to $1 for children. The general admission for adults is $2.

title: From Rolls to Loaves: 113 Varieties
description: BAGELS and biscuits, bri oches and bauernbrot are among 113 different vari eties of breads, from nine OldWorldstyle bakers, at Bloomingdale's Bread Basket, which opens today in the delicacies department.

title: AMEX PRICES OFF IN LIGHT TRADING
description: Prices mostly declined on the American Stock Exchange yes terday in the lightest trading in more than three months.

title: S.E.C. Accuses Company
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 10 (AP) The Securities and Exchange Commission today accused New Jersey corporation of ma nipulating its own stock by buying 80,000 shares on the American Stock Exchange at a predetermined price. It filed a complaint in Federal District Court in New York City against the Soundesign Cor poration of Jersey City. The company, without admitting or denying the allegations, con sented to a permanent injunc tion.

title: INDICTED MAN DIES IN A JERSEY CRASH
description: NEWARK, Feb. 10Mario T. Gallo, one of the 15 men in dicted last December here by a Federal grand jury investi gating organized crime, was killed early today in an auto mobile crash in nearby West Orange.

title: Eramus Hall Night Classes Evacuated in Bomb Scare
description: A bomb scare at the Erasmus Hall High School in Brooklyn forced the evacuation of 1,500 students who were attending evening classes there last night.

title: DAVILA IS STOPPED BY BUGNER ON CUT
description: LONDON, Feb. 10 (AP)Joe Bugner, Britain's young heavy weight prospect, stopped Roberto Davila, a Peruvian liv ing in New York, at the end of the third round of their scheduled 10round feature bout at Albert Hall Stadium tonight.

title: BUCKS TOP 76ERS, ALCINDOR GETS 36
description: PHILADELPHIA, Feb. 10 (UPI) Lew Alcindor scored 36 points tonight to lead Milwau kee to a 139131 victory over the Philadelphia 76ers in a Na tional Basketball Association game.

title: Irate Woman Commuter Wins Right to Jury Trial
description: RYE, N. Y., Feb. 10 (UPI) Miss Edda Koll, the legal sec retary who refused to have her ticket punched on the New Haven division of the Penn Cen tral to protest poor service, today demanded and won a jury trial in Rye City Court.

title: U.S. Boat 9th in Sydney
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Feb: 10 (AP)The American Travelodge International skippered by Roger Welsh of Newport Beach, Calif., finished ninth in a field of 13 boats in the second heat of the world 18footer cham pionship in Sydney Harbor to day. She was sixth in the first heat Sunday. New South Wales boats tookall first three places in today's heat.

title: Press Censorship Warning
description: LAWRENCE, Kan., Feb. 10 (UPI)The establishment of any agency to censor the press would be the most dangerous enemy the people of this coun try could possibly face, Eugene C. Pulliam, the publisher said today. The publisher of the Arizona Republic and Phoenix Gazette and The Indianapolis, Star and Indianapolis News said the recent report of the Commission on Crime and Vio lence constituted a definite and direct call for positive cen sorship of the press.

title: Screen: End of the Road
In Memoriam
description: MEISELMatilda D??sner. February 11, 1968. In loving memory.

title: Reserve in Belgian Drawing
description: BRUSSELS, Feb. 10 (Reuters) Banking spokesmen said to day the New York Federal Reserve bank had made further drawing under its swap agreement with the Belgian central bank. The new drawing is the fourth the Federal Re serve has made since Nov. 25. The sources could not give its exact size, but said all four amounted to less than $100mil lion, against the agreed ceiling of $500million.

title: Lindsay Says Lack Of Funds Hinders Fight on Narcotics
description: Mayor Lindsay said yesterday that despite the rapidly grow ing narcotics problem and mounting pressures for govern ment action on all levels, the city could not substantially ex pand its programs against drug abuse because of lack of funds.

title: Penn State to Retain Policy Of 10Game Football Slate
description: UNIVERSITY PARK, Pa., Feb. 10 (AP)Penn State said today it would continue its tra ditional policy of 10 regular season football games.

title: Old and New Standards On Car Exhaust Fumes
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 10 The following are the Fed eral standards that have been in effect and future stand ards that have now been set for auto exhausts. They do not pertain to trucks and buses. The figures are ex pressed in grams per mile of running time per vehicle.

title: Colette, Play About Writer, Due Here
description: Colette, a play about the French novelist, will be pre sented off Broadway in April.

title: Fund Weighed to Trace Stock Thefts
description: The New York Stock Ex change is considering the estab lishment of a fund on which Federal agents could draw for undercover operations aimed at tracing stolen securities, Attor ney General John N. Mitchell disclosed here last night.

title: Integration Delay Refused
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 10 (AP) The Supreme Court refused, today to delay implementation of a school desegregation plan scheduled to go into effect in Darlington County, S. C., by next Monday.

title: House Vote Adds $38Million to Buy Coast Park Land
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 10 (AP) The House voted today to permit the National Park Serv ice to spend an additional $38.3 million for land for the Point Reyes National Seashore in California. The amount repre sents an increase in land values over the last eight years.

title: Court Clears Black Militant
description: HILLSBOROUGH, N. C., Feb. 10 (AP)A black militant, Howard Fuller, was cleared to day of a charge of engaging in a riot during the picket line distrubance last Nov. 25 at the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill.

title: U.S,. Canada and Britain Agree to Share Data on Drugs and Food Additives
description: OTTAWA, Feb. 10 The United States, Canada and Brit ain will undertake a broad pro gram involving exchange of information on drugs, food ad ditives and pesticides, it was announced here today.

title: Frazier Spars 4 Rounds for Total of 20 in 5 Days; Ellis Avoiding Contact
description: AT 5 o'clock yesterday morning Joe Frazier was sleeping the sleep of the just when Yank Durham, his traineradviser, entered the room of their midtown hotel while rain lashed a message on the window. Gravelvoiced Yank deliv ered the message.

title: Arriba's Prima Donna, a Boxer, Is Named Best at Westminster K.C. Show
description: A trim red fawn boxer with white markings on chest, face and feet and, in the words of the judge, elegance personi fied, attained the peak of American dogdom by becoming best in show at the Westmins ter Kennel Club competition in Madison Square Garden last night.

title: HAROLD ENGSTROM, TRADE CONSULTANT
description: NEW ROCHELLE, N. Y., Feb. 10Harold Engstrom, an in dustrial engineer and consult ant, died at New Rochelle Hospital today or a heart at tack. He had been ill with diabetes for several years. He was 71 years old, and lived at 105 Iden Avenue, Pelham Manor.

title: 39 DIE IN FRANCE UNDER SNOWSLIDE
description: BOURG  ST.  MAURICE, France, Feb. 10An avalanche of snow thundered down on the fashionable Alpine resort of Val d'Isre today, killing at least 39 young skiers.

title: BORROWER LOSES CHURCHILL WORK
description: EAST HILLS, L. I., Feb. 10 Loss of a painting by Sir Win ston Churchill, which had been lent to an art dealer here by the former British Prime Min ister's daughter, Lady Audley, has been reported to the police.

title: JOSEPH E. WILLIAMS
description: PLAINFIELD, N. J., Feb. 10 Joseph E. Williams, a former vice president in the Chase Manhattan Bank, died Sunday after a long illness at his home at 1055 Woodland Avenue here. He was 67 vearg old.

title: American Staff in a Mekong District Consists of One ExPeace Corpsman
description: THOTNOT, South Vietnam, Feb. 8When an American vis itor turned up in this Mekong Delta district yesterday, the to tal American presence doubled by virtue of his arrival.

title: Court Cautions All at Black Panther Hearings to Behave or Face Stern Contempt Action
description: Supreme Court Justice John M. Murtagh issued a stern warning to spectators, defense lawyers and defendants yester day against future disruptions of the pretrial hearings of 13 Black Panthers in the Criminal part of State Supreme Court at 100 Centre Street.

title: MRS. ABNER GOLD
description: SPRINGFIELD, N. J., Feb., 10 Mrs. Adrianne Benson Gold of 219 Lelac Avenue, wife of Abner Gold, editor of The Springfield Leader, died today at Overlook Hospital, Summit. She was 42 years old.

title: Sheen Is in Hospital
description: A spokesman for Archbishop Fulton J. Sheen disclosd yester day that the Roman Catholic leader has been hospitalized in Manhattan for the past week with severe cold and laryngitis. The spokesman said that the 74yearold prelate's condition had improved, and that he was due to he released from Lenox Hill Hospital tomorrow.

title: GULF OIL PLANNING TO PARE OUTLAYS
description: The Gulf Oil Company an nounced yesterday plans for an approximate. 40 per cent cut back in capital spending from $1.5billion in 1969 to $900 million in 1970.

title: Neighborhoods: Fight to Bar Garbage Unit Fuses Inwood
description: Inwood, the remote nortn ernmost tip of Manhattan Is land with a name few New Yorkers recognize and with quiet streets and parks that even fewer know, has sud denly found its voice.

title: Japan Puts Satellite Into Orbit in 5th Try
description: UCHINOURA, Japan, Wednesday, Feb. 11 (Reuters) Japan put an artificial satellite into orbit today in its fifth attempt.

title: MSGR. ARTHUR J. AVARD
description: Msgr. Arthur J. Avard, pastor emeritus of the Roman Catholic Church of the Blessed Sacra ment, died at the Mary Man ning Walsh Home Monday. He was 87 years old.

title: GARELIK OPPOSES MORGENTHAU JOB
description: Mayor Lindsay's plans to set up a third Deputy Mayor's of fice that would cost more than $500,000 a year were blocked yesterday in the City Council and criticized afterward by Sanford D. Garelik, the Council President.

title: Nixon's Message Poses Questions on Car Pollution
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 10 President Nixon's environmen tal message ordered today stricter automobile exhaust standards that experts said posed two major questions: Who is to enforce auto pollu tion limits, and how are they to be applied to used cars.

title: Error by Committee
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 10 A spokesman for the Senate Finance Committee said today that a clerical error was re sponsible for its reporting that an individual doctor received more than $1.4million in Medi caid funds.

title: U.S. Ring Fans in Soviet Jab A.A.U.
description: MOSCOW, Feb. 10  In one corner of the American ambassador's palatial resi dence, wearing gray business suits and weighing heavily in the affairs of Nevada and United StatesSoviet rela tions, respectively, were the Lieutenant Governor of Ne vada; Ed Fike, and the Am bassador, Jacob Beam.

title: De Sapio Sentenced To 2 Years in Prison For Kickback Plot
description: Carmine G. De Sapio, once a powerful figure in state and national Democratic politics, was sentenced yesterday to two years in prison and fined $4,500 for his part in a con spiracy to bribe former Wa ter Commissioner James L. Marcus and obtain kickbacks on Consolidated Edison Com pany contracts.

title: Goodyear Rubber and R. J. Reynolds Profits Rise
description: Operations of the Goodyear Rubber Company in 1969 re sulted in record fullyear and fourthquarter results with sales exceeding 63billion for the first time, the company's report from Akron, Ohio, dis closed yesterday.

title: Washington: For the Record
Counseling U.N. Wives On Beauty
description: AUSTRIAN blondes, South American brunettes, black women from Africa and teacolored ones from Asia are all sisters under the skin. Let them loose among lot of cosmetics and make up experts and they're in terested in the same fine points of beauty.

title: BILL DEFINING JEW ADVANCED IN ISRAEL
description: TEL AVIV, Feb. 10  By substantial majority, the Knes set tonight passed the first reading of the highly contro versial bill accepting the rab binical definition of Jew in civil legislaiton.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Credit Card Bill in Senate
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 10 (Reuters)  A bill that would give the Federal Reserve Board authority, to set regulations for the mailing of unsolicited credit cards was sent to the Senate Banking Committee today by its financial institutions sub committee.

title: Jenkins and Clarion Ensemble Play AllSammartini Program
description: For some 20 years Newell Jenkins has been pursuing with dedication the music of Gio vanni Battista Sammartini, prolific and influential Italian composer of the 18th century. This year his thematic cata logue of the composer's works is being published by the Amer ican Musicological Society and Harvard University.

title: SOVIET ICBM SHIFT DETECTED BY U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 10  The Soviet Union has started to deploy its principal long range missile in complexes that previously consisted only of mediumrange missiles pointed at Western Europe, according to well placed United States Government sources.

title: INSKO FINDS 2,500 HARD TO COME BY
description: WESTBURY, L. I., Feb. 10 Del Insko moved into tonight's harness racing card at Roose velt Raceway needing five win ners to raise his career total to 2,500, a plateau reached only by four modern drivers  Billy Haughton, Stanley Dancer, Joe O'Brien and Bob Farrington.

title: Hogan Given Missing Letters From Mrs. Onassis
description: Four letters written by Mrs. Aristotle Onassisboth as Mrs. Onassis and as Mrs. John F. Kennedywere turned over to the District Attorney's com plaint bureau yesterday.

title: Top Court in India Bars Nationalization of Banks
description: NEW DELHI, Feb. 10  The Indian Supreme Court struck down Prime Minister Indira Gandhi's Bank Nationalization Act today, ruling that the take over of the 14 biggest private banks last July was hostile discrimination since other In dian banks and foreign banks were excluded.

title: BAR GROUP PLANS CENTENNIAL HERE
description: Is violence the cheapest route to important social change in the United States? Can the legal framework of the nation survive the present period of tension and conflict? How can cities be decentral ized most effectively?

title: Procter & Gamble Officers
description: Three new vice presidents of the Procter & Gamble Company were named yesterday. They are: W. Wallace Abbott, vice presidentbar soap and house hold cleaning product division; Edgar H. Potspeich, vice presi dentadvertising, and Harry Tecklenburg, vice presidentre search and development. All have spent their entire business careers with the company.

title: S.F.C. Suspends Concern
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 10 (UPI) The Securities and Exchange Commission today suspended overthecounter trading in the Imperial Investments Corpora tion because of a lack of in formation about the company.

title: U.S. Clears McDonnellDouglas of Bias Charges
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 10 (AP) The Pentagon decided today that the McDonnellDouglas Corporation was complying with the Government's job op portunity requirements. The finding removed the threat of a loss of a multibilliondollar contract held by the company.

title: Medicaid Fee Abuse Report Attacked
description: The presidentelect of they Medical Society of the State of New York yesterday criticized the report of the Senate Finance Committee detailing doctors' abuse of Medicaid and Medicare fees.

title: CONGRESS TERMED HOSTILE TO LABOR
description: BAL HARBOUR, Fla., Feb. 10 The 91st Congress was criti cized today as antilabor by the executive council of the Build ing and Construction Trades Department of the American Federation of Labor and Con gress of Industrial Organiza tions.

title: Grechko Is Visiting Poland
description: WARSAW, Feb. 10 (Reuters) Marshal Andrei A. Grechko, Soviet Defense Minister, ar rived here today at the head of a sixman military delega tion

title: Executive Changes
description: Thomas A. Melfe has been promoted to senior vice president of the United States Trust Company of New York. He formerly was assistant division head of the trust administration division.

title: A Number Leaves Prison and Becomes a Man Again
description: At 9:05, the other morning, No. 45,777 at the New Jer sey State Prison Farm at Rahway became Richard Mayor again.

title: 6STATE CHAMPION WANTS RING WORK
description: In the last five days, Joe Frazier has sparred 20 busy, sometimes brutal rounds. In the same span, Jimmy Ellis has sparred two casual rounds.

title: Assessing Unemployment
description: To anyone old enough to have experienced the great Depression, a rise in the unemployment rate like the half point jump last month conjures up memory of breadlines, the W.P.A., and of fathers of families searching for years for work in vain. A more contem porary fear is born of the fact, historically, a rise in the over all unemployment rate has meant a much sharper rise in the rate for young people and Ne groes. We can't afford to fight in flation, some economists have argued, because of the high price in civil discontent.

title: PLAN FOR STADIUM HITS MONEY SNAG
description: The plan to build a new stadium in Boston primarily for the use of the pro football team there, the Patriots, has hit a snag. Construction of the 55,000seat stadium was to be financed by a $16million bond issue guaranteed by 12 extra days of flat racing at the Suf folk Downs track, run by Bill Veeck.

title: Museum's Attendance Triples on Free Day
description: You'd think they were giv ing away paintings, a woman visitor to the Museum of Modern Art commented, sur veying the crowded lobby on the museum's first free Mon day.

title: Elizabeth Hills And R. W. York To Wed in July
description: SHAKER HEIGHTS, Ohio, Feb. 10Mr. and Mrs. Ed ward Crawford Hills of Shaker Heights and Delray Beach, Fla., have made known the engagement of their daughter, Miss Elizabeth Crawford Hills, to Richard William York. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Willard York of Cleveland.

title: Transport News and Notes
description: The impact of the 10dayold tug strike on Westchester County eased yesterday when the Coast Guard agreed to pro vide tugs to tow sludge barges from its sewagetreatment plant in Yonkers out to sea for dumping. This averted a seri ous crisis, according to Ed ward J. Delehanty, the county's Public Works Commissioner.

title: MOSCOW AND U. S. WIDEN EXCHANGES
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 10The United States and the Soviet Union reached agreement to day on an enlarged cultural ex change program for this year and next, increasing the num bers of students and artistic groups to be exchanged and initiating joint studies of en vironment problems.

title: Charity Drives Urged to Put Emphasis on Social Problems
description: The national coordinating body for the United Fund and Community Chest drives urged its member groups in 2,260 communities yesterday to con centrate more of their efforts and money on problems such as poverty and drug addiction.

title: Rendel of The Times Receives Three Honors
description: John Rendel, who plans to retire from The New York Times at the end of the year, received three honors yester day for long and meritorious dogshow reporting.

title: Presbytery in City Plans Law Service For Communities
description: The Presbytery of New York City voted last night to estab lish an experimental law office to serve as a watchdog, going beyond the traditional role of ombudsman to that of investigator.

title: 35 HURT BY GRENADE IN GAZA STRIP TOWN
description: TEL AVIV, Feb. 10Thirty four Arabs and an Israeli sol dier were injured by a grenade explosion today near the en trance to the civil administra tion building in Khan Yunis in the Israelioccupied Gaza Strip, an Israeli Army report said.

title: KNICKS TO START RUSSELL TONIGHT
description: Cazzie Russell will replace the injured Bill Bradley in the starting lineup tonight when the New York Knicks oppose the Boston Celtics at Madison Square Garden. Bradley, trou bled, with a left ankle sprain sustained against the Celtics on Jan. 27, has missed the last two days of practice at Lost Battalion Hall in Elmhurst, Queens.

title: Mary Jennings Hollis Engaged
description: CHICAGO, Feb. 10  Mr. and Mrs. Everett Loftus Hollis have announced the engagement of their daugh ter, Miss Mary Jennings Hollis, to Hugh Joseph Turner Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Turner of Peabody, Mass.

title: Sir Noel Blithely Accepts 3 Ovations Here
description: Newly knighted by his Queen and toasted by his countrymen on his 70th birth day, Sir Nol Coward has ar rived in New York festooned with honors, not the least of which is that his 40year old comedy, Private Lives, is one of the season's cer tifiable Broadway hits.

title: Garden Starts Ticket Sale For N.I.T. Opening March 13
description: Tickets for the 33d annual National Invitation Tournament are now on sale at the Madison Square Garden box office.

title: No Progress in Air Talks
description: MIAMI, Feb. 10 (AP)Fed eral mediator, Joe Smith, met briefly today with representa tives of National Air Lines and reported no progress toward settling a strike by about 3,500 workers that has grounded all of National's 53 jets. National and negotiators for the Air Lines Employes Association did not meet. No new sessions were scheduled.

title: Fanny May Results for the Week
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 10Mortgage prices rose sub stantially at this week's auction of the Federal National Mortgage Association, it disclosed today.

title: MISSISSIPPI SCHOOL DESTROYED BY FIRE
description: MABEN, Miss., Feb. 10 (AP) A combined elementary and high school was destroyed by fire today, hours before it was to reopen under courtordered faculty desegregation.

title: January Retail Sales Off 1% in a Continuing Slide
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 10  Retail sales continued slow in January, with a one per cent drop from December, the Com merce Department reported to day.

title: Stage: Five Star Saint
description: UNTIL the final act, when fate begins to undermine the worldly role of Alphon sus of Liguori, the 18th cen tury Catholic saint who founded the Congregation of the Most Holy Redeemer, a new play titled Five Star Saint makes an arresting evening of theater.

title: Alabamian Will Run Again
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 10 (AP) Representative Tom Bevill, Democrat of Alabama, an nounced today that he would seek reelection to a third term in the House.

title: Saigon Court Bids Two Deputies Appear
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Feb. 10 (Reuters)A military court has ordered two members of the lower house to face ques tioning on alleged proCom munist activities.

title: Blaine RollCall
Carr Paces Irish Attack by Registering 33 Points
description: SOUTH BEND, Ind., Feb. 10 Notre Dame rolled to a 20 point halftime lead, staved off a determined secondhalf effort by St. John's and then rallied to rout the Redmen, in basket ball, 9076, before 10,347 at the Athletic and Convocation Cen. ter tonight.

title: In Reply to Allies, Soviet Asks Parley On West Berlin Only
description: WASHINGTON, Feb, 10The Soviet Union proposed four power talks today on the fu ture status of West Berlin, dip lomatic sources said, but with conditions that appeared un acceptable to the Western powers.

title: New Orleans Ends the Most Violent Mardi Gras Season in Years With 600 in Its Jail
description: NEW ORLEANS, Feb. 10 At 11:30 this morning two young men plunged through the door of the Cabaret Toulouse onto the crowded sidewalk of Bour bon Street, fighting wildly.

title: AntiAbortion Law Gains in Hawaii
description: HONOLULU, Feb. 10The Hawaii Senate voted 17 to 7 tonight to repeal a 100year old law against abortion.

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS

title: Cozza of Yale to Be Cited
description: CINCINNATI, Feb. 10 (AP) Yale's football coach, Carmen Cozza, and a former profes sional basketball player, Wayne Embry, top a list of six men who will he inducted into Mi ami of Ohio University's Hall of Fame Saturday.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
description: The New York Times Feb. 11, 1970

title: Theater: Good Native Work Stirs in Los Angeles
description: LOS ANGELES, Feb. 10 Franchises or something very like them, seem to be the new pattern of the West Coast theater. In San Fran cisco I noticed that Dames at Sea, Hair and Oh! Calcutta! were all there in local production on extended run, and a new staging of Jacques Brel is about to open.

title: OffDuty Policeman Shoots Man Trying to Rob Him
description: An offduty policeman moon lighting as a taxi driver shot and critically wounded a young man who allegedly tried to rob him last night.

title: Martinis Sentenced to 90 Days After He Pleads Guilty to Drunken Driving
description: Gareth Martinis, son of Criminal Court Judge Joseph A. Martinis, was given a 90 day jail sentence yesterday after pleading guilty to charges of drunken driving and driving without a license.

title: Exchanges Back Rules Change; I.D.S. Denounces Two Proposals
description: The New York Stock Ex change, in a reply to the anti trust division of the Justice Department, said yesterday that proposed rules changes permitting public ownership of exchange members are immune from the antitrust laws.

title: ADLERIAN QUARTET PLAYED AT BENEFIT
description: Possibly Richard Stoker's Adlerian Quartet has some therapeutic values apparent to specialists, but otherwise it is hard to find the relationship between Mr. Stoker's music and his avowed subject matter.

title: 7 Dow Protesters Guilty of Damaging Files in Office Raid
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 10 Seven of the nine members of an antiwar group that de stroyed files and equipment at the offices of the Dow Chem ical Company last March were found guilty today on two charges of malicious destruc tion of property and one of unlawful entry.

title: Schranz Captures Giant Slalom in World Alpine Ski Meet
description: VAL GARDENA, Italy, Feb. 10 (AP)Karl Schranz rose to the top of the World Cup stand ing for the first time this sea son today by speeding to vic tory in the giant slalom of the world Alpine ski champion ships.

title: Christian Services to Mark The Opening of Lent Today
description: Protestant and Roman Cath olic Christians will begin ob servance of their most sacred season today with Ash Wednes day services marking the open ing of Lent.

title: Books of The Times
description: A GREAT FALL. By Mildred Savaze. 536 pages. Simon & Schuster. $7.95.

title: Dow Spokesman Comments
description: DETROIT, Feb. 10A Dow Chemical Company spokesman at the company headquarters in Midland, Mich., said today that the assertions by a group of Colorado scientists were just not credible.

title: SAMUELS REPORTS BACKING OF CHIEFS
description: Howard J. Samuels, a candi date for the Democratic guber natorial nomination, announced yesterday that 18 upstate county leaders had endorsed his can didacy.

title: Mail Fraud Sentence
description: CHICAGO, Feb. 10 (AP)  Guido Fidanzi, 41 years old, a reputed crime syndicate figure, was sentenced today to four years in prison and placed on probation for four years for mail fraud and conspiracy.
