description: PRETORIA, South Africa, Feb. 16Charges under the Suppres sion of Communism Act against 22 black Africans were dropped today, but they were immediate ly rearrested under the Terror ism Act. Its provisions allow in definite detention without trial.

title: Meyer to Make 3 More Films for Fox
description: Russ Meyer, 44yearold di rectorproducerwritereditor cinematographer of 20 suc cessful sex and nudie feature films over the last 10 years, who is now making his major studio debut at 20th Century Fox with Beyond the Valley of the Dolls, has been signed by Fox to produce and direct three additional films.

title: Radio Satellite to Track an Elk in Migration Study
description: An elk named Monique, Moe for short, and a space satellite named Nimbus have a radio rendezvous to keep later this week on a snowcovered plain in Wyoming.

title: Canadiens' Official Concedes End of Dynasty Is Approaching
description: SAM POLLOCK doesn't like to think so, but there are times, when logic gets the best of him, that he admits that perhaps the Montreal Canadiens' dynasty will end. When that happens, it will go hard on the Frenchmen's fans.

title: Eastman Dillon Gets Chief
description: Eastman Dillon, Union Secu titics & Co., a leading invest ment banking and brokerage firm, announced yesterday that Willard S. Boothby had been named chief executive partner.

title: SOVIET PROMISES NECESSARY HELP FOR ARAB STATES
description: MOSCOW, Feb. 16The So viet Union asserted tonight that it would supply the Arab coun tries with the necessary sup port to bolster their defenses against what it termed Israel's criminal policy of aggression.

title: Urban Coalition Picks 1970 Fund Drive Chief
description: Milo M. Brisco, the presi dent of Standard Oil of New Jersey, has been named chairman of the New York Urban Coalition's 1970 drive to raise $7.75million.

title: Soviet Shows Its Portrait, Through a Political and Artistic Lens
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 16 Ordinary people and extraor dinary power plants vie for attention in an ambitious ex hibition of Soviet photo graphic art that opens here tomorrow night. The show, with its hints of a post Stalinist political subtlety among artists, is scheduled to go to five other American cities in the next seven months. The exhibition, USSR Photo 70, will give Americans their first systematic view of the lights and shadows in the art of the camera, Soviet style.

title: EltraPhoton Fight Settled
description: The Eltra Corporation and Photon, Inc., have settled their dispute over phototypesetting patents. A Federal District Court in Chicago had found Eltra's Mergenthaler Linotype division guilty of infringing two Photon patents. The set tlement allows Mergenthaler free continued nonexclusive use of the two infringed pat ents in return for a payment of $2.5million to be paid over six years.

title: Tax on Airline Tickets Is Deferred by Canada
description: OTTAWA, Feb. 16 (Cana dian Press)The Canadian Government announced to day that it would delay for a year the imposition of a tax on airline tickets as part of its response to a re quest from the Prices and In comes Commission.

title: SENATE UNIT, 734, BACKS CARSWELL
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 16 The nomination of Federal Judge G. Harrold Carswell to the Supreme Court won the approval of the Senate Judi ciary Committee today by a vote of 13 to 4.

title: U.S. Payments Balance Sets Opposite Records
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 16The United States balance of international payments showed a record deficit in 1969 by one method of measurement and a record surplus by the other, the Commerce Department reported today. Both measures were distorted by special factors last year, par ticularly by the impact of the extremely restrive monetary policy in the United States.

title: NIXON FORMS PANEL ON DESEGREGATION
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 16 (AP) President Nixon set up today what he called an informal Cabinetlevel working group to see what the Federal Govern ment could do to help school districts desegregate and still preserve the public education system.

title: Congress Asked to Outlaw Banks' Profit Before Loans
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 16 (UPI) Mayor Joseph L. Alioto of San Francisco urged today a Congressional investigation of the growing practice by banks in demanding a cut of the prof its before making business loans.

title: Falstaff Beer Leaving Foote, Cone
description: The Falstaff Brewing Corporation, St. Louis, Will moving its Falstaff beer out of the Chicago office of Foote, Cone & Belding on May 31. The brand was backed by almost $8million in measured media last year.

title: Auto Layoffs Thicken Gloom in Unhappy Detroit
description: DETROIT, Feb. 16Happi ness in Detroit comes when the cars are rolling and there is plenty of overtime and money for color TV and beer, hunting up north and even a new house.

title: Doyle and Perkins Triumph On Points in Chicago Bouts
description: CHICAGO, Feb. 16 (UPI) Irish Tony Doyle of Phoenix, Ariz., handed Getulio Bueno of Argentina his first professional loss tonight by punching out a decision in a 10round bout at Aragon Ballroom.

title: It's More Than a Hair Salon
description: ONE way to attract atten tion is to puzzle people. Virtually everyone going by the shop at 694 Madison Ave nue (62d Street) stops to look at the clothes and accessories in the window, then does a double take at the women having their hair done furth er back in the shop. A glance at the name Mensorio Ricupero is not much of a help, even for those who can translate the Ital ian ricupero into recov ery. Therefore, the curious have to go into the shop and talk to Tom Mensorio or Joseph Ricupero and find out that the new enterprise is both a boutique and a beauty salon.

title: DEFENSE COSTS UP IN ISRAELI BUDGET
description: JERUSALEM, Feb. 16Is rael's Parliament was presented with a new budget today, call ing for higher taxes, a slow down in development projects and heavier expenditures for the country's military machine than ever before.

title: Pro Eleven Quits League
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Feb. 16 (UPI)  The defending champion Indianapolis Capitols withdrew today from the Continental Football League because of scheduling problems under a new, nineteam alignment. Other teams are from Dallas, Fort Worth, Memphis, Omaha, Sacramento, San Antonio, Seat tle, Spokane and West Texas.

title: TV: Return of the Smothers Brothers
description: TOM and Dick Smothers were back last night in a network special on the Na tional Broadcasting Company after their separation last season from the Columbia Broadcasting System. As a matter of principle, it's good that TV competition assures them of a continuing hearing and their perspective con tinues to be in the modern genre far more than most of their TV peers.

title: Samuel Davis, Councilman From 1949 to 1965, Is Dead
description: Samuel Davis, a Manhattan Councilman from 1949 to 1965, died Sunday of a heart attack in a Los Angeles Hospital. He was 82 years old and lived in Los Angeles.

title: Dr. Pusey to Retire As Head of Harvard In '71,2 Years Early,
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Feb. 16  Nathan M. Pusey, the president of Harvard Univer sity, announced today that he would retire next year, two years earlier than planned.

title: Son of University Chancellor Among 14 Held in Drug Raid
description: RALEIGH, N. C., Feb. 16 (AP) Fourteen young persons, in cluding the 18yearold son of Chancellor J. Carlyle Sitterson of the University of North Carolina, were arrested today in what state officials called the breakup of a major illegal drug operation.

title: Getting the Right Number
description: The orders on telephone rates and service issued yesterday by the State Public Service Commission furnish agreeable new evidence that the commission, as recently revamped by Governor Rockefeller, is tak ing seriously its duty to provide better protection for the public.

title: F.C.C. Is Upheld by Court On Mormon Church License
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 16The United States Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia up held today the Federal Com munications Commission's deci sion to renew the Mormon Church's broadcast licenses in Salt Lake City, despite charges of undue concentration of media control.

title: Czechoslovak Skier Gains Nordic Combined World Title
description: STRBSKE PLEO, Czechoslo vakia, Feb. 16 (AP)  Ladis lav Rygl of Czechoslovakia cut into the Soviet athletes' domination of the Nordic world skiing championships today by winning the 15kilometer cross country race and the combined gold medal.

title: Australia Backs U.S.L.T.A. In Move on South Africa
description: MELBOURNE, Australia, Feb. 16 (AP)The Lawn Tennis As sociation of Australia voted to day to support a United States motion, that could lead to the expulsion of South Africa from the Davis Cup.

title: 20 Bodies Are Recovered In Dominican Plane Crash
description: SANTO DOMINGO, Domini can Republic, Feb. 16 (Reuters) Navy search vessels today recoved the bodies of 20 of the 102 persons killed when a Dominican DC9 crashed into the sea shortly after takeoff here last night.

title: Meany Sees Distinct Possibility of Unemployment Rise to 6%
description: BAL HARBOUR, Fla., Feb. 16 George Meany expressed alarm today at the rising rate of unemployment and said that there was a distinct pos sibility that it might reach 6 per cent.

title: On a Delta River, a Test for Vietnamization
description: MOCHOA, South Vietnam, Feb. 16  Trouble with the South Vietnamese is they're, afraid to take risks, said one United States Navy engineman as he piloted a riverpatrol boat through Indian country near the Camhndian border.

title: Baseball Signings
description: AMERICAN LEAGUE

title: Census Bureau to Use DirectMail Method
description: The Census Bureau opened district offices here yester day to begin the 1970 census to count every American ??live on April 1.

title: Spillage Spreads
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., Feb. 16A 10,000gallon spillage of heavy industrial oil from the tanker that ran aground last Friday spread today from Tampa Bay into Boca Ciega Bay and the Gulf of Mexico.

title: A WAGE INCREASE IS U.A.W. TARGET
description: DETROIT, Feb. 16  The United Auto Workers made public today a proposed shop ping list for the summer's bar gaining with the automobile industry.

title: A.P.A. Will Stage Capote's Grass Harp as a Musical
description: The Association of Produc ing Artists, which operated last season in partnership with the Phoenix Theater, is returning to Broadway this year as the producer of Yellow Drum, a musical version of Truman Capote's The Grass Harp.

title: 2 Vancouver Papers Close
description: VANCOUVER, British Colum bia, Feb. 16 (AP)Canada's thirdlargest city was without its two daily newspapers today as their printer, Pacific Press Ltd., suspended publication. The morning Province, with a nor mal circulation of 109,000, and the afternoon Sun, with about 260,000 daily, had been plagued with production troubles for two weeks.

title: MESSAGE FROM PIKE REPORTED BY WIDOW
description: AUGUSTA, Ga. Feb. 16 (AP) Mrs. Diane Kennedy Pike, widow of the Right Rev. James A. Pike, resigned Bishop of the Episcopal Diocese of California, says that she had had mes sages from her dead husband.

title: FRANCESCATTI PLAYS WITH CLEVELANDERS
description: A Beethoven program  not the last we will hear in 1970, you may be sureprom ised no surprises last night at Carnegie Hall, and delivered none. With George Szell at the head of the Cleveland Orches tra and Zino Francescatti as the evening's soloist, the only sur prise would have been medi ocrity or worse, and musicians of the rank of Mr. Szell and Mr. Francescatti do not deal in such novelties.

title: Yablonski Defendant Moved
description: CLEVELAND, Feb. 16 (AP) One of the four Cleveland per sons charged in connection with the slaying of the United Mine Workers leader, Joseph A. Yablonski, was transferred from the Cuyahoga County Jail here today. United States At torney Robert B. Krupansky said Claude E. Vealey had been moved to a maximum security cell at the Summit County Jail in Akron for his safety and protection. He would not elab orate.

title: Hardin, New Temple Coach, Names Four Football Aides
description: PHILADELPHIA, Feb. 16 (AP) Temple University's new foot ball coach, Wayne Hardin, named four new assistants to day.

title: Soccer Results
description: ENGLISH LEAGUE

title: Stage: X Has No Value
description: THE OTHER STAGE is an experimental workshop for new plays and play wrights in Joseph Papp's Public Theater. Last year, in its first season, it produced No Place to Be Somebody, which in itself justifies the workshop's existence.

title: Combustion Engineering Sets Record
description: Combustion Engineering, Inc., realized a 19.3 per cent in crease in earnings last year on a sales gain of 39.9 per cent, both setting new records as did the backlog of orders, the report of Arthur J. Santry Jr., president, disclosed yesterday. Fourthquarter profits were also well ahead of the pre vious year.

title: No Fault Car Insurance Facing a HeadOn Clash
description: ALBANY, Feb. 16Governor Rockefeller, hinting at the power of lawyers in the Legislature, indicated today he did not ex pect his proposal for a sweeping change in automobile insurance laws to pass this year.

title: TAX COURT DECIDES AGAINST STRATTON
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 16 (AP) The United States Tax Court has ruled that former Illinois Gov. William G. Stratton failed to report $28,458 in taxable income for 1958.

title: BULLETS DEFEAT ROCKETS, 140109
5 in Pistol Concern Accused Of Selling Stolen Weapons
description: Five employes of a pistol factory were arrested yester day and accused of having stolen $10,000 worth of parts, assembled them and sold the weapons in the illegal market.

title: TRADE PACT URGED FOR E.E.C. AND JAPAN
description: TOKYO, Feb. 16JeanFran cois Deniau, foreign affairs commissioner of the European Economic Community, called today for a new trade pact and greatly increased economic re lations between the community and Japan.

title: Eastern Life Posts High
description: The Eastern Life Insurance ported yesterday that its net income last year almost tripled that of 1968. Victor Whitehorn, president, said that earnings in 1969 climbed to a record of $895,347, or 53 cents a share, from $323,049, or 19 cents a share, the year before. Net premium income for 1969 in creased 15 per cent to $10,639, 843, from $9,268,185.

title: China Raises Orders for Japanese Steel
description: TOKYO, Feb. 16Communist China is sharply stepping up its orders of Japanese steel in 1970, industry sources here said to day. It was noted that represen tatives of a number of Japanese steel companies were now in China negotiating additional sales to the Peking Government.

title: 10 Coast Police Hurt In Headquarters Blast
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Feb. 17 (Reuters)  An explosion rocked a main police station here shortly before midnight, injuring 10 policemen, at least three seriously, accord ing to first reports.

title: In The Nation: When the Timing Is Bad
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 16  Representative Jerome R. Wal die of California fully expects to be clobbered Wednesday morning when the House Dem ocrats caucus and vote on his motion of noconfidence in Speaker John McCormack. To him this is just another indica tion of how far out of touch the House of Representatives is with the people it's supposed to represent.

title: Soldier Is Still Hospitalized After Bombing Near Ft. Dix
description: WRIGHTSTOWN, N.J., Feb. 16 (UPI)  One soldier re mained hospitalized today with injuries suffered Saturday night in a bombing attack on an antiwar coffeehouse near Fort Dix.

title: MARKET CHURNS TO NEARSTANDOFF
description: The general market remained on a fairly even keel yester day, but several stocks on the active list displayed substan tial losses.

title: Northeast Airlines Is Sought by Delta
description: Delta Air Lines, Inc., an nounced yesterday that it had asked the Civil Aeronautics Board to let it acquire North east Airlines, Inc., or the car rier's route from Miami to Los Angeles.

title: President Presents Gold Medal Awards To 6 U.S. Scientists
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 16 (AP)  President Nixon presented gold National Medals of Science today to six scientists and said that the nation's preeminence in science was one of the rea sons it was the world leader in progress.

title: ASSEMBLY VOTES REPEAL OF BLAINE
description: ALBANY, Feb 16The As sembly passed by a vote of 105 to 36 tonight its own version of a first step toward repeal of the socalled Blaine amend ment to the Constitution, which forbids state aid to parochial schools.

title: TRUDEAU CRITICIZED FOR AUSTERITY PLAN
description: OTTAWA, Feb. 16The Pre miers of Canada's two most populous provinces, Ontario and Quebec, denounced Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Tru deau's antiinflation program today as wrongheaded and unacceptable because it would result in rising un employment.

title: Body Found in Car Trunk Identified as Tavern Owner
description: UNION CITY, N. J., Feb. 16 The body of a man found gagged and trussed up last night in a 1969 Cadillac was identified today as that of Jerry Vecchione, 51 years old, a Weehawken tavern owner.

title: 2 U.S. Soldiers on Trial In Killings of 2 Vietnamese
description: LONGBINH, South Vietnam, Feb. 16 (UPI)Two United States soldiers went on trial today before separate courts martial on charges of killing 2 South Vietnamese.

title: Card of Thanks
description: GILLISRita M. The family of Rita M. Gil lis acknowledges with grateful appreciation your kind expressions of sympathy.

title: SCHOOL FUND VETO FOR NIXON BACKED IN HOUSE MEASURE
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 16 President Nixon won a major round today in his fight with Congress over curbing inflation by cutting back on Government spending.

title: Gleason's Return to C.B.S. Next Season Is in Doubt
description: It is winter contract time for Jackie Gleason and the Columbia Broadcasting Sys tern. As usual, the air in New York and in Miami Beach, where the show originates, is heavy with talk of programing changes and with concern about longtime contractual relation ships terminated.

title: MERRILL LYNCH FAULTS FEE PLAN
description: Merrill Lynch, Pierce, Fen ner & Smith, Inc., the nation's largest brokerage concern, in dicated yesterday that it would try to bring about changes in the new commission structure proposed by the New York Stock Exchange.

title: Shriver Sees Ceausescu
description: BUCHAREST, Feb. 16 (AP) Sargent Shriver, United States Ambassador to Paris now on an unofficial Rumanian visit, was received today by President Nicolae Ceausescu, the press agency Agerpres reported.

title: KNICKS TO OPPOSE LAKERS TONIGHT
description: Attempting to recover from the shock of seeing Donnie May miss a foul shot, the Knicks will resume National Basketball Association business tonight against the Los Angeles Lakers at Madison Square Garden.

title: Antipollution Move Ordered
description: MADISON, Wis., Feb. 16 (AP)Gov. Warren P. Knowles issued an executive order to day directing his cabinet offi Icers to begin steps to elimi nate sources of pollution under their jurisdiction.

title: INSURER IS SET TO OFFER A TRUST
description: Two major corporations with powerful marketing capability took steps yesterday to make new diversified stock or real estate investments available to investors, both large and small.

title: Linda M. Rorabaugh Is Engaged
description: BRIARCLIFF, N. Y., Feb. 16Miss Linda Margaret Rorabaugh and Kenneth David Campbell Jr., students at Alfred University, plan to be married June 27.

title: U.S. Highway Aide Named
description: The designation of Gerald D Love as Federal Highway Ad ministrator for Region I, mainly the northeast but including Puerto Rico, was announces yesterday. He succeeds John A Hanson, who was killed in a traffic accident last fall. Mr Love, 42 years old, has been in Government service for 2C years. He will have his head quarters in Albany.

title: Cahill Lists $1.6Billion Budget In Jersey, Avoiding Income Tax
description: TRENTON, Feb. 16Gov. William T. Cahill presented the first budget of his new Repub lican administration to the Leg islature today and conceded that there was nothing sensa tional in it.

title: Jersey Standard Acts
description: The trend toward massive new sales of common stock, which promises to be a major force holding stock prices down this year, gathered force yes terday.

title: Article 2  No Title
The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Pollution Bill Introduced
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 16 (AP) Legislation to check pollu tion of the Great Lakes and 26 other lakes and reservoirs was introduced today by Senator Gaylord Nelson, Democrat of Wisconsin.

title: LEVIN CHALLENGES OUSTER AS OFFICER
description: Howard S. Levin filed suit in Superior Court of New Jersey yesterday challenging his ouster Jan. 16 as president and chief executive officer of the Levin Townsend Computer Corpora tion.

title: School Aid Surrender
description: The latest version of the education bill, as it emerged from the House Appropriations Committee, would be a complete victory for the President. Since the White House would be given final say on what to withhold, even the appearance of a compromise on the total dollar amount is in fact an exercise in political facesaving. This sleight of hand would allow Congress and the President respectively to pose as the friend of education and the foe of inflation.

title: The Cast
description: AN EVENT, directed by Vatroslay Ml mica; screenplay (Yugoslav with Eng lish subtitles) by Zeliko Senecic, Mr. Mimica and Kruno (Men, based on a short story by Anton Chekhov; direc tor of photography, Frano Vodooivec; a Jadran Film Production, Zagreb; pre sented by the Walter Reade Organiza tion; released by Continental. At the 34th Street East Theater, east of Third Avenue. Running time: 93 minutes. (Not submitted at this time to the Motion Picture Assocation of Amer ica's Production Code and Rating Administration for rating as to audience suitability.)

title: Kidd Turns Pro and Will Join New Ski Group for Swiss Meet
description: GENEVA, Feb. 16Billy Kidd, who became yesterday the first American to win a gord medal in the men's events of the International. Ski Federa tion's world championships, an nounced today that he had de cided to become a professional.

title: On Location in Scarsdale: When Neighborhood Becomes a Set
description: SCARSDALE, N. Y.The other night, shortly before midnight, a nude young lady ran out of one of the brick and shingle houses on Ther esa Lane, a quiet, crescent shaped hill in the Greenburgh area here.

title: Baby Is Born Over Pacific
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Feb. 16 (UPI)Pan American flight 846 left Tokyo with 122 passengers and arrived in. San Francisco today with 123. Anna Maria Victoria Romero was born while the Boeing 707 jet was high over the Pacific. Her mother, Mrs. Roberta Romero, 30 years old is a doctor and another physician, Dr. Jose M. Sgulla, was among the pas sengers.

title: Holiday in Cairo Makes War Remote
description: CAIRO, Feb. 16The gunfire, bomb blasts, passions and feroc ity of war seemed far away today as the four million people of Cairo feasted, danced and sang under a warm sun. They gathered in parks or any other green area for family picnics, sailed along the Nile in high masted feluccas and, in general, enjoyed themselves.

title: U.S. SAYS MAGNAVOX FIXES RETAIL PRICES
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 16 (UPI) The Federal Trade Commission accused the Magnavox Com pany, Inc., today of fixing prices of consumer electronic products.

title: TURNER, IN NEMESIS, TAKES 5.5 REGATTA
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Feb. 16 Ted Turner of Atlanta, sail ing Nemesis, captured the Scan dinavian Gold Cup regatta for 5.5Meter yachts today.

title: News Summary and Index
description: TUESDAY, FEBRUARY 17, 1970

title: Diane Levbarg To Be a Bride
description: Dr. Morrison S. Levbarg, a pediatrician, and Mrs. Lev barg of New York have announced the engagement of their daughter. Miss Diane Rebecca Levbarg, to John Hugh Robert Book, son of Mr. and Mrs. Leopold Brook of London. A July 1 wedding at the Plaza is planned.

title: KENTUCKY DOWNS GEORGIA BY 11686
description: LEXINGTON, Ky., Feb. 16 (AP)  Dan Issei scored 40 points tonight and led Ken tucky to a 11686 victory over Georgia that moved the Wild cats closer to the Southeastern Conference basketball cham pionship.

title: Espionage Charges Against Russian Dropped, on Condition He Leave the U.S.
description: SEATTLE, Wash., Feb. 16 (AP)  The United States dropped espionage charges to day against a Russian United Nations employe on the condi tion that he leave this country by tomorrow.

title: Industry Responds To Consumerism
description: Formal acknowledgment by representatives of industry that the consumer movement is here to stay and may be pinching some corporate pocketbooks was offered here yesterday as more than 125 top executives began a threeday meeting on consumerism.

title: Advertising
description: If things keep going as they are, perhaps New York's supermarket shoppers will turn out tobe one world's srmartest.

title: Red Wings Recall Popiel
description: DETROIT, Feb. 16 (AP)The Detroit Red Wings today re called Paul Popiel, defenseman, from the Cleveland Barons of the American Hockey League as a replacement for Gary Bergman, who is sidelined with a leg injury.

title: Alcoa Plans Expansion
description: The Aluminum Company of America said yesterday it would expand the capacity of its alumina plant near Point Comfort, Tex., to 1,080,000 tons a year from 900,000 tons. Alumina is the refined form of bauxite, from which aluminum smelters produce the metal itself.

title: MAYOR SET TO GIVE MORGENTHAU OATH
description: Mayor Lindsay plans to swear in his newest Deputy Mayor, Robert M. Morgenthau, tomorrow even though the City Council will not have ap proved funds for the office.

title: GRAY IDOL, $7, FIRST IN SPRINT AT BOWIE
description: BOWIE, Md., Feb. 16 (AP) Joel Kligman's Gray Idol raced to his third consecutive victory today in the Queen Wilhelmina Purse at Bowie race course.

title: TANKERS HELP MOVE ISRAELI PIPELINE OIL
description: TEL AVIV, Feb. 16A fleet of 12 supertankers will carry oil to Israel's new 42inch pipe line, which has gone into oper ation, linking Dath on the Gulf of Aqaba with Ashkelon on the Mediterranean.

title: NETHERLANDS CHOIR IS HEARD AT HUNTER
description: The Netherlands Chamber Choir sang a concert of sacred and secular music at Hunter College Playhouse last night, and for the most part the group showed the same reverential at titude toward both kinds of music.

title: MRS. FREDERICK SCHLAPP
description: BELMAR, N. J., Feb. 16 Mrs. Rose G. Schlapp, who in 1965 retired as supervisor of systems installations with the Remington Rand Company in New York, died today of a liver ailment at her home, at 1101 B Street. She was 69, years old and was the wife of Frederick J. Schlapp.

title: Greenberg and Fried Gain In Class C Squash Racquets
description: Glenn Greenberg of the Yale Club, son of Hank Greenberg, advanced to the third round of the 22d annual Class C Fowler Memorial invitation squash rac quets invitation tournament yesterday by defeating Charles Callison of the Harmonie Club, 155, 154, 158, at the Seventh Regiment Armory.

title: In Memoriam
description: GUDISRalselle. Time has passed but our love and longing for you is with us ever lasting. We miss you so.

title: Apollo II Crew Honored
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 16 (AP) Vice President Agnew pre sented the three Apollo 11 astro nauts today with the National Geographic Society's Huhhard Medal for mankind's first walk on the moon. You have won a place alongside Christopher Co lumbus in American history, Mr. Agnew said to Neil A. Arm strong, Col. Edwin E. Aldrin Jr. and Col. Michael Collins. You have been first.

title: $150Million Offering
Dr. Peyton Rous, Nobel Laureate, Dies
description: Dr. Peyton Roust who 60 years ago demonstrated for the first time that animal can cer can be caused by a virus, died of cancer early yester day at Memorial Hospital in New York. He was 90 years old.

title: 14YEAROLD BOY DIES OF OVERDOSE
description: A 14yearold boy died ap parently of an overdose of pills yesterday only hours after the Board of Education said it had no funds for security guards to fight the narcotics problem at the school he attended.

title: Frazier Is Looking to Rock and Clay
description: Free at last. Joe Frazier's voice has sounded better on the 45 r.p.m. records he has made, but the words were all that mattered on this solo.

title: 4 U.S. Clergymen Seek Aid Of Pontiff to Visit P.O.W.'s
description: ROME, Feb. 16 (AP)Four clergymen from New York, representing four faiths, flew to Rome today to seek the support of Pope Paul VI for their attempt to visit Ameri can prisoners of war in North Vietnam.

title: Banker Heads Center
description: Lloyd Sherwood, an invest ment banker, has been elected president of the Lincoln Square Neighborhood Center, a settle ment house at 218 West 64th Street. Mr. Sherwood, who is a vice president of the firm of Kidder, Peabody & Co., lives in Scarsdale. The center provides a range of services, including a day nursery and daytime and evening programs for young people.

title: A Rose By Any Other Name
description: ATHOUGH the United States fancies it self as being the most enlightened nation on the globe, it ain't neces sarily so. When it comes to measurements, we are practically primitive and now are becoming a shrinking island on a universal sea. Even those traditional diehards, the British, are abandoning the clumsy yards, feet and inches that they invented and be queathed to us. They are in a process of joining the rest of the world by adopting the metric system.

title: Contempt Sentences Are Raising Judicial Questions
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 16 Judge Julius J. Hoffman ap pears to have skirted the edges of several judical precedents in sentencing two defense lawyers in the Chicago conspiracy trial to long prison terms for con tempt. According to the author of the book. The Contempt Power, the fouryear, 13day sentence imposed on one attorney. William M. Kunst er, is apparently the longest sen tence for contempt ever imposed in an American court. Judge Hoffman sentenced a second defense lawyer, Leon ard L Weinglass, to 20 months, 5 days in prison. In each case, the lawyers were said to have used insulting and contemptu ous tactics in the course of the long, frequently bizarre and raucus trial, which is now in the hands of the jury.

title: Designers Turn to Handbags as a New World of Style to Conquer
description: NOW that alligators have gone out of favor, what kind of handbag can a woman of fashion carry over her arm these days?

title: Scientists and Students Doubt Heroin Will Gain on Campus
description: Scientists and students are finding some evidence of a trend toward increasing use of heroin on college campuses, but there is strong doubt that this addictive drug will achieve widespread popularity.

title: 3 STATIONS CANCEL N.E.T. SHOW ON U.S.
description: Three outlets of the National Educational Television network last night canceled a contro versial program on United States military interventions, contending that it presented an oversimplified, misleading and unbalanced view.

title: Volpe Restricting Highway Building
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 16  Transportation Secretary John A Volpe, whose highway plans around the country have been opposed by people living in the path of proposed construction, said today that no new proj ects would be approved unless adequate replacement hous ing was provided first.

title: ADDONIZIO ENTERS SCHOOLS DISPUTE
description: NEWARK, Feb. 16Mayor Hugh J. Addonizio entered this city's school dispute today and brought both sides together with a mediator tonight. The negotiations were to continue around the clock in an effort to end the strike by teachers that is now in its third week.

title: Blaine Provision Born 75 Years Ago
description: The Blaine amendment, a misnomer for Article XI, Sec tion 3 of the New York State Constitution, is a 75yearold provision that specifically pro hibits direct or indirect state aid to parochial schools. It reads:

title: A LeftWing Italian Editor Is Freed Pending Appeal
description: ROME, Feb. 16 A Rome appeals court today granted a leftwing editor, Francesco Tolin, provisional liberty pend ing his appeal of his conviction on charges that he had used his weekly newspaper to incite striking workers to crime.

title: Who, Me? Cabbies Protest on Cursing
description: Zaven Demirdjian raised his arms above his head in a Joblike gesture. As God is my judge, he declared in a quivering voice, I never cursed! Never!

title: U.S. HOPES FOR GAINS ON A GERMWAR BAN
description: GENEVA, Feb. 16Gerard C. Smith, Director of the United States Arms Control and Dis armament Agency, said today that he hoped for early progress at the disarmament conference here on a ban on germ warfare.

title: ELLIS SAYS HE LET FRAZIER RUN BOUT
description: The bull had gored the mata dor, but now in the sanctuary of his dressing room, Jimmy Ellis was assuring his friends he had not been seriously hurt.

title: Dayan's Wife Arrives Here
description: Mrs. Ruth Dayan, wife of Gen. Moshe Dayan, Israeli De fense Minister, arrived at Kennedy Airport yesterday afternoon from Israel to take part in a fundraising tour for the United Jewish Appeal.

title: Unsung Army Pitches Yankees' Camp
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., Feb. 16  Baseball training, that distinctive American rite of spring enjoyed by the privileged few and absorbed vicariously by the envious many, begins officially for the New York Yankees to morrow. But the Yankees who often don't get their names in the papers have been at work for some time already.

title: Most Comply on Integration, But Macon Mayor Is Defiant
description: MACON, Ga., Feb. 16 (AP) The Mayor of Macon and about 30 other white parents defied a courtordered desegregation plan today by refusing to trans fer their children to other schools in Bibb County.

title: A TRADE SURPLUS LISTED BY BRITAIN
description: LONDON, Feb. 16  Brit ain reported today a $93.6mil lion trade surplus for January, the sixth successive month that exports exceeded imports. The continued improvement in the longtroublesome trade ac count invigorated financial markets.

title: Kern Named Army Aide
description: WEST POINT, N. Y., Feb. 16 (AP)Fred Kern Jr., an assist ant football coach at Virginia Military Institute last season was named today as the de fensive line coach by the Army. He succeeds Bill Par cells, who resigned recently to accept a position at Florida State.

title: Tight Policy Kept, Reserve Discloses
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 16The Federal Reserve's Open Market Committee, despite some recent opinion to the contrary, did not make any formal change in the tightmoney policy at its meet ings of Nov. 25 and Dec. 16, it was disclosed today.

title: Activist Lawyer With a Cause
description: NTIL a few years ago, the first job for many a bright, ambitious law gradu ate was clear: a Wall Street firm, or clerkship to a judge, or perhaps a time as an as sistant district attorney. Now, some young lawyers are choosing not the safe, tradi tional route within the pro fession but a pre carious position at its flank: defend ing radical causes and advancing radical solutions. In the forefront of those who have chosen the second course is Gerald Bernard Lef court, a 27yearold lawyer whose clients include Abbie Hoffman, Mark Rudd and two of the defendants in the Black Panther conspiracy case here.

title: COLORADO STUDIES RADIATION PERIL
description: DENVER, Feb. 16The Colo rado Health Department is ex panding its search for danger ous radiation levels in private homes, businesses and public buildings in the western part of the state.

title: Foster Children Win Right to Court Hearing
description: Children won the right yes terday to hearings in Family Court to determine what is best for their own welfare. Foster parents also gained legal ground.

title: 2 ASSEMBLY SEATS TO BE VOTED TODAY
description: Voters in two city Assembly districts, one in Queens and one in the Bronx, will fill va cancies today that were caused by recent resignations. The polls will be open from 6 A.M. to 7 P.M.

title: Bridge:
description: WELLINGTON, New Zea land, Feb. 16The Unit ed States touring team, in cluding Robert Jordan, Arthur Robinson, Bill Root, Mrs. Dorothy Hayden and this writer, won one and lost one in two short matches here tonight.

title: DANCERS DISPLAY SENSE OF THEATER
description: Intelligence was the hallmark of last night's debut at the Cubiculo of the Chamber Arts/ Dance Players, headed by Joan Miller.

title: The Theater: DoubleBill at La Mama
Article 6  No Title
DIVIDEND MEETINGS TODAY
description: Aaronson Eros Sirs

title: Spear Against Guns: An African Rebel Dies in the Fight Against the FrenchBacked Chad Government
L. I. U. Five Tops Kings, 7057; C.C.N.Y. Beaten by Bridgeport
description: Walter Jones and Mike Can nata scored 16 points each to pace Long Island University to a 7057 victory over Kings Col lege last night on the winner's court in Brooklyn. The victory, was the 13th in 20 games for L. I. U. this season.

title: Spain Returns Leftist Doomed by Moroccans
description: MADRID. Feb. 16 Spain has turned over to Morocco prominent Moroccan Socialist who is under sentence of death In his own country.

title: McMahon Sets Course Mark In Capturing 19Mile Run
description: NEWTON, Mass., Feb. 16 (AP)Pat McMahon, a Lowell schoolteacher from Ireland, set a course record today in win ning Silver Lake Dodge's fourth annual Washington's Birthday road race from Hop kinton to Newton.

title: Alter Fall From Olympic Glory, Beamon Is Ready to Jump Back
description: Success almost ruined Bob Beamon. It created problems that created more problems.

title: charter Offer by U.S. Lines Extended to Other Concerns
description: United States Lines offered yesterday to charter ships to other shipping companies on terms similar to those under which it has agreed to charter 16 modern containerships to SeaLand Service, Inc., a sub sidiary of R. J. Reynolds To bacco Company.

title: Mayor Tells Queens Chamber State Aid Holds Key to Budget
description: Mayor Lindsay went to Queens yesterday not to hold out an empty hand but to offer a friendly ear.

title: New Outbreak of Tuberculosis Is Eyed by Doctors
description: Mass tuberculosis testing be gan on Capitol Hill yesterday after six cases of the lung dis ease, two of them fatal, were detected there in the last few months.

title: Susan Etess Plans Bridal
description: GROSSINGER, N. Y., Feb. 16Dr. and Mrs. A. David Etess of Grossinger and New York have announced the en gagement of their daughter, Miss Susan Etess, to Barry Fallick, son of Mr. and Mrs. Mac Fallick of Brooklyn, New York.

title: Pittsburgh Aide Withdraws
description: PITTSBURGH, Feb. 16 (UPI) William H. Hewitt, a Penn State associate professor ap pointed a week ago as Pitts burgh Public Safety Director, at $25,000 a year, asked today that the appointment be with drawn. Mayor Peter F. Fla herty said that Mr. Hewitt had told him the post would cause the professor severe financial hardship.

title: EXECUTIVE CHANGES
description: Robert A. Klath, F. Kent Mit chel, David K. Evans and James H.. Whitcomb have been elect ed corporate vice presidents of the General Foods Corpora tion. Mr. Klath has also been promoted to controller of the corporation and remains direc tor of corporate planning.

title: HAMILTON SIGNS YANKEE CONTRACT
description: Steve Hamilton, the left handed relief pitcher who is the senior member of the team at the age of 33, signed yester day for his eighth season with the New York Yankees. Con tract terms were not disclosed.

title: EASTERN HOCKEY LEAGUE
Assembly RollCall on Blaine
description: ALBANY, Feb. 16Following is the rollcall vote by which the Assembly today approved repeal of the socalled Blaine amendment:

title: MANSON IS DENIED CHANGE OF VENUE
description: LOS ANGELES, Feb. 16 (AP) Superior Court Judge Mal colm M. Lucas ruled today that publicity about the Sharon Tate murders would not make it im possible for Charles Manson to get a fair trial here and denied a request to change the trial site.

title: Brinkley Announces Huntley's Departure From N.B.C. Aug. 1
description: The retirement of Chet Hunt ley from the National Broad casting Company's evening newscast was formally an nounced last night by his part ner, David Brinkley.

title: Dr. Frank Boudreau, 83, Dead; Long a Leader in Public Health
description: AMHERST, Mass., Feb. 16 Dr. Frank G. Boudreau, an epidemiologist and former pres ident of the Milbank Memorial Fund in New York, died in the Amherst Nursing Home on Saturday. He was 83 years old.

title: A Correction
description: In a story in Sunday's New York Times concerning the wives of auto executives, Henry Ford 2d was described as the owner of the Ford Motor Company rather than its chairman and chief execu tive officer. Ford is a public ly owned company in which Mr. Ford holds a large block of stock.

title: Psychiatrist Weds Lynne Stetson
description: Miss Lynne Stetson, daugh ter of Mr. and Mrs. Lee Clark Stetson of Dallas, be came the bride of Capt. David Vickers Forrest, U.S.A.F., a psychiatrist and the son of Mr. and Mrs. Melbourne A. Forrest of East Hills, N.Y., yesterday in the Episcopal Church of the Transfigura tion, (The Little Church Around the Corner.

title: DR. SAMUEL WILLIS JR.
description: BRONXVILLE, N. Y., Feb. 16 Dr. Samuel Waring Willis Jr., a surgeon, died in Lawrence Hospital here last night a few hours after suffering a stroke. He was 37 years old.

title: Berman and Wife Separate
description: Frederic S. Berman, the 42 year old former City Rent and Rehabilitation Commissioner, and Mrs. Berman, the former Joan Honey Bernstein, filed a memo of a legal separation yesterday in State Supreme Court in Manhattan. They were married in 1959 and have two sons.

title: Observer: Money
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 16 After almost a decade of pros perity pessimists are saying that hard times are just around the corner. Inflation, rising unem ployment and a sinking stock market have reminded many persons that even in America the money can stop.

title: Rep. Cramer Stiffens Stand on Oil Spillage
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 16  Representative William C. Cra mer, a key figure in the House Senate stalemate over the ques tion of liability for the cost of cleaning up oil spills, indicated today that he had hardened his position as a result of the spill from a tanker off St. Peters burg, Fla., his home district.

title: SPY FOR SOVIET SAYS HE BETRAYED TUNNEL
description: MOSCOW, Feb. 16 (UPI) George Blake, the convicted Soviet spy who escaped from a British prison in 1966, said in a newspaper article today he had betrayed a BritishAmerican spy tunnel in Berlin.

title: Books of The Times
description: AFTER 55 years, Hermann Hesse's Rosshalde has at last been made available in English. It is a transi tional novel. Hesse stopped meditating on the anguish of adolescence to ponder for a while the alienation of the artist before groping toward his ultimate role: as a tourist among mysteries. Indeed, at the end of Rosshalde. the artistprotagonist Veraguth, having taken leave of the sweet twilight of youth...without resignation, full of defiance and ven turesome passion, is about to embark on a journeyto the East, of course. The odd agency of Veraguth's deliver ance from a love less marriage and a life that has stagnated in the swampy lake of in decision is the death of his young son. Pierre. Since Pierre, before dy ing of meningitis, moons about the Ross halde estate talking to the flowers and feeling sorry for himself, Hesse gets to touch all the usual bases.

title: Business Records
description: ASSIGNMENTS

title: Jury for Chicago 7 Ends Its Third Day Without a Verdict
description: CHICAGO, Feb. 16The jury in the Chicago conspiracy trial completed its third day of de liberations today without reach ing a verdict.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: Frazier Flattens Ellis and Wins Undisputed Heavyweight Title
description: Actually smiling throughout a savage assault that typified his unstylish but undefeated career, Joe Frazier succeeded Cassius Clay last night as the undisputed world heavyweight champion by recording a fifth round knockout over Jimmy Ellis at Madison Square Garden.

title: PACIFIC ROCK FLOW HELD TO BE VARIED
description: The flow of rock toward the edges of the Pacific Ocean, which has become evident in recent years, has not been a uniform process but has varied both in speed and direction.

title: School Activists Praised By a State Commission
description: ALBANY. Feb. 16  A spe cial legislative commission to day released the results of its sevenmonth study on the causes of campus protests with praise for the sincerity and ?? of most stuaent activ ists arid recommendations for educators, politicians and the students themselves.

title: NEW RULES URGED ON COOPERATIVES
description: The conversion of apartment buildings from rental to co operative status would be subject to more stringent regu lation under the terms of a bi partisan bill introduced in the Legislature yesterday by four Manhattan legislators.

title: House Passes Bill Doubling Aid for Fish Conservation
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 16 (UPI)  A bill to more than double Federal assistance for certain commercial fish conser vation programs over the next four years was passed by the House today and sent to the Senate.

title: Missile Belle Wins by 3 Lengths in Hialeah Stakes Race
description: MIAMI, Feb. 16 (UPI)John A. Morris's Missile Belle, the evenmoney favorite of 18,488 fans, galloped to an easy vic tory at Hialeah today in the first running of the $31,300 Indian Creek Stakes of 11/16 miles on grass.

title: 91Day Bill Rates Off to 6.777% At Treasury's Weekly Auction
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 16  Treasury bill rates declined dramatically at today's auction to the lowest levels since last June, the Government reported late this afternoon.

title: Article 4  No Title
description: PREPARA??

title: Czech Communism Tries to Rekindle Proletarian Spirit
description: PRAGUE, Feb. 16The Com munist party celebrates the 22d anniversary this month of its takeover of Czechoslovakia, trying to rekindle some of the proletarian fire in a disheart ened people.

title: Louise B. Turner Prospective Bride
description: BRONXVILLE, N. Y., Feb. 16Miss Louise Binford Tur ner, a senior at Smith Col lege, and Seaman Robert Boris Isard of the Naval Re serve plan to be married.

title: Foreman Takes 16th in Row, Beating Peralta
description: Gregorio Peralta of Argen tina, a 35yearold heavyweight with 14 years of boxing behind him, almost closed the genera tion gap last night in his 10 round fight with unbeaten George Foreman, the Olympic champion.

title: MUSKIE ENTERS RACE FOR 3D SENATE TERM
description: PORTLAND, Me., Feb. 16  Senator Edmund S. Muskie an nounced here today that he would seek reelection this year to a third term in the United States Senate, paving the way for a possible Presidential bid in 1972.

title: Teachers Gain Support
description: BAL HARBOUR, Fla., Feb. 16 The executive council of the A.F.L.C.I.O. voted support today to the Newark teachers.

title: Kaunda Tells Rogers U.S. Should Help End White Minority Rule
description: LUSAKA, Zambia, Feb. 16 President Kenneth D. Kaunda of Zambia said today that the United States should bear the main responsibility among the great powers for helping Afri cans to end white minority rule in Southern Africa.

title: Governor Would Sign Quarterhorse Bet Bill
description: ALBANY, Feb. 16 (UPI) Governor Rockefeller said to day he would sign a bill le galizing parimutuel betting on quarterhorse racing if the Legislature acts favorably on it.

title: 3 Die in New Orleans Blast
description: NEW ORLEANS, Feb. 16 (AP) Three men were killed today when a gasoline explosion and fire ripped the workshop of a city sanitation department ga rage. A mechanic at the garage said the explosion occurred mo ments after a gasoline pump that he was using to fill a truck stopped working. He said he managed to get the pump working but gasoline fumes caught fire.

title: U. S. Steel Output Off
description: The pace of United States steel production this year has fallen behind the recordbreaking 1969 rate for the first time, the American Iron and Steel Institute reported yester day.

title: Dionne Warwick Honored
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Feb. 16 (AP)The Hasty Pudding Club, Harvard University's oldest the atrical group, announced today that it had chosen the singer Dionne Warwick as its 1970 Woman of the Year. The club's' award is given annually to a woman in the arts.

title: Comedic Francaise: A Thriving Tradition
description: Far from being shaken by France's political and social upheaval in 1968, the Comdie Franaise has emerged from it unscathed. Even untouched.

title: Soviet and Chile Sign Pact
description: MOSCOW, Feb. 16 (AP)The Soviet Union and Chile signed an agreement on cultural and scientific cooperation today. The agreement provides for ex changes in science and educa tion, public health, literature and art, sports, radio and tele vision.

title: 100 COUNTRIES BEGIN PARLEY ON INTELSAT
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 16 Representatives of nearly 100 nations gathered today at the State Department in a new effort to define permanent permanent arrangements for managing international satellite communications.

title: Georgia Senate Votes Suffrage for Women
description: ATLANTA, Ga., Feb. 16 (AP)After nearly 50 years, Georgia has finally ratified the 19th Amendment to the United States Constitution, which gives women the right to vote.

title: Catholic Missionaries Fined For Entering Nigeria Illegally
description: LAGOS, Nigeria, Feb. 16 (Reuters)Twentynine Roman Catholic missionaries detained at Port Harcourt have been fined 100 Nigerian pounds (about $280) each on charges of entering Nigeria illegally, it was announced today.

title: Mortimer Howard, Pianist On Radio and TV, Is Dead
description: Mortimer Howard, a vaude ville pianist and the Uncle Morty of The Horn & Har dart Children's Hour on radio and television, died at Cale donian Hospital in Brooklyn on Sunday after suffering a heart attack. He was 74 years old and lived at 1395 East 19th Street in Brooklyn.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: Draft. President Nixon ap pointed Col. Dee Ingold, 65, a native of Milwaukee, to serve as interim director of Selective Service. A White House spokesman said a new director would be named in the near future to replace Gen. Lewis B. Hershey, who left office today.

title: GAIN IS REPORTED BY CINCINNATI GAS
description: The Cincinnati Gas and Elec tric Company and its subsid iaries reported yesterday gains in operating revenues and net income for 1969. The annual report put operating revenues at $247,291,996 against $225, 042,556 a year earlier.

title: Revenue Properties, Ltd., Wins Dismissal of Charge
description: TORONTO, Feb. 16(Cana dian Press)A charge against Revenue Properties, Ltd., of To ronto that it had failed to state the source and application of funds in its 1968 annual report was dismissed today.

title: L.I.U. Returns to National College Basketball Picture Next Season
description: Long Island University will return next season to the na tional college basketball promi nence it enjoyed 20 years ago during the coaching days of Clair Bee.

title: Hospital Group Will Honor Aide at L. I. Aged Home
description: Monroe Mitchel, administra tor of the A. Holly Patterson Home for the Aged and Infirm in Uniondale, L. I., has been se lected as Young Hospital Ad ministrator of the Year by the American College of Hospital Administrators.

title: Powless Resting Well
description: MADISON, Wis., Feb. 16 (AP)John Powless, University of Wisconsin basketball coach, was reported resting comfort ably in St. Mary's Hospital to day following his collapse with a stomach ailment during a practice session yesterday.

title: 747 Service to Tokyo Set
description: Pan American World Air ways announced yesterday that jumbo jet 747 service from Los Angeles to Tokyo, via Hono lulu, would start March 10. Three other routes with the Boeing 747 have been opened previously.

title: Parvin Plummets As the Amex Allows Trading to Resume
description: One of the sharpest daily price declines in a stock in years highlighted the activity on the American Stock Ex change yesterday as the corn mon shares of the ParvinDohr mann Company, which had not been traded since Oct. 10, plummeted 33, points to end the session at 35.

title: Maki Pleads Innocent as Trial Opens
description: OTTAWA, Feb. 16 (Cana dian Press)Wayne Maki of the St. Louis Blues said today he was only trying to protect himself and his hockey career when he swung his stick at Ted Green of the Boston Bruins in an exhibition game here last September.

title: Hershey Aide, a Retired Colonel, Named Acting Director of Draft
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 16 (AP) Col. Dee Ingold, a longtime aide to Gen. Lewis B. Hershey, the draft director, was named acting director today. He said he would attempt no policy changes during what he ex pects to be a brief term in office.

title: ABRAM EXPECTED TO BID FOR SENATE
description: Morris B. Abram, president of Brandeis University, has de cided to seek the Democratic nomination for the United States Senate.

title: Czechs Can Still Joke, But the Flavor Is Wry
description: PRAGUE, Feb. 16Despite the trend of events, the Czechoslovaks have not lost their sense of humor. Among the jokes circulating about their plight is the following:

title: Nominees Selected For Oscar Awards Slated for April 7
description: Anne of the Thousand Days, Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid, Midnight Cowboy, Hello, Dolly! and the French  made Z were nominated yesterday for an Oscar as best picture of 1969.

title: College Stars Play March 28
description: JACKSONVILLE, Fla., Feb. 16 (AP)The EastWest College AllStar basketball game will be played March 28 at Indiana polis. Twentytwo seniors will be picked to play the Saturday afternoon game to be televised by the Hughes Sports Network.

title: DR. IRVING F. KLEIN
description: Dr. Irving F. Klein, adminis trator of Sea View Hospital and Home in Staten Island, died at his residence on the hospital grounds yesterday morning. Dr. Klein, who was 65 years old, apparently died in his sleep, a city health serv ices official said.

title: Assembly Plan Would Tax Wealthy Who Pay Nothing
description: ALBANY, Feb. 16The Republican leadership of the Assembly recommended today a taxreform program that would establish a minimum income tax to reach wealthy taxpayers who now escape all state taxes.

title: ROBERT G. WHYTOCK
description: Robert G. Whytock, a vice president of the Chase Manhat tan Bank, died Sunday after heart attack in his home at 97 Lortel Avenue, Castleton Cor ners, S. I. He was 60 years old.

title: PRICE LEVELS DIP AT MINK AUCTION
description: Eugene K. Denton, the 80 yearold founder of Tailored Woman who retired after 48 years in business and then in 1968 reopened his store on Madison Avenue, yesterday pur chased the top bundle of Rova lia mutation mink in a once ayear sale at Hudson's Bay Company here.

title: U.S. Water Program Is Scored by City
description: City pollution control of ficials are increasingly con cerned that President Nixon's program to clean up the na tion's waters is not only inade quate but may even delay the actual cleanup.

title: LEGISLATORS HELD BRIBERY TARGETS
description: A series of attempts to bribe three state legislatorsinclud ing one said to have been made as an Assemblyman delivered a speech from the floor of the Assemblywere charged in a perjury indictment announced yesterday by Manhattan Dis trict Attorney Frank S. Hogan.

title: Opposition to Lowering Voting Age Laid to TV Coverage of College Unrest
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 16  Television coverage of disrup tive college students is a major factor in keeping states from granting the vote to 18year olds, according to witnesses who appeared today before a Senate Judiciary subcommittee considering a constitutional amendment to lower the voting age nationally.

title: Celtics Beat Warriors
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Feb. 16 (AP)Don Nelson's basket with 11 seconds to play tonight sealed a 117114 victory for the Boston Celtics over the San Francisco Warriors.

title: Kennedy, Ill With Pneumonia Votes No on Judge Carswel
description: PALM BEACH, Fla., Feb. 16 (AP)Senator Edward M. Ken, nedy, ill here with pneumonia voted from his sickbed today against Senate Judiciary Com mittee approval of the Supreme Court nomination of Judge G. Harrold Carswell.

title: Football Signings
description: AMERICAN CONFERENCE

title: Soviet Penalizes Workers Changing Jobs Too Often
description: MOSCOW, Feb. 16  Soviet authorities have apparently im posed new regulations on work ers as part of the nationwide campaign to end violations of labor discipline and increase productivity.

title: Letters to the Editor of The Times
description: ABM Review Urged

title: Air Traffic Unit and F.A.A. Attempt to Avoid Slowdown
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 16 (AP)  Federal Aviation Ad ministration officials and a group of dissident air traffic controllers spent several hours with a Federal mediator today in an effort to avoid a nation wide air traffic slowdown.

title: Thant in Plea for Buddhist Shrine
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Feb. 16  Secretary General Thant, a Buddhist, sought the help of governments today in developing the birthplace of Buddha, in the foothills of the Himalayas, as a major religious shrine.

title: West of Lakers Sets Pace In Pro Basketball Scoring
description: Jerry West of the Los Ange les Lakers led the National Bas ketball Association's scorers by a wide margin in the official statistics issued yesterday for games played through Sunday.

title: PENGUINS TRIUMPH OVER FLYERS, 4 TO 2
description: PITTSBURGH, Feb. 17 (AP) The Pittsburgh Penguins, scored three goals, then held, off a Philadelphia rally to de Feat the Flyers, 42, in a Na tional Hockey League game tonight.

title: Market Place:
description: IS General Motors a better value than Avon Products; the. Whirlpool Corporation better than Johnson & John son; the Kearney & Trucker Corporation, the overthe counter machinetool stock, better than Dorr Oliver, and the Cummins Engine Com pany better than I.B.M.?

title: Bayh Optimistic on Voting Age of 18 After the White House Backs Measure
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 17 Senate subcommittee hearings on a Constitutional amendment to lower the voting age to 18 recessed today with the sub committee's chairman guarded ly optimistic that an amend ment would be reported to the Senate in the next few months.

title: Activities To Interest The Young
29 ARE ARRESTED IN NEWARK STRIKE
description: NEWARK, Feb. 17  Twentynine more Newark school teachers were arrested on picket lines this morning, raising to 91 the number of teachers, union officials and sympathizers seized since the strike began Feb. 2.

title: Odyssey of Robert Kennedy Unfolded
description: THE tragic odyssey of Rob ert F. Kennedy was re counted again last night in David L. Wolper's document ary on the American Broad casting Company's television network.

title: Daughter of Stalin Discloses '69 Talk With Soviet Visitor
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Feb. 17 Svetlana Alliluyeva said to night that she had what might have been semiofficial ad vice last spring from a Soviet visitor to the United States to keep quiet and not to give up Soviet citizenship or get married in the United States.

title: TEXAN MAPS APPEAL OF CANDIDACY DENIAL
description: AUSTIN, Tex., Feb. 17 State Senator Ralph W. Hall headed for Washington today to see if the Supreme Court would lift the legal bar against his candidacy for Governor.

title: 6 Hurt in Police Station Blast As Violence Hits Coast Cities
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Feb. 17 A wave of violence, including the second police station bomb ing within five days, struck cities around San Francisco Bay last night.

title: Mrs. Henry Rosner, Taught English in the High Schools
description: Mrs. Sophie Blanche Rosner, retired high school teacher and wife of Henry J. Rosner, the city's Assistant Commissioner of Social Services, died yester day at Beth Abraham Home in the Bronx after a long illness. She was 62 years old and lived at 12 East 86th Street.

title: Health Plan Foreseen
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 17The American Hospital Association's new president, Mark Berke, forecast today that the United States would have a national health insurance system in three to six years.

title: GEN. GELSTON, LED MARYLAND GUARD
description: BALTIMORE, Feb. 17 (AP) Maj. Gen. George Morris Gel ston, who as head of the Mary land National Guard and as Baltimore Police Commissioner was known for his calm handling of racial disorders, died today. He was 57 years old.

title: Canadians Reorganize
description: OTTAWA, Feb. 17 (AP) Transport Minister Don Jamie son is reorganizing his depart ment to make separate admin istrations for air, land, water and Arctic trnasport, in a move for more profit, he announced today.

title: Democrats Win Elections in Bronx and Queens
description: Two Democrats, Emanuel R. Gold and Alan Hochberg, were elected to the State Assembly yesterday in special elections to fill vacant seats from heav ily Democratic areas of Queens and the Bronx.

title: Security National
description: The Security National Bank Seeking Entree Into City Bank, which has long been a power in banking on Long Island, an nounced yesterday a $58mil lion deal that could give it a longsought entree into the New York City market.

title: 6 SEIZED IN YONKERS IN A NUMBERS RAID
description: YONKERS, Feb. 17 (AP) The police used a noknock warrant last night in a raid on what was described as a $100 millionayear numbers ring.

title: Rev. Dr. Simon C. Kramer Dies; Led Hebrew Theological College
description: ROCHESTER, Minn., Feb. 17 Rev. Dr. Simon G. Kramer, president of the Hebrew Theo logical College at Chicago, died at St. Mary's Hospital, part of the Mayo Clinic here, this morning. He was 67 years old.

title: Seymour Says Campaign Against Crime Is Effective
description: Whitney North Seymour Jr. said last night that the current campaign by Federal, state and local law enforcement agencies was making great inroads into organized crime.

title: Action Urged by GATT
description: GENEVA, Feb. 17The in ternational trading community was urged today to gird its forces for a major assault on barriers to the free flow of goods across frontiers in 1971.

title: Change in City Welfare Policy Urged To Spur JobTaking and Save Families
description: A study calling for a change in attitudes toward receiving welfare here  aimed at en couraging work and keeping families together  is being circulated by the Center fort New York City Affairs. The center is part of the New School for Social Research.

title: Report of Economic Group Calls for Government on Two Levels in Metropolitan Areas
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 17 The way to make America's crisisridden metropolitanarea governable is to create govern ments with two tiers, a pres Itigious corporate organization recommended today.

title: Drive Against Class Enemies Reported Intensified by Peking
description: HONG KONG, Feb. 17  A manysided campaign against what Peking terms class ene mies, capitalist tendencies, cor ruption, theft, embezzlement and other acts of opposition to the Maoist social order appears to have reached a high pitch in Communist China.

title: CONFESSION UPHELD IN BOMB CASE HERE
description: A motion by a defendant in a bombingconspiracy case to suppress a confession he madeli when he was arrested was denied in Federal Court yester day.

title: Japan's Reserves Hit Record Level Jan. 31
description: TOKYO, Feb. 17 (AP)  Japan's gold and foreign currency reserves reached a record of $3.61billion at the end of January, the Finance Ministry said today.

title: Letters to the Editor of The Times
description: Defense Spending

title: Kansas City Sports Complex Named for Harry S Truman
description: KANSAS CITY, Feb. 17 (AP) Former President Harry S Truman's name was given to day to a sports complex being built at the eastern edge of Kansas City.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: RECITAL IS GIVEN BY ZARA NELSOVA
description: If all cello recitals could be as pleasing to look at and listen to as the one given by Zara Nelsova at Alice Tully Hall last night, the cello world would be the better for it.

title: Labor Council Supports National Health Insurance
description: BAL HARBOUR, Fla., Feb. 17  The executive council of the A.F.L.C.I.O. strongly supported today a program for national health insurance that would provide comprehensive care for all Americans.

title: Judith V. Gants Plans Nuptials
description: WHITE PLAINS, Feb 17 Albert Milfred Gants, candi date for the Republican nomination for United States Representative from the 26th Congressional District, and Mrs. Gants have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Judith Valerie Gants, to Joel Marcus, son of Mr. and Mrs. Irving Marcus of Hewlett, L. I. The wed ding will take place here July 12.

title: DOROTHY ADAMS
description: Dorothy Adams, executive vice president of Clyne Maxon, Inc., advertising agency, died of a heart attack Monday in her home at 25 Sutton Place. She was 62 years old.

title: FOLA LA FOLLETTE, SUFFRAGE LEADER
description: Fola La Follette, a suffrage leader, actress and daughter of the late Senator Robert M. La Follette of Wisconsin, died of pneumonia yesterday at a hospital in Arlington, Va. She was 87 years old.

title: Welfare Clients Go to Albany To Lobby for Additional Aid
description: ALBANY, Feb. 17Welfare recipients moved by caravan into the Capitol today for a round of protest ranging from quiet lobbying for more relief to an angry pounding by a crowd of hundreds on Governor Rockefeller's office door.

title: ADDONIZIO'S LAWYER FILES FOR DISMISSAL
description: NEWARK, Feb. 17 (UPI)A lawyer for Mayor Hugh J. Ad donizio filed motions in Fed eral Court yesterday asking for the dismissal of extortion and taxevasion charges against him.

title: Article 1  No Title
Auto Group Is Cracking Down, Demanding Saler Race Tracks
description: ON THE door of the dining room where Lester Sea songood, insurance counsel to the Sports Car Club of America, was giving a lunch eon for the wives of S.C.C.A. officers, Seasongood had pasted a New Yorker car toon. It showed an insurance broker telling a client: You know, on second thought I don't want to sell you any insurance. You look like the kind of wise guy who would put in claims. The clipping could not have been more appropriate, for much of the club's conven tion last weekend in New Orleans was devoted to the cost of insurance for races, which has more than doubled for 1970.

title: Granatelli Picks Andretti
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Feb. 17 (AP) Mario Andretti, the winner of the 1969 Indianapolis 500 mile auto race, was named to day to drive again in the event for Andy Granatelli.

title: Article 2  No Title
Hank lba's Son Dismissed As Coach of Memphis Five
description: MEMPHIS, Feb. 17 (UPI) Henry (Moe) Iba, son of Okla homa State's famed basketball coach, Hank Iba, was dis missed today as Memphis State basketball coach.

title: 25 Form Council to Make Scientists Aware of Consequences of Their Work
description: Twentyfive scientists, in cluding five Nobel laureates, have formed an organization to sharpen the awareness of the scientific community, especially biologists, to social and po litical consequences of their work.

title: NEW AIRPORTS SEEN NEEDED BY CHICAGO
description: CHICAGO, Feb. 17Najeeb E. Halaby, president of Pan American World Airways, said here today that he believed it would take 10 years to provide Chicago with the airport facili ties it needs to handle super sonic and jumbo planes plus conventional traffic.

title: BAHR WILL BRIEF BRANDT ON TALKS
description: MOSCOW, Feb. 17 (Reuters) The special West German envoy, Egon Bahr, said today, after his fifth meeting with the Soviet Foreign Minister, Andrei A. Gromyko, that the meeting had been agreeable and that he would return to Moscow next week for more talks on a pos sible nonaggression pact.

title: Business Records
description: SOUTHERN DISTRICT

title: Smith, Barney Asks Delay For Big Board's Fee Rise
description: Smith, Barney & Co., Inc., leading investment concern, called yesterday for a mora torium on the implementation of the new commission rates proposed by the New York Stock Exchange.

title: SCIENTIST FOUND TO BE RADIOACTIVE
description: ALBANY, Feb. 17A State Department of Health scientist, apparently involved in private, unauthorized research with a radioactive isotope, has been permanently contaminated by the material.

title: Priest Is Ejected After Scolding City Council About Bronx Slum
description: A Roman Catholic priest was shoved out of the City Council chamber by guards yesterday after he disrupted a meeting by shaking his fist and shouting at the Councilmen on the floor below.

title: Denise Fugazy, Debutante of '66, Is Betrothed to Vito A. Luciani
description: HARRISON, N. Y., Feb. 17 The engagement of Miss Denise Fugazy to Vito An thony Luciani has been an nounced by the future bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. William Denis Fugazy. Her fianc is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Vito V. Luciani of Woodbridge Conn.

title: Two Ambassadors Chosen
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 17 (AP) President Nixon announced today that he would nominate Findlay Burns Jr. as Ambassa dor to Ecuador and William Carter Burdett as Ambassador to Malawi. Both are career dip lomats.

title: New Books
description: FICTION

title: Thant Indicates Jarring May Renew Mideast Role
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y. Feb. 17Secretary General Thant hinted in a news conference this morning that he might ask Dr. Gunnar V. Jarring of Swe den, his special representative, to resume peacemaking efforts in the Middle East without waiting for guidelines from the Big Four.

title: Accused Spy Leaves U.S. And Flies Home to Moscow
description: Aleksandr V. Tikhomirov, the Russian translator at the United Nations against whom the United States first brought, and then dropped, spy charges, flew home to Moscow yesterday, The Associated Press reported.

title: PROTESTERS FIGHT POLICE IN SEATTLE
description: SEATTLE, Feb. 17 (UPI)  A thousand demonstrators charged the United States Courthouse today in a protest against the Chicago riot con spiracy trial. They battled the police, threw rocks through windows and lobbed tear gas into the building.

title: Sorensen Declares Senate Candidacy
description: Theodore C. Sorensen, for mer aide to Presidenet John F. Kennedy and to his brother, Senator Robert F. Kennedy, formally announced yesterday that he was running for the United States Senate from New York.

title: 19 Mets Report to Spring Camp, But Hodges Is Detained at Home
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., Feb. 17The rich young New York Mets converged on their spring training headquarters today to open their title defense and to look for answers to the in triguing question: What can they do for an encore?

title: Negro Named Police Chief By Mayor Hatcher of Gary
description: GARY. Ind., Feb. 17 (AP) Mayor Richard Hatcher named Charles Boone as his new po lice chief today. Both are Negroes, and the appointment put blacks in five of the six top positions in Gary's city govern ment.

title: Columbia Plan Includes Underground Expansion
description: A new master plan for Columbia University's academic and housing needs will be officially submitted to the uni versity's trustees within the next few weeks.

title: Pennsylvania's Public TV Chain To Close Unless It Gets Funding
description: Pennsylvania's ninestation public television network will shut down in 10 days unless a $1.7million appropriation, tied up for eight months in the State Senate, is approved.

title: Preminger To Produce Play in Fall
description: Otto Preminger, the inde pendent film producerdi rector, has acquired a new play, The Rise and Fall of Practically Nobody, by Je rome Alden, for Off Broad way production next fall.

title: Aslund of Sweden Triumphs In Nordic 15Kilometer Race
description: STRBSKE PLESO, Czechoslo vakia, Feb. 17 (AP)  Lars Goran Ashind of Sweden broke the Soviet Union's domination of the event by winning the 15kilometer race today in the world Nordic skiing champion ships.

title: WIND AND RAIN EASE OIL HAZARD IN GULF
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., Feb. 17  A number of oil slicks that had threatened resort beaches along the Gulf of Mexico yesterday were broken up by rain and high winds to day.

title: Margaret N. Jensen to Be a Bride
description: LITCHFIELD, Conn., Feb. 17Miss Margaret Nancy Jensen and Donley Hotchkiss Johnson, teachers at the Forman School here, plan to be married in August.

title: Slaying of Wife and Daughters By Four Is Reported by Captain
description: FAYETTEVILLE, N. C., Feb. 17A 26yearold medical of ficer, who is a narcotics spe cialist attached to the Green Berets, told the police that three men and a blond woman screaming Acid is great, kill the pigs! killed his wife and two young daughters in their beds at Fort Bragg early today.

title: Foreign Affairs: French Reform and the U. S. A.
description: PARISIt is arguable that President Georges Pompidou has a more American view of the development of capital ist society and of employer worker relationships than his predecessor. On the verge of his first official trip to the United States it is interesting to elab orate this point.

title: ISRAELIS ATTACK CAIRO AREA AGAIN; WARN EGYPTIANS
description: JERUSALEM, Feb. 17Israel carried her bombing raids to the outskirts of Cairo again today and warned the Egyptians that there would be no letup in the air attacks until they agreed to abide by the ceasefire of 1967.

title: H.E.W. Rights Chief Quits; Charges Political Pressure
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 17  Leon E. Panetta, liberal and outspoken civil rights chief of the Department of Health, Edu cation and Welfare, resigned today because of what he called political pressures in fluencing enforcement of civil rights laws.

title: BOSTON COLLEGE REGISTERS UPSET
description: BOSTON, Feb. 17 (UPI)  Boston College upset George town, 7969, in basketball to night.

title: Budget Chief Says Nixon Would Combat Recession
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 17Budget Director Robert P. Mayo told Congress today that the Administration would not be reluctant to come forward with a program to com bat a recession if, contrary to Administration expecta tions, one developed this year.

title: Goldberg Urges Congress To Scrutinize the Military
description: ATLANTIC CITY, Feb. 17 Arthur J. Goldberg called on Congress tonight to review the nation's world commitments and the workings of the mili tary establishment.

title: Sato Indicates He Plans No Shift in China Policy
description: TOKYO, Feb. 17  Premier Eisaku Sato made clear today that his Government contem plated no major changes in re lations with Communist China in the near future.

title: Franklin Jarman to Weal Mrs. Nancy Smith Ahola
description: Franklin M. Jarman, the 39yearold Genesco chair man, who divides his time between Tennessee and New York, was married on Satur day to Mrs. Nancy Smith Ahola, a former airlines stewardess he met on the morning run from Nashville eight years ago.

title: In European Tradition
description: S. Y. Agnon's art had a curi DUS duality. It was very much pf the modern world. It was also very much in the past. In such stories as The Betrothed, Metamorphosis and Edo and Enam, the mood of disloca tion, the ambiguous and myste rious endings and their brood ing otherworldly atmosphere place them in the center of our Euro pean literary tradi tion. The term Kafkaesque has been applied more than once to these tales, though it can be shown that Agnon was writing in this vein before Kafka carne to be pub lished.

title: KINNEY DEFENDS WARNER ACTIONS
description: Kinney National Service, Inc., which last year entered the motionpicture business with the acquisition of Warner Bros., proved yesterday that movies are a lot more interest ing to talk about than offices service, parking garages and funeral parlors, which Kinney also operates.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
ARAB MAYOR URGES WESTBANK ENTITY
description: HEBRON, Israeli  occupied Jordan, Feb. 17 (Reuters)  The Mayor of this Arab city called today for the creation of a Palestinian entity on the west bank of the Jordan to represent Arabs on both sides of the river.

title: Bridge:
description: OMAR SHARIF'S touring bridge Circus suffered a beating in four days of play in Dallas that ended Sunday night. The Circus was de feated by the Dallas Aces, who will represent the United States in the next world championship, by 156 match points in a match of 168 deals.

title: Beirut: The Dope Traffic in the Middle East
description: BEIRUTOn the counter of the U.S. Consulate along the Mediterranean waterfront of this beautiful city there is Notice to Americans concern ing the use and smuggling of hashish. It is a symbol ofthe rising battle by the Nixon Ad ministration to protect the wan dering young American dope addicts and strangle the world wide dope traffic at its source.

title: Sports of The Times
description: THE stylish Jimmy Ellis gave something of a boxing lesson to an overly cau tious Joe Frazier in the first round of their fight for the undisputed heavy weight championship of the world in Madison Square Garden the night before last. But once Frazier abandoned caution and began doing what came naturally, he brought an abrupt end to the lesson. He also brought an abrupt end to Ellis, a knockout victim after 12 minutes of fight ing.

title: O'BRIEN IS EXPECTED TO HEAD DEMOCRATS
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 17 (AP) Lawrence F. O'Brien appears headed for a return engage ment as chairman of the debt ridden Democratic National Committee.

title: Widow, 78, Is Slain In Riverside Park, Her 2 Dogs Nearby
description: A 78yearold widow was found stabbed to death yester day in Riverside Park, her handbag missing and the poo dles that she walked daily in the park lingering nearby.

title: TAX ON PILLS URGED FOR HELP TO ADDICTS
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 17 (UPI)Dr. James L. Goddard, former head of the Food and Drug Administration, proposed today that the Government tax drugs subject to abuse and use the proceeds to pay for treat ment of addicts and a huge ed ucation program.

title: Action Needed on Rents
description: The still officially suppressed study by the Rand Corporation of housing decay in this city makes plainer than ever the need for modifying New York's 27yearold rent control law. Apartments that would cost more than a billion dollars to replace are being abandoned each year while vacant rental housing sinks toward zero. An overall deficit of $225 million annually in owners' income from rentcontrolled apartments is a critical element in that drift toward housing disaster.

title: ROGERS AND MOBUTU TAKE CONGO CRUISE
description: KINSHASA, the Congo, Feb. 17 (UPI)Secretary of State William P. Rogers spent more than five hours today on Pres ident Joseph D. Mobutu's pri vate river steamer.

title: Parents Storm City Hall Over Boy's Pill Death
