description: ENGLISH and Irish early 19thcentury cut glass should prove a fruitful field for collectors seeking new objectives.

title: Nathaniel Bishop, Engineer, Marries Mrs. Laura Hunter
description: FAIRFIELD, Conn., Feb. 20 Mrs. Laura McEldowney Hunter, widow of F. K. Mid dleton Hunter, was married here this afternoon to Na thaniel Bishop, a licensed professional engineer. The Rev. Howard Nutting of the United Congregational Church in Bridgeport performed the ceremony at the bride's home.

title: Stanley Dancer Drives Tonight In His 1970 Debut at Westbury
Cleveland Police Lose Suit
description: CLEVELAND, Feb. 20 (UPI) A $6million damage suit filed by six policemen injured in the Glenvile disorders was dismissed yesterday by the Cuyahoga County Common Pleas Court. The six contended the administration of Mayor Carl B. Stokes knew of the im pending trouble, but did not warn the Police Department. The gun battle in July, 1965, claimed 10 lives, including those of three policemen.

title: James M. J. Pringle Is Dead; A. P. War Photographer Was 51
description: ROME, Feb. 20 (AP)James Matthew Joseph Pringle, the Associated Press photographer known for his pictures of war action and revolutions, died yesterday in a hospital here. He was 51 years old and had been suffering from cancer.

title: J. H. M'GRAW JR., BOOK PUBLISHER
description: James H. McGraw Jr., the former president and chairman of the board of McGrawHill, Inc., died here yesterday after a long illness. He was 76 years old and lived at 31 East 79th Street.

title: Old Dangers Turning Up in French Snowslide Area
description: VAL DISERE, France, Feb. 20When the founda tion was being dug for a freshair hostel here a decade ago, workmen came across the skeletons of a woman, a child and a mule.

title: Nixon to Nominate Wille As a Director of F.D.I.C.
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 20 (AP) President Nixon said today he would nominate Frank Wille, New York State Superintendent of Banks, to be a member of the board of directors of the Federal Deposit Insurance Cor poration.

title: 22 Blacks in South Africa Accuse Police of Torture
description: PRETORIA, South Africa, Feb. 20South African securi ty police were accused today of assaults, threats and torture by 22 Africans being held for in terrogation.

title: Egyptians Report Downing Israeli Plane Near Canal
description: CAIRO, Feb. 20 (Reuters) An Egyptian military spokes man said that an Israeli plane was shot down today on the eastern side of the Suez Canal. He said that it had been one of a group of aircraft that had raided Egyptian positions in the southern sector of the canal.

title: FINCH CANCELS EDICT ON PRESS CONTACTS
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 20 (AP) Robert H. Finch, Secretary of Health, Education and Wel fare, canceled orders today requiring written, detailed re ports on all contacts between newsmen and officials of the National Institute of Mental Health.

title: BRITISH FOOTBALL
description: ENGLISH LEAGUE

title: Pro Skiing Is Postponed
description: VERBIER, Switzerland, Feb. 20 (AP)The world professional Alpine ski championships were postponed today until tomor row because of bad weather.

title: Catholics Weighing New U.S. Council
description: Leaders of the American hierarchy of the Roman Catho lic Church took the first step yesterday toward the conven ing of a National Pastoral Council of bishops, priests, re ligiqus and laymen to help gov ern the church in this country.

title: FLU ACROSS NATION REPORTED AT PEAK
description: ATLANTA, Feb. 20 (UPI) This winter's unexpected out break of Hong Kong influenza across the United States has reached its peak in most areas, the National Communicable Disease Center said today.

title: PISTONS DEFEAT BULLETS, 122119
description: BALTIMORE, Feb. 20 (UPI)  Jimmy Walker and Dave Bing combined for 58 points and Binges key steal in the final minute of play led the Detroit Pistons to a 122119 victory over the Baltimore Bullets tonight in a National Basketball Association game.

title: Second Round in Warsaw
description: The second round of secret SinoAmerican talks this year took place in Warsaw yesterday as sched uled. Since both nations' representatives referred after ward to plans for holding additional meetings, it can be assumed that these latest talks went reasonably well even though there is understandable silence on the specifics.

title: NO END IS IN SIGHT IN CEMETERY STRIKE
description: State and city mediation of ficials reported to Mayor Lind say yesterday that the grave diggers' strike, now in its sixth week, was still far from a set tlement.

title: ANGELINA LAPIANA
description: WELLESLEY, Mass., Feb. 20 (AP)Miss Angelina LaPiana, professor emeritus of Italian at Wellesley College, died yes terday at the NewtonWelles ley Hospital after a heart at tack.

title: Bridge:
description: AN unusual exhibition match will be played tonight at the New York Hilton Hotel about 11:30 o'clock following completion of the Open Pair Champion ship at the Greater New York Bridge Association's Tourna ment.

title: METS' M'ANDREW INJURES HIS KNEE
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., Feb. 20 (UPI)Jim McAndrew be came the first casualty of the New York Mets' training camp when the pitcher twisted his left knee while coming off the mound today on a routine play to cover first base.

title: M. W. KELLOGG SETS A MOVE TO HOUSTON
description: The M. W. Kellogg Company, a major engineering and con struction organization for the oil and petrochemical indus tries, will move its headquar ters from New York City to Houston, it was announced yes terday.

title: Lindsay Condemns the Chicago Trial as a Mockery
description: Mayor Lindsay again strong ly condemned the court's con duct in the Chicago conspiracy trial yesterday, and said that the fourandahalf month pro ceeding made a mockery of the judicial process.

title: Russian Priests May Minister to Roman Catholics
description: MOSCOW, Feb. 20The Rus sian Orthodox Church has de cided to permit its priests to administer sacraments to Ro man Catholics.

title: Scientists Question the Moving of Sludge Site
description: Marine scientists said yes terday that there was no evidence yet to indicate that carrying sewage sludge here farther out to sea would re duce the danger of contami nation.

title: City Records 33d TeenAge Heroin Death of 1970
description: Another death of a teenager caused by herointhe 33d this yearand the arrest of four more alleged suppliers of heroin to school children were recorded in the city yesterday.

title: Subways' Colored Tile Gets CoverUp Job
description: The oldfashioned tile and fancycolored mosaics lining the walls of many BMT sub way stations since the days of World War I are giving way to modernity.

title: G.M. Urged to Respond to Public Need
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21A group of young lawyers, who have formed the Campaign to Make General Motors Respon sible, made public today six resolutions concerning the fu ture conduct of the company that they want to have voted on at the corporation's stock holders' meeting on May 22.

title: JERSEY JURY GETS KAVANAUGH CASE
description: PATERSON, N. J., Feb. 21 (APThe jury began deliberat ing the case of four persons charged with the murder of Judy Kavanaugh today, two days before the fourth anniver sary of the crime.

title: A Correction
description: In an article on the arts and humanities in this section on Feb. 15, the name of Barnaby C. Keeney, a historian and head of the National Endowment for the Humanities, was misspelled. The Times regrets the error.

title: Prices of Steel Scrap Soar, but Not Far Enough to Make Derelict Cars Vanish
description: Even though scrap metal is an increasingly valuable part of the nation's resourcesa fact that was underlined strongly last weekan old car remains, in relative terms, a piece of junk.

title: EASTERN HOCKEY LEAGUE
description: FRIDAY NIGHT'S GAMES

title: UKRAINIANS MEET CUP RIYAL TODAY
description: Six major soccer teams in the area will resume outdoor action today, after two weeks of indoor activity and three weeks of postponements be cause of bad weather. The Ger manHungarians will tackle the New York Ukrainians in the New York semifinal for the United States Challenge Cup, while the GreekAmericans will meet New York Hungaria and Elizabeth will oppose Kingston for the German  American League title.

title: James McCracken Rebels Once Again
description: THERE was a time when the major Hollywood studios used to sign up young actors or actresses who had suddenly made good on Broadway and then put them on ice. That is, if the company found no use for such an actor in features, it might relegate him to short films or ignore him altogether. But if another company wanted to cast him in a star role, he was not allowed to accept the offer. It was a doginthemanger practice which could be very harmful to an actor's career.

title: Headliners
description: Anastasia Goes On

title: James Wills to Wed Phyllis Koller
description: MEMPHIS, Tenn., Feb. 21 Mr. and Mrs. Edward John Koller have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Phyllis Ruth Koller, to James Goodyear Wills of New York, son of Mr. and Mrs. Ralph Wills of East Lansing, Mich.

title: Mrs. Elizabeth W. Boynton Is Wed
description: RED BANK, N. J., Feb. 21 Mrs. Elizabeth Willguss Boynton, widow of Casimer Whitman Boynton 3d, an in dustrial designer, was mar ried here this afternoon to John Lawrence Davis. The ceremony in the chapel of the United Methodist Church was performed by the Rev. Edward B. Cheney.

title: Honeywell Protest Planned
description: MINNEAPOLIS, Feb. 21 (AP) A group of professors and students from colleges in this area has purchased 39 shares of Honeywell, Inc., to further a protest against that company's manufacture of weapons used in Vietnam. The stock was bought Wednesday so that 39 representatives of the group, which calls itself the Honey well Project, could attend the company's annual meeting April 28.

title: Architecture
description: ONE of the more astute U.S.  watchers, Lon don's Economist, re marks that Americans have discovered that air comes two waysclean and dirty. Pollution has finally been made a priority concern at the national level.

title: Chicago 7 Protest in Washington Ends With 112 Youths Arrested
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21  City policemen arrested 112 young demonstrators here this afternoon for disorderly con duct and refusing to disperse after two hours of speeches and a loosely organized march against the sentencing of the Chicago conspiracy defendants.

title: Cleaning Streets By Motor Scooters To Be Tried by City
description: The city's Sanitation Depart ment will put some of its hand broom men on motorscooters to raise their productivity in a new attempt to attack the per sistent problem of dirty streets.

title: SewageControl Law for Boats Takes Effect Next Sunday
Harlem Industry More Than a Dream
description: For 15 years, Curtis McFar ley labored in the clogged streets and clattering factories of New York's Garment Dis trict, pushing dress carts at first, then cutting and stitching cloth and finally supervising others who did the same things.

title: In Bergen, Office Space Undergoes Big Growth
description: BERGEN COUNTY is ex periencing a boom in office building. In the last year, 164,000 square feet of office space was completed in the county and 1,621,000 square feet is planned for 1970 or now under way.

title: Westchester Government Needs Modernization, Ottinger and Reid Agree
description: WASHINGTONOgden Reid, Republican, and Richard Ot tinger, Democrat, who share the representation of Westchester County in the House of Repre sentatives, also share the view that the county is behind the times in some ways.

title: Poverty Aide Named
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21 (AP Alfred H. Taylor Jr. of Glen coe, Ill., has been named exec utive director of the planning And review committee of the Office of Economic Opportunity.

title: Elizabeth Kopp Betrothed
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21 Judge Arnold Raum of the United States Tax Court and Mrs. Raurn have announced the engagement of Mrs. Raum's daughter, Miss Eliza beth Ann Kopp, to Charles Richard Levin, son of Mr. and Mrs. Benjamin Levin of Newton, Mass.

title: Gromyko Plans a Visit To East Germany Soon
description: EAST BERLIN, Feb. 21 (Reuters)The Soviet For eign Minister, Andrei A. Gro myko is to visit East Berlin within the next few days for what observers believe will be discussions on the proposed meeting next month between the Premiers of East and West Germany.

title: Gardens
description: JOY SHAW is a river watcher. In much the way devoted conserva tionists read the seasons and the health of the environment in the behavior of birds, she picks up ecolog ical signals from life on the Mill River in Fairfield, Conn. Observation is easy for Mrs. Shaw because, with her hus band and two children, she lives in the old mill house overlooking Perry's Darn and what is left of the mill pond. The Shaws have a front row seat on the changing show. They can watch mallards flying in and out, muskrats feeding and children exploring the banks and trails of a richly endowed outdoor laboratory.

title: Mexican Tomato Bans
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21 (Reuters)The United States has given Mexican tomato growers a threeweek reprieve by deciding to hold off tougher import restrictions until March 16. Adverse weather affecting the flow of supplies from Flor ida was given yesterday as the reason for delaying the new restrictions.

title: Maureen O'Keefe Prospective Brick
description: LAWRENCE, L. I., Feb. 21 Mr. and Mrs. Paul J. O'Keefe have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Maureen Elizabeth O'Keefe, to Peter C. Browne Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Browne also of Lawrence.

title: Army Six Beats Colgate, 31
description: WEST POINT, N. Y., Feb. 21 Army capitalized on a situa tion that gave them a twoman advantage tonight and upset Colgate in hockey, 31.

title: Algeria's New Politics Downgrades Ideology
description: ALGIERS, Feb. 10At one of the many meetings organized in recent months to spur Al geria's four  year development plan, Ahmed Kaid, Minister in charge of party affairs, seemed to be carried away by the spirit of the occasion.

title: Dance
Irish Seaman Lost
description: DUBLIN, Feb. 21 (AP)The mate of the 700ton Irish freighter Oranmore drowned early today when the ship was abandoned in heavy seas off the coast of Kerry. Joe Lennon, 53 year old, went overboard as the 11man crew transferred from the freighter to a lifeboat

title: Miss Seminer Fiancee Of Barry Allen Kohn
description: Mr. and Mrs. Irving Semi ner of Jackson Heights, Queens, have announced the engagement of their daugh ter, Miss Brina Lynn Seminer to Barry Allen Kohn, son of Mr. and Mrs. Harvey Kohn of Plainfield, N. J.

title: Stamps
description: BRITAIN will go on deci mal currency next year, but to avoid pres sures on stamp print ing, three high value stamps in the current Queen Elizabeth II definitive design will be issued June 17. In addition, to pay (postage due) labels will also be is sued June 17 in high denomi nations in a new design. Cur rent postagedue stamp de signs have been unchanged since 1914.

title: Margaret Mead Bids Administrators Teach
description: ATLANTIC CITY, Feb. 21 (AP)  Margaret Mead, the recipient of the American Education Award, believes that school superintendents should teach one class a day to help bridge the genera tion gap.

title: Secret Study Asks Nixon Policy Shift On Urban Education
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21 (AP) A report on urban education, commissioned by the Nixon Administration but so far kept under wraps by the Department of Health, Education and Wel fare, sharply conflicts with Ad ministration policy and recom mends a massive new Federal investment in inner city schools.

title: Mrs. Hart Gets Degree
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21 (UPI) Mrs. Philip A. Hart, wife of the Democratic Senator from Michigan, became a college graduate today at the age of 48  in absentia. She missed the midday convocation cere mony at George Washington University here because she had an engagement in Detroit to help her husband campaign for a third term.

title: New Views From a Former Cold Warrior
description: WASHINGTONA recent Sec retary of Defense, so the story goes, once asked the State De partment to provide him with the Government's foreign policy in the Middle East. After four months of silence he grew mildly impatient, drew up his own pol icy statement, submitted it to State andafter another, shorter waitgot back a grudging ap proval.

title: Some in Soviet Assail Trend to Profit Motive
description: Influential Soviet economic executives and economists are urging a drastic retreat from the country's present profit  oriented management system as a means of coping with economic difficulties.

title: Recordings
description: FERRUCCIO BUSONI in an article in a 1913 book called Great Pianists on Piano Playing, recounted a story of an artist he had met whose fame rested upon his wonder ful stainedglass windows. Busoni related a remark this artist made to him, a remark which must have taken deep root in the Italian pianist composer's mind: If a truly great work of art in the form of a stainedglass window should be accidentally shat tered to little bits, one should be able to estimate the great ness of the whole window by examining one of the frag ments, even though all the other pieces were missing.

title: Writing About Trade Unions
description: To the Editor:

title: Car Sales Value In Britain Down
description: LONDON, Feb. 21 (UPI) Britain's auto industry has been complaining that Gov ernment curbs on credit and other trade restrictions have cramped its domestic per formance in 1969 and statis tics from the Board of Trade recently proved the point about lower home sales.

title: A son of Horace, one of the tribe of The Horatians
description: If poetry, as Auden once defined it, is the clear expression of mixed feel ings, then this new volume is not all poetry. The feelings here are often unmixed, and these conservative mo ments give even Auden pause:

title: The French Woo Visitors With Better Transport
description: PARISAll sorts of im provements in facili ties, service and ac commodations await the 1970 tourist in France, whether he travels across the country by car, bus, train or airplane.

title: MARQUETTE ROUTS DETROIT, 80 TO 60
description: DETROIT, Feb. 21 (UPI)  Dean Meminger scored 34 points today as Marquette en hanced its chances for a Na tional Collegiate tournament bid by swamping the Univer sity of Detroit, 8060.

title: Mrs. Moffett, Fremont Peck Married on L.I.
description: BROOKVILLE, L. I., Feb. 21Mrs. Elizabeth Gleason Moffett and Fremont Carson Peck, both of Piping Rock Road in Locust Valley, were married here this morning in the Brookville Reformed Church by the Rev. Charles Robert Harrah.

title: Children's Plays Give Junior League Another Role in Community Service
description: DARIEN, Conn.Throughout the chill winter months, 60 women have steadfastly presented themselves at St. Paul's Episcopal Church three mornings a week to plan and rehearse a play that will be performed for 36 public schools in the NorwalkStamford area this spring without charge.

title: Cost of Rearing Child Held $5,000 Greater Than in '61
description: WASHINGTON Feb. 21 (UPI)It will cost the parents of a child born last year about $5,000 more to rear him to age 18 than it would have had he been born eight years earlier, an Agriculture Department Economist has said.

title: How Can You Handle Unruly Defendants?
description: Julius J. Hoffman was not the only judge to hand out contempt citations last week. And he may lose his newfound role as cham pion of the contempt power by year's end: Justice John M. Mur tagh has already handed down two contempt sentences, and his trial, of New York's Black Pan thers in the State Supreme Court, hasn't even begun.

title: Troy Lawyer, 29, Seeks G.O.P. Senate Nomination
description: TROY, N. Y., Feb. 21 (UPI) Robert P. Reeves, who will be barely old enough to make the race, said that he will campaign for the G.O.P. Senatorial nom ination in all of New York State's 62 counties.

title: Quotes
description: Man is a very strange animal. In much of the world half the children go to bed hungry and we spend a trillion on rubbishsteel, iron, tanks. We are all criminals. There is an old mungarian poem: If you are among brigands and you are silent, you are a brigand yourself.

title: Dentist to Wed Jeannie Hong
description: Sung Wook Hong, Korean consul general here, and Mrs. Hong have announced the engagement of their daugh ter, Miss Jeannie M. Hong, to Dr. Chongsun T. Yun, who practices dentistry here. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. T. C. Yun of New York. His father, who is retired, was formerly Korean Ambassador to Britain and Turkey.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Report on AllVolunteer Army
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21 Following is the opening chapter of the report of the President's Commission on an AllVolunteer Armed Force, released by the White House today:

title: HUMPHREY ASSAILS CONTEMPT RULINGS
description: Former Vice President Hubert H. Humphrey last night termed deplorable the criminal con tempt sentencing of the Chica go conspiracy trial defendants and their lawyers.

title: Air Pollution Liability Bill
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Feb. 21 (UPI)A bill that would permit residents of Ohio to sue for in juries caused by air pollution has been introduced in the leg islature. The bill would enable victims of air pollution to col lect $100 a day in damages.

title: A.C.L.U. Seeks Penalty End On the Use of Marijuana
description: WASHINGTON Feb. 21 (AP) The American Civil Liberties Union has asked Congress to abolish criminal punishments for the use or possession of marijuana.

title: Will Amy Work for Peace? Will Phillip Enlist? Will....
description: AREPORT in The Times heralding ABCTV's new soap opera, All My Children, was headlined: Social Activism Grips Soap Opera; Heroine of Serial on ABC to Be a Mother for Peace.

title: New Rochelle Girls College Dismisses Controversial Sociology Professor
description: The father of one of the two 12yearold Queens schoolgirls who fought for the right to remain seated in class during the Pledge of Allegiance has been dismissed from his teach ing post at the College of New Rochelle, effective next Sep tember.

title: N. Texas Tops Bradley
description: DENTON, Tex., Feb. 21 (AP) North Texas State defeated Bradley, 8375, in a Missouri Valley game today. It was the Texans' 14th straight victory.

title: Research May Help Traveler's Time Sense
description: TRAVELING up and down in the world, north and south, creates no serious physiological prob lems for the pleasure traveler. It is only when he starts going cross ways, east and west across lines of longitude and time zones, that his own private biological clock goes out of whack. Then the happy tourist be comes completely discombobulated, turning into a forlorn, tired, nervous, sleepy but sleepless stranger in a land where the local clocks and his stomach and brain function, if at all, at very cross purposes.

title: Advertising:
description: The United States Army missed by one inch of get ting itself one heck of a pro fessional soldier. But the Army's loss was Ted Bates's gain.

title: Puerto Rico to Begin Voluntary Family Planning
description: SAN JUAN, P. R., Feb. 21 Puerto Rico will open an island wide family planning program on July 1, becoming the first predominantly Roman Catholic community in the world to ap prove a governmental role in birth control efforts. The an nouncement was made today by the Commonwealth Health Secretary, Ernesto Colon Yor dan.

title: Religion
description: As recently as the last cen tury, the local pastor was widely regarded as a sort of village Renaissance Man. Bet ter educated than almost anyone else, he was a re spected and frequently con sulted authority on matters of this world as well as those of the next.

title: 76ERS TURN BACK PISTONS BY 112110
description: DETROIT, Feb. 21 (UPI)  Billy Cunningham scored 26 points and stole the ball in the last 33 seconds as the Phila delphia 76ers scored a 112110 National Basketball Association victory over the Detroit Pistons tonight.

title: Observer: Readin' and Writin' and Politics
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21 The White House has arranged this briefing in response to many complaints from people who say they cannot under stand the Administration's pol icy on school desegregation. I will be delighted to clarify the policy for anyone who has question.

title: Mosconi, World Champion, In Two Exhibitions Today
description: Willie Mosconi, who has won the world pocket billiards title 15 times, will play two exhibi tions tomorrow at Glen Oaks Billiards on Union Turnpike in Glen Oaks, Queens.

title: OHIO STATE BOWS TO IOWA, 97 TO 89
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Feb. 21 (UPI)John Johnson scored 38 points to lead ninthranked Iowa to a 9789 Big Ten bas ketball victory over Ohio State tonight and extended its per fect conference record to 100.

title: Open house
description: The dream of wide open spaces tantalizes many urban and suburban box dwellers, but the facts of open plan interiors make them impractical for most people. An architect in Memphis, Francis Mah, managed to make the impractical practical and suggest room divisions without shutting off the spatial flow from one area to another. The major living space looks like a big tent roofed with natural fir. Part of the space under the big top is sliced in half by a large balcony that contains the master bedroom and allows privacy with out confinement. The flowing sense is enhanced by white walls and a black slate floor throughout.

title: KIRK SAYS CLUB TOOK IN $420,000
description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla., Feb. 17 Claude R. Kirk Jr. disclosed this week that state contrac tors, political appointees and friends had contributed more than $200,000 in dues to his Governor's Club in the last 22 months.

title: Michigan Triumphs
description: ANN ARBOR, Mich., Feb. 21 (UPI)Michigan, led by Rudy Tomjanovich's 37 points, went on a scoring rampage late in the first half today and held on in the second period to beat Minnesota in the Big Ten, 9587.

title: Explosion and Crash Kill 47 On IsraelBound Swiss Jet
description: GENEVA, Feb. 21  All 38 passengers and 9 crew mem bers were killed today when a Swiss airliner crashed 15 min utes after takeoff on a flight from Zurich to Israel. The pi lot had reported an explosion aboard.

title: FREEDOMS GROUP TO HAIL YOUTH, 18
description: VALLEY FORGE, Pa., Feb. 21 (UPI)Mike Levesque, 18 years old, will receive the highest award of the Freedoms Founda tion tomorrow for organizing youth for decency rally held last March in Miami's Orange Bowl.

title: Foreign Affairs: Mene, Mene, Tekel, Upharsin
description: PARIS  Two significant Middle East developments dur ing the past fortnight have received inadequate attention. The first is the continuing approach of outright confronta tion between the United States and the Soviet Union and the second is emergence of the fedayeen guerrillas as a major political force.

title: Dr. Alan H. Peck To Wed Amy Harr
description: SHAKER HEIGHTS, Ohio, Feb. 21Mr. and Mrs. Milton Harr have announced the en gagement of their daughter, Miss Amy Harr, to Dr. Alan H. Peck, son of Mr. and Mrs. Harry Peck of Jamestown, N. Y. and Hollywood, Fla.

title: Spotlight:
description: Oil stocks ended last week with a bang, not a whimper, as President Nixon an nounced early Friday that he would delay any major changes in the controversial oilimport program, thereby shelving the recommenda tions of his cabinet task force.

title: CANADIANS STRESS CLAIMS ON ARCTIC
description: OTTAWA, Feb. 21There is a certain amount of dissatis faction in Canadian circles over the failure of President Nixon to mention Canada in his re view of foreign affairs on Wednesday.

title: Floating Rate for the Peso Announced by Philippines
description: MANILA, Feb, 21 (AP)The Philippine Government an nounced today a freemarket exchange rate for the peso, starting immediately. The cen tral bank described is as an alternative to devaluation, but it was expected to have the same effect.

title: Pollution Control at Kennedy
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., Feb. 21 (AP)As part of President Nixon's antipollution campaign, experimental exhaust emission control devices are being in stalled on one quarter of the 1,600 Government vehicles at the Kennedy Space Center.

title: Kings Point Wrestlers Beat Fairleigh Dickinson, 3313
description: TEANECK, N.J., Feb. 21  Kings Point scored a 3313 wrestling victory over Fair leigh Dickinson here today to even its season wonlost record at 66.

title: A BREAKTHROUGH FOR CITY TENNIS
description: The city's tennis players, a persistent breed, have scored a big point in their never ending match with the Parks Department.

title: Card of Thanks
description: CARLINThe family of the late Samuel Carlin acknowledges with deepest gratitude all of the kind expressions of sympathy in their recent bereavement..

title: Susan W. Stephenson Is Betrothed
description: GREENVILLE, Del., Feb. 21Mr. and Mrs. Thomas W. Stephenson have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Susan White Stephenson, to John Davis Gates, the business editor of The NewsJournal papers in Wilmington.

title: Yale Coeds Invade Alumni Fete To Protest Male Predominance
description: NEW HAVEN, Feb. 21 About 40 of Yale University's new coeds invaded a quiet Alumni Day luncheon in Fresh man Commons today and, with clenched fists and placards, protested the ratio of women to men in the student body.

title: FEW POLICE TOLD ABOUT SPRAY USE
description: While most American police departments have equipped their men with chemical spray weapons, very few have de veloped instructions on when and where to use them.

title: George Best: Soccer's Saturday Hero
description: LONDON, Feb. 21His romance with a Danish beauty was headline news across Europe last fall, and British girls sighed with anticipation when he broke it off, When he tired of his Iso Rivolta sports car, Alfa Romeo offered him one of theirs free.

title: A Correction
description: The Times inadvertently re ported in Saturday's editions that Secretary of Defense Mel vin R. Laird had said that draft calls this year would fall to 90,000. This figure was incor rect. Mr. Laird, in a report on defense programs and bud getary decisions, actually said that draft calls would drop by 75,000 to 90,000, or from about 290,000 in 1969 to a figure be tween 200,000 and 215,000 during 1970.

title: Controls Haven't Caught Up to Boom in Computers
description: New York erupted into frenzied, spontaneous show; er of ticker tape and paper last year when the bumbling, beloved Mets became the World Champions of base ball.

title: Dog Show Calendar
description: TodayElm City K.C. allbreed show; Goffe Street Armory, 290 Goffe Street, New Haven; 1,270 entries; 9 A.M.

title: Wagner Downs Hartwick As Hodge Excels, 103 to 92
description: Wagner College, behind the 45point scoring of Ray Hodge, upset Hartwick College of On eonta, N. Y., 10392, last night at Sutter Gymnasium, Staten Island. Hartwick, New York State's secondranked team, was stopped in its bid for its 10th straight victory.

title: Speedy Mole Digs Ohio Coal Shaft
description: CADIZ, Ohio, Feb. 21  Coalmining history is being written in eastern Ohio where a mechanical groundhog, too busy going in the opposite direction to look for its shad ow, is slowly burrowing its way toward a 5foot seam of coal near the Georgetown, Ohio, preparation plant of the Hanna Coal Company.

title: East Hudson Parkway Post
description: The appointment of Raymond Radzivila as executive director of the East Hudson Authority, has been announced by Charles W. Merritt, chairman of the au thority. Mr. Radzivila, a civil engineer, succeeds the late Er nest T. Perkins.

title: Sports of The Times
description: MY biggest crime is stupidity, is a quote attributed to Denny McLain. If the Detroit Tiger pitching ace didn't characterize himself as being monumentally stupid, he certainly should have. Perhaps a more precise word ta describe his outlook on life would be fatuity, which is defined as complaisant stupidity.

title: RAYMOND C. BALL
description: HARTFORD, Feb. 21 Ray mond Clift Ball, an honorary director and former president of the Connecticut Bank and Trust Company, died Thursday in Hartford Hospital. He was 72 years old and lived at Glouces ter Lane, West Hartford, and in Chilmark. Mass.

title: Do As Britons Do, Go West That's Where Their Sun Is
description: PLYMOUTH, England  Britain has scheduled what could be termed a double doubleheader this year. It is celebrating anniversaries marking a sea voyage, a political murder, the death of a novelist and the birth of a poet.

title: Nevada Prison Odds High
description: CARSON CITY, Nev., Feb. 21 (UPI)If one was arrested on a narcotics charge in Nevada last year, the odds were at least 65 to 1 that he did not go to the state prison. A survey showed that, of 2,000 adults arrested in 1969 on narcotics or drug abuse charges, only 160 were convicted in Nevada, and only 30 of them ended up with prison terms.

title: 21 HELD BY ISRAELIS ON SABOTAGE COUNT
description: JERUSALEM, Feb. 21The Israeli police announced today that 21 Israeli Arabs suspected of having planned sabotage or of having had ties with Pale stine guerrilla organizations have been arrested in the last two weeks in Nazareth, Ilut and villages in the western Galilee.

title: STUDENTS CANCEL MARCH IN MANILA
description: MANILA, Feb. 21  A but toneddown and boardedup Manila reacted with surprised relief tonight as an expected re newal of violence springing from demonstrations by dissi dent students failed to mater ialize.

title: Deep And Basic Reversal On Rights
description: WASHINGTON  I do not know what the politics of hu man rights is today, said Sen ator Walter F. Mondale, Dem ocrat of Minnesota, in appeal ing for continuation of the na tional school desegregation ef fort. I sense that it's less pop ular than it's been for a number of years. But unless we sustain it, the cause of our country will be lost.

title: Lund Captures 300Mile Daytona Race
.342 HITTER JOINS AARON, GONZALEZ
description: WEST PALM BEACH, Fla., Feb. 21 (AP)Rico Carty, who batted .342 for the Atlanta Braves last year, agreed to terms for his 1970 contract to day.

title: N.Y.U. FENCERS BEAT ARMY FOR 9TH IN ROW
description: New York University's unde feated fencers posted their ninth victory of the season yesterday by downing Army, 1512, at the Washington Square gymnasium. The Violets are one match away from their first unbeaten campaign since the 196061 season.

title: Religious Education Backed in Boston
description: BOSTON, Feb. 21  Roman Catholic parents in the Boston Archdiocese appear less con cerned today about the need for a complete parochial school system provided they are sure that their children will receive sound religious education some where.

title: Business Index Fell in Week
description: The New York Times Weekly Index of Business Activ ity fell to 345.6 last week from 359.8 a week earlier. A year ago it was 345.2.

title: Boston City Hospital Plans $171.5Million Renovation
description: BOSTON, Feb. 21 (AP) Boston City Hospital has an nounced a sixstep plan to re build the 109yearold municipal facility at the cost of $171.5 million.

title: City Faces Crisis in Retirement of MiddleManagement Employes and Lack of Quality in Job Applicants
description: The oldtimers in the city offices used to sit around look ing at the clock, a middleaged municipal employe said the other day. Now they look at the calendar.

title: MARAVICH GETS 64 BUT L.S.U. LOSES
description: BATON ROUGE, Feb. 21 Pete Maravich, the nation's leading college basketball scorer, outpointed Dan Issel in a shootout of allAmericans, but secondranked Kentucky defeated Louisiana State, 121 105, today.

title: Anniversaries
description: SCHNEIDERMr. and Mrs. Sam Schneider, wonderful parents, wonderful grandparents, celebrating their Fiftieth Anniversary to day. Congratulations and all our love. Thelma, Eddie, Lorraine, Sam, Sandy Joyce, Maria, Peggy, Katy, Andy, Alma and Alice.

title: VAN GOGHS IN SALE AT PARKEBERNET
description: Two paintings rivet atten tion in a collection of impres sionist, postimpressionist am modern paintings that will be auctioned Wednesday eveninl at the ParkeBernet Galleries 980 Madison Avenue.

title: LOVE Keeps This Band Together
description: THE most successful un successful jazz band in New York (in the country? in the world?) began its fifth suc cessive year at the Village Vanguard on Feb. 9, play ing to a packed, cheering house, as usual, and wonder ing, as usual, what it takes to make it on the current music scene.

title: Ireland Keeps Tourists On the Move
description: DUBLINUntil about five years ago, many of the tourists who came to Ireland to fish, golf or relax on beach stayed in one place for week or two. Today, just about everyone, it seems, either rents a car once he gets here or arrives by automobile by way of the new ferryboat services between Britain and Ireland.

title: Margaret S. Helm Is Betrothed
description: SHERBORN, Mass., Feb. 21 Mrs. Alfred H. B. Peabody of Sherborn and George W. Helm Jr. of White Plains, former president of The WestchesterRockland News papers, Inc., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Margaret Sey mour Helm to James Kemper Bonney, son of Mr. and Mrs. Arthur P. Bonney of Falls Church, Va.

title: Bowling Green Victor
description: BOWLING GREEN, Ohio (AP) Bowling Green spurted early in the second half today to beat Toledo, 8262, and keep alive its hopes of tying Ohio Univer sity for the MidAmerican Con ference basketball title.

title: Hardwick Is Selected As Bowler of the Year
description: MILWAUKEE (UPI)  The Bowling Writers Association of America has named Billy Hardwick of Louisville, Ky., as the 1969 male bowler of the year.

title: Rogers, in Ghana, Says U.S. Will Weigh Loan
description: ACCRA, Ghana, Feb. 21 (AP)  Secretary of State William P. Rogers conferred in the 17thcentury Christian sborg Castle today with Ghana's ruling military lead ers and Prime Minister Kofi A. Busia.

title: Florida State Wins
description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla., Feb. 21 (AP)Florida State's balanced attack enabled the eighth ranked Seminoles to roll to an easy 9780 victory over Geor gia Tech tonight.

title: Birth Control Without The Pill
description: The relative effectiveness of various contraceptive techniques has become a matter of press ing concern in familyplanning circles as women drop the pill in response to recent publicity regarding its alleged health haz ards.

title: ExDetroit Mayor Loses Appeal in Tax Conviction
description: CINCINNATI, Feb. 21 (AP) Former Mayor Louis C. Miriani of Detroit has lost a bid to have the United States Court of Appeals for the Sixth Circuit overturn his conviction on four counts of income tax evasion.

title: Councilman Vows Change In Rent Law Within Year
description: The city's rent control law will be changed within the year, Councilman Donald R. Manes, chairman of the Council's Hous ing Committee, said yesterday.

title: Copter Crashes Off Vietnam
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Feb. 21 (AP)A United States Navy helicopter crashed at sea while attempting a landing aboard the carrier Constella tion off Vietnam, the Navy reported today. One of the 11 men aboard was lost.

title: Miss Beverley B. Byrd Is Fiancee of Lieutenant
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21 Senator and Mrs. Harry Flood Byrd Jr. of Winchester, Va., and Washington have an nounced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Beverley Bigelow Byrd, to Second Lieut. George Partridge Greenhalgh 3d, who is serv ing with the Army at Fort Sill, Okla. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Greenhalgh Jr. of Boyce, Va.

title: Soren J. Winger Becomes Fiance Of Margot Ryan
description: GLADWYNE, Pa., Feb. 21 Mr. and Mrs. Nathan Alex ander have announced the en gagement of Mrs. Alexander's daughter, Miss Margot Barry Ryan, to Soren Jacob Winger, son of Mr. and Mrs. Carsten Winger of Oslo, Norway.

title: Kelly Stars as St. Joseph's Defeats Seton Hall, 8677
description: SOUTH ORANGE, N. J., Feb. 21Dave Kelly scored 38 points and led St. Joseph's Col lege to an 8677 victory over Seton Hall University tonight.

title: French Planes Gain in U.S.
description: PARIS, Feb. 21 (Reuters) The United States replaced Israel last year as the French aviation industry's biggest customer, according to an in dustry official.

title: U.S. TIES TO CHINA EXPECTED TO GROW
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21  American officials and scholars who specialize in Chinese af fairs are showing marked, if cautious, confidence that the United States and Communist China are moving toward an accommodation of their differ ences.

title: INJUNCTIONS SLOW CLEAN AIR DRIVE
description: The city's efforts to enforce air pollution controls on apart ment incinerators are being hampered by court injunctions obtained separately by about 400 landlords. In addition, courts have deferred action on summonses in 92 per cent of cases in the last six months.

title: Does disobedience mean anarchy?
description: The Chicago Eight have been on trial for the liberties of all of us. (In fact they are now Seven, the attempt to destroy Bobby Seale having taken its separate course.) In their contribution to The Conspiracy, a collection of essays by the Eight, their at torneys explain how ordinary political protest would be chilled if the Eight were convicted and their convictions ultimately up held: an explanation which should be read by everyone who takes the continuation of American democracy for granted.

title: Project Gasbuggy And Catch85*
description: BOULDER, Colo. AT first glance, nothing could appear more innocent  in deed, more laudable  than Plowshare, the Atomic Energy Commission's program to develop peaceful uses for nuclear explosives. Plowshare has been in operation since 1957 (as the Division of Peaceful Nuclear Explosives since 1961), and it has come up with ideas for using nuclear blasts to build harbors, dams, highway cuts and canals, and to stimulate oil and naturalgas produc tion, among other applications.

title: F. V. Holberton Becomes Fiance Of Gale Russell
description: CHEVY CHASE, Md., Feb. 21Mr. and Mrs. Frank M. Russell have announced the engagement of their daugh ter, Miss Gale Russell, to Philip Vaughan Holberton, both of New York. The pro spective bridegroom is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Robert M. Holberton of Summit, N. J.

title: Laotian Forces Abandon Key Plain Despite B52 Aid
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Feb. 21 Laotian Government troops have reportedly been driven from their last remaining positions on the Plaine des Jarres, 100 miles north of here.

title: Trains Collide in Hamm
description: HAMM, West Germany, Feb. 21 (UPI)Two passenger trains collided in the Hamm railway station today after one train missed a switch. A station spokesman said 32 persons had been seriously injured. Twenty six others also needed medical treatment.

title: RALLIES PROTEST TRIAL IN CHICAGO
description: CHICAGO, Feb. 21  More than 5,000 demonstrators gathered outside the Federal Building here today to protest the convictions in the Chicago conspiracy trial, then rallied in front of the Cook County Jail where the seven defendants are imprisoned.

title: Marita Donnelly Plans Nuptials Donna May
description: BRONXVILLE, N. Y., Feb. 21Announcement has been made by Mr. and Mrs. and Mrs. Ardsley J. Donnelly of Bronxville and Fort Lauder dale, Fla., of the engagement of their daughter, Miss Ma rita Therese Donnelly, to Ens. Dennis Joseph Doody U.S.N., son of Mr. and Mrs. Jeremiah J. Doody of Bound Brook, N. J.

title: R.P.I. Six Triumphs, 42
description: TROY, N. Y., Feb. 21John Renwick scored two firstperiod goals tonight to help Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute post a 42 hockey victory over North eastern.

title: D. M. Elliman Tr. Weds Miss Brooks
description: The marriage of Miss Stephanie Howard Brooks to Donald Mackay Elliman J. took place in St. James' Episcopal Church here yes terday afternoon.

title: Mrs. Ruth T. Callaway Bride in Jersey
description: PRINCETON, N.J., Feb. 21  Mrs. Ruth Tooker Calla way of Princeton and Charles Sprague Sargent Jr. of New York were married here at noon in the chapel of Prince ton University by the Rev. Dr. Frederic Fox, recording secretary of the university and a Presbyterian minister.

title: Today's Kids Should Laugh More
description: JIMMY STEWART. It's a name that makes conservatives salute the flag and liberals cringe and movie buffs feel a little warm inside. Jimmy Stewart, superpatriot. SUPERSUPER STAR. And how many older actors can you really say that about any more? Wayne ... Lancaster ... Grant ... Peck. Fonda, maybe. Yet there's something about Stewart that makes him tower above the rest. First there's his heightall 6 feet 3 inches. And his military career. He prob ably has more medals and ribbons than all the East Village costume shops put to gether. As a World War 11 bomber pilot, he took part in 20 missions over Germany, rising from a private to a full colonel. He eventually wound up a brigadier general in the Air Force Reserve. (He retired in 1968.)

title: CRACKDOWN NETS SIX FOR SCALPING
New Zealand Election Upset
description: BLENHEIM, New Zealand, Feb. 21 (Reuters)New Zea land's Opposition Labor party won a special election today in what its leader, Norman Kirk described as one of the biggest surprises in New Zea land politics in 30 years.

title: Fay's Sundance Places 3d, Keeps 5.5Meter Sail Lead
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Feb. 21 (AP)Ernie Fay of Houston finished third in Sundance to day to lead after three heats in the world 5.5meter class yacht ing championship.

title: WEST GERMAN SOCCER
description: 1860 Munich 4, Rotweiss Oberhausen 1.

title: LEUKEMIA TRAIT GUIDES PROGNOSIS
description: The Philadelphia chromosome, a genetic abnormality, has been confirmed once again as a prognostic and therapeutic guide in a current medical jour nal report. But 11 years after its discovery in only one form of leukemia, it still baffles scientists.

title: News of the Realty Trade
description: OFFICIALS in the Lind say administration ap pear to be leaning away from commercial rent control as a way of stem ming, soaring rents for small stores and small industries in some areas of Manhattan.

title: NAVY TURNS BACK N.Y.U. FIVE, 7062
description: ANNAPOLIS, Md., Feb. 21 Navy, in the midst of its worst basketball season since 1939, set back New York University, 7062, today at the Naval Academy field house.

title: Florida Is Gaining Cruise Trade as New York Slumps
description: The New York winter cruise market has been sluggish in contrast to Florida's booming business.

title: Evans Sets Sights for McGrady In A.A.U. Meets 600Yard Run
description: SAN DIEGO, Feb. 21 (AP) Lee Evans set the world 500 yard run record, then turned quickly to thoughts of Martin McGrady in his last effort at 600 yards.

title: And Stopping Inflation Hurts
description: amined in November in a brilliant paper by G. L. Bach of Stanford Uni versity. Nearly all economists, Bach said, recognize today that monop olistic business or labor groups can exert only limited inflationary pres sure on the economy unless aggre gate demand is growing to validate the higher wages and prices these monopolists set.

title: Columbia Appoints Frankel To New Philosophy Chair
description: Charles Frankel, former As sistant Secretary of State and currently a philosophy pro fessor at Columbia University, has been named to the newly created Old Dominion Chair of Philosophy and Public Affairs, it was announced yesterday by Columbia's president, Dr. An drew W. Cordier.

title: CUSTOMERS SHUN LABELS AT STORE
description: A department store chain has found that its customers had only mild interest in iden tification tags that had been specially attached to 143 dif ferent makes and models of percolators, irons and blenders so the customers could com pare product characteristics.

title: Mets Sign Gaspar for $17,000, Resume Talks With Swoboda
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., Feb. 21The New York Mets signed Rod Gaspar today, resumed diplomatic relations with Ron Swoboda and moved closer to the economic goal of no hold outs for 1970.

title: Letters: The Pilgrims Were Gypped
description: THE story in the Travel Section of Feb. 1 about commemorative pro grams marking the 350th anni versary of the Mayflower voyage says that those of the English Separa tists who fled to Holland in 1608 to avoid persecution sailed aboard the May flower from the Dutch port of Delfshaven in July, 1620, coming to America via Southampton and Plymouth, England.

title: ZUG DOWNS POOR IN 4GAME MATCH
description: PHILADELPHIA, Feb. 21 Jim Zug gained the quarterfinal round of the United States squash racquets tournament today with a 1613. 1512, 13 15, 154 triumph over Tom Poor, the Atlantic Coast title holder, at the University of Pennsylvania.

title: FORDHAM SUBDUES RUTGERS, 9170
description: Bob Cassou made a lion's debut at Fordham 3 years ago, and he was about to make a lamblike exit last night when, suddenly he roared, scoring a career high of 24 points before 1,963 in his final game at the Rose Hill gym, giying the Rams a 9170 victory over Rutgers.

title: 1,200 TO HONOR BOB HOPE HERE
description: Bob Hope, honored as an en tertainer in many parts of the world, will receive a Gold Tee award tomorrow at the annual dinner of the Metropolitan Golf Writers Association.

title: This Road Is A Dead End
description: TWO films based on nota ble novels have recent ly opened: End of the Road, derived from John Barth's second, and probably best, novel, The End of the Road; and Tropic of Cancer, adapted from Henry Miller's fictionalized autobiography, possibly the favorite forbidden book of yesteryear.

title: Van Buren, Far Rockaway Win Playoffs in Basketball
description: Van Buren and Far Rock away won their opening games yesterday in the Public Schools Athletic League basketball playoffs.

title: Second Attempt to Find Elk By Use of a Satellite Fails
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21 (AP) A second attempt to find Monique the Elk by satellite communication to the plains of Wyoming failed today and an observer will be sent in to do the job on foot; the National Aeronautics and Space Admin istration said.

title: DRUGS KILL YOUTH; 34TH HERE IN 1970
description: A 17yearold boy died of an overdose of narcotics in a Brooklyn apartment building Friday afternoon, bringing to 34 the number of teenagers who have died of drug abuse in the city this year.

title: Before its finalor temporaryillness the theater was a wonderful thing
description: The current gossip along the Rialto is that the theater is dead, the old Fabulous Invalid practically has had it. Maybe so, maybe not, for Broad way's batting average as a seer is well below .400. One thing is certain, however, and a glance at Norman Nadel's A Pictorial History of the Theatre Guild will prove it: in the years just before its final illness or temporary malaisethe theater was a wonderful thing.

title: Sigma Delta Chi Chairmen
description: DALLAS, Feb. 21 (UPI) James F. Chambers Jr. and Joe M. Dealey have been elected honorary cochairmen of the 1972 national Sigma Delta Chi convention to be held in Dallas, it was announced this week. Mr. Chambers is president of the Dallas Times Herald Print ing Company and publisher of The Dallas Times Herald. Mr. Dealey is president of The Dallas Morning News.

title: Young G.O.P. Head in Race
description: OMAHA, Feb. 21 (AP)The chairman of the National Fed eration of Young Republicans, Ronald C. Romans, has an nounced his candidacy for the Republican nomination for Lieu tenant Governor of Nebraska. Mr. Romans, a 32yearold trucking company operator from Ralston, Neb., was elected head of the 500,000member Young Republicans group last year.

title: Chess
description: THESE days the San Francisco Bay area is a flourishing arena for active chess play of high quality. Foremost in the circuit are William Addison, who finished a strong second in the recent United States champion ship, and the young master, Jude Acers, our diligent and enthusiastic corres pondent.

title: GEORGE BRENGLE, 81, MARINE LAW EXPERT
description: George Swift Brengle, a spe cialist in marine law, who re tired in 1956 as senior partner of the New York law firm of Bighan, Englar, Jones & Hous ton, died Thursday in New York Hospital. He was 81 years old and lived at the University Club.

title: PAPPAS IS VICTOR IN RICH BOWLING
description: MILWAUKEE Feb. 21 (UPI) George Pappas of Charlotte, N. C., came up with a $10,000 shot in the final frame of the final game today to take first place in the $70,000 Miller High Life open bowling tour nament.

title: Sports Editor's Mailbox
description: Infuriated, Not Confused

title: 22 Injured on Bronx Bus Hitting Post After Pothole
description: Twentytwo persons were in jured, none seriously, yester day afternoon when a bus hit a pillar supporting IRT sub way tracks at Southern Boule vard and 167th Street in the Bronx.

title: The Radicalizing of a Guest Teacher at Berkeley
description: ISPENT last winter at the University of California at Berkeley. I'd been invited by the English Department to teach some writing courses during the winter quarter to group of students almost all of whom were work ing for teacher's credentials. I lived in the faculty club on campus and was therefore very close to, though not very actively involved in, the student strike and the uprisings and riots that followed it. Very soon after the strikeit was really a boycott, but since students everywhere call this kind of operation a strike, I will use that wordmy students and I decided to move our classes off campus, not so much because we strongly or actively supported the strike but because we did rot want to appear to be opposing it or flaunting it. Also, some of my students were very strongly in sup port of the strike and to continue to meet on campus would have made it impossible for them to go on attending the class, which they very much wanted to do.

title: A Gingerly Step Into Westchester Taken by Logue
description: EDWARD J. LOGUE moved into the suburbs last week like a man sticking his toe into a tub of hot water. The Urban Development Corporation, which he heads, is planning to build six or more demonstration housing projects in Westchester Coun ty, Mr. Logan said. They will be administered by a new subsidiary of the state agency made up of West chester residents.

title: John A. Knox Johnston to Wed Miss Shirley C. Laffey in April
description: FAR HILLS, N. J., Feb. 21 Mr. and Mrs. Edwin Well man Laffey of Far Hills and Harbour Island, Bahamas, have announced the engage ment of their daughter, Miss Shirley Collette Laffey, to John Anthony Knox Johnston of London. He is the son of Anthony Gordon Knox John ston, retired from the Colo nial Administrative Service, and Mrs. Knox Johnston of Palma de Mallorca, Spain.

title: American in Every thing but Geography
description: PEOPLE argue about whether the Japanese have an inferiority complex or a superiority complex. I sometimes think they have neither; what they have is an eriority complex. They just feel different from everybody else  sometimes superior, sometimes inferior, but al ways different. And this feel ing of uniqueness, the feeling of being a separate people, isolated on a few islands an chored off the far coast of Asia, has been a part of the cement holding the group to gether.

title: Johanna M. O'Donnell Planning Nuptials
description: The prospective bride was graduated from St. Raymond Academy and Marymount College in Tarrytown. A pro gramer with the Metropolitan Life Insurance Company here, she is enrolled in the national insurance education program of the Life Office Manage ment Association.

title: INFILTRATION RATE DROPS IN VIETNAM
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21  New information in the hands of the Nixon Administration shows that the rate of enemy infiltration in South Vietnam in January and so far on February was considerably below that of the same period of last year and that the rate this month) was even lower than that of last month.

title: A WRITER KNOCKS ZABRISKIE POINT
description: PREVIEW night at a new Antonioni film feels a little like play ing bingo in Saint Peter's Basilica. You can sense the stakes in the air, the rustle of reputation over pile carpeting, the perspiration under corporate collars. After all, this isn't just somebody's movie they're unveil ing tonight. Zabriskie Point is MGM's entree into The New York Review of Books, and Antonioni's hid for a life time subscription to Rat. No wonder the lobby of the Coronet is brimming with dry expectation. One man's tenure arbiter of Now is the line.

title: Does the study of the past have a future?
description: In The New York Times's review of 1969 in education, Stephen Graubard observed that the study of history is clearly on trial. There are signs of considerable self doubt in the historical profes sion about the worth of the whole enterprise. Historians who have done estimable work have themselves begun to question the value of the study of the past. Lee Benson, taking what he called a rather ex treme position, believes that history has become a rela tively trivial enterprise and has lost its intellectual vi tality. Martin Duberman, ad mitting his wish that we could find a way of making the past yield information of vital concern to contemporary needs, concludes skeptically that he has little hope that we can. C. Vann Woodward asks, as president of the Amer ican Historical Association, the unsettling question whether the study of the past has a future.

title: Law
description: WASHINGTON  The most visible Southern strategy at work these days is not the Nixon Administration's alleged political appeal to Dixie, but Southern leaders' campaign to prove that the nation's integra tion laws discriminate against the South.

title: Sierra Club and Muskie Accuse the Administration of Disregarding New Environmental Policy Act
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21The Sierra Club, a leading conserva tion organization, accused the Nixon Administration today of either ignoring or circumvent ing the new Environmental Policy Act when it recommend ed passage of a bill to increase logging in the national forests.

title: Migration From Puerto Rico to Mainland Is Down
description: SAN JUAN, P. R., Feb. 19 Migration from Puerto Rico to the mainland dropped sharply last year, according to figures supplied by Puerto Rico's plan nina board.

title: Cruise Prospects Bright
description: SMOOTH sailing is the way that cruise ship operators are describ ing the 1970's. This op timism is based on a sizable increase in advance bookings, as compared with 1969, and on a substantial program for building ships designed ex clusively for cruise work.

title: G.M. Shuns Performance For Cleaner Atmosphere
description: CHICAGO, Feb. 21The Gen eral Motors Corporation will test next fall whether the public is willing to accept some incon venience and possibly a little cost for a cleaner atmosphere.

title: MOSES SEES PANIC ON THE ENVIRONMENT
description: Robert Moses has lashed out against the national panic over environmental conditions and extravagant promises of instant remecliag action.

title: Judge Hoffman And the Contempt Weapon
description: CHICAGO  Before the trial of the Chicago 7 ended last week with the conviction of the Out of State 5, Judge Julius Hoff man left no doubt that he un derstood the offense vaguely called contempt of court as including disdainful attitudes to ward his court and our judicial system. Interpreted literally  and Judge Hoffman's interpre tation is not without precedent  contempt of court takes on the peculiar character of out lawing a state of mind.

title: Princeton Six Beats Yale
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Feb. 21 In a game marred by 26 penal ties, Princeton's hockey team downed Yale today, 53, for the Tigers' first Ivy League victory of the season. Roger Kyle scored two goals for the Tigers.

title: International Travel/1970 Part II
description: NAIROBI, KenyaEmptiness. The great African sky. Birds and animals in endless variety. Snowy mountains, dry plains, velvetgreen valleys, trop ical wetlands. Lonely Masai hunters, painted in ochre. These are a few of the reasons to travel in East Africa. The jaded tourist will find his curiosity refreshed, his gaze lifted. Anyone will feel a sense of renewal in the relationship with nature, of humility in the experience with different cultures.

title: Sister Attends Beatrice Cook At Her Bridal
description: SUMMIT, N. J., Feb. 21 Miss Beatrice Jean Cook and Robert Michael O'Connell were married here this after noon in the chapel of the Central Presbyterian Church by the Rev. Robert H. Stephens.

title: Dr. Gerald Henderson Dies; Anthropology Professor, 42
description: Dr. Gerald M. Henderson, an associate professor of anthro pology at Brooklyn College, did yesterday of an apparent heart attack in his home at 367 Parkside Avenue, Brooklyn. He was 42 years old.

title: LIVERPOOL UPSET BY WATFORD, 10
description: LONDON, Feb. 21 (Reuters)  Second  Division Watford broke the First Division's mo nopoly of the last four places in the English Football Asso ciation Cup race today when it beat Liverpool, 10, in the ma jor upset of the sixthround quarterfinals.

title: NIXON PANEL ASKS VOLUNTEER ARMY BY MIDDLE OF '71
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21  A highlevel Presidential commis sion told President Nixon today that the present Selective Serv ice System should be replaced by an allvolunteer army, backed by a standby draft for national emergencies, by the middle of next year.

title: The New Young Lunts?
description: THE question in Los An geles was not how the British National Thea ter seemed to be func tioning (splendidly, we knew that) but how Maggie Smith and Robert Stephens would shape up as the unannounced Lunts (they are husband and wife) of the company. Both were opening in a brandnew production, the gentle, grace ful, mezzotint revival of Farquhar's The Beaux' Stratagem, and then, a few nights later, taking over prominent roles in an already aged and much recast mount ing of Chekhov's The Three Sisters. There is no mistaking them. They do nothing to jar the very nice balance of the acting company as a whole, they're not whetting backstage knives to become superstars. But they are se verely present, palpably up there onstage.

title: Laredo Times Purchased By New Texas Concern
description: LAREDO, Tex., Feb. 21 (AP) The William Prescott Allen Estate has sold the 85yearold Laredo Times for an undisclosed sum to Laredo Newspapers, Inc., a new Texas corporation, it has been announced.

title: ROSS GROUP SEEKS TO PURCHASE JETS
Sadowsky Writes Bill to Reduce Estimate Board's Budget Power
description: The first move in a campaign to rearrange the powers of the city government  legislation that would remove budgetmak ing powers from the Board of Estimate  was introduced in the City Council yesterday.

title: FORT LAUDERDALE COLLEGE
description: Degree Programs

title: INQUIRY ON U.M.W. TURNS TO CANADA
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21  The Labor Department is ex tending into Canada its six weekold investigation of al leged election fraud in the United Mine Workers of America.

title: Late TV Listings
description: The following information about today's television pro grams was not available in time to appear in Section 2:

title: OvertheCounter Brokers Stay in the Black
description: Profits of most large overthecounter brokerage houses have dropped much less than those of their counterparts on the New York Stock Exchange.

title: Fairfield, in Upset
description: Manhatan College's hopes for a postseason tournament bid received a severe blow at an inopportune time yesterday. The Fairfield University bas ketball team, headed for no where with a 1210 wonlost record, upset the Jaspers, 7169, at Madison Square Garden.

title: Springtime soft
description: Spring enters softly, in hushed tones of beige and chamois, of mauve as pale as quartz, of blue as light as an April sky. The fabric usedwool jerseyis equally soft, and so is the styling.

title: In the Land of Kefta and CousCous
description: RABAT, MoroccoMany tourists attracted by Mo rocco's exotic and romantic reputation are finding a bonus in the country's culinary delights, and they go home convinced that they have discovered something really new. But kefta, bastilla, ouajen and djaja mammra are centuriesold Moroccan food specialties that are still the favorites of discriminating gourmets here.

title: Thailand's Foreign Minister Arrives Here for 5Day Visit
description: Foreign Minister Thanat Kho man of Thailand arrived here yesterday to begin a fiveday visit, which will be highlighted by a dinner in his honor Tues day, given by the Asia Society.

title: List of Forthcoming Entertainment Benefit Parties
description: Tickets for the following events may be obtained from the beneficiaries unless other wise indicated:

title: Art Notes
description: OUTSIDE his Deep South home, a black railroad worker strums a man dolin. A sharecropper prods a mule across a Caro lina field. A family glooms in a tenement flat. And, attend ed by a servant, a black SusannahfromtheBible pre pares to take her famous bath.

title: Article 6  No Title
description: THEATRE AND FINE ARTS

title: Army Captain Attends Mass For Slain Wife and Children
description: FORT BRAGG, N. C., Feb. 21 (UPI)  Capt. Jeffrey Mac Donald attended a Roman Cath olic mass today for his wife and two daughters, believed slain by, four persons under the in fluence of drugs.

title: International Travel/1970 Part I
description: PRAGUEAn American resident here was confronted one recent morning by a hitherto unknown friend of a friend back home who rang his bell, handed him a letter of introduction and stood panting in his doorway: An American in Prague! Oh, boy! An American in Prague!

title: A Big Year in Soviet Union Lenin's 100th Anniversary
description: MOSCOWFor visitors with an interest in Commu nist affairs, this is a very special year: It is the 100th anniversary of the birth of Vladimir Ilyich Lenin on April 22. Not surprisingly, the Soviet Union is devoting much of its energy these days to rolling out a red carpet for those who want to join the 241 mil lion Russians in celebrating Lenin's birthday.

title: Malawi Plans First Election
description: BLANTYRE, Malawi, Feb 21 Agence FrancePresse)Malawi will hold a general election early next year, her first since independence in 1964, it was announced today.

title: VILLANOVA SCORES. OVER LA SALLE, 9685
description: PHILADELPHIA, Feb. 21 (UPI)Howard Porter scored 24 points and pulled down 24 rebounds tonight to pace Vil anova to a 9685 victory over La Salle.

title: A Changing South Korea Doffs Her Morning Calm
description: SEOUL, South KoreaThis ancient Land of the Morning Calm, now rapidly transforming itself into modern nation, is concentrating this year on attracting as many tourists as possible from the hordes that are ex pected to visit Japan for Expo '70. Osaka, site of the fair, is only 75 min utes away by jet.

title: Degrees of Recruiting
description: BUMPING, Darrell Royal said, is when you just happen to wander down the street in this small country town, and this high school football prospect you've been chasing for the Iast two years walks by, and you just hap pen to bump into each other.

title: Gomez Finds Cuban Baseball Ails
description: YUMA, Ariz., Feb. 21Pres ton Gomez rem tmbers 1959. He was something of a hero in Cuba that year. So was Fidel Castro.

title: RUSSIANS CREATE ANTIHELIUM UNIT
description: Soviet physicists have re ported the creation and detec tion of nuclei of antihelium, thus strengthening the hypoth esis that the universe is com posed symmetrically of ordi nary matter and antimatter.

title: News of the Rialto
description: MARTIN DUBERMAN, that latterday Pro teus who teaches his tory at Princeton, writes assorted philosophical essays for magazines, re views the drama for Show magazine and fashions thea ter works such as In White America and the recently cordially received, if not ex actly successful Memory Bank. has another script in the offing.

title: MRS. ISIDORE HOLDEN
description: Mrs. Frances F. Ossin Holden, director of volunteers at Lin coln Hospital, the Bronx, since 1965 and cochairman of its community  action committee, died yesterday at her home, 500 West End Avenue. Her age was 53. She was the widow of Isidore Holden, who had been in the textile business.

title: Finland: The Price Is Right
description: HELSINKIIt is possi ble to eat a superior lunch in the capital of Finland for $2.50. A pack of cigarettes costs 60 cents. A good shot of whisky (good, as compared to Den mark's sniffsize pourings) is about 80 cents. And a double room in a hotel for more than $10 is the exception rather than the rule.

title: STUDENT DISSENT RISES IN PAKISTAN
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, Feb. 21 (AP)Campuses in military ruled Pakistan are buzzing with dissension while the Gov ernment guards against a re newal of the student uproar that brought down the 10year old regime of Field Marshal Mohammad Ayub Khan last March.

title: American Kennel Club Changes Regulation for Becoming Judge
description: THE American Kennel Club has abandoned the ap prentice system, through which candidates to become breed judges at dog shows become approved, and has replaced it with one through which the candidates are put right into the ring for three shows. It is called the pro visional judging system, because the applicants are approved on a provisional basis only until the three assignments are completed.

title: Calendar of Motor Sports Events
description: Feb.27Wing and Bonnet Sports Car Club rally school at Gifford's Inn, Avenue of Two Rivers, Rumson, N. J., 8 P.M. Information, Wing and Bonnet Club, P.O. Box 263, Sea Girt, N.J. 08750.

title: Sue Kessler, Aide at Museum, And Stuart P. Feld Betrothed
description: BROOKVILLE, L. I., Feb. 21Miss Sue Kessler, regis trar of the New York Cul tural Center (the former Gallery of Modern Art), and Stuart P. Feld, a partner in Hirschl and Adler Galleries in New York, plan to be married March 29.

title: Tennis Pros Hesitant on Support for Ashe on South Africa Issue
description: SALISBURY, Md., Feb. 21 When Arthur Ashe told reporters at the National Open indoor tennis champion ships here that he was going to fight for South Africa's expulsion from Davis Cup competition and the Interna tional Lawn Tennis Federa tion, he realized in advance he would receive little help from other tennis Wavers.

title: Democrats in Congress See Need For a Revolution
description: WASHINGTONNothing bet ter illustrates the current dis organization and impotency of Democratic liberals in the House than the way three riders aimed at blocking school integration were slipped into a Health and Education appropriations bill ap proved last week by the House.

title: $2Billion Market Might Open for Makers of Private Phone Systems
description: To interconnect, or not to interconnect: that is the big question facing corporate communications managers these days.

title: Yeshiva Triumphs by 7267
description: Yeshiva outscored Brooklyn College, 104, in the last three minutes of play to post a 7267 victory in its last home game of the season.

title: SPACE FERRY PLAN EYED BY PENTAGON
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21The space agency pressed ahead this week with plans for its pet project of the future, the space shuttle, but comments from sev eral high Administration offi cials have raised questions as to whether it will be converted into a troop train.

title: ORR NETS 2 GOALS AND SETS UP THIRD
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., Feb. 21 (AP)Bobby Orr scored two goals and set up another to night as the Boston Bruins de feated the Minnesota North Stars, 42, and moved into a firstplace tie with the New York Rangers in the East Division.

title: HAWKS SET BACK KNICKS BY 122106
INCREASE IS URGED IN HOSPITAL FUNDS
description: ALBANY, Feb. 21  Gover nor Rockefeller today proposed a $1.4billion increase in the amount of mortgage loan funds available for the construction and renovation of hospitals and nursing homes in the state.

title: AJive in Denmark
description: DIBECTOR Norman Jewison, who showed us what it was like to be a cub reporter in Chicago during the early part of this century in Gaily, Gaily, will give us an idea of what it means to he a young, black American living in contemporary Copenhagen in his next movie. He has just purchased the screen rights to Cecil Brown's highly acclaimed first novel, The Life & Loves of Mr. Jiveass Nigger,

title: Rev. Albert Buckner Coe Dies; ExHead of Congregational Unit
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Feb. 21 The Rev. Dr. Albert Buckner Coe, who retired in 1958 as president of the Massachusetts Congregational Christian Con ference and who took a leading part in the merger of the Con gregational Christian Churches and the Evangelical Reformed Church into the United Church of Christ, died today. He was 81 years old.

title: Grace C. Tebbutt to Be May Bride
description: LOUDONVILLE, N. Y., Feb. 21 Mr. and Mrs. James Greene Tebbutt Jr. have an nounced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Grace Cantine Tebbutt of New York, to Stephen Christopher Meigher 3d of New York, son of Mrs. Harry Roswell Sum merhayes Jr. of Schenectady and the late Dr. Stephen C. Meigher.

title: 15 Yankee Pitchers Campaigning for Four Openings on the Staff
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., Feb. 21 Spring training is only a few days old, but the pitching alignment of the New York Yankees is es sentially clear already, even though 21 pitchers are work ing out daily.

title: PLAINFIELD REACHES CURLING SEMIFINALS
description: MOUNT HOPE, N. Y., Feb 21 Curling rinks from New Jer sey, Quebec and Massachusetts reached the semifinal round to day of the 15th annual St. An drew's invitation mixed bon spiel at St. Andrew's Golf Club.

title: JUSTICE CLARE HOYT OF STATE COURT DIES
description: WALDEN, N. Y., Feb. 21 State Supreme Court Justice Clare J. Hoyt of Walden died last night at St. Luke's Hos pital in Newburgh after a short illness. He was 54 years old.

title: Labor Report Calls for Revised World Trade Policy.
description: BAL HARBOUR, Fla., Feb. 21The economic policy com mittee of the A.F.L.C.I.O. said today that the United States' position in world trade had de teriorated in recent years and that as a result a thorough re vision of Government policy was required in the interest of the American people. ne committee's report re flected growing concern by la bor in such industries as glass, shoes, electronics, textiles and steel over the effects of in creasing imports and competi tion.

title: Nixons Fete Tricia, 24, At Camp David Party
description: THURMONT, Md., Feb. 21 (AP)The Nixon family flew by helicopter today to Camp David, the Presidential re treat in the Maryland moun tains, to celebrate the 24th birthday of Tricia Nixon.

title: Barr was the biggest snoop of all
description: enigma standable, I would stoop to every liberty on earth. What constitutes excessive liberties in a historical novel is a clear matter of interpretation: the probabilities of 13thcentury Sicily are remote from the ex periences of 20thcentury America. But to me, the sum of her indulgences seems ex cessive and the resulting con struction unconvincing.

title: The Response
description: By tradition, this is the day when maplesugar men can expect sap to start flowing in lower New England. It doesn't always happen, but it does hap pen often enough to keep tradition alive.

title: The Year of the Tourist Starts in Japan Next Month At Expo '70 World's Fair
description: TOKYOThis is The Year of the Dog in the East. But in Japan, 1970 undoubtedly will be known as The Year of the Tourist. On March 15, Expo '70 will open in the Senri hills outside the old mercantile city of Osaka. Expo Is not only the first world's fair to be held in Asia, but it also is billed as the biggest and most expensive world's fair ever.

title: THE GIRL ON THE BILLBOARD
description: Your highways are open and littered with bones, but beyond the barbed wires as far as they can see your gentle land rolls brown and waistdeep in summer.

title: 3 Will Make Debut With the City Opera During Its 3d Week
description: Three artists will make their debuts with the New York City Opera during its third week of the season at the State Theater. They are Gary Glaze, tenor, as Normanno in Lucia di Lam mermoor; Richard Mundt, bass, as the Comte Des Grieux in Manon, and George Singer, conductor, for La Boheme. Casts for the week follow:

title: Is Betrothed
description: LAKELAND, Fla., Feb. 21 Mr. and Mrs. Carl W. May have announced the engage ment of their daughter, Miss Donna May of Annandale, Va., to Paul C. Nicholson 3d, son of Mr. and Mrs. Nichol son Jr. of Providence and Bristol, R. I. The wedding is planned for July 11.

title: The High Price of Being A Successful Gadfly
description: THE future of the Na tional Citizens Com mittee for Broadcast ing now appears in doubt. Thomas P. F. Hoving is quitting as chairman, Rob ert Montgomery already has left the organization and Marva Mannes, the critic and essayist, is too busy with oth er interests and, one suspects, may be weary of the war fare that has marked the group's internal delibera tions. There have been other resignations as well, and the outlook for Ben Kubasik, the committee's executive direc tor, who hopes to hold the group together, cannot be re garded as especially bright.

title: U.S, WILL SUPPORT 12MILE SEA LIMIT
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Feb. 21The United States has decided to favor an interna tional treaty extending the ter ritorial waters of all countries from the traditional threemile limit to a distance of 12 miles from the coast while guaran teeing international rights of passage through international straits.

title: Penn State Downs Pitt
description: UNIVERSITY PARK, Pa., Feb, 21 (AP)Ron Kodish and Bob Fittin led a secondhalf surge that gave Penn State a 6148 victory over Pitt today.

title: Garrison Assured Election After Opponent Withdraws
description: NEW ORLEANS, Feb. 21 District Attorney Jim Garri son, who sought to prove that a conspiracy was behind the death of President Kennedy, was assured of another term in office last night when his lone opponent for reelection with drew from the race.

title: Bridge
description: BRIDGE players, like plane pilots, sometimes find themselves land ing in unexpected places. The North South players in today's hand appar ently had established a sound major suit fit, but then wound up in a no trump contract.

title: U.S. ISSUES WARNING ON A PARTY FABRIC
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21The Government warned yesterday that a dangerously flammable sheer fabric, used mainly in wedding gowns and party dresses, had recently been gold nationwide both to bigname designers and massproducers of such apparel.

title: Duke 8776 Victor
description: DURHAM, N. C., Feb. 21 (UPI)  Randy Denton poured in 24 points and grabbed 21 rebounds today as Duke beat Maryland, 8776. Denton's re bound total equaled the entire Maryland effort.

title: Pipers Drop 6th in Row As Pacers Win by 130110
