description: BOGOTA, Colombia, Feb. 22  The fourway presidential election campaign in Colombia has entered the final stretch, and the question Will it come off peacefully? is receiving nearly as much attention as Who will win?

title: ROGERS PRAISES REALISTIC VIEWS OF BLACK AFRICA
description: MONROVIA, Liberia, Feb. 22 Secretary of State William P. Rogers ended a 15day tour of 10 African nations today and expressed pleasure with its results.

title: Pope Visits American College
description: ROME, Feb. 22 (UPI)Pope Paul visited the Pontifical North American College here today and told 250 American stu dents, You are sons of a great people, young and generous. The students gave the Pope $1,000 to aid slum dwellers in Rome.

title: Penn Central Appoints Metropolitan Manager
description: The Penn Central's three commuter lines into and out of Grand Central Terminal will be known, starting to morrow, as its Metropolitan Region and will be under the immediate supervision of James M. Loconto, a former New York Central official who returns as general man ager for operations.

title: ISRAEL SEEKS LIFT IN TRADE ACCORD
description: PARIS, Feb. 22Israel is counting on a new preferential trade agreement with the Euro pean Economic Community to accelerate structural changes in her industry and lift earn ings of foreign exchange.

title: PETERSHAM CURLERS GAIN WICKS TROPHY
description: MOUNT HOPE, N. Y., Feb. 22,  The Petersham (Mass.) Curl ing Club rink, skipped by Ed ward Cetto, won the 15th an nual invitation mixed bonspiel for the Wicks Trophy today. Petersham defeated Plainfield (N. J.) C. C., the defending champion, skipped by Robert Fuller, 86, in the 10end final at St. Andrew's Golf Club.

title: ROYALS VANQUISH 76ERS, 136 TO 116
description: CINCINNATI, Feb. 22 (UPI) Connie Dierking scored careerhigh 45 points, 19 in the third quarter, in leading the Cincinnati Royals to a 136116 victory tonight over the Phila delphia 76ers in a National Basketball Association game.

title: Memorial Servires
description: McEWENIan Howard Potter. Memorial serv ice Church of the Epiphany, York Ave. and 74th St., at 12 noon, Tuesday, Feb. 24. Please omit flowers.

title: Frustrated Suburbanite Maps City Parking Plan
description: A Westchester housewife who invariably experienced frustration during shopping trips to New York City be cause she found it difficult to find convenient parking garages, has provided a solu tion for other motorists.

title: MICHIGAN CONTEST DIVIDES THE G.O.P.
description: LANSING, Mich., Feb. 22  The task of fielding a candidate against Michigan's strong and popular senior Senator, Philip A. Hart, has left the state's Republican party in turmoil.

title: Richard Fagan Plays Piano at Town Hall
description: A talent for imaginative pro grambuilding enabled Richard Fagan to come to Town Hall late Saturday afternoon with list of works that gave his piano recital special appeal even though he himself did not play it all with the authority and noise it needed.

title: ClosedEnd Funds
Bullets Beat Knicks for First Time in 10 Games, 110104, as Monroe Stars
description: BALTIMORE, Feb. 22This city's athletic pride received a badly needed boost today when the Bullets, who had lost nine games in a row to the Knicks since last March 12, topped New York, 110104, be fore a crowd of 9,068 at Civic Center.

title: Echo From Chicago
description: The explosions set off at the home of Justice John M. Murtagh, minor as they fortunately were, represent one more step in the dangerous escalation of violence attending the judicial process. No known evidence links the outrage to the pretrial hearings of the Black Panthers, presided over by Justice Murtagh, and in deed it seems unlikely that a group whose members are charged with conspiracy to bomb public places would be foolhardy enough to commit such an act at this time.

title: F.C.C. Aide Scored for Double Standard on News
description: Nicholas Johnson, a liberal member of the Federal Com munications Commission, was chided yesterday by a top ranking official of the Colum bia Broadcasting System for al legedly supporting a double standard of Government inter vention in the dissemination of news.

title: Soviet Jewish Writers' Fate Decried
description: Max Hayward, the transla tor of Russian literature, as serts that Jewish writers in the Soviet Union live in a curious limbo, a kind of psychological twilight in which their relation to Rus sian society has been delib erately distorted.

title: Stolen Rifle Said to Cost G.I. More Than Its Price
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 22 (UPI)  A twicewounded and decorated soldier whose rifle was stolen in Vietnam was not only made to pay for it but was overcharged $60, Representative Lionel Van Deerlin, Democrat of California, said today.

title: CHICAGO WINS, 63, WITH EARLY SPURT
description: CHICAGO, Feb. 22 (AP)  The Chicago Black Hawks scored four goals in an action packed first period today and went on to smash the Boston Bruins, 63, in a nationally tele vised National Hockey League game.

title: NEW DATA GIVEN ION POVERTY IN CITY
description: With all its masses of poor, New York City nevertheless appears to have fewer poor families in proportion to its population than does the coun try at large.

title: White Elephant Ball to Assist Child Adoption Service March 4
description: The little White Elephant gathering that started life 31 years ago as a cocktail party and grew into a ball 13 years later will return to the Wal dorfAstoria on March 4 for the annual dinner dance in behalf of the Child Adoption Service of the Children's Aid Society.

title: FINCH WARNS SENATE ON H.E.W. FUNDS BILL
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 22 (UPI) Robert H. Finch, Secretary of Health, Education, and Welfare, warned the Senate today that he would recommend a second Presidential veto of a contro versial H.E.W. money bill un less its spending levels were cut further.

title: CALIFORNIAN GETS FINAL 68 FOR 273
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex., Feb. 22 (AP)Ron Cerrudo, one of the most promising young players on the professional tour, shot a closing 68 in rain and mud today for a fiveshot victory in the $100,000 San Antonio open golf tournament.

title: Sun Ra's Arkestra Plays Continuously For Over 2 Hours
description: Sun Ra and his merry crew, the Intergalactic Research Arkestra18 instrumentalists dressed in glittering red or gold dashikis and jauntily pointed woolen caps along with three girls who danced, declaimed and sangswarmed through the Red Garter at 15 West Fourth Street yesterday. It was a nonstop concert that lasted more than two hours.

title: Emily Vanderbilt Hammond, 95, Dies
description: Mrs. Emily Vanderbilt Sloane Hammond, a leader in philan thropic activities died yester day in her home at 136 East 64th Street. She was 95 years old.

title: Szell III, Lane to Conduct
description: Louis Lane, associate con ductor of the Cleveland Orches tra, will make his New York debut tonight at Carnegie Hall, substituting for the orchestra's musical director, George Szell, who has the German measles. The program remains the same: Bruckner's Symphony No. 8 and Mozart's Piano Concerto in E Flat (K.449), with Rudolf Firkusny as soloist.

title: Personal Finance
description: Last year. Congress enacted the Tax Reform Act of 1969, the most massive overhaul of tax law in the nation's history. The following article is the second of a series that periodically will examine the implications for personal money management of the changes that were adapted.

title: White House Is Host to 1776, Its First FullLength Broadway Show
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 22 The house is yours, Presi dent Nixon said tonight to the cast of 1776, which had just performed the first fullscale, fulllength Broad way show ever presented at the White House and received a standing, shouting ovation. It was George Washington's 238th birthday, and so, quite appropriately, the production was Sherman Edwards's tale about the drafting of the Declaration of Independence. John Adams, Benjamin Frank lin and Jefferson were among the principals, with Washing ton being heard from by dis patch. When It was over, the President gave a sense of his tory back to the performers. He told them that Abigail Adams, the first Presidential wife to inhabit the Executive Mansion, had hung her wash to dry in the same room where they had played. He pointed out the portrait of Washington by Gilbert Stuart hanging on an East Room wall. He informed his listeners that probably the best paint ing ever done of Franklin was just next door in the Green Room, and that a blessing John Adams wrote, express ing the hope that only wise and just men would live in the house, was carved into the mantelpiece of the State Dining Room.

title: A Rain of Marshmallows Pelts Thurmond at Drew U.
description: MADISON, N. J., Feb. 22 (UPI)  Senator Strom Thur mond, Democrat of South Caro lina, was pelted with marshmal lows by a group of hecklers as he defended Judge Julius Hoff man of the Chicago conspiracy trial, at a speech given here to day at Drew University.

title: North Cascades Dam Threat
description: Barely a year and a half ago, Congress established the North Cascades National Park in northern Wash ington State. Because of pressures from Seattle City Light, several scenic wilderness valleys were left out of the park. Now the motivation for this compromise has become clear.

title: Largest Containership Built in U.S. Sails for West Coast and a Cargo
description: The largest containership built in this country, the Ha waiian Enterprise, is headed for the West Coast to load her first cargo. The 34,700displace mentton vessel is designed to carry more than 1,000 24foot containers.

title: Thant Visits Burma Shrine
description: RANGOON, Burma, Feb. 22 (UPI)Secretary General Thant of the United Nations visited the Shwedagon Pagoda today and briefly meditated at the 2,500yearold Buddhist shrine, then spent the rest of the day visiting with his family. He leaves tomorow for the sea side resort of Ngapali for a threeday stay.

title: Jordan Expresses Regret At Crash of Swiss Plane
description: AMMAN, Jordan, Feb. 22 (Reuters)Jordan tonight ex pressed deep regret at yester day's Swissair plane disaster but said it was unthinkable that it could have been an Arab act in any way.

title: Massachusetts Politics: A Priestly Hat Is Thrown Into the Ring
description: BOSTON, Feb. 22  Massa chusetts, which has seen al most all manner of hats tossed into its political ring, saw for the first time this weekend the biretta of a Roman Catholic priest added to the lot.

title: MATZNER CLEARED IN JERSEY MURDER
description: PATERSON, N. J., Feb. 22 (AP)  Harold Matzner, a Wayne newspaper executive, and three other defendants were found not guilty today of the murder of Mrs. Judith Kavanaugh of Clifton.

title: Mexican Sings City Opera Butterfly
description: The ability to fuse singing and acting and make the re suit seem the natural expres sion of the performer is a rare quality in opera. It seems

title: Center for Vietnamese Studies Stirs Illinois Dispute
description: CARBONDALE, Ill., Feb. 22 Southern Illinois University at first glance seems a most unlikely magnet for antiwar militants.

title: Miss Popick Plans Nuptials
description: BALTIMORE, Feb. 22An nouncement has been made by Mr. and Mrs. Bernard Popick of the engagement of their daughter, Miss Barbara Frances Popick, to Dr. Doug las Roy Rosing, son of Mr. and Mrs. Warren W. Rosing of Williamsville, N. Y.

title: Advertising: New Creative Chief at Doyle
description: Doyle Dane Bernbach, with its bright creative reputation, today has a new creative di rectorBob Levenson, a 40 yearold with 11 years at the agency.

title: City Is Turned On And Out by Holiday And Hint of Spring
description: Inspired by weather that made spring seem a possibility again this year, New Yorkers shed their winter boots and took to the parks and sidewalks with their dogs, children and bicycles yesterday.

title: Chinese Report Industry in Shanghai Has Reduced Pollution by Using Wastes
description: HONG KONG, Feb. 22  Communist China reported to day that it, too, faced problems of industrial pollution, but it said that they were being solved by frugality and Maoist ingenuity.

title: Nayar, Howe Reach Final Of National Squash Racquets
description: PHILADELPHIA, Feb. 22  Anil Nayar, the defending title holder from Boston, and Sam Howe of Haverford, Pa., runner up last year, reached the final of the national squash racquets championship today at the Uni versity of Pennsylvania.

title: Bill Against Pupil Transfer Signed by Gov. McKeithen
description: BATON ROUGE, La., Feb. 22 (AP)Gov. John J. McKeithen signed today a bill against forced transfer of students to achieve racial balance.

title: Stamford Women Plan Style ShowLuncheon
description: STAMFORD, Conn., Feb. 22  The Stamford Woman's Club will hold its annual luncheon and fashion show March 6 at the Stamford Yacht Club. Mrs. Billie E. Card and Mrs. George J. Michel are cochairmen of the event, whose proceeds will help maintain the club house and grounds.

title: Guard and Police Arrest 2 On Carolina Negro Campus
description: DENMARK, S. C., Feb. 22 (AP)Two hundred and fifty National Guardsmen and law officers moved Into predomi nantly Negro Voorhees College before dawn today to enforce a court order against unauthor ized persons being on campus.

title: 16 Lines Stop Cargo Flights to Israel
description: LONDON, Feb. 22At least six European airlines tempo rarily suspended cargo flights to Israel today after yesterday's explosion and crash of a Swiss air jet bound for Tel Aviv in which 47 persons were killed.

title: For Officials, There Are Times for Discretion and Times for Action
Dublin: Battle to Keep the Gate Open
description: DUBLIDUBLINIf Byron's Arden NIf waved her green leaves above the dead of Waterloo, with equal pathetic fallacy Joyce's Anna Livia Plurabelle river runs sorrowfully for her city's theatrical children. The year has begun bleakly, and there are ominous signs that it will continue bleakly to its close. Above all, there is a loosely interpreted touch of dramatic irony in the present state of the Gate Theater. Just when its future seemed rosily assured it has been found to be riddled with dry rot, and, at the moment, it is that most sad of institutionsa dark and empty theater.

title: St. Andrew's Wins Curling
description: SOUTH PLAINFIELD N. J., Feb. 22The St. Andrew's Curling Cluh of Hastingson Hudson, N. Y., won the Dykes Memorial Medal today bl de feating Schenectady, N. Y., 14 7, at the Plainfield C. C.

title: Histadrut Campaign Raises $4Million in Five Months
description: The National Committee for Labor Israel reported yester day that it had raised $4,030, 000 in the last five months for the health, educational and social welfare activities of Histadrut in Israel.

title: MOLLOY AND POWER REACH SEMIFINALS
description: Archbishop Molloy High School, the defending champion, gained the semifinal round of the Catholic High Schools Ath letic Association basketball championship yesterday by de feating LaSalle Academy, 7463, for its 20th straight victory. Brian Winters led the Stanners with 27 points in the game played at St. John's University.

title: JEAN WALLACE MILLER
description: Jean Wallace Miller, a grad uate of Barnard College, in 1903 and permanent president of that class, died here Friday. She was 88 years old and lived at 28 East 10th Street.

title: Unity Is Price of Diversity for New York House Group
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 22  The New York Congressional delegation, long on numbers, has gotten the unhappy feel ing that it is short on clout.

title: 11Million Collection Offered To Milwaukee Art Center
description: MILWAUKEE, Feb. 22The Milwaukee Art Center disclosed today that it had been offered the entire $11million collection of Mrs. Harry Lynde Bradley, a Milwaukee art patron, who has acquired notable works of 20th  century painters and sculptors.

title: Prince Charles Gets Laugh By Fluffing Lines in Show
description: CAMBRIDGE, England, Feb. 22 (AP)Prince Charles gave preview of his talents as stage comedian today and for got his lines.

title: GOVERNOR WILL ASK $1.85 MINIMUM PAY
description: ALBANY, Feb. 22Governor Rockefeller said today he was sending to the Legislature to morrow a bill to raise the state's minimum hourly wage from $1.60 to $1.85.

title: KENNEDY MAPPING VOTEAT18 MOVE
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 22  Two Democratic liberals in the Senate, Edward M. Kennedy of Massachusetts and Birch Bayh of Indiana, are drafting a plan to use the Administration's vot ing rights bill as a legislative vehicle to reduce the voting age to 18.

title: LOUIS BEAUDOIN, 57, EXOTTAWA SPEAKER
description: MONTREAL, Feb. 22 (Cana dian Press)Louis Ren Beau doin, Speaker of the House of Commons from 1953 to 1957, died yesterday of a heart at tack. He was 57 years old.

title: South Africa Orders Press Not to Use Articles on Police
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Af rica, Feb. 22Detectives or dered newspaper editors this weekend to withhold publica tion of articles dealing with the activities of the security police.

title: PUERTO RICO LAGS IN SUGAR OUTPUT
description: SAN JUAN, Puerto Rico, Feb. 22  Puerto Rico's sugar in dustry, once the mainstay of the island's economy, is on the verge of collapse. Despite gov ernment attempts to bolster the industry, production of sug ar have declined.

title: News Summary and index
description: MONDAY, FEBRUARY 23, 1970

title: Thriving Cougars Defeat Nets, 10197
description: CHARLOTTE, N. C., Feb. 22The Carolina Cougars knew it was gding to be their day when their uni forms arrived almost in time for the game today.

title: Chess:
description: A New York master, An drew Soltis, won the recent Eastern experts championship, scoring, 4 , in the fiveround Swiss system event. The tourney was limited to 26 players, all rated above 2,000. Second place went to 21yearold Robin Spital, a graduate stu dent at Cornell. He had a score of 41.

title: Barbra and Rozie's Mother Used to Hope for Her Own Name Up in Lights
description: WHEN Mrs. Diane Kind was a youngster grow ing up in the Bushwick sec tion of Brooklyn, she used to lie in bed at night and dream about becoming an actress or ballerina or prima donna.

title: Ingrid Lafforgue and Penz Win SlalomRaces at Jackson Hole
description: JACKSON HOLE, Wyo., Feb. 22 (AP1Ingrid Lafforgue beat Barbara Cochran of Richmond, Vt., in the women's slalom to day and Alain Penz and Henri Brechu finished one two in the men's as the French continued their domination of the Wild West Classic World Cup ski races.

title: Belfast Pub FireBombed
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Feb. 22 (UPI)A gasoline bomb blew off the front door of a pub in a Roman Catholic area of Belfast today. No one was injured in the attack or in two other firebombings.

title: DOC GUERNSEY, 76, OF CLINTON DIES
description: Irwin S. (Doc) Guernsey, who taught social studies at De Witt Clinton High School for 44 years, died yesterday at his home, S Forster Parkway. Mount Vernon, N. Y. He was 76 years old.

title: Charles Abrams, World wide Housing Expert, Dies
description: Charles Abrams, the urban planner whose views have had a major effect on housing here and abroad, died of cancer in his home at 18 West 10th Street yesterday. He was 68 years old.

title: Filipinos Protest on U.S.
description: MANILA, Feb, 22 (Reuters) About 50 students carrying posters denouncing American imperialism, colonialism and feudalism picketed the United States Embassy here today. They were, dispersed at dusk by policemen.

title: Police Discover Heroin On a Suspect in Assault
description: A Brooklyn woman was pushed down a flight of sub way stairs in midtown yes terday by a pursesnatcher who was found to be carry ing heroin.

title: SONICS TURN BACK WARRIORS, 131127
description: SEATTLE, Feb. 22 (AP)Bob Rule scored 11 of his 30 points in the fourth quarter today as the Seattle Super Sonics held off a San Francisco Warrior rally for a 131127 National Basket ball Association victory.

title: 12 ARE ARRESTED IN WEAPONS RAID
description: Twelve members of the Pa triot party, a white militant group that supports the Black Panthers, were arrested last night at 674 West 161st Street after detectives observed weap ons being unloaded from a car parked in front of that ad dress.

title: Jewish Unit Urges Flights To Arab Nations Be Halted
description: The American Jewish Con gress called on the United States Government yesterday to take the lead in a worldwide effort to discontinue all flights to Arab nations as long as they continue to provide protection and support that make Arab terrorism possible.

title: CITY STUDIES PLAN TO MAKE 2 STREETS SHOPPING MALLS
description: The city is looking into the possibility of turning 42d and 53d Streets into pedestrian shopping malls during the noon time hours, Transportation Ad ministrator Constantine Sida monEristoff said yesterday.

title: Mickey Mouse in Italy
description: BOLOGNA, Italy, Feb. 22 (UPI)A Mickey Mouse comic hook published in 1933 sold fo4 $800 at public auction here to day. The buyer was not iden tified.

title: TEACHER IS BACKED IN STAND ON PLEDGE
description: ROXBURY, Conn., Feb. 22 More than two dozen local resi dents including William Styron and Arthur Miller, the authors, signed a statement here today protesting the suspension of teacher who refused to say the Pledge of Allegiance with her classes.

title: In Memoriam
description: SIEGELNorman. Miss you terribly. You'll always be with me. Anne.

title: U.C.L.A. Receives Annual Lesson in How to Lose
description: The University of California, Los Angeles, basketball team received its annual instruction in losing Saturday night.

title: Rising Momentum Is Indicated For February Eurobond Market
description: Financing activity in the international bond market is picking up this month, the Morgan Guaranty Trust Company reported in the current edition of its World Financial Markets publication. About $225 million of new offerings will have been made in February, Morgan Guaranty calculated. This is up from $140million last month.

title: Child Junkies and a Cry for Help
description: Sitting slightly slumped for ward in a chair, he rested his chin on his fist on top the table. His hair was brown; so were his eyes, brown and trusting. His face was thin.

title: Guatemala Election Race Enters Final Week as Violence Subsides
description: GUATEMALA, Feb. 22The momentum of Guatemala's presidential campaign is so strong going into the final week before the voting on Sunday that fears have passed that last minute terrorism can disrupt the election.

title: Frank Glazer Gives Piano Recital Of Schubert and Brahms Works
description: Frank Glazer's piano recital yesterday afternoon at Town Hall left the listener full of re spect for his intelligent musi cianship and ability to give carefully reasoned, unaffected performances of 19thcentury music. Mr. Glazer plays the piano most ably, although he had brief flurries of labored fingering in highly chromatic passages, and his taste in Brahms and Schubert ran to ward the simple and noble.

title: A CHURCH MOURNS PLIGHT OF ADDICTS
description: Lord, we must offer up our rage to you, the worshipers intoned yesterday at Good ShepherdFaith Presbyterian Church.

title: Athletics for Athletes
description: THE typical university coach is a soulless, back slapping, meticulously groomed, team  oriented efficiency experta jock's Robert McNamara. It not surprising that those studentscollege athleteswho daily spend two or three hours under the tutelage of these men are often the most reactionary group on campus.

title: Vast Plans Set for Solar Eclipse of the Century
description: Wideranging preparations are being made for viewing a March 7 total eclipse of the sun that United States astrono mers expect to be the eclipse of the century.

title: Professor Urges 5Point Plan To Aid U.S. Merchant Marine
description: A fivepoint program to re vive America's declining mer chant marine has beer, propcised by a Clemson University mari time specialist.

title: APPEARANCE GROUP IN DANCE PROGRAM
description: Two dances of a simple rhythmic nature were presented by a group called Appearance at the Museum, 739 Broadway, on Saturday evening. The first, The Disappearance, at least had the modest courage of its primitive movement convic tions, but the second dribbled out of performer control almost as soon as it began.

title: Swiss Government Investigates Sabotage in Crash
description: GENEVA, Feb. 22The Swiss Government, in a statement to day, officially voiced the widely held suspicion that the crash of a Swiss airliner bound for Tel Aviv yesterday was the result of sabotace.

title: This Year Even the Shoe Designers Are Confused
description: IF THE dress and coat seg ments of the fashion in dustry are perplexed about hemlines, the footwear chap ters are certainly having their ups and downs. One ray of sunshine on a otherwise cloudy horizon is the demise of the ugly shoe.

title: 7 Youthful Singers Serve a Rich Platter Of Puccini Pastries
description: Listening to a Puccini concert of arias and duets, with one luscious throbbing tune follow ing another, is rather like wolf ing down a large plate of su perbly prepared yet very rich Italian pastries. Such was the menu at Philharmonic Hall yes terday afternoon as seven young singers and an orchestra led by Carlo Moresco presented fa miliar music from nine Puccini operas.

title: Hope to Get Golf Award
description: A gathering of 1,200 golf buffs and champions will honor Bob Hope and others tonight at the national golf awards din ner at the Americana. Hope will receive the Gold Tee, sym bolic of his contributions to the game and his efforts to raise funds for the Eisenhower Med ical Center in Palm Springs, Calif. Among the champions to be honored will be Orville Moody, the United States Open titleholder.

title: Troops in Carolina Patrol Campus of Closed College
description: DENMARK, S. C., Feb. 23 (AP)National Guard troops patroled the Voorhees College campus today to prevent stu dents from returning to the predominantly black school, which was closed indefinitely after a class boycott.

title: House and Senate Hear The Farewell Address
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 23 (UPI)The House and Sen ate went through their an nual reading of George Washington's Farewell Ad dress today. It took Repre sentative Frank Annunzio, Democrat of Illinois, 56 minutes to read the speech. Senator Quentin N. Burdick, Democrat of North Dakota, read the 7,641word address in 41 minutes.

title: EXKENNEDY AIDE IS IN STATE RACE
description: Adam Walinsky, a former legislative assistant to the late Senator Robert F. Kennedy, an nounced his candidacy yester day for the Democratic nomi nation for State Attorney Gen eral.

title: In The Nation: The Great Turnaround
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 23 Suddenly it seems that the great national turnaround sym bolized in the Senate approval of the Stennis amendment means that the nation is to have a more sensible and pub licly acceptable approach to providing equal educational op portunity.

title: Tito in Egypt for Talks
description: CAIRO, Feb. 23President Tito of Yugoslavia arrived in Egypt today for two days of talks with President Gamal Abdel Nasser on the Middle East and other issues, includ ing proposals for a conference of nonaligned countries.

title: DR. WEATHERFORD, STUDIED APPALACHIA
description: BEREA, Ky., Feb. 23 (AP) Dr. Willis D. Weatherford Sr., a longtime trustee of Berea College and a director of major study of the Southern Appalachian region, died at Berea Hospital Saturday., He was 94 years old.

title: 4 Die in Austrian Avalanche
description: INNSBRUCK, Austria, Feb. 23 (AP)Four persons were killed and five injured when an avalanche hit the Tyrolean village of St. Sigmund in the Sellrain Valley today, rescue workers reported. Army en gineers flown in by helicopter were working in the ruins.

title: Marilyn E. Pfaff Is Future Bride Of E. E. Pollard
description: SUMMIT, N. J., Feb. 23 Mr. and Mrs. Henry C. Pfaff of Summit and Nantucket, Mass., have announced the engagement of their daugh ter, Miss Marilyn Elissa Pfaff, to Edward Ellsberg Pollard, son of the Rev. Dr. and Mrs. Goldwin S. Pollard of Huntingdon Valley, Pa., and Southwest Harbor, Me.

title: Toy Discount Store Is Set For Suburb by Interstate
description: Interstate Department Stores, Inc., announced yesterday that its Children's Bargain Town U. S. A. division will open the first of 12 discount toy super markets in the New York area in Commack, L. I., in the fall. Commack is in Suffolk County.

title: 30 Reported Buried In Swiss Avalanche
description: RECKINGEN, Switzerland, Tuesday, Feb. 24 (AP)The police said today that about 30 people had been buried by an avalanche in the Goms Val ley in southwest Switzerland.

title: Letters to the Editor of The Times
description: Fate has presented President Nixon with a magnificent op portunity. With a stroke of the pen he can defuse the student revolt, preempt the most ef fective arguments of the New Left and destroy the plausibility of charges of protofascism now openly leveled at his Ad ministration.

title: Maddox Signs Bill Barring Transfers of Students
description: ATLANTA, Feb. 23 (AP)  Gov. Lester G. Maddox signed into law today a bill to pre vent the transfer of students and teachers to achieve racial balance in schools.

title: Abram Leaves Brandeis; Will Enter Senate Race
description: WALTHAM, Mass., Feb. 23 Morris B. Abram, president of Brandeis University since 1968, resigned today so he would be free to explore more completely the call from many quarters to run for the United States Senate.

title: Article 3  No Title
Pompidou Is Welcomed by Agnew as He Arrives for an EightDay Visit
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 23 President Pompidou was wel comed to the United States today by Vice President Agnew. The President, For eign Minister Maurice Schu mann, their wives and other members of the party landed in a chilly wind at Andrews Air Force base in Maryland after a flight from Paris aboard a French Air Force jet. The protocol called for no formal greetings before a trip to President Nixon's re treat at Camp David, Md. There is to be a formal wel come at the White House tomorrow morning. But the Administration sent Mr. Agnew to set a friendly tone for the eightday visit. As a thousand proIsrael demon strators paraded with anti Pompidou signs at the White House, Mr. Nixon's press sec retary, Ronald L. Ziegler, said: The plans arranged for President Pompidou's state visit are in accordance with the friendship that does exist between the two countries. We receive him with courtesy and friendship and I believe Congress will receive him with courtesy. A group of Congressmen have announced plans to boycott Mr. Pompi dou's address Wednesday.

title: Wings' Goalie Out for Week
description: DETROIT, Feb. 23 (UPI) Roger Crozier's sprained right ankle will be placed in a cast and the Detroit Red Wings' goalie will be sidelined for a week to 10 days, Sid Abel, the Wings' general manager, said today. Crozier originally in curred the injury on Jan. 22 and hurt the ankle again last Sturday night in a game against Toronto.

title: GUERRILLA GROUPS DENY CRASH ROLE
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Feb. 23 The unified command of Pales tinian guerrilla organizations announced today that a thor ough investigation had shown beyond the shadow of a doubt that none of the com mando groups had anything to do with the Swiss Air disaster on Saturday.

title: DIVIDEND MEETINGS TODAY
description: Amer Bank Note

title: KENTUCKY LEADS IN WRITERS' POLL
Clarence Schoo Dead at 85; President of Box Concern
description: SPRINGFIELD, Mass., Feb. 23  Clarence J. Schoo, founder and president of the General Fibre Box Company of West Springfield, died after a stroke at his home here last night. He was 85 years old.

title: Canada's Bid Threatens Hockey as Olympic Sport
description: LAUSANNE, Switzerland, Feb. 23  Avery Brundage, president of the International Olympic Committee, said today there was little chance that ice hockey would remain on the Olympic program if profession als were permitted to play in the sport's world champion ships.

title: ROGER GRESHAM COOKE
description: LONDON, Feb. 23  Roger Gresham Cooke, an active hackbench Member of Parlia ment, died last night in West minster Hospital. His age was 63.

title: NEW ETHICS CODE URGED ON CAPITOL
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 23 Congress has been urged to adopt a stringent new code of financial disclosure rules, af fecting both members and high salaried staff workers and in volving property holdings and debts as well as income.

title: Ceylon Plans Asian Talks
description: COLOMBO, Ceylon, Feb. 23. Ceylon plans to sponsor a conference of nonaligned coun tries. No date has been decided but an exploratory Meeting for the proposed talks by heads of governments is to be held in Colombo March 812.

title: Wyandotte Chemical Raises Sodium Bicarbonate Prices
description: The Wyandotte Chemical Corporation announced yester day it would raise its prices by $6 a ton on all grades of sodium bicarbonate. The new prices, effective March 1 for spot cus tomers and April 1 for contract customers, are free on board Wyandotte, Mich., freight equalized, for shipment in truck or car load quantity.

title: E. R. WEINERMAN OF YALE AND WIFE
description: Dr. E. Richard Weinerman, a professor of public health at Yale University, and his wife, Shirley, were among the 47 victims of the Swissair jet crash Saturday near Zurich. Dr. Weinerman was 52 years old; his wife was 51. They lived at 5 Eastland Road in Hamden, Conn.

title: The Politics of Oil
description: President Nixon has bowed to the oil industry in shelving the recommendations of the majority of his Cabinetlevel task force on oil import control.

title: CITY JOBS OFFERED TO YOUNG LAWYERS
description: The city's Investigation De partment is offering an excit ing experience  at a starting salary of $10,500 a year  to young lawyers.

title: Stanley Fryczynski, 84, Dies; Bayonne City Commissioner
description: BAYONNE, N. J., Feb. 23 Stanley H. Fryczynski, who was elected City Commissioner at the age of 65 and served three fouryear terms, died yes terday in his home at 32 East 34th Street here. He was 84 years old.

title: Pollution Fight Pressed Across Nation
description: Spurred by the emergence of conservation as a potent political issue, state and local government officials across the country are responding to growing public pressure with a flood of proposals for new environmental laws.

title: 6 Held in Theft at Pier Of Truck With TV Sets
description: Six men were arrested early today in the theft of a truck containing television and radio sets and tape re corders valued at $1million from a Brooklyn pier.

title: Apollo 12 Crew in Europe
description: LISBON, Feb. 23The three Apollo 12 astronauts, Comdrs. Charles Conrad Jr. and Richard F. Gordon Jr. and Lieut Comdr. Alan L. Bean of the Navy today began a goodwill tour of Eu rope with a oneday visit to Lisbon.

title: Knights of Columbus Honor Washington; Others Protest the Chicago Trial
description: Two paradesone of devo tion and one of dissent marked the observance of George Washington's Birthday here yesterday.

title: Poor People Are Poor, Antipoverty Chief Says
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 23 (AP)  Donald Rumsfeld has informed his employes at the antipoverty agency they can once again call poor people poor.

title: Article 1  No Title
Brazilian Minister Resigns
description: BRASILIA, Feb. 23 (AP)  Brabil's Minister of Trade and Commerce, Fabio Yassuda resigned today and was re placed by Marcos Vinicius Pra tini de Moraes.

title: Washington's Birthday A Work Day Next Year
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 23 (UPI)George Washington's birthday falls on a Monday next year, too, but many Americans who got yesterday off will have to work on the birthday next year.

title: Behind the Jockeying to Repeal Blaine: A Squabble Over Method
description: ALBANY, Feb. 23When the Legislature turns its attention again to the socalled Blaine Amendment, it will be dealing more with a problem of how to accommodate differing posit tions of legislative leaders than with the substantive issue of state aid to churchrelated schools.

title: Charles Plays the Clown Prince for Old Trinity
Theater: Shaw's Man and Superman
Nat'l Hockey League
description: SUNDAY'S GAMES

title: A Correction
description: Because of a mechanical er ror, an article in yesterday's New York Times about Richard W. Jencks's criticism of Nicho las Johnson, the Federal Com munications Commission mem ber, quoted Mr. Jencks, presi dent of the C.B.S. Broadcast Group, as having said that the F.C.C. sought the security outtakes of the network's coverage of the Mississippi Freedom March in 1968. Mr. Jencks actually said that the F.C.C. sought to secure out takes, or unused film portions, of the march. The issue of se curity was not involved in the case.

title: Suit to Aid Whooping Cranes
description: CORPUS CHRISTI, Tex., Feb. 23 (UPI)The Naticnal Audu bon Society has sued the Texas Parks and Wildlife Commission and five San Antonio Bay area shell dredgers to halt destruc tion of the only remaining winter feeding grounds of the whooping crane. The society asked Federal Court here for an injunction to stop oyster shell dredging sanctioned by the commission to obtain cal cium carbonate for road con struction.

title: Guyana Proclaimed a Republic; Ties With British Crown Broken
description: GEORGETOWN, Guyana, Feb. 23The birth of the Coopera tive Republic of Guyana was proclaimed here at midnight ceremonies last night in a move to sever this former British colony's remaining ties to the Crown.

title: Data Hint Moon Is Not Homogeneous and Has an EarthLike Crust
description: HOUSTON, Feb. 23  Scien tists reported today that chem ical evidence is pointing more and more to the conclusion that the moon is not a homo geneous body but, like the earth, has a crust.

title: St. George Biddle Duke To Marry Janie C. Lee
description: Angier St. George Biddle Duke, with roots in Biddle and Baker banking and Duke tobacco money, will marry Miss Janie Corry Lee, who owns an art gallery in Dal las, on April 4 in a ceremony at her home there.

title: Shore Chosen to Get Lester Patrick Trophy
description: Eddie Shore, one of the greatest defensemen in hock ey history, was named yes terday to receive the 1970 Lester Patrick Memorial Tro phy.

title: Article 6  No Title
COACHES' POLL
description: The top 20 teams, with points figured on a 1098765 4321 basis for first through 10th places (firstplace votes in parentheses) and wonlost records through games of last Saturday:

title: LIPPERT ADDS SENTA TO HER MET ROLES
description: Marion Lippert, the German soprano who made a striking impression in her debut as Turandot in the Puccini opera last season at the Metropolitan Opera, has been widening her repertory with the company this year. She recently sang the Marschallin in Der Rosen kavalier and last night she took the part of Senta in Der Fliegende Hollnder for the first time here.

title: Phoenix Returning With BacktoBack Productions
description: When the Association of Producing Artists and the Phoenix producing organiza tion dissolved their ties last spring, T. Edward Hamble ton said that the Phoenix would go on. He was, he now freely acknowledges, saying the usual courageous words you say in such circum stances.

title: I.T.T. Unit Fills Post
description: The election of R. L. Scraf ford as executive vice president of I.T.T. Space Communica tions, Inc., a division of the International Telephone & Tele graph Corporation, has been announced. Mr. Scrafford had been executive vice president.

title: Kentucky Tops Alabama 9889, and Gains 25th League Title as L. S. U. Loses
description: TUSCALOOSA, Ala., Feb. 23 (AP)Dan Issel scored 47 points tonight as topranked Kentucky defeated Alabama, 9889, and won its 25th South eastern Conference basketball championship.

title: GENERAL'S NOVEL STIRS COLOMBIANS
description: BOGOTA, Colombia, Feb. 23 A Colombian Army general renowned for his victories against guerrillas has become a successful author with a novel about guerrilla war that con demns violence.

title: King Is Demoted in Ivory Coast Decentralization
description: BONDOUKOU, Ivory Coast The king of the Abron tribe and his four chief ministers arrived here with much glitter, incan tations and beating of drums. They were borne high on sedan chairs, shaded by royal para sols and accompanied by golden scepter bearers and hundreds of followers.

title: Advertising: Yankees Hitting the Airwaves
description: The New York Yankees took to the air yesterday to drum up enthusiasm for its baseball team. They've never started a preseason promo tion so early.

title: The Diving Hemline: Now It's Tassell
description: A WOMAN in public life could do a lot worse than be dressed over the years by Gustave Tassell. Her clothes would always look tasteful, even stylish. And nobody could tell how large her wardrobe was or how much she spent on clothes. They were so classic and they changed so subtly, they'd stay, above fashion for years. Until now.

title: Clarke Seeks Yanks' Aid to Get Loan
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., Feb. 23If you don't believe times have changed, consider the notyetofficial but possible holdout of Horace Clarke, reg ular second baseman of the New York Yankees.

title: TALE OF 3 TENORS AND A CONDUCTOR
description: LONDON, Feb. 23  Three tenors in three days is a bit much  even for Leonard Bernstein. But that is what the conductor has faced in re hearsals, a public performance and then a recording of the Verdi Requiem here.

title: WNBCTV Bureau Head
description: WNBCTV (Channel 4) has named Frank Kelly to head the local station's new bureau in Greenwich, Conn., which will be responsible for news in Westchester County, N.Y., and Fairfield County, Conn. The station's other suburban bu reaus are in Mineola, L.I., and Newark.

title: Jordan's Interior Minister Resigns a Day After Accord With the Commandos
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Feb. 23 One of King Hussein's most trusted cabinet ministers re signed today in what appeared to be an expression of disap proval over the agreement reached yesterday by the King with Palestinian commando groups.

title: Soares to Pilot Brown Six
description: PROVIDENCE, Feb. 23 (AP) Allan Soares, freshman hockey coach at Brown University since 1963, was named today as head coach of the varsity team, ef fective next season. Soares suc ceeds Jim Fullerton, who an nounced his retirement a few weeks ago.

title: Thousands of Kentucky Teachers Strike on Pay
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Feb. 23, (AP)  Thousands of teachers' abandoned classrooms across the state today in a battle with the Legislature over mon ey. It was not clear how many were actually on strike be cause many were scheduled to be out anyway in observance of Washineton's Birthday.

title: PAN AM SAYS 747 SHOWS A PROFIT
description: In its first four weeks in passenger service, the Boeing 747 jumbo jet carried consider ably more passengers than needed to make a profit, Pan American World Airways in dicated yesterday.

title: John Eisenhower Rejects Call to Run for the Senate
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 23 (AP) John S. D. Eisenhower, the Ambassador to Belgium, has rejected the suggestion of some Pennsylvania Republicans that he run for the Senate against Senator Hugh Scott.

title: Laotian Dam Is Started
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Feb. 23 (Agence FrancePresse)  King Savang Vatthana of Laos to day laid the first stone of the $31million dam at Namngum, about 30 miles north of here. The dam, paid for by an inter national consortium, is expected to help increase farm and pow er production in Laos and Thailand.

title: MONTREAL STOCKS SHOW SHARP RISE
description: The stock market in Montreal scored a sharp advance in light trading, but declines out numbered advances 229 to 198.

title: Industry Is Thriving on Cape Breton Island
description: PORT HAWKESBURY, Nova Scotia  Every few minutes a truck piled high with logs rumbles down Granville Street, past the Strait Printing and Publish ing Co., Ltd.

title: NUVEEN WILL TRADE IN OPTIONS ON BONDS
description: John Nuveen & Co., the wide ly known bond dealer, an nounced yesterday that it was starting to trade in put and call options on Government bonds. A spokesman for the firm said that this was believed to be the first time that such an option market had been de veloped.

title: STORE SALES HIGH IN CITY PROMOTION
description: Consumers beset by rising prices and the continuing bite of inflation responded yester day in an unprecedented turn out for the holiday as New York stores presented their traditional Washington's Birth day bargain promotions.

title: Article 9  No Title
PRISON STUDY PLAN ENDORSED BY BURGER
description: ATLANTA, Feb. 23 (AP) Chief Justice Warren E. Burger threw his support today be hind a proposal by the presi dent of the American Bar As sociation for a major study of the nation's prison system.

title: Marks Outpoints Vinales
description: Carlos Marks of Trinidad, a middleweight, outpointed Luis Vinales of New York last night in the featured 10round bout at the Audubon Ballroom. Marks weighed 158 pounds, two less than Vinales. There were no knockdowns.

title: Tenant Interest Urged
description: City councilman Robert I. Postel, Democrat of Manhattan, filed a resolution yesterday that would require landlords of resi dential and commercial build ings to deposit security money required of tenants in interest bearing bank accounts and re turn the interest to the tenant. He said landlords ex tracted $500million in security payments from tenants and put it to their own use and advan tage but with no reciprocal benefit to the tenants.

title: ROBERT L. LUENING
description: Robert L. Luening, a retired consulting engineer and admin istrator, died after a heart at tack Feb. 16 at his home in Bucksport, Me. He was 75 years old.

title: American Killed in Attack On Holy Land Tourist Bus
description: JERUSALEM, Feb. 23  An American woman was killed and two women were slightly wounded today when the bus on which they were making a tour of the Holy Land was raked by shots close to Hebron, in Israelioccupied Jordan.

title: Four Miners Shot by Police At South African Gathering
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Af rica, Feb. 23  Four Africans were wounded, one seriously, yesterday when the police opened fire after miners refused to disperse during a loud gath ering and then did a war dance near Klerksdorp, in the western Transvaal.

title: SOUTHERN CROSS SAILS TO VICTORY
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Feb. 23 (AP)  Strong winds and rough seas disabled two United States boats in today's heat in the world 5.5Meter yachting championship.

title: News Summary and Index
description: TUESDAY, FEBRUARY 24, 19??

title: India Said to Ask U.S. to Shut Down 5 State Libraries
description: NEW DELHI, Feb. 23 (AP) Informed sources said today that the Indian Government had asked the United States to close its Information Agency libraries in five state capitals within 90 days.

title: Downing Hopes Oakland Gold Will Lead to a Rainbow Year
description: MESA, Ariz., Feb. 23Al Downing hasn't lost a team. He's gained a uniform and a pair of shoes.

title: Student in the Middle
description: OLDLINE school adminis trators regard the arrival of the lean, softspoken young man in their halls with apprehension. Some militants consider him a sellout for trying to work within the es tablished system. Many dis affected high school students think him foolish for trying to change what is unchangeable, or irredeemable. You're always caught in the mid dle when you try to acomplish something in stead of talking, says Don ald St. George Reeves, the 17yearold president of the City General Organization Council, which is the repre sentative body for the city's 275,000 public high school students. But then, he adds with one of his rare smiles, nobody ever said it was easy.

title: 3 Auto Makers Say Feb. 1120 Sales Fell
description: Lower newcar sales during Feb. 1120 were reported yes terday by the General Motors Corporation, the Ford Motor Company and the Chrysler Cor poration.

title: Graham to Head Book Firm
description: Howard B. Graham, general manager of the Junior Book Division of McGrawHill Book Company for the last four years, has joined Grolier, Inc., as pres ident of its Franklin Watts, Inc., subsidiary, it has been an nounced by E. J. McCabe Jr., Grolier chairman. Grolier is one of the world's largest publishers of encyclopedias, reference, books and educational material. The subsidiary publishes a wide range of children's books for preschoolers, elementary and junior high school students.

title: MAN TRAPPED IN FIRE ACCUSED AS A THIEF
description: A man returned to a Green wich Village bar where he had once worked, the police said, pocketed the weekend receipts and set fire to the place early yesterday, only to be trapped by the fire in the basement. He was found unconscious by fire men and taken to St. Vincent's Hospital, where he was treated for smoke inhalation and de tained as a prisoner.

title: Chinese Trade Gains
description: TOKYO, Feb. 23 (AP)Com munist China's foreign trade in 1969 overcame a twoyear decline, the Japanese Foreign Ministry's statistical division has reported. Chinese exports were placed at $2billion and imports at nearly $1.9billion.

title: Japan Eases Restrictions On Bank Dividend Rate
description: TOKYO, Feb. 23 Reuters The Japanese Finance Ministry said today it had decided to ease current restrictions on rates of divided paid by major commercial banks, effective in September.

title: P.S.C. Opposes Bus Bid To Raise Jones Beach Fare
description: The Public Service Commis sion announced yesterday that it had prevailed upon two local bus companies not to raise their fares on runs between Manhat tan and Jones Beach.

title: Lake Tests Link Cities To Snowfall
description: In addition to producing smoke; noise and frayed nerves it appears that cities also make snow.

title: COMMON MARKET MEETS ON MONEY
description: PARIS, Feb. 23 (Reuters) Finance Ministers of the European Economic Community tonight reached broad agree ment that 1980 should be the deadline for a common Euro pean currency, according to financial sources here.

title: POMPIDOU TO WOO U.S. INVESTMENTS
description: PARIS, Feb. 23  President Georges Pompidou of France is going to the United States with hopes of attracting more Amer ican capital investment in France, his aides said today.

title: Rogers Back From Africa
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 23 (Reu ters)Secretary of State Wil liam P. Rogers returned here tonight from his 15day tour of 10 African nations. He visited Morocco, Tunisia, Ethiopia, Ken ya, Zambia, the Congo (Kin shasa), Cameroons, Nigeria, Ghana and Liberia.

title: FORD PROFITS SAG WHILE SALES RISE
description: DETROIT, Feb. 23  The Ford Motor Company's profits in the fourth quarter and all 1969 dropped sharply despite record sales.

title: Tax Relief Limit Proposed To Slow Population Growth
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 23 (Reu ters)  Senator Robert W. Packwood, Republican of Ore gon, proposed today that a family should only be allowed income tax relief for a maxi mum of three children.

title: Six on Light Airplane Killed In Crash on Kentucky Peak
description: PINEVILLE, Ky., Feb. 23 (UPI) Six Ohio residents, returning home from auto races at Day tona Beach, Fla., were killed last night when their light air craft crashed and burned dur ing a heavy rainstorm in moun tainous southeastern Kentucky.

title: Curbs on Flights to Israel Are Assailed in Britain
description: LONDON, Feb. 23  The Government came under attack from all sides of the House of Commons today for letting air lines suspend some services to Israel after the apparent sabo tage of an Israelbound Swiss plane.

title: Louis Lane Leads Szell Clevelanders In Bruckner Eighth
description: Louis Lane conducted the Cleveland Orchestra in a mag nificent performance of Bruck ner's Eighth Symphony last night at Carnegie Hall.

title: Bridgeport Team Registers 7972 Triumph Over lona
description: John Fosterbey scored 27 points and grabbed 12 re bounds to lead Bridgeport to a 7972 upset of Iona last night at Mount St. Michael Academy in the Bronx.

title: City's Skies Are Viewed as a Huge Trash Can
description: SWIRLING up and aloft on yesterday's strong winds, over the streets and across the parks, went thousands of pieces of litter, papers, tissues, boxes and cardboard, creating a surrealistic vision of an urban maelstrom.

title: Eddie Albert Sets Up Firm; Plans Antipollution Movies
description: Eddie Albert, the actor, has formed Eddie Albert Produc tions to make movies, visual aids and other communications materials for theater, television and schools in the campaign against environmental pollution.

title: Mrs. Romney Enters Contest for Senate
description: ANN ARBOR, Mich., Feb. 23 Mrs. Lenore Romney entered the Michigan Senate race to day.

title: Computer Multiplies Rates
description: NEWBURYPORT, Mass., Feb. 23 (AP)Irate residents who bombarded the Board of As sessors with complaints today that new property evaluation rates were too high discovered that a computer had added ex tra zeros to their bills. The computer went haywire, a spokesman said.

title: Gillette Elects Officer
description: The election of Stephen J. Griffin as executive vice presi dent in charge of international operations, was announced yes terday by the Gillette Company. Mr. Griffin had been senior vice president in charge of adminis trative operations.

title: U.S. Places 4th Highest In Consumer Price Rises
description: The United States showed the fourth highest increase in consumer prices between June, 1968, and June, 1969, in a study of 14 industrial countries

title: DR. ELAINE WESTON
description: KEARNY, N. J., Feb. 23Dr. Elaine Weston Riordan, a phy sician who practiced here for more than 20 years and the wife of Dr. John P. Riordan, died yesterday at West Hudson Hospital. She was 54 years old and lived at 926 Bloomfield Avenue, Glen Ridge.

title: PEKING CHARGES A PLOT ON TAIWAN
description: HONG KONG, Tuesday, Feb. 24Communist China charged the United States and Japan to day with promoting a move ment for the independence of Taiwan.

title: Tests Slated for Hetzel
description: PHILADELPHIA, Feb. 23 (UPI) Fred Hetzel of the Philadel phia 76ers, admitted yesterday to Good Samaritan Hospital in Cincinnati for a stomach ail ment, returned here today and was placed in the care of Dr. Stan Lorber, the team physician. Hetzel will undergo tests at Temple University Hospital.

title: Save Your Vision Week
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 23 (AP) President Nixon, declaring that preservation of sight is one of man's greatest chal lenges, proclaimed the first week in March as Save Your Vision Week. He said that modern research had developed the technology for preventing nearly onehalf of all new cases of blindness in this country.

title: BOSTON U. STUDENTS BEGIN 2DAY STRIKE
description: BOSTON, Feb. 23Class at tendance was off sharply at Boston University today as stu dents began a twoday strike to protest what they call po litical repression at the uni versity.

title: Oliver Rea Plans 2 Off Broadway Shows for Fall
description: Oliver Rea, who for six years served as administra tive director and president of the Minnesota Theater Com pany Foundation, which oper ates the Tyrone Guthrie Rep ertory Theater in Minne apolis, is looking forward to a busy season off Broadway.

title: British Soccer
description: ENGLISH LEAGUE

title: Bounty for Junked Cars Urged
description: Special incentives to car owners were proposed here yesterday to keep them from adding to the curbside clut ter of abandoned automo biles.

title: Chapman Applies for Approval Of 148 Lost Victories in Canada
description: WESTBURY, L. I., Feb. 23 On this of all days, when even a man with limitless gall wouldn't attempt to stray from the truth, John Chapman sought confirmation of 148 vic tories not credited to him by the United States Trotting As sociation.

title: End of Mod Era? Not for New Shop.
description: THERE have been rumors that the. British mod movement in fashion is dead, but Granny Takes a Trip, of the Kings Road in London, doesn't seem to think so. The shop has opened a New York branch at 304 East 62d Street, full of the finery the young seem reluctant to part with. There are shiny satin pants in psychedelic colors for either sex ($25) to be worn with Vic torian blouses (for girls, $35) or velveteen Edwardian coats (for men, $125). The shop's favorite dress is a longand long waisted  affair guaranteed to make any young woman look like a folk singer from the hills of Tennessee. It comes in sprigged calicos ($60) or in foggycolored crepes ($65).

title: Brisker of Pipers Sidelined
description: PITTSBURGH, Feb. 23 (UPI) John Brisker, the high scorer of the Pittsburgh Pipers, will sit out the team's next three games with a heel injury, an offiical of the American Bas ketball Association club said today.

title: PROTESTS FOUND IN 18% OF SCHOOLS
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 23  Eighteen per cent of the coun try's high school principals who responded to a Congressional questionnaire reported that their schools experienced some Corm of student protest in the 196869 school year. Only 1 per cent of the principals categor ized their disturbances as riots.

title: To End Needless Anguish
description: The striking union of gravediggers will be doing thousands of bereaved families a great service if it goes along today with the plea of Governor Rockefeller and Mayor Lindsay that it submit all disputed issues in its sixweekold stoppage to binding arbitration.

title: Golf Clubs Are Warned to Stop Return of Calcutta Betting
description: A warning that efforts would be made to curb gambling in golf was issued yesterday by Philip Strubing, president of the United States Golf Association.

title: Massachusetts U. Election
description: BOSTON, Feb.23 (AP)Trus tees of the University of Massachusetts today elected Oswald Tippo as chancellor, new post Mr. Tippo has been at the University since 1964 as provost.

title: Philippine Banks Seek To Clarify Peso Rule
description: MANILA, Feb. 23 (Reuters) Dollar transactions in all commercial banks in the Philippines were suspended today as bankers sought clarification of the new Cen tral Bank ruling adopting a floating exchange rate for the peso.

title: MINE VOTE REQUEST STUDIED BY CANADA
description: OTTAWA, Feb. 23 (UPI) Canada is studying a request by the United States to look into Canadian union elections connected with the struggles of Joseph A. Yablonski, the slain miners' union leader, Labor Minister Bryce S. Mac kasey said today.

title: Observer: The Fact About Progress
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 23 Progress is what people who are planning to do something really terrible almost al ways justify themselves on the grounds of.

title: In Guatemala There Are 2 Separate Worlds
description: GUATEMALA CITY, Feb. 23 On the day that commemo rates the death of Tecun Uman, an Indian warior, at the hands of Pedro de Alvarado, a leader of the Spanish conquistadors, Guatemalans play a game of changing faces.

title: Article 4  No Title
The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Queen Attends Film Opening
description: LONDON, Feb. 23  The movie Arne of the Thousand Days opened here tonight be fore a glittering audience that included Queen Elizabeth II and her daughter, Princess Anne. The performance raised 42,000 ($100,480) for the Cin ema and Television Benevolent Fund, the most raised in the 24yearhistory of the charity.

title: Kidd Qualifies for Finals In $30,000 Pro Ski Races
description: VERBIER, Switzerland, Feb. 23 (AP)  Billy Kidd, who turned professional after the recent world championships in Italy, qualified today for the final races of what is billed as the first world pro ski cham pionships with a $30,000 purse.

title: Another Vietnam?
description: The rout of Laotian forces, strongly supported by American airpower, in the Plaine des Jarres poses a serious test for the Nixon Doctrine of limited United States overseas involvement. It lends urgency to Con gressional efforts to define the limits of the American commitment in that small but strategic state on the borders of Vietnam.

title: Books of The Times
description: CREEZY by Flicien Marceau. Translated from the French by Jim Underwood. 122 pp. Orion. $5.95.

title: Article 8  No Title
The Palestinian Terror
description: The mounting wave of indiscriminate Palestinian terrorism against innocent travelers of many lands in airliners and on the ground in the Holy Land demands a prompt and determined response at many levels.

title: Lawmaker Asks Study of Nursing Homes After Working in Some
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 23 (AP)  Representative David A. Pryor is only 35 years old, but has spent much time in nursing homes for the aged  as a nurse's aide helping patients and learning about their lives. What he learned sickened him and now he wants Congress to find out more about such places.

title: 15 Are Named to Arts Institute
description: Philip Roth, the novelist, and Duke Ellington, the jazz composer, are among 15 art ists, writers and musicians who have been voted into the National Institute of Arts and Letters, the Congression ally chartered honor society for the arts.

title: Werden Is Honored At Golf Dinner Here
description: Lincoln A. Werden, golf writer of The New York Times, was honored last night at the National Awards Din ner of the Metropolitan Golf Writers' Association at the Hotel Americana.

title: PHILIP NOLAN DIES; PHYSICIST WAS 61
description: POINT LOOKOUT, L. I., Feb. 23  Dr. Philip Nolan, chief physicist for the Farrand Opti cal Company of the Bronx, N. Y., died apparently of drowning yesterday. His body was recovered from the ocean near his home at 126 Bellmore Street. He was 61 years old.

title: Rahway Faculty Plan on School Strife Accepted
description: RAHWAY, N. J., Tuesday, Feb. 24The faculty of Rah way High School agreed to return to work today after the Board of Education, in a meet ing that ended at 1 A.M., ac cepted a formula designed to end the racial strife that has closed the school for a week.

title: N. I. T. GETS CALLS OF FAMILIAR RING
description: Bob Bass telephoned from Lubbock, Tex., yesterday to make the National Invitation Tournament committee aware of his Texas Tech basketball team's 138 wonlost record.

title: U.S. Program of Park Fees Held Unfair and a Failure
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 23 (AP) The Golden Eagle Passport program of yearly fees for en trance to the national parks and recreation areas was de scribed in a House subcommit tee today as a financial failure and unfair.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: Dollar Acceptances Fell $163Million in January
description: Bankers' dollar acceptances outstanding in the United States fell $163million in January to $5,288,000,000, the Federal Re serve Bank of New York re ported yesterday. The January decline was the largest for a single month on record and fol lowed an increase of $239 million in December.

title: 2 Catholic Iowa Women Distributing Communion
description: DUBUQUE, Iowa, Feb. 23 Women are distributing holy communion in the Archdiocese of Dubuque, the Roman Cath olic diocese in northeast Iowa.

title: Greece Sets March 21 For Trial of Two Arabs
description: ATHENS, Feb. 23Greece today scheduled for March 21 the murder trial of two Arabs charged with attack ing an Israeli El Al jetliner at the Athens airport 14 months ago.

title: KNICKS FACE SUNS WITHOUT BRADLEY
description: With their Eastern Division lead over the Milwaukee Bucks trimmed to 5 games after weekend losses to Atlanta and Baltimore, the New York Knicks will attempt to right themselves tonight at Madison Square Garden against the Phoenix Suns, who are among their favorite opponents.

title: Caso to Seek the Top Spot in Nassau
description: GARDEN CITY, L. I., Feb. 23  Ralph G. Caso, Presiding Su pervisor of Hempstead, an nounced today that he would seek the Republican nomination for Nassau County Executive.

title: Shadow From Nazi Past Troubles Bustling Munich
description: MUNICH, West Germany, Feb. 23Munich radiated, Thomas Mann wrote after he had moved to this southern city, the capi tal of Bavaria, from his native Lbeck, in the north, near the end of the century.

title: Jewish Defense League Pickets Jewish Federation
description: About 80 members of the Jewish Defense League picketed the Federation of Jewish Phi lanthropies yesterday to de mand more money for Jewish schools and neighborhood self defense.

title: Article 7  No Title
Miss Beeson Plans Bridal
description: HIGH POINT, N. C., Feb. 23 Mr. and Mrs. James E. Bee son have announced the en gagement of their daughter, Miss Claudette F. Beeson, to Edwin C. Walton Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Walton of Scar boroughonHudson. N.Y.

title: The National Priorities Problem
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 23  It has become fashionable in weighty Government declara tions nowadays to dwell at some length on the subjects of national priorities and re source allocation. The reason is that everyone here worries about the competing claims of large military and nonmilitary programs without quite knowing how to resolve them.

title: Miss Kathrina Anne DeWitt Is Fiancee of John P. Kaiser
description: AMBLER, Pa., Feb. 23 The Right Rev. Robert L. DeWitt, Episcopal Bishop of Pennsylvania, and Mrs. De Witt have announced the engagement of their daugh ter, Miss Kathrina Anne DeWitt, to John Philip Kaiser, son of Mr. and Mrs. Paul R. Kaiser of Gwynedd Valley. A June wedding is planned.

title: Ogilvy Chief Celebrates Holiday With Canadians
description: Imagine an advertising man with enough charisma to get an advertising crowd togeth er for a luncheon on George Washington's Birthday to hear a talk on advertising. That's just what Andrew Kershaw, president of Ogilvy & Mather, Inc., did yesterday. Of course, he went to Canada to do it and they're not as big on George Washington up there.

title: Soviet Says Its ABM Can Reliably Hit Attacking Missiles
description: MOSCOW, Feb. 23The Soviet Union today ended a prolonged silence on the capability of its antimissile defenses by asserting that they could reliably hit at tacking missiles at any height or speed and at great distances from defended tar gets.

title: Wood, Field and Stream: A Bird Dog in Action
description: CHARLOTTE, N. C.Pud dles of water from the previous day's rain lay in the low spots in the fields and woods of the Squash Hill Shooting Preserve, the temp perature was in the mid40's, and the sky was heavy with clouds.

title: Sports of The Times
description: According to the Rules

title: MANSFIELD RISKS 2D FUND BILL VETO
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 23 (UPI) The Senate Democratic lead er, Mike Mansfield, urged the Senate today to pass a big edu cation and welfare spending bill despite the threat of an other veto by President Nixon.

title: MRS. CURTIS WINS FINAL IN 3 SETS
description: AGAWAM, Mass., Feb. 23 (AP)Mrs. Mary Ann Curtis of St. Louis won her third New England women's indoor tennis championship by beating Pam Teeguarten of Los Angeles in the final tonight, 46, 62, 75.

title: HUMPHREY IS SEEKING O'BRIEN AS CHAIRMAN
description: WASHINGTON Feb. 23 (AP) Hubert H. Humphrey dis closed through a spokesman today that he had asked Law rence F. O'Brien to leave his New York political public re lations firm and return to the chairmanship of the Demo cratic National Committee.

title: Bulls Top Rockets, 127125, Gain Third Place in Division
description: KANSAS CITY, Feb. 23 (AP) The Chicago Bulls took over third place in the National Bas ketball Association's Western Division from idle Phoenix to night by defeating the San Diego Rocket, 127125. Shafer Halimon fired in nine points in the final five minutes to lead a Bulls' late spurt.

title: William Glover Gets His Old Billing Back
description: When William Glover left Canada to act on Broadway he was told by Actors Equity Association that, in accord ance with its rules, he could not use his own name be cause another performer al ready was using it. Therefore, he was featured in Noel Cow ard's hit comedy, Private Lives, as David Glover.

title: AntiMatter for AntiWorlds
description: Moscow's announcement that Soviet physicists have created and identified nuclei of antihelium calls atten tion again to the concept of antimatter, one of the most eerie ideas in modern physics. Conventional, everyday matter on this planet consists of atoms made up of negative electrons and positive protons.

title: Basketball Ratings
description: The top 20 teams, with points figured on a 201816 141210987654321 basis for first through 15 places (firstplace votes in parenthe ses) and wonlost records through games of last Satur day:

title: MERGING RAIL LINES LIST DIVISION SITES
description: ST. PAUL, Feb. 23 (AP) Three major railroads and two smaller lines who will merge March 2 into Burlington North ern, Inc., have announced sites of six divisional headquarters.

title: Oh! Calcutta! Is Banned By Court in Melbourne
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Feb. 23 The Supreme Court of the State of Victoria issued an order in Melbourne today for bidding the presentation of the revue Oh! Calcutta! The judge described it as an excursion into depravity.

title: Jewish Council in Queens Plans 7 Rallies for Israel
description: Seven simultaneous rallies in Queens next Sunday to ex press support for Israel were announced yesterday by the Queens Jewish Community Council.

title: 40,000 CLAIMS ASK REFUNDS ON DRUGS
description: Forty thousand consumers throughout the United States have filed claims to share in a pioneering settlement of il legal overcharges on tetracy cline and other broadspectrum antibioticsthe socalled won der drugs.

title: 5 Rescued Off Alaskan Coast
description: YAKUTAT, Alaska, Feb. 23 (UPI)A Coast Guard cutter picked up five surviving crew men and the body of another yesterday off the Alaskan coast, where their oceangoing tug went down in a storm last Friday. Two men are still miss ing and presumed drowned.

title: Markets Take Holiday
description: Stock, bond and commodity marketsas well as most bankswere closed yesterday in observance of the Washing ton's Birthday holiday. Cana dian and other foreign security markets were open for business as usual.

title: For 3 Families, Welfare Island Is Haven
description: To many, Welfare Island looks like a desolate place brightened only by the promise of the two new towns sched uled to be built there by the State Urban Development Cor poration.

title: PPG Industries Planning PhaseOut of Newark Unit
description: PITTSBURGH, Feb. 23 (AP) PPG Industries, Inc., has an nounced that it is phasing out its consumer paints and indus trial coating plant at Newark.

title: Campus With a Fading Generation Gap
description: SYRACUSESome students at Syracuse University are finding they can trustand actually be friends with  people over 30. And in this case the people are way over 30. In fact, their average age is 70.3.

title: RUINS OF PALACE FOUND IN THEBES
description: ATHENS, Feb. 23Traces of a large palace heavily damaged by fire some 3,200 years ago, have been discovered in the Greek town of Thebes.

title: Phoenix Conflict: Rapid Growth of City vs. Good Life
description: PHOENIXMommy, says a local 2yearold when ever he sees a vacant lot, what are they going to build there?

title: Mine Bureau Chief Is Target of New Ouster Effort
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 23  After more than a year of un successful efforts to oust John F. O'Leary, the director of the Bureau of Mines, the Nixon Administration is making an other attempt to replace him with a man more acceptable to the mining industry and the Republican party.

title: Heroin Is Called Cause Of Three More Deaths
description: Three more deaths from acute reactions to heroin were reported here yester day.

title: Tyros Hanover Wins Pace
description: The Washington's Birthday Pace, which headed Monday night's program, was won eas ily by the George Phalendriven Tyros Hanover, who paid $4.40 for $2. The victor led virtually all the way and defeated High Vista by 3 lengths in 2:03. It was the 20th winner driven by Phalen in 69 starts at the meet ing.

title: Monetary Plan Proposed
description: BONN, Feb. 23 (Reuters) The West German Economic Ministry today published a four stage plan for the creation of a European monetary union to be operative by the end of the 70's.

title: CITY STUDENTS ASK A VOICE ON POLICY
description: The elected representatives of the city's 275;000 high school students will ask the Board of Education this week to give students a major voice de termining policies and practices in their schools.

title: A.C.L.U. Sues to Aid Poor
description: MILWAUKEE, Feb. 23 (UPI) The American Civil Liberties Union has filed a suit challeng ing the constitutionality of a Wisconsin law requiring indi gents convicted of a crime to pay for their courtappointed attorney.

title: 2 ECONOMISTS WARN OF RECESSION PERIL
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 23 (UPI)Two economists warned Congress today that the nation faces a recession unless the Nixon Administration's high in terest rate policies were al tered.

title: Mrs. Stuart: White House Impresario
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 23 When you come to the White House, it's a real cultural experience, Connie Stuart, staff director to Mrs. Richard M. Nixon, said today.

title: Article 5  No Title
Israel Hints at Retaliation It Air Routes Are Periled
description: JERUSALEM, Feb. 23Pre mier Golda Meir warned today that Israel would not sit long with hands folded if Arab ter rorists were permitted to con tinue to harass or destroy her civil aircraft and those of other countries carrying passengers or cargo to Israel.

title: U.C.L.A. Names Executive
description: LOS ANGELES, Feb. 23 (AP) Harold Williams, board chair man of Norton Simon, Inc., was named dean of the Graduate School of Business Administra tion at the University of Cali fornia at Los Angeles today.

title: Cranston Against Carswell; Cites White Supremacy Talk
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 23 (UPI) Senator Alan Cranston, Dem ocrat of California, announced today that he would vote against the Supreme Court nomination of Judge G. Harrold Carswell.

title: R.O.T.C. Building Burns
description: ST. LOUIS, Mo., Feb. 23 (UPI)  The Army R.O.T.C. building on the campus of Washington University was vir tually destroyed by fire today. The university's chancellor, Thomas H. Eliot, said, There is no doubt that this was ar son. About 200 students cheered the flames and booed firemen trying to extinguish the blaze.

title: Man Trying to Stow Away On Plane Is Fined in Sydney
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Feb. 23 (Reuters)A West German im migrant was fined 225 Aus tralian dollars ($252) here to day for attempting to stow away on an airliner from which another stowaway fell to his death yesterday.

title: 56,400 U.S. Traffic Deaths In '69 Reported by Safety Unit
description: More Americans died on the nation's highways in 1969 than in any previous year.

title: A Stiff Drink in Moscow Is Now Twice as Stiff
description: MOSCOW, Feb. 23 (UPI) Vodka prices have been quietly doubled in Moscow's restaurants in the latest move to reduce drunkenness.

title: Mrs. Nixon to Receive Quilt Signed by Congressmen
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 23 (AP)  Wives of Republican members of the 88th Congress will present a huge quilt em broidered with signatures of their husbands to Mrs. Nixon Wednesday.

title: Turks and Soviet Open Talks
description: ANKARA, Turkey, Feb. 23 (Reuters)Turkey and the So viet Union began talks here today on a new border de marcation agreement. The So viet delegation is planning to stay in Ankara for about two weeks.

title: Clark of New York Beaten By Briton in Five Rounds
description: LONDON, Feb. 23 (Reuters) Tommy Clark, a New York heavyweight, was beaten to night by a 22yearold Briton, Dan McAlinden. The referee stopped the bout at the end of the fifth round because of the battering the American had taken. the fifth round because of the battering the American had taken.

title: Alice Franklin, John Goyert Jr. Engaged to Wed
description: NOROTON, Conn., Feb.23 Miss Alice Louise Frank lin, a computer programer with the Union Carbide Cor poration, and John Emmett Goyert Jr., an account exec utive with Young & Rubicam, plan to be married in the Noroton Presbyterian Church on June 20.

title: Soccer Wives Balk at Staying Home
description: RIO DE JANIERO, Feb. 23 (UPI)Should wives accom pany their soccer star hus bands on road trips?

title: U. of New Hampshire Averts Mass Resignation
description: DURHAM, N. H., Feb. 23 A mass resignation by all 17 department chairmen in the University of New Hampshire's College of Liberal Arts was withdrawn today after two days of discussion between the faculty and the university pres ident.

title: 3d Republican Joins Connecticut Race
description: HARTFORD, Feb. 23  Re publican Representative Thom as J. Meskill announced his candidacy for Governor today with an attack on the Demo cratic organization that has ruled Connecticut for the last 16 years.

title: Another Bastion Falls To Women in Princeton
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Feb. 23 A tradition died here today when 24 women were served lunch in the Yankee Doodle Tap Room of the Nassau Inn, a room formerly open only to men during weekday luncheon hours.

title: Nayar of Harvard Keeps Squash Racquets Laurels
description: PHILADELPHIA, Feb. 23  Anil Nayar, the Harvard gradu ate school student from Bom bay, won the national squash racquets championship for the second straight year today.

title: A Correction
description: The 48to56inch Liberty print tablecloths and place mats mentioned in an article in yesterday's editions of The New York Times are avail able at Boutique de Cuisine, 200 East 61st Street (be tween Lexington and Third Avenues).

title: Front Page 1  No Title
Baseball Signings
description: AMERICAN LEAGUE

title: McGrady Will Challenge Evans in 440
description: Martin McGrady, who has made the 600yard run the glamour event of the indoor season, said yesterday he would challenge Lee Evans outdoors in the quartermile.

title: 2 Germanys Plan Meeting
description: BONN, Feb. 23 (AP)  East and West German officials agreed today to meet in East Berlin March 2 to prepare for the meeting later in the month between Chancellor Willy Brandt of West Germany and Premier Willi Stoph of East Germany.

title: SENATE AMENDS PUPILLUNCH BILL
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 3The Senate passed an amendment to the schoollunch program today requiring the states to file plans detailing how they spent their Federal money and to report to the Agriculture Department monthly on the number of chil dren being helped by the program.

title: Shultz Says Nixon Is Ready to Combat Rise in Joblessness
description: BAL HARBOUR, Fla., Feb. 23 President Nixon is prepared to take strong measures to combat any major rise in un employment, Secretary of La bor George P. Shultz reported today.

title: SWISS CURB ENTRY OF ARABS AND ASK AIR SAFETY TALKS
description: BERNE, Switzerland, Feb. 23 Switzerland imposed drastic restrictions on the admission of Arab travelers today. At the same time she called for an international emergency con ference on air security, at which, it was indicated, she would propose that other coun tries adopt similar curbs.

title: 101 SHOT TAKES SANTA ANITARACE
