description: ARCADIA, Calif., Feb. 23 (AP)Quilche, a 101 shot, from Chile scored an upset vic tory today in the $58,100 San Luis Obispo Handicap at Santa Anita, breaking the course rec ord on the grass. The favorites, Fiddle Isle and Snow Sporting, ran out of the money.

title: Alouettes Get Cornerback
description: MONTREAL, Feb. 23 (Cana dian Press)  The Montreal Alouettes of the Eastern Foot ball Conference signed today Merl Code, a 6foot, 200pound cornerback from North Caro lina A. and T.

title: U.S. FourMan Slued Triumphs at Lake Placid
description: LAKE PLACID N. Y., Feb. 23 (AP)  Harry Petersen gave the United States its first vic tory in international bobsled competition since 1959 by win ning the fourman bobsled event in the Kennedy Memorial winter games today.

title: Comedian Joins Golfers to Receive Award at the Writers' Dinner
8 Killed in Bungalow Blaze
description: PALMYRA, Va., Feb. 23 (UPI)Eight persons burned to death when a fire destroyed their wooden bungalow here about 4 A.M. today. Charles Bates, the 51yearold father of five of the victims, died in vain attempt to Save his chil dren. Two of his nieces were also killed in the blaze.

title: MASAKO YANAGITA IN VIOLIN RECITAL
description: It must be a solace to fanci ers of violin music to see that, just as their noble instrument seems to be falling out of pop ular favor, an army of superior young players is coming for ward, ready to put King Fiddle back on his throne. If the restoration succeeds, thanks will be owed in large part to Oriental countries, which have become breeding grounds for virtuosos in the last couple of decades.

title: Thieu Opponent, Facing a Trial, Holds National Assembly SitIn
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Feb. 23Tran Ngoc Chau, the Op position deputy accused by President Nguyen Van Thieu of proCommunist activities, made a surprise appearance this morning at the National As sembly and announced he would stage a sitin there un til his trial ended.

title: BANKS IN BRITAIN TELL TRUE PROFIT
description: LONDON, Feb. 23Britain's four big commercial banks have succumbed to public pres sure and disclosed, for the first time, their so  called true profits and hidden reserves. Previously, the bank reported profits only after undisclosed transfers to secret inner re serves.

title: Drexel Becoming University
description: PHILADELPHIA, Feb. 23 (UPI) The Drexel Institute of Tech nology becomes Drexel Univer sity next Friday. The school, established in 1891, originally was known as the Drexel In stitute of Art, Science and In dustry. The name was changed to Drexel Institute of Tech nology in 1936. The school has 10,500 students.

title: Bridge:
description: FOUR famous husbands were soundly defeated by their four famous wives in a short exhibition match played Saturday night at the New York Hilton. Edgar Kaplan, Victor Mitchell, Bill Passel and Mike Moss lost a sixdeal match by 26 inter national match points to Betty Kaplan. Jacqui Mitch ell, Marietta Passell and Gail Moss. This proved, to the complete satisfaction of the wives, that women play bet ter than men.

title: Article 2  No Title
House Crime Panel Seeks To Limit Pep Pill Output
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 23 (UPI)The House Crime Com mittee proposed today putting strict limits on production of amphetamines, or pep pills.

title: MARIJUANA HOLDS PAROLEE STUDENT
description: TULSA, Okla., Feb. 23  A former convict, now paroled and studying for his doctorate at the New York State Univer sity School of Criminal Justice, was arraigned here yesterday on charges of possessing mari juana.

title: Lieut. Gov. West Announces For Carolina Governorship
description: COLUMBIA, S. C., Feb. 23 Lieut. Gov. John C. West for mally announced his candidacy for Governor today and pledged to preserve public education.

title: Jersey Drivers Put Tentative Bus Pact To Vote Tomorrow
description: EAST PATERSON, N. J., Feb. 23 (AP)A tentative agree ment was reached today to end a threeweekold strike against the Manhattan Transit Compa ny that has halted bus service for 20,000 North Jersey com muters.

title: Genocide Pact Again Opposed by U.S. Bar Unit
description: ATLANTA, Feb. 23 (AP)  The American Bar Association rejected a plea from the Nixon Administration today and re affirmed, by a margin of four votes, its opposition to a 21 yearold treaty banning geno cide.

title: Rivers Flood in West Germany After Sudden Thaw
description: BONN, Feb. 23  The major rivers in West Ger many overflowed their banks today after a sudden thaw and widespread rainstorms, isolating villages, stopping highway traffic and inland shipping, and sweeping away one bridge.

title: Louisa Ogilvie Married in London
description: LONDON, Feb. 23  Miss Louisa Ogilvie, daughter of the late Group Capt. Patrick Ogilvie of the Royal Air Force and of Mrs. Roger Kennaway of Reperry Manor Farm, Lanivet, Cornwall, was married Saturday to Alexis Richard Dion Oswald, son of Count de la Falaise of Paris and Mrs. John Mc Kendry of New York.

title: Ho Chi Minh Trail Is Target of B52's For 7th Day in Row
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Feb. 23 (AP)United States B 52's dropped 1,500 tons of bombs on the Ho Chi Minh Trail in Laos today, informed sources said.

title: N.I.T. BAN UPHELD BY IVY PRESIDENTS
description: The runnerup for the Ivy league basketball titleColum bia or Pennsylvaniawill not be permitted to take part in the National Invitation Tourna ment at Madison Square Garden next month.

title: Mrs. Runnells Wed To John Carter Jr.
description: HOUSTON, Feb. 23Mrs. Winifred Trimble Runnells, daughter of Mrs. John Park inson Jr. of Oyster Bay, L. I., was married here today to John Boyd Carter Jr., man aging partner of the Lehman Brothers office here.

title: Japanese Banks Are Asked To Invest $100,000 in Congo
description: TOKYO, Feb. 23 (Reuters) Bank of Japan said today three Japanese banks bad been asked to invest $100,000 in the Congo Development Finance Company.

title: Metropolitan Museum to Study Its Role in City's Communities
description: What is the role of the Metropolitan Museum of Art in relation to various New York City communities? Should it decentralize its fa cilities, set up branch mu seums, lend its art works to local groups?

title: GOTTEHRER MAY RUN FOR FARBSTEIN SEAT
description: Barry H. Gottehrer, a top assistant to Mayor Lindsay, said yesterday that he was giving strong consideration to running as what he called a Lindsay Democrat against Leonard Farbstein, the Demo cratic Representative from the 19th Congressional District.

title: JOHNSON IS DEPICTED AS VICTIM OF SYSTEM
description: George E. Reedy, one of President Johnson's press sec retaries, contends in an article in the current issue of Look magazine that the White House has a courtlike atmosphere that shields the President from reality and can warp his po litical instincts.

title: New Horse Racing Bureau Notes Plan for U.S. Chase
description: LONDON, Feb. 23 (AP)An international horse racing bu reau was started in London to day and its first announcement was that the United States planned to stage an interna tional steeplechase at Camden, S.C., Nov. 14. To be known as the Colonial Cup, the race could challenge England's Grand National as the world's premier event in a few years.

title: Bolivians in Madridfor Oil Talks
description: Thomas D. Lumpkin, executive vice president of the Gulf Oil Corporation, disclosed here yesterday that talks had started in Madrid between the Spanish Government and a Bolivian team with regard to Gulf's nationalized proper ties in Bolivia.

title: Rockefeller Signs Transit Bill Providing $30Million in Loans
description: ALBANY, Feb. 23Governor Rockefeller signed a $30.7mil lion emergency mass transit loan bill today. The act is de signed to improve maintenance on metropolitan area commuter railroads and New York City's subway system and to help up state bus companies.

title: West Point Posts Filled
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 23 (AP) President Nixon today named Louis R. Vincenti of Pasadena, Calif., and Leif John Sverdrup of St. Louis, Mo., to threeyear terms on the Board of Visitors of the United States Military Academy at West Point, N. Y. The President also named a Chicago automobile dealer, Carl Sommer, as a member of the National Highway Safety Ad visory Committee to fill a term that expires March 15, 1971.

title: Met Rookie Pitchers Face Job Scarcity
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., Feb. 23Young men seeking fame and fortune with the New York Mets were warned today that the line forms on the right.

title: 3Week Walkout by Teachers Reported Near End in Newark
description: NEWARK, Feb. 23The teachers' strike that has crippled schools here for three weeks appeared near an end tonight.

title: Militants Protestat Arraignment Of 12 Seized in Weapons Raid
description: Young militants and plain clothes policemen clashed in Criminal Court late yesterday during the arraignment of 12 persons arrested when a cache of weapons was seized in a raid Sunday night.

title: BILL IN ASSEMBLY WOULD UNDO CUTS IN EDUCATION AID
description: ALBANY, Feb. 23  Forty nine of the Assembly's 79 Re publicans introduced a bill to day that would undo $215mil lion in cuts made last year in the state's school aid formulas for the 197071 school year.

title: Amer, Basketball Ass'n
description: SUNDAY'S GAMES

title: CONGRESS PANEL STUDIES CARRIER
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 23A joint subcommittee of Congress has been set up to study whether the United States needs another nuclearpowered aircraft carrier costing $640 million.

title: Colt Named Joe Namath, $83.20, Wins at Hialeah; Quilche Victor on Coast
description: MIAMI, Feb. 23Joe Namath the outsider in the betting? And at 40 to 1, no less. So great a defiance of the law of probability was posted on the odds board before the $31,450 Florida Breeders Stakes today, and Joe Namath, a 3yearold colt foaled in Ocala, promptly proceeded to extend the aura of success attached to his namesake by coming through with the most unlooked  for victory. His price was $83.20 for $2.

title: War and PX Goods Spill Into Cambodia
description: BAVET, Cambodia, Feb. 21  The war in neighboring South Vietnam spills over into this neutral country in a va riety of ways, some deadly, most corrupting.

title: Millard Rothenberg Dies at 45; President of a Blouse Concern
description: SCARSDALE. N. Y., Feb. 23Millard Rothenberg, presi dent of Judy Bond, Inc., a manufacturer of women's blouses, died today in his home at 62 Birchal Drive here. He was 45 years old.

title: HEARING IS HELD ON DUMPING BILL
description: SANDY HOOK, N. J., Feb. 23  The four Representatives sniffed the open plastic bags of muck and one gingerly dipped his fingers into a bag of black goo.

title: Youth Sentenced to a Year For Patching Seat With Flag
description: LEOMINSTER, Mass., Feb. 23 (AP)Valarie Goguen, 19 years old, of Leominster, was sentenced to one year in jail today after being convicted of violating an 1899 law that for bids treating the American flag in a contemptuous manner.

title: SPECIAL DISCOUNT URGED ON HOUSING
description: CHICAGO, Feb. 23  The president of the Mortgage Bank ers Association of America to day offered four proposals to pump more money into the housing market.

title: Hucklebuck Finishes First
description: ADELAIDE, Australia, Feb. 23 (UPI)John Truett of Eng land sailed Hucklebuck to her second straight victory today as British yachtsmen dominat ed the third heat of the 16 yacht world Flying Dutchman Class championship.

title: 2 KEY SENATORS EXPRESS DOUBTS ON EXPANDED ABM
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 23  Two of the Senate's leading Democratic defenders of the Safeguard program expressed reservations today about ex pansion of the missile defense system as now contemplated by the Administration.

title: Corn Off the Cob, Smelling Salts Win Flamingo Trials at Hialeah
description: MIAMI, Feb. 24A pair of contests in which several eligi bles for next Tuesday's $100, 000 Flamingo participated featured the Hialeah card today, before 17,064 fans.

title: JEERERS PREVENT A HUMPHREY TALK
description: AMHERST, Mass., Feb. 24 (AP)  A crowd of about 250 jeering youths broke up a scheduled lecture by former Vice President Hubert H. Humphrey tonight.

title: GOODBODY LISTS LOSS OF $832,000
description: Goodbody & Co., one of Wall Street's largest brokerage firms disclosed yesterday an operat ing loss of $832,000 for 1969, compared with an aftertax profit of $4,096,000 in 1968. Last years loss would be pared to $433,000 after taxes.

title: GABRIELI ENSEMBLE MIXES OLD AND NEW
description: Any brass group must in variably look high and low for a suitable repertory in this area of limited compositional ac tivity. The London Gabrieli Brass Ensemble, a very modish looking quintet of young Britons who performed last night in Carnegie Recital Hall, resorted to a familiar solution: Renaissance/Baroque arrange ments and a contemporary commission.

title: Tate Defendant Arraigned
description: LOS ANGELES, Feb. 24 (Reuters)Patricia Krenwinkel, one of six defendants in the Sharon Tate murder trial, was arraigned today in Los Angeles Superior Court. She asked per mission to act as her own counsel. Judge George Dell, however, appointed a public defender to discuss the case with Miss Krenwinkel, who waived extradition from Mo bile, Ala., last week.

title: Jersey Woman Has Quintuplets; All Reported Doing Well Here
description: Quintupletsthree girls and two boyswere born at the Presbyterian Hospital last night to a 27yearold New Jersey woman whose first two chil dren, like the quintuplets, were born after she had been taking fertility shots.

title: New Council for the Americas Is Urged to Promote Business
description: Jose de Cubas, president of the Council for Latin America, Inc., said here yesterday that an attempt would be made next month to form a new Council for the Americas to utilize the productive abilities of business men in the hemisphere.

title: ITALIANS HAIL FILM ON CORRUPT POLICE
description: ROME, Feb. 24A taboo breaking movie that portrays Italian police officials as cor rupt, authoritarian and immune from the laws they are sup posed to enforce is drawing critical praise and standing room only crowds here and in Milan.

title: Construction Administrator Named for City University
description: The Board of Higher Educa tion last night appointed Peter S. Spiridon to the newly cre ated post of dean of campus planning and development for the City University of New York.

title: CARNEVALE IS SET TO BE CHAIRMAN
description: The National Collegiate Ath letic Association and the Ama teur Athletic Union have been working quietly to develop a formula for settling their differ ences, officials close to the dis pute revealed yesterday.

title: EQUITABLE SALES RISE TO A RECORD
description: The Equitable Life Assurance Society of the United States the thirdlargest insurer in the country after Prudential and Metropolitanreported yester day that sales of individual and group life insurance rose nearly 20 per cent last year to a rec ord of $5.7billion.

title: Dizzy Dean Named CoConspirator in Gambling Indictment
description: DETROIT, Feb. 24 (UPI) Jerome (Dizzy) Dean, whose very helpful information led to several arrests in a Govern ment gambling crackdown, was one of five persons named to day as coconspirators in a Fed eral indictment charging 10 other men with gambling con spiracy.

title: American Newsman Visits Northern Side of DMZ
description: ON THE 17TH PARALLEL, North Vietnam, Feb. 24 (AP) A somber portion of the 17th parallel, the line dividing North and South Vietnam, is now on view.

title: TOLL OF 30 FEARED IN BIG SWISS SLIDE
description: GENEVA, Feb. 24A giant avalanche in the Swiss Alps engulfed an army camp today in a 30foothigh wave of snow that was believed to have taken 30 lives.

title: Reporters to Satirize Lindsay's 2d Coming
description: Gazing quizzically at a car toon of himself garbed in a flowing angel's robe, Mayor Lindsay accepted a ticket yes terday to the annual lompoon show of the Inner Circle.

title: Kidd, U.S. Skier, Qualifies For Final in Giant Slalom
description: VERBIER, Switzerland, Feb. 24 (AP)Billy Kidd of Stowe, Vt., and Egen Zimmermann 2d of Austria qualified for the final of the giant slalom in a world professional ski meet today.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: Feb. 25, 1970 ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL COUNCIL Commission on Human Rights A.M. and 3 P.M.

title: Eban, in Bonn, Stresses Special Ties
description: BONN, Feb. 24Foreign Min ister Abba Eban of Israel de clared here today that West Germany must continue and ex pand its special relationship with Israel, whatever happens in the Middle Eastern conflict or in other areas affecting the two countries.

title: Maddox's Ax Handles Create Capitol Furor
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 24 Gov. Lester G. Maddox of Georgia had a fractious day on Capitol Hill today, first clashing with Senator Birch Bayh of Indiana over voting rights and then stirring up furor in the House restaurant by passing out ax handles.

title: Road Is Blocked
description: BOURG  SAINT  MAURICE, France, Feb. 24 (AP)  An avalanche blocked the road leading to the resorts of Gines and Val d'Isere today, and cut the telephone cable leading to the villages. Electricity cables were also damaged.

title: Rice Crop Is the Center of Cambodian Village Life
description: PHOUM BONG RO, Cam bodia, Feb. 16There are many villages just like Phoum Bong Ro not only in this northcentral region of Cambodia but through out the flat and almost fea tureless country of seven mil lion people.

title: Letters to the Editor of The Times
description: Filibuster as Tactic

title: Bid for Coburn Referred By Colonial Commercial
description: Bernard Korn, president of the Colonial Commercial Cor poration, said yesterday the company would defer further consideration of a possible ex change offer for common stock of the Coburn Corporation of America pending release by Co burn of its audited financial statement for fiscal 1970, end ing Feb. 28.

title: Draft Record Trial, set
description: CHICAGO, Feb. 24 (AP)  A Federal judge today set May 4 for the trial of 15 persons charged with destroying Selec tive Service records and en tered an order barring the de fendants and their lawyers from making statements about the case until it has been dis posed of. I'm going to control this trial, Judge Edwin J. Robson of United States Dis trict Court said.

title: 2 Jockeys Hurt in Spills At Golden Gate Opening
description: ALBANY, Calif., Feb. 24 (AP)  Spectacular spills resulting in injuries to two jockeys marred today's opening of thoroughbred racing at Golden Gate Fields.

title: Bill to Legalize Abortions Clears Hawaii Legislature
description: HONOLULU, Feb. 24Hawaii's Senate approved today and sent to Gov. John A. Burns a bill that would make this state's abortion law the most liberal of any in the nation.

title: Governor Drafts Program On TeenAge Drug Abuses
description: ALBANY, Feb. 24Reacting to public concern over daily reports about teenagers killed by narcotics and about drug addiction among schoolchildren, Governor Rockefeller an nounced today a declaration of total war against drug abuse by those under 16.

title: Dutch Transforming Seacoast With Dams to Replace Dikes
description: HELLEVOETSLUIS, the Neth erlands, Feb. 24  In a year when other Northern European countries are at pains to conserve their natural sur roundings, the Dutch are push ing ahead with a project to transform their southwestern seacoast.

title: How Blass Will Outfit Men in Fall
description: THERE'S been some fear that, after a period of sartorial splendor, the Amer ican man has been slipping back into fashion squaredom. Not if Bill Blass can help it.

title: SPRINGER PLANS SALE OF THIRD OF EMPIRE
description: BONN, Feb. 24  Axel C. Springer, the West German newspaper publisher, an nounced today that he will transfer onethird of his pub lishing empire to Bertelsmann A.G. of Gillersloh, West Ger many's biggest book publish er, after his 60th birthday in 1972.

title: Building Group Elects
description: The Building Trades Employ ers Association reelected Roger H. Corbetta for a third oneyear term as president. The 800 gen eral and specialty contracting concerns in the association erect 85 per cent of the new construction in the city. The annual meeting was held at the association's headquarters at 711 Third Avenue, near 44th Street.

title: No Surprises Yet
description: CLEVELAND, Feb. 24 (AP) United States Attorney Robert B. Krupansky told newsmen to day that the Federal grand jury investigating the Yablonski murders had turned up no sur prises.

title: Gibson Seeks 20 Again
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., Feb. 24 (AP)Bob Gibson, the right hander, checked in today at the St. Louis Cardinals' camp and said his intention was to be come the club's first fivetime 20game winner.

title: Houk's LineUp Ideas Clear As Yankees Take First Drill
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Feb.24 The full squadalmostof the 1970 New York Yankees took its first workout today, and Manager Ralph Houk ob served the cheerful, lowkey activities with a fairly clear idea of how he expected his team to shave up.

title: STUDENTS PROTEST COLLEGE TEACHING
description: Unlike other student radicals who have relied on protests and sitins to force educational in stitutions to change alleged dis criminatory practices, 85 Puer to Ricans went to the State Division of Human Rights yes terday to file what is believed to be the first discrimination complaint ever made against a college here.

title: Supreme Court Removes a State Barrier to Welfare
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 24 The Supreme Court ruled to day that New York could not deny welfare benefits to per sons unable to show that they had moved to the state for a reason other than to go on relief.

title: E.C.A.C. Honors Football Stars
description: Mike Reid, Penn States allAmerica defensive tackle, was honored as 1969 player of the year in Eastern Col lege Athletic Conference Di vision 1 football during the E.C.A.C.s annual awards dinner last night.

title: Pornpidous' Stand on Hemlines
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 24American women may have their doubts about the midi lengthbut Georges Pompidou, the President of France, has none. Here with his wife on an eightday tour of the United States, he told an audience at a National Press Club luncheon, As far as I am concerned, I must say I have known the era of long dresses, and I believe they added mystery to love.

title: TELEPHONE RATES TO BE INCREASED BY 8% TOMORROW
description: ALBANY, Feb. 24The Pub lic Service Commission said to day that it had authorized the New York Telephone Company to put into effect at 12:01 A.M. on Thursday an interim rate increase that will cost subscrib ers 5136.7million.

title: Transport News and Notes
description: LONDON, Feb. 24 (AP) The British merchant fleet, aft er a halfcentury of steady de cline, is again on its way to re covery, the United Kingdom Chamber of Shipping said to day in its annual report.

title: EXU.S. AIDES URGE BONDS IN CHICAGO
description: CHICAGO, Feb. 24Ramsey Clark, the former Attoney Gen eral of the United States, has signed a friend of the court brief urging that the defendants and lawyers in the Chicago conspiracy trial be released on anneal bonds.

title: MERRITT OF REDS FRACTURES ELBOW
description: TAMPA, Fla., Feb. 24 (A) Jim Merritt, a lefthander who was the Cincinnati Reds' top winner last season, has frac tured his right elbow.

title: MARTIN WILL JOIN U.S. STEEL BOARD
description: William McChesney Martin Jr., who resigned recently after more than 18 years as chair man of the Federal Reserve Board, has been nominated as a director of the United States Steel Corporation.

title: Panthers Express Regret Over Murtagh Bombing
description: Thirteen Black Panthers ac cused of conspiring to bomb public places, and their six law yers expressed regret yester day to Supreme Court Justice John M. Murtagh that someone had tried to bomb his Inwood home over the weekend.

title: Bonnies, Villanova and Niagara Accept N.C.A.A. Tourney Bids
description: The East's three best, major independentsSt. Bonaventure, Villanova and Niagara  ac cepted invitations yesterday to the National Collegiate Ath letic Association basketball tournament. But Marquette, one of the nation's top teams, spurned a bid in a controversy over the site of its regional competition. Dayton was se lected as Marquette's replace ment.

title: Coalition Regime Collapses In State of Lower Saxony
description: BONN, Feb. 24The coali tion government of Christian Democrats and Social Demo crats in the state of Lower Saxony broke up today over the admission of a member of the extreme rightwing Nation al Democratic party to the par liamentary ranks of the Chris tian Democratic party.

title: Transit. Policeman Upheld on Refusal To Strike His Colors
description: The New York City Transit Authority ruled yesterday that an American flag emblem could legally be worn on a Transit Authority police uniform.

title: Susan S. Dickey, Debutante of '65, Will Be a Bride
description: PITTSBURGH, Feb. 24 Mr. and Mrs. Robert Dickey 3d have announced the en gagement of their daughter, Miss Susan Scott Dickey, to John Marshall Gilmore, son of Mrs. Addison Leitch Gil more and the late Mr. Gil more.

title: Foster Stops Hardney in 4th
description: ORLANDO, Fla., Feb. 24 (AP) Bob Foster, the lightheavy weight champion, stunned in the third round by Bill Hardney, scored a fourthround technical knockout over the North Caro linian tonight In a nontitle fight. Foster weighed 177 pounds, Hardney 182.

title: Leufroy J. Bonvillain Dead; Nassau County Aide, 62
description: MINEOLA, L. L, Feb. 24 Leufroy Bonvillain, director of public relations for the Nassau County Department of Social Services since 1961, died of cancer today in Nassau Hospital. He was 62 years old and lived here at 101 Clinton Avenue.

title: Orders in Durable Goods Decline 4th Month in Row
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 24New orders for durable goods, an important leading indicator of the economy, declined sharp ly in January, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: COMMODITY PRICES LISTED IN THE WEEK
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 24 Daily index numbers and spot primary market commodity prices Feb. 10, 1970 to Feb. 17, 1970.

title: New Books Today
description: Envy: A Theory of Social Behavior, by Helmut Schoeck, translated by Michael Glenny and Betty Ross (Helen & Kurt Wolff Book: Harcourt, Brace & World, $7.50).

title: Susan E. Vann And A. P. Hoag Planning Bridal
description: DURHAM, N. C., Feb. 24 Miss Susan Elizabeth Vann, a stockbroker with Rotan, MosleDallas Union, Inc., in New York, and An thony Phillips Hoag, an as sistant vice president of Harris Upham & Co., Inc., New York, will be married here April 4 in the Duke Uni versity Chapel.

title: M. W. Marcus, Elizabeth Roper Engaged to Wed
description: The engagement of Miss Elizabeth Roper to. Dr. Mich ael W. Marcus, son of Dr. and Mrs. Murray Marcus of Brooklyn, has been announced by the prospective bride's parents, Dr. and Mrs. Leo H. Roper. Plans have been made for a wedding this May in Pound Ridge, N. Y.

title: STRONG 3D PERIOD PROVES DECISIVE
Mays Weighs 190
description: CASA GRANDE, Ariz., Feb. 24 (AP)Willie Mays reported today for his 20th season with the San Francisco Giants, weighing 190 pounds.

title: WESTVACO NET DOWN 10c IN FIRST QUARTER
description: Net income of the Westvaco Corporation in their first quart er ended Jan. 31 fell to $3,521, 000, or 33 cents a share, from $4,611,000, or 43 cents a share, in the 1969 period, David L. Luke 3d, president, reported to shareholders at the annual meeting in the Biltmore Hotel yesterday.

title: Books of The Times
description: WALKER SMITH JR. was born in. Black Bottom in Detroit in 1921. When he was 12 he moved with his mother and two sisters to Hell's Kitchen in New York. Not long after he discovered that he was very good with his fists. He boxed his first amateur match in Kingston, N.Y., in 1936. His coach identified him with an Amateur Athletic Union card that belonged to one Ray Robinson. The name stuck, along with the nickname Sugar, which was offered by a woman who thought his style sweet.

title: Dispute on Education Funds Appears in Albany
description: ALBANY, Feb. 24Governor Rockefeller and the chairman of the State Assembly's Educa tion Committee differed today on how to distribute about $360million more in aid to schools for the 197071 school a year.

title: MRS. LILA WALLACE TO RECEIVE AWARD
description: Mrs. Lila Acheson Wallace, cochairman and cofounder of the Reader's Digest Associa tion, Inc. has been chosen to receive the 1970 Golden Door Award of the American Council for Nationalities Service. She will be the first woman to receive the award.

title: Aviation Official Suggests Dogs Make Excellent Bomb Detectors
description: The International Air Trans port Association has suggested to some member airlines the idea of using dogs to detect explosives that saboteurs might try to slip aboard their planes.

title: International Step Asked By U.S. to Guard Airlines
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 24  The United States called today for joint planning by govern ment aviation officials over the world to protect their civil air transport from terrorist attacks.

title: Arrest We Must
description: In San Francisco it is illegal to pick up used confetti and throw it again, but there Is no recent arrest record for such an offense. In New York, where it is unlaw ful to remove objects from subway station trash receptacles, the law  that law, at any rate  is strictly enforced. An otherwise inoffensive citizen, who had picked a newspaper out of such a waste basket, was subsequently arrested in his midtown office the other day and driven to the Criminal Courts Building at Centre Street under the heavy guard of three uniformed patrolmen and one detective. He chose a $5 fine over a day in fail.

title: Striking Teachers Besiege Legislature in Kentucky
description: FRANKFORT, Ky., Feb. 24 (UPT)  Hundreds of striking public school teachers descend ed on the Kentucky State Legislature today to plead for higher salaries and were given a cool reception by most legis lators.

title: Fanny May Data Listed for Week
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 24Mortgage prices rose again at this week's auction, the Federal National Mortgage Asso ciation disclosed today.

title: Senator's Aide Raped
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 24 (AP)  A 20yearold secretarial em ploye of a United States Sena tor was raped in her apartment last night the police said. A man entered her room she told the police and demanded money. When she said she had none she was forced to disrobe and was raped. Her indentity and the name of the Senator for whom she works were withheld.

title: A Summary of Supreme Court Actions
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 24 The Supreme Court took the following actions today:

title: U.S. TUNA VESSEL IS SEIZED BY PERU
description: LIMA, Peru, Feb. 24  The Peruvian Government seized and fined today an American fishing boat  the first boat seized on the Pacific tuna fish ing grounds off the Peruvian coast this season.

title: Mets 4th Choice at 92; Yankees Are 151 Shots
description: LAS VEGAS, Feb. 24 (UPI) The first line on the com ing baseball season by odds makers here listed the world champion New York Mets to day as the fourth choice at 92 to repeat as National League winners.

title: HALT IN BUDD CARS DIMS L.I.R.R. HOPES
description: The effort to provide new cars for the troubled Long Is land Rail Road, the production of which was already eight months behind schedule, fell even further behind yesterday when the manufacturer of the cars announced that it was halting production because it had run out of critical parts.

title: Rahway High School Opens After Week's Racial Unrest
description: RAHWAY, N. J., Feb. 24 Rahway High School reopened this morning after a oneweek shutdown because of racial clashes.

title: Vermont Six Routs Williams
description: BURLINGTON, Vt., Feb. 24 (AP)The University of Ver mont shut out William College, 100, today in hockey.

title: Nigeria Estimates War Cost
description: LAGOS, Nigeria, Feb. 24 (Reuters)The twoandahalf year Nigerian civil war, which ended last month with the sur render of the former territory of Biafra, cost the Federal Gov ernment in Lagos more than 300 million Nigerian pounds (about $840million), according to the Federal Finance Com missioner Obafemi Awolowo.

title: MRS. ALLISON MAXWELL
description: PITTSBURGH, Feb. 24Mrs. Eleanor McCook Maxwell, widow of Allison R. Maxwell, a Pittsburgh steel executive who died in 1929, and mother of Allison R. Maxwell Jr., chairman of the board of the WheelingPittsburgh Steel Cor poration, died here yesterday.

title: Thousands of British Asians Fear Ouster by Uganda
description: KAMPALA, Uganda, Feb, 24 Fear is growing among thou sands of British Asians in Uganda that they will soon be forced out of their jobs, busi nesses and country.

title: IRT Service Disrupted
description: Power on the IRT Woodlawn and Jerome Avenue line was out from 6:15 until 8:31 last night. According to Consoli dated Edison, the disruption was caused by a failure in four 19,000 volt feeder cables in two !Transit Authority substations.

title: July Nuptials For Miss Neal
description: CHARLOTTESVILLE, Va., Feb. 24Mr. and Mrs. J. Robert Neal Jr. have an nounced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Susan Neal, to John Patrick Mc Veigh, son of Dr. and Mrs. Gorman McVeigh of New York. A July 11 wedding is manned.

title: 42 Points for Mount
description: MINNEAPOLIS, Feb.24 (UPI) Rick Mount's 42 points led Purdue to a 10894 Big Ten vic tory over Minnesota tonight.

title: Protest Halts Hearing on Budget
description: Puerto Rican protesters took control of a capital budget hearing in City Hall for 90 minutes yesterday and shouted that the city was discriminat ing against their community.

title: Girls' College to Stay As Is
description: KEUKA PARK, N. Y., Feb. 24 (AP)  Keuka College in this Finger Lakes community an nounced today that it would re main an all women's school, ra ther than becoming coeduca tional. The college which has 800 students has been studying the possibility of becoming co educational since 1968. The col lege was coeducational after it was founded in 1890, but it has been for women only since 1921.

title: Music: Fox in Last of 4 Organ Recitals
description: THERE is this about Virgil Fox: when his hands are on the console, there are two of them; and when his feet are engaged in pedal work, there also are two. They can be counted. Two hands, two feet. But when the famous virtuoso organist is busy ad justing stops, and he is al ways busy adjusting stops, he has many hands. He must have. Fingers and wrists are incessantly darting out of nowhere, there is a constant blur, and one gets the im pression that Mr. Fox has as many hands as he has teeth.

title: Brewster Held Unfit Mentally for Trial On Bribery Charge
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 24 (AP)  Former Senator Daniel B. Brewster of Maryland, who has been charged with accepting bribes while he was in office, suffered a severe mental lapse and is not competent to stand trial, a doctor's report said today. The report said that the chronic effect of alcohol was contributing cause.

title: Navy Contracts Awarded
description: The Westinghouse Electric Corporation announced yester day receipt of a $13.1million Navy contract for Poseidon missilelauncher equipment. In another action, the Hoffman Electronics Corporation was awarded a $7million Navy contract for navigation equip ment.

title: RATE RISE IS BACKED BY ILLINOIS CENTRAL
description: The Illinois Central Railroad, which has been trying for sev eral weeks to slow the rail road industry's move for an other freightrate increase which would be the third in less than a yearis abandon ing that position.

title: Scanlan's, a Monthly Magazine, Promises to Vilify Institutions
description: A new monthly called Scan Ian's, a compound of new and old journalism, including re portage by the late Ben Hecht appeared on newsstands here yesterday.

title: EXPANSION OF ABM TO 3D MISSILE SITE IS SOUGHT BY LAIRD
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 24 Defense Secretary Melvin R. Laird outlined today a Nixon Administration request to de fend a third Minuteman site with Safeguard defensive mis siles and to acquire land and do preliminary work at five additional locations.

title: Stage: Unseen White Rabbit Returns
description: THE Phoenix Theater's pro duction of Harvey, in a carefully studied restaging by Stephen Porter, restores James Stewart and a sense of innocence to the American theater. It also gave a certain glamour to the firstnight audience, for the ANTA Theater last night seemed studded with stars of stage and screen  all of them vintage and some of them of good years.

title: Swiss Moves Unclear
description: BERNE, Switzerland, Feb. 24 Switzerland recorded progress today on her proposal for an international conference on air security. But her decision to curb Arab travel marked time

title: Hokkaido, Facing Soviet, Vital in Japan's Defense
description: SAPPORO, Japan, Feb. 23 We don't think of the Soviet Union as a hypothetical enemy, Lieut. Gen. Masakatsu Hashimoto said. But the close presence of the armed forces of a great power is a potential threat to Hokkaido.

title: TUG STRIKE TALKS WILL BE RESUIVIED
description: Negotiations in the strike of 6,000 tugboat workers here are to be resumed tomorrow.

title: U.S. SUSPENDS CUT FOR PIANO TARIFF
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 24 President Nixon opened the way for the first time today for a United States industry to ob tain adjustment assistance from the Government on the ground it was being injured by imports.

title: L.I.U. Beats Post, 68.53, As Jones Gets 19 Points
description: BROOKVILLE, L.I., Feb. 24 Long Island University, held to a 3point lead over C. W. Post College in the first half, pulled away from the Pioneers in the second half tonight to score a 6853 victory. The Blackbirds were led by Walter Jones, who scored 19 points.

title: U.M.W. President to Make Announcement of National Interest
description: PITTSBURGH, Feb. 24W.A. Boyle, president of the United Mine Workers, will make an announcement here Thursday that the U.M.W. said today would be of national interest.

title: ARABS REVIEWING AIRLINER ATTACKS
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Feb. 24 Yasir Arafat, the top Palestine commando leader, said today at a news conference in Am man, Jordan, that the Unified Command of the commando or ganizations is now seriously re viewing the entire question of attacks on international air liners, according to the Amman radio.

title: POMPIDOU ASSERTS FRANCE WANTS U.S. TO STAY IN EUROPE
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 24 President Pompidou today forcefully conveyed France's de sire to strengthen her ties with the United States despite va rious policy divergences and to see the American military and economic presence maintained in Western Europe.

title: Tito and Nasser End Taiks
description: ASWAN, United Arab Re public, Feb. 24 (AP)President Tito of Yugoslavia and Presi dent Gamal Abdel Nasser held their second of two sessions on the Middle East crisis today.

title: Market Place:
description: LET'S say you've got $5,000 and you want to buy a stock. Are you going to let the New York Stock Ex change's proposed new com mission schedule dictate what price stock you buy?

title: In Memoriam
description: BEEKMANCharles K. in loving memory of a fond and cherished companion. M. B. B.

title: 7 Die In a Village
description: GRENOBLE, France, Feb. 24 (AP)  An avalanche poured down on an Alpine village near here today and smashed into a small hotel and a farmhouse. Officials said that seven per sons were killed and five in jured and that nine were un accounted for.

title: Kennedy Asserts That Substantial Cuts Can Be Made in Rock Bottom Military Budget
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 24 Senator Edward M. Kennedy said today that the military budget described by the Ad ministration as rockbottom could be substantially cut with out any danger to the nation.

title: New Tubing Developed
description: The Union Carbide Corpora tion announced yesterday that it had developed a new tubing that was said to be four time more effective in transferring heat. It is being distributed by the Wolverine Tube division of, the Universal oil products Com pany, which will sell the tubing to makers of commercial air conditioners and water chillers.

title: Miss Marie L. Trigg Engaged To Robert Winslow Puffer 3d
description: WELLESLEY, Mass., Feb. 24Miss Marie Louise Trigg will be married here May 23 to Robert Winslow Puffer 3d in St. Andrew's Episcopal Church.

title: WORSE BARS EFFORT TO SEEK HOUSE SEAT
description: EUGENE, Ore., Feb. 24  Former Senator Wayne Morse said today that he would not run for the House this year because it would cause a further split in the Oregon Democratic party.

title: 2FOR1 SPLIT URGED BY KIMBERLYCLARK
description: A 2for1 split of the com mon stock of the Kimberly Clark Corporation was proposed yesterday by directors of the paper manufacturing company.

title: 1,033 SEEK SEATS ON SCHOOL BOARDS
description: Sharply contested races for membership on the new de centralized local school boards are shaping up in most sections of the city.

title: Bristol, Ousted by Reds, Tries His Agility Regimen on Pilots
description: TEMPE, Ariz., Feb. 24 The Seattle Pilots won 25 fewer games and batted 43 points less than the Cincin nati Reds last year. But this spring the Pilots look exact ly as the Reds did a year ago.

title: California Ruling Stands
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 24The Supreme Court avoided ruling today on the volatile issue of abortion when it declined to review a decision of the Supreme Court of California that declared that state's antiabor tion law unconstitutional.

title: U.S. SLOOP FIRST IN AUSSIE RACE
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Feb. 24 (AP)  The American yacht, Nemesis, won the fifth race to day but continued to trail Cara bella of Australia and Crest of Norway for the 5.5Meter Class championship.

title: Hawks Increase Lead
description: LOS ANGELES, Feb. 24 (AP) Joe Caldwell scored 38 points tonight to lead the At lanta Hawks to a 118106 vic tory over the Los Angeles Lakers. The victory enabled the Hawks to increase their firstplace lead over the Lak ers to three games.

title: Japanese in Alaska Oil Bid
description: TOKYO, Feb. 24 (AP)A joint oildevelopment enter prise was officially established in Tokyo today to bid for all concessions in Alaska's north slope. The new concern, the North Slope Company, Ltd., is supported by 26 Japanese com panies.

title: Iowa Wins 13th In Row
description: IOWA CITY, Feb. 24 (AP) Ninthranked Iowa, paced by John Johnson's 49 points, cap tured its 13th straight victory and raised its Big Ten mark to 110 with a 11697 victory over Northwestern tonight.

title: VILLANOVA ROUTS TOLEDO, 107 TO 82
description: VILLANOVA, Pa., Feb. 24 (AP)Villanova, getting more than half its points from Chris Ford, Fran O'Hanlon and Clar ence Smith, took command mid way through the first period and went on to rout Toledo, 10782, tonight.

title: NARCOTICS POLICE ARREST A CHILEAN
description: A 35yearold Chilean was arrested in a car near his tene ment in upper Manhattan yes terday while holding a shopping bag that the police said con tained cocaine and heroin with a retail value of $1.5million.

title: Gromyko in East Berlin
description: BERLIN, Feb. 24Andrei A. Gromyko, the Soviet Foreign Minister, flew to East Berlin today to consult with East German leaders on the state of Soviet contacts with the West Germans and on the proposed EastWest Germans talks at the level of heads of government.

title: POTATO FUTURES POST SHARP GAINS
description: Potato futures prices reacted to reports that the National Farmers Organization had called a nationwide holding ac tion on potatoes by rising sharply yesterday.

title: MARKET TRAVELS A MIXED COURSE
description: The stock market showed a continuation of gains yesterday in some bank and oil stocks, while pollutioncontrol issues ran into profit taking.

title: B52's Seek to Block Heavy Traffic Along Ho Chi Minh Trail
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Feb. 24 (AP)  Informed sources said today that North Viet nam had launched the biggest supply operation of the war down the Ho Chi Minh Trail in eastern Laos.

title: 5 New Judges Sworn By International Court
description: THE HAGUE, Feb. 24 (Reu ters)The International Court of Justice met in special ses sion today for the swearing in of five new judges to bring it up to its full strength of 15.

title: JUDICIAL REFORM SUPPORTED BY BAR
description: ATLANTA, Feb. 24 (AP) The American Bar Association today endorsed the Judicial Re form Act sponsored by Senator Joseph Tydings as it closed its 1970 midwinter meeting.

title: C.B.S. Takes Nielsen Lead
description: The Columbia Broadcasting System television network was in first place in the national Nielen ratings for the week ending Feb. 15, leading in seven of the top 10 shows. C.B.S. had a 21.6 rating, the National Broadcasting Company had 20.3, and the American Broad casting Company had 16.8 N.B.C. had been the ratings' leader for most of the current season.

title: AMEX PRICES DIP IN QUIET TRADING
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange generally eased yes terday in quiet trading.

title: Democrats Say Nixon's Budget Scrimps on Needs of the People
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 24 Democratic leaders opened a new assault on the Nixon. Administration's spending pri orities today as they pre pared to welcome Lawrence F. O'Brien as their new national chairman.

title: Marijuana Seized in Boston
description: BOSTON, Feb. 24 (AP)The state police arrested a 21year old Suffolk University coed, Kathleen N. Isbell, as she stepped from a plane at Logan International Airport today and confiscated two bags they said contained 32 pounds of mari juana. Miss Isbell, of Cam bridge, was charged with ille gal possession of marijuana and illegal possession with intent to deliver. Her flight originated in San Francisco.

title: MORE VIGILANCE HELD NECESSARY;Gambling Danger Obvious and Won't Be Tolerated, Commissioner Warns
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., Feb. 24Bowie Kuhn said today that betting on baseball games had increased and predicted that a network of security agents would be created to pro tect the sport.

title: Sports of The Times
description: THE road to sports immortality has been a welltraveled passageway of recent weeks as some of yesterday's heroes were whisked toward the end of the rainbowelection to various halls of fame. Although fame may be fleeting for ordinary men, any enshrinement brings a degree of permanence. New demigods have been added to the pantheon at Cooperstown for bakball and to the one at Rutgers for col lege football.

title: The Chattanooga Post Closes After U.S. Files Antitrust Suit
description: CHATTANOOGA, Feb. 24 The Chattanooga Post, one of two afternoon papers in this city, ceased publication today after the filing of a Federal anti trust suit charging that the Times Printing Company, own er of The Post, was attempting to monopolize the daily news paper market here.

title: ST. JOHN'S BEATS HOLY CROSS, 7562
description: With 11 minutes 37 seconds left in the first half and the score, 133, in favor of Holy, Cross, the St. John's rooters among the 8,186 fans in Alumni Gym last night were beginning to think, Oops, there goes another tournament bid, but they were wrong as the Redmen roared back to win easily. 7562.

title: 2 Candidates Protest Coalition Tactics
description: Two liberal Democratic can didates for Governor, Howard J. Samuels and William van den Huevel, have been working together on a plan to boycott the nominating convention of the New Democratic Coalition, the largest organized liberal group within the party.

title: EXPORT BANK SEES MORE ARAB BUSINESS
description: Henry Kearns, president and chairman of the ExportImport Bank, said yesterday that his organization anticipated doing increased business with the states of the Arab world.

title: U.S. SEXTET SCORES OVER JAPAN, 11 TO I
description: BUCHAREST, Feb. 24 (AP) Herb Brooks scored three goals today in leading the United States team to an 111 victory over Japan in the first round of the world ice hockey champion ship for Group B teams before a crowd of 2,500.

title: Vietnam Casualties
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 24 (UPI) The Defense Department to day listed the names of the following Army men from the New York area as having been killed in Vietnam:

title: CARROLL SKATES TO 1,500 VICTORY
description: WEST ALLIS, Wis., Feb. 24 (UPI)  Dan Carroll of the United States, skating in the last pair, scored an upset vic tory in the men's 1,500meter international speedskating race today at Olympic Rink.

title: High Court Agrees to Consider Rockland County's Voting Issue
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 24  The Supreme Court agreed today to rule on whether the method of selecting members of the Rockland County Legislature satisfies the Con stitution's oneman, onevote requirement.

title: City and State Operate Own Narcotics Centers
description: Both the city and the state operate narcotics programs that include preventive edu cation, treatment and rehab ilitation and research.

title: HIGH COURT REFUSES TO REVIEW SCM CASE
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 24 (AP) The Supreme Court refused today to review the antitrust conviction of the SCM Corpora tion of New York and the awarding of $70,000 damages and nearly $45,000 in attorney fees to the Advanced Business Systems & Supply Company of Baltimore.

title: Schary Named City's First Cultural Chief
description: Dore Schary, the play wright and former Holly wood producer, has been named the city's first Com missioner of Cultural Affairs.

title: Israel Philharmonic Explores Fiscal Help in the West
description: The Israel Philharmonic Orchestra, which for years has been rare among inter nationally renowned sym phonies for being almost self sufficient economically, is running into financial trou ble and is exploring possibili ties of substantial assistance in the United States and oth er Western countries.

title: Nepalese Prepare for a Royal Wedding
description: KATMANDU, Nepal, Feb. 21 Four white stallions have been flown from England, flowers are coming from the Nether lands, two planeloads of food from New Delhi, 200 automo biles from Japan to carry the guests and nine elephants from Nepal's own jungles.

title: HOME OF POLICEMAN IS FIRE BOMB TARGET
description: MADISON, N. J., Feb. 24 An attempt was made last night to fire bomb the home of a 21yearold policeman who acted as an undercover agent in an investigation that led to a series of arrests on narcotics charges in Morris County last week.

title: Bar's PresidentElect
description: SEATED behind his carved walnut desk in his luxuri ous Houston law office, Leon Jaworski is a benign, blue eyed picture of a man con tent with himself. He once said that a man's life is race with time, and, by his reckoning, the new presi dentelect of the American.

title: Museum of Modern Art Finishes $1Million in Red for Fiscal '69
description: A record deficit of nearly $1 million plagued the Museum of Modern Art at the close of fis cal 1969.

title: Hyland to Leave Jersey Post
description: TRENTON, Feb. 24William F. Hyland, chairman of the State Commission of Investiga tions said today that he in tended to resign from the chairmanship he has held since the creation of the commission last year to devote more time to his Camden law practice and to his family. Mr. Cahill said he would meet with Mr. Hy land on Friday.

title: LTV to Sell Control of Wilson To Pepsico, Inc., for $63Million
description: LingTemcoVought, Inc., announced yesterday that it had agreed to sell its 75 per cent controlling interest in the Wilson Sporting Goods Company to Pepsico, Inc., for approximately $63million.

title: Minimum Note Level Set
description: The New York State Banking Board moved yesterday to pre vent banks from raising capital by issuing their shortterm notes to small investors, thus thwarting the plans of at least one major bank to do so.

title: New Bond Issues
description: STRAIGHT DEBT

title: Rate on 273Day Bills Declines To 6.994%, Down From 7.725%
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 24 Treasury bill rates declined at today's auction from last month's levels, the Government reported late this afternoon.

title: BOOKINGS TO ISRAEL ARE FOUND NORMAL
description: El Al and other airlines with direct service from New York to Tel Aviv said yesterday that concern about recent acts of sabotage against airliners headed for Israel had had no apparent effect on their book ings.

title: London Ground Crews Bar Work on Mideast Airliners
description: LONDON, Feb. 24Ground crews at the London airport refused today to do regular work for airlines of eight Arab countries and El Al, the Israeli airline. The reason given was fear for the men's safety after the recent explosions on planes bound for Israel or carrying mail for Israel.

title: OVERHOSPITALIZING CHARGED BY DOCTOR
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 24 (AP) A family doctor from North Carolina testified today that about 30 per cent of the people admitted to hospitals did not need to be.

title: DON C. PEDEN
description: SAN DIEGO, Feb. 24 (UPI) Don C. Peden, who served as coach and later as athletic director at Ohio University for 26 years, died here today. He was 71 years old.

title: The Students' Voice
description: Student leaders of the city's high schools have de manded a major role in the decisions that affect their education, and the predictable response of some spokesmen for the system is one of alarm and opposi tion. It is the wrong response, more likely to intensify the already serious discord than to contain it.

title: ANACONDA TO CUT ITS CHILE COPPER
description: The Anaconda Company said here yesterday that its major affiliates in Chile would cut their scheduled deliveries of copper by 40 per cent next month because of production difficulties.

title: DISSONANCE MARKS RIMMER SYMPHONY
description: Musically speaking, New Zea land didn't seem very far away last night at Carnegie Hall dur ing the concert of the National Orchestral Association. John Rimmer's Symphony 1968 was played, and it might as well have been written just around the corner rather than faraway Auckland, where Mr. Rimmer studied and teaches.

title: Washington: For the Record
Nat'l Hockey League
description: STANDING OF THE CLUBS

title: Pilots' Spokesmen at U.N. By SAM POPE BREWER
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Feb. 24The president of a worldwide organization of 46, 000 airline pilots conferred to day with Under Secretary General Ralph J. Bunche on possible moves to force ef fective action against sabotage of civil aircraft.

title: Rutgers Victor in Overtime
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N. J., Feb. 24 (AP)  Bob Wenzel made a pair of foul shots with 1 second remaining in regula tion time and then sank two crucial baskets in overtime to help Rutgers to a 9084 triumph tonight over the University of Connecticut.

title: 3 ADULTS, 2 BOYS DIE IN THRUWAY CRASH
description: CATSKILL, N.Y., Feb. 22 Three persons from Brooklyn and two children from Sara toga Springs were killed today on the Gov. Thomas E. Dewey Thfuway when a car skidded sideways across the median and collided broadside with another, the, state police'said.

title: Scans Warns of Anthill Society
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 24By the year 2000, Americans will be jammed together in an anthill society unless govern ment and business join in a coherent national growth policy, Secretary of Comrrierce Maurice H. Stans said in lecture tonight.

title: SHIPPING / MAILS
description: ALL HOURS GIVEN IN EASTERN STANDARD TIME (Tugboat Strike May Caus e Ship Movement Delays)

title: Attacker of Rudi Dutschke Is Suicide in German Jail
description: BERLIN, Feb. 24Josef Bach mann, the 25yearold house painter who tried to kill Rudi Dutschke, a leftist student leader, in April 1968, today committed suicide in his prison cell, prison authorities said.

title: Bugbear for Economists
description: The contradictory, and confusing outcome of the United States balance of payments last yeara $7billion deficit by one measure and a $2.7billion surplus by anotherhas raised doubts about the wisdom of basing United States poli cies on such con flicting yardsticks. In particular, econ omists who cite the growth of United States gold and other international reserves after 20 years of decline question such practices as tying foreign aid to purchases of goods manu factured in the United States and continued restraint on American lending and investing overseas.

title: Cincinnati Moves Up
description: CINCINNATI, Feb. 24 (AP) Cincinnati downed Drake, 8872, in a Missouri Valley Conference game tonight and moved into second place, one game behind leagueleading Drake.

title: TOULOUSE ENSEMBLE IN GALLIC MOZART
description: Since in France, Mozart's name is pronounced quite gen erally as Mohzahr, as if he were an adopted son instead of an alien Austrian, it was no surprise last night at the Grace Rainey Rogers Auditorium of the Metropolitan Museum of Art to hear a persuasively Gal lic performance of his Diverti mento in D (K. 136) by the Toulouse Chamber Orchestra.

title: Europeans Press for a Common Currency
description: PARIS, Feb. 24Finance min isters of the European Economic Community strengthened their resolve today to establish a European monetary personal ity and eventually common currency that could compete with the dollar.

title: CHEMIST DEVELOPS PLASTIC CONCRETE
description: HOUSTON, Feb. 24 A plasticimpregnated concrete four times as strong as ordinary concrete is being tested for the construction of houses, pipe lines, pavements and under water structures.

title: KyungWha Chung, Of Musical Family, In Debut on Violin
description: The musical Chungs were out in force last night to help KyungWha Chung make a good thing of her first New York recital.

title: Moira Shearer as a Wife and Mother
description: TWENTYTHREE years ago a dancer named Moira Shearer took time out from doing leading roles with Sad ler's Wells Ballet (now The Royal) to appear in a movie, The Red Shoes.

title: RANGER DEFENSE GETS NO RESPITE
description: For crying out loud, Cat, we've had four games in five days. Give us a rest, moaned Arnie Brown yesterday. But Brown did not talk loud enough for Coach Emile Francis to hear him.

title: THOMAS BANCROFT SR.
description: OLD BROOKVILLE, L.I., Feb. 24  Thomas Moore Bancroft Sr., chairman and former presi dent of Mount Vernon Mills of Baltimore, died yesterday of a heart attack at Community Hospital in Glen Cove. His age was 67.

title: Oppositionist Deputy in South Vietnam Sentenced to 20 Years
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Wednesday, Feb. 25  Tran Ngoc Chau, an Opposition Deputy, was found guilty today in absentia of having damaged the national security of South Vietnam through having had dealings with his brother, a North Vietnamese intelligence agent. Mr. Chau was sentenced by a military court to 20 years at hard labor.

title: Miss Coker Is Affianced
description: GLEN COVE, L. I., Feb. 24 F. George Coker, president of George J. Coker & Son, a New York catering firm, and Mrs. Coker have an nounced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Margaret Elizabeth Coker, to Richard Wayne Haag, son of Mr. and Mrs. Richard Harding Haag. Both families are of Glen Cove. A July wedding is planned.

title: Chocolate Lenin on Cake Found Excessive Adulation in Soviet
description: MOSCOW, Feb. 24 Rus sians can have their cake, but they need not eat a chocolate Lenin medal with it, too.

title: Harrelson Sheds Hair After 4Figure Threat
description: TUCSON, Ariz., Feb. 24 (UPI)Ken Harrelson, who arrived at the Cleveland In dians camp last night sport ing purple bellbottoms, purple shoes and purple  sunglasses augmented by shoulder length hair, got his locks trimmed quickly today at the threat o a fourfigure fine.

title: Speaking of the Environment
description: The Sierra Club and Senator Edmund S. Muskie have raised a question that directly tests the determi nation of the Nixon Administration to protect and restore the environment against the pressures of vested interests. The question is: where are the detailed statements of the Secretary of Agriculture and the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development on the environmental impact of pending legislation to get optimum timber productivity out of the national forests?

title: Laird Says Pentagon Plans Massive Cuts In U.S. Bases Soon
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 24 (AP) Secretary of Defense Melvin R. Laird said today that the Pentagon will announce mas sive base reductions within the next 30 days.

title: Cassius Clay Loses Plea For Hearing by 15 Judges
description: NEW ORLEANS, Feb. 24 The United States Court of Ap peals for the Fifth Circuit turned down today the request of Cassius Clay that his appeal from a conviction for refusing to be inducted into the Army be heard by all 15 judges of the court.

title: Bridge:
description: TWO widely disparate worlds  the world of Aquarius and the world of tournament bridge  inter sected here Monday when a hero of the hippie generation came close to winning a major title.

title: At Pompidou Dinner, Leaders Trade Praise
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 24 The portrait of the Marquis de Lafayette was wreathed with green tonight at the White House as the Presi dent and Mrs. Nixon paid tribute to all things French in honor of President and Mrs. Pompidou of France.

title: TREIGLE CHARMING AS FAUST'S DEVIL
description: In these days, Gounod's Faust can survive only if it is cast with superlative singers or if it is given the kind of flamboyant production that can be found at the State Theater whenever the New York City Opera is functioning there.

title: Yonkers Is Bedroom and Office for Mafia Chiefs
description: YONKERSSo many big time Mafia members live in Yonkers, a lawenforcement officer familiar with orga nized crime said recently, that we think of the city as a little Newark.

title: Four Czechoslovak Exiles Are Deprived of Citizenship
description: PRAGUE, Feb. 24 (Reuters)  The Czech State Interior Ministry today announced that it had revoked the citizenship of Jiri Pelikan, Ota Sik, Ivan Svitak and Otakar Rambousek, all reformers who are now liv ing abroad.

title: PRICES AGAIN SLIP ON LONDON BOARD
DR. DAVID THOMSON, OF SUSSEX COLLEGE
description: LONDON, Feb. 24Dr. David Thomson, Master of Sidney Sussex College, Cambridge University and an author, died today in Cambridge. His age was 58.

title: DOCTORS FACE BAN ON SALE OF BILLS
description: ALBANY, Feb. 24  The State Senate passed a bill today that would outlaw the sale of Medicaid bills to collection agencies by physicians, den tists and druggists.

title: Bullets Down Rockets
description: BALTIMORE, Feb. 24 AP) The Baltimore Bullets, with four players scoring over 20 points, defeated the San Diego Rockets, 128118 tonight at the Baltimore Civic Center.

title: SAMUEL LOUIS ROSS
description: HARTSDALE, N. Y., Feb. 24 Samuel Louis Ross, who entered the field of radio broadcasting and mutual funds while they were in their infancy, died yesterday at White Plains Hospital after a long illness. He was 77 years old and lived at 170 East Hartsdale Avenue.

title: Ottinger Declares Senate Candidacy
description: Representative Richard L. Ottinger of Westchester County formally announced his candi dacy for the Democratic nomi nation for the United States Senate yesterday and opened his campaign with an attack on the Nixon Administration's Middle East policy.

title: THAI, HERE, STRESSES ASIAN SELFRELIANCE
description: Foreign Minister Thanat Kho man of Thailand said last night that United States military in tervention in Southeast Asia may not only be ineffective, but may even become a lia bility.

title: Britons Debate Fees
description: LONDON, Feb. 24The Lon don Stock Exchange followed New York into a controversial area today with proposals to change brokeragehouse corn missions.

title: Roxbury Official Sentenced
description: BOSTON, Feb. 24 (AP) David J. O'Connor, a member of the Massachusetts House from a Roxbury District where he conducts an undertaking business, was sentenced today to five months in jail for failure to file Federal income tax re turns in 1962 and 1963. He also was fined $10,000 by Judge An thony Julian in United States District Court. The sentence was suspended for 10 days to allow time for appeal.

title: REVENGE IS ALLEGED IN MOTEL SLAYINGS
description: FLINT, Mich., Feb. 24 (UPI) The prosecution in the Al giers Motel Federal conspiracy trial began its summation today by charging that the police had beaten and shot young Negroes and white prostitutes there to get even for the riot raging outside the motel in Detroit.

title: Franchising Abuses Scored by Williams
description: The growing franchise busi ness, in which annual sales currently are estimated to be in the neighborhood of $90 billion, is accompanied by such abuses as an unfortunate con centration of swindlers and conartists and an alarming failure rate in some areas re sulting from a getonthe bandwagon attitude, Senator Harrison A. Williams Jr., Demo crat of New Jersey, declared in remarks prepared for de livery here yesterday.

title: POLLUTION EBBING IN CITY'S WATERS
description: Although oil seepage, noxious chemicals, industrial wastes, debris and silt continue to be foul New York City's water ways, municipal experts and they are slowly winning the battle against the city's own worst contaminant  human sewage.

title: Jane Ellen Silberstein Betrothed
description: WHITE PLAINS, Feb. 24 Announcement has been made by Dr. and Mrs. Alexander G. Silberstein of the engagement of their daughter, Miss Jane Ellen Silberstein, to Eric Liebling Herzog, son of Dr. and Mrs. Bernard Herzog.

title: White House Roots For Family Trees
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 24Mrs. Alice Roosevelt Longworth declines an invitation to a luncheon today. I'm cut ting down on going out, she apologized. The excuse prompted Princess Julia Grant Cantacuzene, one of the guests, to remark: Cutting down? Wellthink of that. Why she's only 86. The Princess will be 94 years old in June.

title: EASTERN HOCKEY LEAGUE
description: LAST NIGHT'S GAMES Charlotte 8, New Jersey 4. Syracuse 4, New Haven 2.

title: KRANEPOOL SIGNS $37,000 CONTRACT
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., Feb. 24On the eve of their first full workout of spring training, the New York Mets signed Ed Kranepool to his contract to day and reduced their holdouts to oneRon Swoboda.

title: Orr Continues Record Pace For Pro Hockey Scoring
description: Bobby Orr of the Boston Bruins, skating toward a Na tional Hockey League mark, continued his recordbreaking scoring pace last week.

title: Bagpipes Toot at Grand Central
description: When commuters smile as they stream through the vastness of the Grand Central Terminal in the morning, instead of moving with grumpy determination, it's got be something.

title: Is It a Crocodile or an Alligator?
description: Two reptile experts at the Bronx Zoo have devised a method of telling alligator skins from crocodile skins. The system is expected to aid the enforcement of new laws banning the sale of products made from American alli gator hides.

title: Advertising: Southern Living Comes North
description: Southern Living, a fast growing monthly magazine distributed in 12 southern states, put on its first New York luncheon and slide pres entation yesterday, and it was as blantant a piece of vicious, mean, rotten, souldestroying propaganda as you could imagine.

title: Gary Peters Injured
description: WINTER HAVEN, Fla., Feb. 24 (UPI)Gary Peters became the first Red Sox casualty of the spring today when he pulled a muscle in his back. The 33 yearold lefthander, obtained from the Chicago White Sox in a multiplayer trade during the off season, is expected to miss practice for a few days.

title: Action Against Air Piracy
description: A terrible irony has emerged since last weekend's bomb explosions on Swiss and Austrian airplanes. Israel, the real and intended victim of the bombers, has been further victimized by several of the foreign airlines serving it, which have now imposed an em bargo on Israelbound freight and mail. Thus it has been Israel, the target, rather than the perpetrators of these outrages, that has been made to suffer.

title: CHALLENGE TO F.C.C. ON PAY TV REJECTED
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 24 (UPI) The Supreme Court let stand today an Appeals Court ruling allowing the Federal Communi cations Commission to license paytelevision stations.

title: Celanese Posts a Gain of 35% in Earnings for '69 on 7% Rise in Sales
Discrimination Held Main Cause of Income Inequality
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 24  Several studies commissioned by the Government in recent years have shown that the ma jor reason the income of Negroes lags far behind that of whites continues to be dis crimination, not education or training. But Gov ernment has in creasingly been emphasizing the latter in prefer ence to the former, presumably because the policy makers consider discrimination too difficult to combat and edu cation more likely to yield re sults.

title: Roosevelt Drivers
HIGH COURT DROPS FREE SPEECH CASE
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 24  A case testing college students' free speech rights was dismissed by the Supreme Court today be cause the student was also ac cused by the university of lying about his protest activities.

title: Keating and India A re at Odds On Order Closing 5 Libraries
description: NEW DELHI, Feb. 24Am bassador Kenneth B. Keating of the United States and the In dian Foreign Ministry exchanged veiled barbs today after the ministry had ordered the United States Embassy to close five of its nine cultural centers in the country within three months.

title: Again, South African Justice
description: In its treatment of 22 blacks charged with working for the banned African National Congress, South Africa seems determined to outdo even its own appalling record for legal cruelty and hypocrisy. The prose cution in Pretoria was having deep trouble making a case against the defendants under the Suppression of Communism Act, so it therefore abruptly dropped the charges.

title: Car Sales at A.M.C. Down 10% From Feb. 11 to 20
description: DETROIT, Feb. 24  The American Motors Corporation reported today that midFebru ary automobile sales fell 10 per cent from 1969, or to 6,532 retail deliveries from 7,269 a year ago.

title: Contempt Charges Are Dropped As Lords Reach Church Accord
description: Contemptofcourt charges against 105 members of the Young Lords were dropped yes terday after the militant Puerto Rican group reached agreement with the city and an East Har lem church to establish a day care center in the church.

title: EDWARD L. BORTZ, EXPERT ON AGED
description: PHILADELPHIA, Feb. 24 Dr. Edward L. Bortz, an au thority on geriatrics, died to day at Lankenau Hospital. He was 74 years old and lived in BalaCynwyd.

title: Foreign Affairs: Manners Makyth Man
description: WASHINGTONThe United States is unique among nations in that it has always been an agglomerate of peoples who came  or whose ancestors camefrom different lands to find their future in what was called the American Dream.

title: SENATE BROADENS SCHOOL LUNCH AID
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 24 The Senate passed a much ex panded school lunch bill today, by a vote of 85 to 0, after approving an amendment, 41 to 40, to require free school lunches for all needy children meeting new Federal eligibility standards.

title: Conrad Nagel, Actor, Dies at 72; Star of Stage and Silent Pictures
description: Conrad Nagel, the actor, was found dead yesterday in his home at the Park Vendome, 340 West 57th Street. He was 72 years old.

title: Newark Teacher Strike Issues Narrowed to Monetary Items
description: NEWARK, Feb. 24Negoti ations in the Newark teachers' strike continued this evening, with salaries and other mone tary items reportedly the only serious differences remaining between the Board of Educa tion and the teachers' bargain ing agent, the Newark Teach ers Union.

title: AMERICAN HOCKEY LEAGUE
description: ?? 2, Provi??, ?? STANDING OF THE CLUBS

title: Panic and Pregnancies Linked To Senate Inquiry on Birth Pill
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 24 A New York obstetrician told a Congressional subcommittee today that publicity generated by its hearings on hazards of birth control pills had caused panic among women using the drug and dozens of un wanted pregnancies.

title: Higher Airport Noise Level Foreseen
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 24The head of the Federal Aviation Administration said bluntly to day that the noise around major airports would grow steadily louder in the foreseeable future, despite the promise of quieter planes now in production.

title: CITY URGED TO AID LUXURY HOUSING
description: An expert on housing and urban affairs has recommended that all vacant housing sites on Manhattan avenues and as many side streets as possible, be rezoned for luxury apart ment dwellings.

title: Corporates in Rise
description: Interest rates on taxexempt bonds declined sharply yester day. Corporate bond yields, however, moved upward as the RCA Corporation and Phelps Dodge Corporation announced tentative plans to sell $250 million of debt securities.

title: PRINCIPALS DEPLORE STUDENT RIGHTS BILL
description: Associations of high school principals and supervisors as well as individual school prin cipals yesterday denounced the proposed student bill of rights drafted by the City General Or ganization Council, the recog nized student governmental body.

title: Hofstra Victor in Finale, Beating Wagner, 77 to 74
INTEGRATION BAR PRESSED IN SOUTH
description: ATLANTA, Feb. 24Legisla tors in the Deep South have res urrected a previously impotent technique of resistance to school integration by introduc ing a new barrage of state bills designed to impede or prevent the enforcement of recent Fed eral court orders.

title: Mrs. Emma Galley Miller, 95, Of Democratic Committee Dies
description: GROVE CITY, Pa., Feb. 24 Mrs. Emma Guffey Miller, a champion of equal rights for women and, at 95, the oldest member of the Democratic Na tional Committee, died today at Grove City Hospital after suf fering a heart attack. She lived at Wolf Creek Farm, near slip pery Rock.

title: Southern Pacific Forming a Subsidiary
description: The Southern Pacific Com pany announced yesterday the formation of a new subsidiary, the Southern Pacific Land Com pany.

title: $178.3Million Revenue Plan Breaks Pennsylvania Deadlock
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., Feb. 24 Legislative leaders today reached firm agreement on a new revenue package for $178.3  million, made possible by $42.1million in spending reductions, to resolve the state's 13month deadlock on fiscal matters.

title: Wilt to Start Working Out
description: LOS ANGELES, Feb. 24 (AP) The Los Angeles Lakers said tonight that Wilt Chamberlain would start working out with the club March 5 and might play the final four or five games of the season. He has been side lined since Nov. 7 with a rup tured knee tendon.

title: Kit Narodick, Teacher, To Wed Sally P. Gould
description: CLINTON, Mass., Feb. 24 Special Justice for Massa chusetts Morris N. Gould and Mrs. Gould have an nounced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Sally P. Gould to Kit G. Narodick of New York, son of Dr. and Mrs. Philip H. Narodick of Seattle and Honolulu. The wedding will take place in Randolph April 11.

title: PROFITS ROSE IN '69 AT TEXAS UTILITIES
description: The Texas Utilities Company and subsidiaries reported gains in operating revenues and net income yesterday for the final quarter of 1969 and for the full year. The preliminary annual report placed operating reve nues at $99,044,491 for the quarter, compared with $88,232, 698 a year earlier. Net income rose to $17,806,947, or 69 cents a share from $16,347,450, or 64 cents a share, reported in the final quarter of 1968.

title: Expert Says Fungus Diseases Take Surprisingly Large Toll
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 24  Fungus infections consti tute a far greater public health problem In the world, including the United States, than most people realize, an ex pert told an international con ference today.

title: Washington: Who Are the Friends of Israel?
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 24 You can put it down as a gen eral rule that almost any criti cism of the Israeli Government's policies in the Middle East will be attacked and even rebuked these days either by Israeli officials or their friends in this country or both.

title: Article 1  No Title
H.W.FITZPATRICK,71, BAY STATE SHERIFF
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Feb. 24 (UPI)Howard W. Fitzpatrick, Middlesex County Sheriff for more than 20 years, died in the Cardinal Cushing Rehabilitation Center last night. He was 71 years old.

title: 2 Fires in Brooklyn School
description: About 1,500 students at Jun ior High School 258, at Macon Street and Tompkins Avenue in Brooklyn, had to leave the build ing twice yesterday when two suspicious fires broke out, the police reported. No one was in jured. The first fire, reported at 10 A.M., caused only minor damage. The second, started about an hour later in a class room closet and caused con siderable damage to the room and its contents.

title: DYNAMICS WEIGHS CHANGE FOR BOARD
description: The board of directors of Gen eral Dynamics Corporation will gather this morning for one of the most significant meetings in the history of the giant defense contractor.

title: Money
description: TUESDAY. FEB. 24. 1970

title: Morgenthau Heads City Drug Council
description: A City Narcotics Control Commission was set up yester dayheaded by Deputy May or Robert M. Morgenthau and listing no role for City Council President Sanford D. Garelik.

title: Bracken Helps Set Up an Entertainment Company
description: Eddie Bracken, the actor, and Gerald T. Arthur, a New York businessman, have formed a multimilliondollar corporation for the purpose of buying or leasing theaters and producing shows.

title: News Summary and Index
description: As President Pompidou was received at the White House, the theme that French American friendship stands above any cur rent policy disputes was sounded repeatedly. He said that France wanted to strengthen her ties with America and wanted to see the American presence in Europe continued. [Page 1, Column 1.]

title: Steel Output Up 4.3%
description: Steel production rose 4.3 per cent last week, compared to that of the preceding week, the American Iron and Steel Insti tute reported yesterday.

title: PISTONS CONQUER BUCKS, 136 TO 111
description: DETROIT, Feb. 24 (AP)The Detroit Pistons outscored the Milwaukee Bucks, 4725, in the last period tonight and romped to a 136111 National Basket ball Association victory.

title: Basil Paterson Endorsed For Lieutenant Governor
description: ALBANY, Feb. 24The Coun cil of Elected Negro Democrats, which includes black elected public and party officials in the state, tonight endorsed State Senator Basil A. Paterson of Manhattan for the Demo cratic nomination for Lieuten ant Governor.

title: Hickel Warns Power Company on Canal
description: MIAMI, Feb. 24Secretary of the Interior Walter J. Hickel threatened Florida's largest power company with court ac tion today if it did not promise immediately to stop digging a sixmile canal the Government says will damage Biscayne Bay with thermal pollution.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL
