description: GUATEMALA, Feb. 26 (AP) A candidate for Congress from the government's Revo lutionary party and two of his supporters were shot to death last night while putting up campaign posters for presidential and congressional elections Sunday.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: Awards. The President said that he would present atomic pioneers awards to morrow to Dr. Vannevar Bush, director of President Roosevelt's Office of Scien tific Research and Develop ment; Dr. James B. Conant, former chairman of the Na tional Defense Research Com mittee, and Lieut. Gen. Les lie R. Groves, former com manding officer of the Man hattan Project.

title: LAIRD REASSURES CONGRESS CRITICS ON LAOS CONFLICT
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 26  Secretary of Defense Melvin R. Laird said today that Presi dent Nixon would not send ground troops to fight in Laos without the consent of Con gress.

title: Some Pay Station Calls Will Most More in City
description: Some calld from pay tele phones to locations within the five boroughs will cost 25 cents under an interim rate increase for the New York Telephone Company that took effect yesterday.

title: Mrs. Jones Will Not Defend Wimbledon Title This Year
description: LONDON, Feb. 26 (UPI) Mrs. Ann Jones of England, the defending champion in women's play at Wimbledon, announced tonight that she would miss this year's competi tion because of the strain in volved.

title: A.A. U. Track Schedule
description: AFTERNOON EVENTS

title: SHERIFFMAFIA TIE CHARGED BY LACEY
description: NEWARK, Feb. 26United States Attorney Frederick B. Lacey, continuing a feud with Essex County Sheriff Ralph D'Ambola, identified Mr. D'Am bola today as a man who had handled money intended to help the election of a State Senator supported by the underworld.

title: HOST MOTHER PLAN FORESEEN BY BRITON
description: BIRMINGHAM, England, Feb. 26 (UPI)An embryologist sug gested today that host moth ers might be paid someday to give birth to babies conceived in test tubes from the eggs of women unable to have children.

title: MAYOR TO OFFER RENT LAW SHIFTS TO HELP OWNERS
description: Mayor Lindsay told the City Council yesterday that by June 1 he would propose modifica tions in the city's 27yearold rent control law to strengthen the owner's economic base.

title: Wood, Field and Stream: Gaffing Kings
Neighborhoods: Existing by the Numbers
description: In one area of the South Bronx a man walks around with a carton on his shoulder. It is empty, but on the sides is a threedigit numberthe winning combination for the day in the numbers racket.

title: Nets Sign 7Foot Center
description: WEST HEMPSTEAD, L. I., Feb 26 (UPI)The New York Nets signed John Smith, a 7 foot center, as a free agent to night in an attempt to improve their rebounding. Smith, who played at Southern Colorado, was with the Dallas Chaparrals last season and was traded this year to the Pittsburgh Pipers, who recently released him.

title: NATIONAL STUDENT SHIFTS EXECUTIVES
description: Roger O. Walther has been elected president and chief ex ecutive officer of the National Student Marketing Corporation. Mr. Walther, who had been ex ecutive vice president and chief operating officer since July 1969, succeeds Cortes W. Ran dell, who resigned March 19.

title: Melville Price, 49, Painter And Art Professor, Dies
description: Melville Price, a modern expressionist painter and a pro fessor of art at the University of Alabama at Tuscaloosa, died there Tuesday of a heart at tack. He was 49 years old.

title: Murder of a Key Drug Informer Under Intense Investigation Here
description: An intensive investigation is going on into the murder of an informer for the Federal Bu reau of Narcotics whose death last October forced a reduction of charges against three men accused of smuggling drugs.

title: LINDSAY ASSAILED ON $190,000 RAISES
description: Mayor Lindsay was sharply criticized yesterday by Con troller Abraham D. Beame and Councilman Matthew J. Troy Jr. for handing out $190,000 in raises on Monday to 60 ad ministrative aides.

title: Stanoje Simic of Belgrade, ExForeign Minister, 77
description: BELGRADE, Feb. 26 (Reu ters)Stanoje Simic, Yugo slavia's Foreign Minister from 1946 to 1948, died here today at the age of 77.

title: W'GOWAN SHARES LEAD WITH MARI
Nat'l Basketball Ass'n
description: LAST NIGHTS GAME Phoenix 131, Detroit 123.

title: 15 Die in Turkish Bus Crash
description: ANKARA, Turkey, Feb. 26 (Reuters)  A bus carrying pil grims from Mecca plunged into a ravine at Ulukisla today, kill ing 15 passengers and injuring 13. A second bus overturned in a separate crash, injuring 21 pilgrims.

title: Old Man Banks Keeps Hustling Along
description: SCOTTSDALE, Ariz., Feb. 26Leo Durocher sat in the dugout and watched his squad sweat its way through the morning calisthenics.

title: Pennsylvania U. Professor, Shot by ExStudent, Dies
description: PHILADELPHIA, Feb. 26 Dr. Walter Koppelman, a Uni versity of Pennsylvania mathe matics professor, died here to day two weeks after he was shot in the chest by a former graduate student.

title: News Summary and Index
description: International

title: Rhodesia to Become Republic on Tuesday
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, Feb. 26 (AP)Rhodesia, which declared its independ ence from Britain on Nov. 11, 1965, will become a republic at 12:01 A.M. Tuesday, it was announced today.

title: Thai Leads Singapore Open
description: SINGAPORE, Feb. 26 (AP) Suskree Onchum of Thailand shot a sevenunderpar 64 to day for a threestroke first round lead in the Singapore open golf tournament.

title: LINDSAY INTRODUCES MOVIE ON DR. KING
description: King: A Filmed Record, Montgomery to Memphis was screened on Wednesday night for invited representatives of the media at the Little Carnegie Theater. In introducing the film, Mayor Lindsay praised the producer, Ely Landau, and pointed to the lesson of the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr., that both means and ends can be noble.

title: AGNEW DEPLORES CHICAGO 7 TACTICS
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 26 (UPI)  Vice President Agnew told the nation's Governors today that the defendants in the conspiracy trial of the Chi cago Seven were a handful of oddballs [who] deliberately set out to disrupt the most basic protection of our coun try, the dignity of the courts.

title: Col. Louis G. Kelly, 73, Dies; Wartime Military Governor
description: ROCHESTER, Feb. 26 (AP) Col. Louis G. Kelly, who was Military Governor of the Saar Valley in Germany after World War II, died today in Highland Hospital. He was 73 years old.

title: Drinan Resigns College Post
description: BOSTON, Feb. 26 (AP)The Rev. Robert F. Drinan, S.J., re signed today as vice president and provost of Boston College to campaign in the Democratic primary for Congress. He an nounced last weekend he would seek the seat of Representative Philip J. Philbin, a Democrat.

title: YOUTHS BATTLE POLICE ON COAST
description: SANTA BARBARA, Calif., Feb. 26  Defying a curfew, heavy police patrols and a declaration of extreme emer gency by Gov. Ronald Reagan, hundreds of youths pelted po lice cars with rocks and clashed with policemen tonight on the outskirts of this university com munity.

title: Syria, in a Retaliation, Curbs Entry of Swiss
description: DAMASCUS, Syria, Feb. 26 (Reuters)The Syrian Foreign Ministry instructed it embas sies and consulates today not to give entry visas to Swiss nationals without its approval.

title: Assembly Line Surgery Corrects Some Ailing Football Giant Elbows
description: Five members of the New York Giants underwent elbow surgery yesterday at St. Vincent's Hospital.

title: U.S. Reserves Rise
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 26 Total United States monetary reserves, swollen by the first allocation of Special Drawing Rights, rose by $432million in January, the Treasury and Fed eral Reserve Board reported today.

title: Meredith Maher Will Wed in April
description: MANHASSET, L. I., Feb. 26  Miss Meredith Walsh Maher and Dennis Patrick Brosnan will be married April 25 in St. Mary's Roman Catholic Church in Roslyn.

title: Chain Stores Post Gain Over' 69 Month
description: Chain stores and catalogue houses continued to show siz able sales gains in January compared with the year before, according to a survey by The New York Times yesterday.

title: SUNS SINK PISTONS AS HAWKINS STARS
description: DETROIT, Feb. 26 (UPI) Connie Hawkins scored 33 points as the Phoenix Suns de feated the Detroit Pistons, 131 123, tonight. The Suns out scored their opponents, 249, in the second quarter.

title: India Charges U.S. Centers With Undesirable Activities
description: NEW DELHI, Feb. 26The Government indirectly accused the United States today of hav ing used its cultural centers in India for undesirable political activities.

title: A Bitter Swoboda Signs With Mets for $40,000 for the Good of the Team
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., Feb. 26The New York Mets solved their final holdout today when Ron Swoboda signed a $40,000 contract for 1970.

title: AntiU.S. Demonstrators in Manila Throw Firebombs
description: MANILA, Feb. 26Groups of young men roamed through Manila tonight hurling rocks and firebombs after riot police men charged into and dispersed a throng demonstrating in front of the United States Embassy.

title: College Coach Joins Falcons
description: ATLANTA, Feb. 26 (UPI) Hornsby Howell, head football coach at North Carolina A. & T., was named an Atlanta Fal cons' scout today.

title: Bank Data Published
description: Easier money, which Wall Street is convinced lies just around the corner, was no where to be found during the last two weeks, banking data published yesterday showed.

title: Intercity Truck Tonnage Down 0.8% From '69 Level
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 26In tercity truck tonnage in the week ended Feb. 21 was 0.8 per cent below the volume in the corresponding week of last year.

title: Dubliners to Give Behan Play Here
description: The dramatization of Bren dan Behan's recollections of his prison years, Borstal Boy, will have its Ameri can premiere Tuesday, March 31, at the Lyceum Theater.

title: BIG BOARD PRICES STAGE A RETREAT
description: Stock prices retreated mod erately yesterday after their ex plosive rally, late Wednesday that gave the market its best advance of 1970.

title: PX System: One of Most Powerful and Least Visible Retailing Enterprises
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 26A Government agency operating with an aggressive and largely unfettered management has built an obscure string of stores into one of the largest, most powerful and least visible re tail enterprises in the world.

title: LRVITT CRITICIZES STATE LOAN POLICY
description: ALBANY, Feb. 26Control ler Arthur Levitt, documenting that millions of dollars in state loans to public authorities are never repaid, urged the Legis lature today to pass stricter laws to safeguard the funds of the state and its taxpayers.

title: Petunia Beats Devilish Angel by Three Lengths in Hialeah Sprint
description: Petunia Beats Devilish Angel by Three Lengths in Hialeah Sprint

title: MILLS CLEARS WAY FOR A HOUSE VOTE ON WELFARE PLAN
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 26 President Nixon's program to replace much of the welfare system with income mainte nance for the poor was tenta tively approved today by the House Ways and Means Com mittee.

title: Pompidou in San Francisco
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Feb. 26 (Reuters)President Pompidou arrived by air tonight. The plane landed shortly after some 2,000 demonstrators staged an orderly protest here against French plociy in the Middle East.

title: A.B.C. IS DROPPING 9 SHOWS IN FALL
description: The American Broadcasting Company has canceled nine programs and will bring in 11 new ones next season, it was learned yesterday. Industry sources reported that the net work's 197071 schedule has been completed except for one or two slots on Friday.

title: Chicago Derby Scheduled
description: CHICAGO, Feb. 26 (UPI) Balmoral Park announced to day it would present the $125, 000added Chicago Derby for 3yearolds on May 23, one week after the Preakness. The race will be run at Washington Park.

title: Organizers of Venice Biennale Plan Wide Innovations for '70
description: ROME, Feb. 26Theatened by a mass boycott of Italy's most influential cultural figures, the organizers of the Venice Biennale announced yesterday that its 1970 edition would be bigger, longer and more innova tory than ever. Most details of its actual program, however, still remain to be worked out, they said.

title: Broncos Sign Cornerback
description: DENVER, Feb. 26 (AP)The Denver Broncos announced to day the signing of their 13th round draft choice, Jim McCoy, a 175pound cornerback from Parsons College in Iowa.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: ASHE, RICHEY SCORE IN MACON TOURNEY
description: MACON, Ga., Feb. 26 (UPI) Arthur Ashe and Cliff Richey advanced to the quarterfinals of the Macon international ten nis tournament today, but the two topseeded foreign players and Clark Graebner were elim inated.

title: Violence Continues on Buffalo Campus
description: BUFFALO, Feb. 26About 100 students briefly invaded the Administration Building of the State University here to night, smashing windows and setting a small fire.

title: GRAIN FUTURES SHOW A DECLINE
description: Grain futures on the Chicago Board of Trade were mostly lower yesterday in moderate dealings.

title: City Urged to Restore Fund for School in Harlem
description: City officials were urged yes terday by the principal, teach ers and students of a Harlem high school with a major drug problem to restore $5.7million to the capital budget for a comprehensive high school in Harlem to prepare students for college or train them for a voca tion of their choice.

title: De la Renta's First Designs for Men
description: IN EVERY women's de signer, apparently, there's a men's tailor yearning to emerge. Now it's Oscar de la Renta, whose name on Seventh Avenue conjures up ruffles and low decolletages and all those things feminine girls are made of.

title: Preview on Sunday At Magic Theater
description: A preview of the Magic Theater, an exhibition of electrical environments de signed by eight artists, has been arranged for Sunday at Automation House, 49 East 68th Street. The event, a benefit for the Museum of Contemporary Crafts of the American Crafts Council, also will open the building as the new home of the American Foundation on Automation and Employment.

title: 90 in Ocean Hill Schools Reading 33 Times Faster
description: Ninety fifthgraders in the Ocean HillBrownsville dem onstration school district in Brooklyn who underwent an intensive reading course over the last three months have surpassed the national norm, according to the course's sponsors.

title: ELLIOTT OPPOSES LUXURY REZONING
description: Donald H. Elliott, chairman of the City Planning Commis sion, said yesterday that I disagree strongly with most of the proposals advanced by a housing expert to encourage construction of luxury housing.

title: Hughes Gets Party Post
description: TRENTON, Feb. 26Former Gov. Richard J. Hughes was named by the New Jersey State Democratic Committee tonight to succeed David T. Wilentz as a Democratic national commit te??man. The appointment was a??ounced by Salvatore A. Bon te??po, the state party chair man, following a committee meeting at which Mr. Wilentz was given a framed citation for his ?? year of service to the party.

title: 3 MIG's Claimed By Israeli Pilots; Egypt Denies Loss
description: JERUSALEM, Feb. 26 The Israelis reported that their jets shot down three Egyptian MIG21 intercep tors today in what appeared to be Cairo's strongest ef fort to counter Israel's two monthold policy of Nile Delta raids.

title: SERIES LEAD HELD BY BRITISH YACHT
description: ADELAIDE, Australia, Feb. 26 (AP)The defending cham pion, Rodney Pattison of Brit ain, sailed Superdocious into the lead over another British craft, Hucklebuck N, today in the Flying Dutchman yachting world championship.

title: ISRAEL KRAMER
description: LONG BEACH, L. I., Feb. 26 Israel Kramer, a retired land developer, died Tuesday while vacationing in Miami Beach. He was 83 years old and lived at Shore Road.

title: Bradley Fischman to Marry Cynthia Joy Gardstein in June
description: Dr. and Mrs. Henry F. Gardstein of New York and Lido Beach, L. I., have an nounced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Cynthia Joy Gardstein, to Bradley Miles Fischman, son of Mrs. Irving Goldblatt of Brooklyn and the late Louis. H. 0. Fishman.

title: Conservationists Seek to Counter Ads
description: An influential group of con servationists, called Friends of the Earth, have demanded free television time to counteract advertisements for high powered cars and leaded gaso lines, which they charge are despoiling the environment.

title: Liberalized Abortion Law Voted by Arizona House
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., Feb. 26 (UPI)  A bill lifting all re strictions against abortions per formed by licensed physicians was approved by the Arizona House today and sent to the Senate.

title: Abram Sees Effort By Rivals to Balk His Race for Senate
description: Morris B. Abram brushed off attacks on his eligibility to run for the United States Sen ate from New York with a charge yesterday that other contenders were maneuvering to keep me out of the race.

title: Foreign Affairs: How Berlin Was Eclipsed
description: WASHINGTONOf all prob lems bequeathed by the 1939 1945 war, the least necessary and the most puzzling is surely Berlin which, small as it is, like Tennyson's Flower in the Crannied Wall, symbolizes much more.

title: Slide Destroys 7 Acres Of Alsatian Vineyards
description: RIQUEWIHR, France, Feb. 26 (Reuters)  More than seven acres of fine French vineyards were wiped out near this vil lage in Alsace today when heavy and prolonged flooding set off a large landslide.

title: Store Sales Reported
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 26The Commerce Department today estimated last week's depart ment store sales at $568million, up 4 per cent from the year earlier $548million. Total re tail store sales last week were about $6,070,000,000, down 2 per cent from $6,198,000,000.

title: Advertising: Lennen & Newell Buys Geyer
description: Lennen & Newell, the country's 17th largest agen cy, has acquired Geyer Oswald, which ranks 48th.

title: Music: From St. Louis
description: TWENTIETHCENTURY Czech music, Janacek aside, is a bit of a mystery. We do not hear much of it, and yet the Bohemian fields and forests have spawned many composers since the death of Dvorak in 1904. Most of them are only names to American audiences.

title: Nothing Small About the Stage At Jersey Show: It's an Ocean
description: IF YOU'VE seen one boat show, you've seen them all. Not so, says Gerry Gasque, the director of the 17th annual Jersey Coast Boat Show. Although we may not have as many boats as the New York show, we have boats they didn't have, some boats they couldn't.

title: Kienast Quintuplets Remain Well
description: The Kienast quintuplets, born Tuesday night six weeks before term, were taken off their special oxy genenriched air yesterday at the Columbia Presbyterian Medical Center.

title: Vietnam Casualties
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 26 (UPI) The Defense Department to day issued the names of the following Army men from the New York area as having been killed in Vietnam: MARTIN, Dennis P., Pfc., Swedes boro, N. J. PALLADINO, Thomas A., Pfc., East Patchogue, L. J.

title: Haitian Exile Sentenced
description: MIAMI, Feb. 26Ren Len of St. Albans, N. Y, a Haitian exile revolutionary who piloted a plane that dropped fire bombs on the home of Preci dent Francois Duvalier of Haiti last year, was sentenced today to three years' imprisonment on charges of violating United States neutrality laws.

title: Dining In? Pork Dish Suggested
description: IN the menus below, dishes marked with an asterisk are followed by a recipe.

title: SAMUEL I. LEVINE
description: Samuel I. Levine, a lawyer with offices at 1440 Broadway, wno specialized in real estate, died Wednesday in Miami, after a long illness. He was 72 years old and lived at 9960 63d 116ad, Forest Hills, Queens.

title: O'Brien Turns Down Chairmanship of Democrats
description: WASHINGTON, Feb.. 26 Lawrence F. O'Brien turned clown today a plea from former Vice President Hubert H. Hum phrey that he resume the chairmanship of the troubled Democratic party.

title: In Memoriam
description: GREENBERGHerman. Happy Anniversary MY Lover, My Life, My Heart, My Soul. ESSIE.

title: Arthur Miller, Judith Anderson Planning Bridal
description: AVON, Conn., Feb. 26 Second Lieut. Judith Carol Anderson, an Air Force flight nurse, and First Lieut. Arthur Reid Miller, a fighter pilot, will be married April 11.

title: VIETNAM MURDERS LAID TO 5 MARINES
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Feb. 26Five United States ma rines have been arrested and charged with murdering 11 South Vietnamese women and 5 children on Feb. 19, the Marine Corps command an nounced today.

title: ARMY ENDS WATCH ON CIVIL PROTESTS
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 26 (UPI) The Army will no longer keep tabs on peaceful demon strations or publish a list of individuals who might be in volved in a riot, the chairman of the House Invasion of Pri vacy Subcommittee announced today.

title: Future of B.B.C. Is Debated in Britain
description: LONDON, Feb. 26Be neath bronze statues and towering stained glass win dows, the House of Lords opened a solemn debate yes terday over the British Broad casting Corporation's plans for rock and Bach.

title: Nixon and Pompidou Fail to Agree on the Mideast
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 26  United States officials said to day that three day of French American discussions during President Pompidou's stay here had not reduced signifi cantly the differences between the two Governments over Mid dle East policies.

title: Shipping Association Votes Change in Assessment Basis
description: Member companies of the New York Shipping Associa tion, by a vote of 58 to 3, have approved a resolution changing the basis for member assess ments to pay for fringe bene fits for longshoremen.

title: Bonn Expanding Effort to Spur Worker Savings
description: BONN, Feb. 26The Cabinet of Willy Brandt, the Social Democratic Chancellor, fulfilled one of his fundamental cam paign promises today by ap proving a bill designed to give factory workers the opportun ity to increase their assets.

title: GIACOMETTI SETS AUCTION RECORD
description: A new record at auction for a work by Alberto Giacometti, the Swissborn sculptor who earned worldwide eminence be fore his death in 1965, was posted here last night with the sale of Femme de Venise, I for $150,000.

title: Article 3  No Title
BLEINER, AUSTRIA, AHEAD IN SLALOM
description: VANCOUVER, British Colum bia, Feb. 26 (UPI)Werner Bleiner of Austria posted the best time in the first run of the men's giant slalom today as Canada's fourday World Cup meet opened on Grouse Moun tain.

title: A SEVERE DROUGHT REPORTED IN CHINA
description: HONG KONG, Feb. 26 (AP) A drought that could severely damage China's spring wheat harvest is reported to have spread through four major provinces.

title: TENNECO IS BUYING A PAPER COMPANY
description: Tenneco, Inc., announced yes. terday that its subsidiary, Packaging Corporation of America, had acquired full ownership of the Tennessee River Pulp & Paper Company.

title: President of Dreyfus Fund Is Given Chairman's Office
description: The Dreyfus Fund announced yesterday that Howard Stein, Who has been president had been given the additional office, of chairman. He succeeds Jack J. Dreyfus Jr., who has retired to devote more time to the Dreyfus Medical Foundation.

title: Vietcong Chief Delegate Is Boycotting Paris Talk
description: PARIS, Feb. 26  The Viet cong delegation to the peace talks indicated today that its chief representative, Mrs. Ngu yen Thi Birth, had decided to join the chief North Vietna mese delegate in boycotting the sessions.

title: $250Million Goal Is Set for Sale of Israel Bonds
description: MIAMI BEACH, Feb. 26 American Jewish leaders adopt ed today a goal of $250million for the sale of Israel Bonds this year to provide increased economic aid for Israel.

title: Ski Racing Is No Circus, Bearded Ladies Warned
description: STOCKHOLM, Feb. 26 (AP) Organizers of the Valsalop pet crosscountry ski race for men ordered a close check of competitors' beards before the annual event this week end.

title: Ghana to Cut Back Missions
description: ACCRA, Ghana, Feb. 26 (AP) Ghana is to make a further cutback in the number of its diplomatic missions abroad from 44 to 37, External Affairs Minister Victor Owusu said to day. He said the move was for economic reasons.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Bostwick and Scott Reach Semifinals in Court Tennis
description: Members of the New York Racquet and Tennis Club gained the four semifinal berths yes terday in the national court tennis singles tournament.

title: African Dust Suspected As a Hurricane Factor
description: HOUSTON, Feb. 26A little bit of Africa, reddish dust whipped up by storms over the Sahara Desert and borne by trade winds across the Atlantic Ocean, regularly reaches the West Indies in such atmos pheric concentrations that sci entists suspect it may contrib ute to the cause of hurricanes.

title: KOERNER'S FILLY WINS 2D STRAIGHT
Variety of Corporations Report Statistics on Their Sales and Earnings
ROMNEY SELECTS HOUSING DESIGNS
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 26 George Romney, Secretary of Housing and Urban Develop ment, unveiled today 22 build ing designs selected as part of his department's effort to meet what he called the na tion's increasingly desperate housing shortage.

title: April Trip to Arctic by S.S. Manhattan Expected
description: The S.S. Manhattan, the first commercial vessel to transit the Northwest Pas sage, is expected to leave April 1 for a second series of tests to determine the economic feasibility of trans porting Alaskan oil to East Coast markets by ship.

title: Nuptials in May For Mary Akin
description: Miss Mary Akin, a person nel associate with the Mc Cann  Erickson Advertising Agency, and Carl Phillip Hor ton, an executive with the Oldsmobile division of Gen eral Motors here, plan to be married in May.

title: Leary to Move 200 Police To Unit Fighting Narcotics
description: Police Commissioner Howard R. Leary is planning to shift 200 men from gamblinglaw en forcement to antinarcotics work in an effort to relieve the cri ses proportions of the city's drug problem.

title: Amer. Basketball Ass'n
description: LAST NIGHT'S GAME

title: Massachusetts Vote Barred
description: BOSTON, Feb. 25 (AP)The Massachusetts legislature, in a joint constitutional convention killed Wednesday a bill for a referendum on a constitutional amendment to reduce the mem bership of the House from 240 to 100 members.

title: Denis M. Hurley New Head Of Brooklyn Public Library
description: Denis M. Hurley and Mrs. Minneola P. Ingersoll have been elected president and secretary, respectively, of the Brooklyn Public Library. The voting, by the library's board of trustees, also reelected Jay Sam Unger as vice president and H. Elliot Wales, treasurer.

title: MORTON ROTH
description: Morton Roth, a lawyer who specialized in real estate and was coauthor, with Milton M. Bergerman, of Annotated New York Realty Forms, died yes terday of a heart ailment in New York Hospital. He was 66 years old and lived at 505 East 79th Street. His office was at 295 Madison Avenue.

title: Saigon Deputy Seized in Assembly
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Feb. 26National policemen seized Representative Tran Ngoc Chau in his sanctuary in the National Assembly to day and dragged him strug gling out of the rear gate to begin a 20year prison sen tence on charges of pro Communist activity. The po lice raid, watched by hun dreds of South Vietnamese spectators who had been expecting it, ended a four day sitin in the National As sembly by the 46yearold deputy, who accused President Nguyen Van Thieu of having acted unconstitutionally to bring his prosecution.

title: An Unfazed Educator
description: IRVING ANKER, whom an associate describes as a sort of answer man to any question anybody's got about the city's school system, was asked by a visitor yes terday how much money he would receive in his new job as Acting Superinendent of Schools. I don't know, he said. Come Mon day, when he starts his new job, Mr. Anker will be earning $48,000 a year, $13,000 a year more than his present position as an assistant su perintendent. But money does not appear to faze him. Nei ther do the publicity, power, excitement and headaches that are attached to his new job as chief administrator of the city's 900 public schools.

title: Washington: The Hidden War in Laos
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 26In his definitive foreign policy speech of last Nov. 3, President Nixon said: I believe that one of the reasons for the deep division about Vietnam is that many Americans have lost con fidence in what the Govern ment has told them about our policy. The American people cannot and should not be asked to support a policy which in volves the overriding issues of war and peace unless they know the truth about that policy.

title: SUBSTANCE LINKED TO CANCER SPREAD
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 26A substance has been found in cancer tissue that makes cells grow wildly, without discipline.

title: JAY H. CONNAWAY, ARTIST, 77, DIES
description: Jay Hall Connaway, a well known marine and landscape artist, died Feb. 17 in Green Valley, Ariz. He was 77 years old.

title: PLENTY OLD POSTS COAST RACE UPSET
description: ARCADIA, Calif., Feb. 26 (UPI)Plenty Old scored a ma jor upset at Santa Anita today when he captured the $30,550 San Jacinto Stakes for 3year olds by a nose over the heavily favored George Lewis.

title: Ship Crash Spreads Oil in Florida
description: JACKSONVILLE, Fla., Feb. 26 (AP)A freighter plowed into an oilfilled barge to night, sending a banktobank black mass rolling down the St. Johns River.

title: Market Summary
description: Thursday, Feb. 26, 1970

title: The Screen
description: LET the lexicographers grapple with Muhair, which began heating the Ri alto and the TransLux 85th Street Theaters yesterday. If the title of this brightly colored, spicy slice of spe cialized Argentine amor is a Spanish distortion of mujer (woman), it precisely covers spectacular ground. It brings back, in full nude view, Isabel Sarli, who is ob viously much woman and hardly an actress in any lan guage, in a rickety romance as foolish as Fuego, in which she titillated the Ri alto's customers last fall.

title: 70% Increase in Hospital Costs Is Predicted in 5 Years
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 26  Hospital charges will rise about 70 per cent in the next five years, Senators investigating soaring medical costs were told today by the Social Security Administration's chief actuary.

title: Article 1  No Title
Thai Sweep Border Areas
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Feb. 26 (Reuters)  Thai troops have stepped up their sweeps in northern border areas as part of a full alert ordered yester day following the North Viet namese thrust in Laos, official sources said today.

title: Davis P. Harding of Yale Dies; English Literature Expert, 55
description: NEW HAVEN, Feb. 26Davis P. Harding, an associate pro fessor of English at Yale Uni versity, died Tuesday in Yale New Haven Hospital. He was 55 years old and lived at 65 Spring Garden Street in Ham den.

title: Governor Weighs Use of Fact Finding In Cemetery Strike
description: I Governor Rockefeller, declar ing himself deeply disturbed by the cemetery workers' re jection of arbitration in their dispute with 44 New York area cemeteries, moved yesterday to invoke the factfinding ma chinery of the State Labor Law.

title: Dining Out In Setting Of Books
description: A selective list of restau rants in New York and vicin ity is given on this page on Friday. The restaurants are rated four stars to none, based on the relationship of food and service to cost. Credit cards are honored in the restaurants where it is indicated.

title: Abbado Conducts The Philharmonic In Austrian Works
description: Claudio Abbado, currently guest conductor of the New York Philharmonic, led an un commonly interesting program in Philharmonic Hall last night. It might have been called Three Centuries of Austrian Composers, since Mozart, Bruckner and Alban Berg were represented, but this would be meaningless. The three works performed had nothing in com mon and could suggest no ele ments of continuous tradition.

title: The Tallahassee Transaction
description: The extraordinary anguish among law school faculty members and leading lawyers over the nomination of Judge G. Harrold Carswell to the Supreme Court should alert every Senator to consider his responsibility to country and Constitution.

title: Urges Liberal Policies
description: BRUSSELS, Feb. 26 (Reuters)  The Common Market's ex ecutive commission assailed re strictive trends in the trade policy of the United States in a document issued today and said world trade would suffer if a liberal policy were abandoned.

title: Horses Decrease in Norway
description: OSLO, Norway (UPI) The number of horses on Norwegian farms has dropped 60 per cent in thelast 10 years to a total of 40,000, according to the Norwe gian Horseowners Organization.

title: President Is Selected At Crown Zellerbach
description: The election of Charles Raymond Dahl as president and chief executive officer of the Crown Zellerbach Corpo ration was announced yester day by Peter T. Sinclair, chairman of the San Fran ciscobased forestproducts company. He succeeds the late Francis O. Boylon, who died last week.

title: Militants Lecture the BigSix Mayors
description: ROCHESTER, Feb. 26  A black and Puerto Rican sitin prevented the state's BigSix Mayors, including New York's John Lindsay, from taking their seats on the speakers' platform for more than 20 min utes at a community forum on urban problems here today.

title: 387 Applicants Pass the State Bar Examination
description: ALBANY, Feb. 26The State Board of Law Examiners an nounced today that 387 appli cants to the New York State Bar had passed the examina tion held on Dec. 10 and 11. A total of 640 persons took the test.

title: Polly P. Bullock Planning Bridal
description: NORTH GRAFTON, Mass., Feb. 26Mr. and Mrs. Au gustus George Bullock of North Grafton and James town, R. I., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Polly Prim rose Bullock to Durban Alex ander McGraw Jr., son of Mrs. Joseph Paterno of Oster vine, Mass., and Mr. McGraw of Osterville. The wedding is planned for June in James town.

title: NANCY RICHEY LEADS WOMEN'S ADVANCE
description: WINCHESTER, Mass., Feb. 26 (AP)Nancy Richey of San An gelo, Tex., and Mrs. Mary Ann Eisel Curtis of St. Louis did not lose a game tonight as they led the advance of five seeded Americans into the quarter fi nals of the National indoor women's tennis championships.

title: Humble Will Build Mine
description: HOUSTON, Feb. 26 (UPI) The Humble Oil and Refining Company, the chief subsidiary of the Standard Oil Company (New Jersey), announced today it would build a uranium mine near Douglas, Wyo. The mine will produce 2,000 tons of ore daily when completed in 1973, the company said.

title: ALLEN KANDER, 81, NEWSPAPER AIDE
description: Allen Kander, a newspaper broker and consultant here for 42 years and a former Hearst newspaper executive, died Tuesday of a heart ailment in Miami Beach, Fla. He was 81 years old and lived in New York and Miami Beach.

title: KIMBERLYCLARK TO WIDEN OUTPUT
description: The KimberlyClark Corpo ration is planning a major ex pansion of its nonwoven fabric manufacturing operations, offi dais of the paper company said here yesterday.

title: Canadian '69 G.N.P. Rose 9.3% Despite Strike Loss
description: OTTAWA, Feb. 26 (Canadian Press)Canada produced $78, 099,000,000 in goods and serv ices last year, a 9.3 per cent increase in the Gross National Product, despite a record loss of production because of labor disputes, the Dominion Bureau of Statistics renorted today.

title: Books of The Times
description: DAVID HACKETT FISCHER, a young historian who teaches at Brandeis University, holds the somewhat un fashionable view first, that there is a tacit logic of historical thought; second, that this logic can be raised to the level of awareness, and third, that historical thinking itself can be refined by its intel ligent and purposeful application. With these premises in mind, Mr. Fischer has compiled a long list of logical fallacies that threaten the working historian. He has done so, not in a destructive spirit, but rather as if he were mapping the route from New York to Boston, and wished to point out where travelers have frequently wandered astray.

title: Bruins Whip Rangers, 53, and Trail East's Leaders by 2 Points
description: BOSTON, Feb. 26The Bruins won their biggeft game of the season tonight, stopping the Rangers, 53, as they muscled their way past a weakened de fense and forwards who got slapped around.

title: STEPHEN BELL GIVES GUITAR RECITAL HERE
description: Stephen Bell, who made what the program said was his for mal New York debut last night at Carnegie Recital Hall, proved not to be ready for so auspi cious an event.

title: MISS HELLMAN LOSES LITTLE FOXES PLEA
description: ALBANY, Feb. 26 (AP) Lillian Hellman was turned down today by New York's highest court in her $500,000 suit against the Columbia Broadcasting System for tele vising the movie The Little Foxes.

title: Court in Indiana Orders Jailing of State Auditor
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Id., Feb. 26 (AP)The Indiana Appel Iate Court found the State Auditor, Trudy Etherton, in contempt today and commit ted her to the Marion County jail for an indefinite period.

title: 9th Tax Aide Since Jan. 23 Charged With BribeTaking
description: An Internal Revenue Service agent arrested on bribery charges yesterday became the ninth former or present tax of ficial who has been arraigned since Jan. 23 for taking bribes.

title: Soviet Publishes Letters by Jews Assailing Israel
description: MOSCOW, Feb. 26The So viet Union appeared to inten sify its campaign against Israel today with the publication of letters from Soviet Jews con demning Israel and Zionism.

title: Federation of Pilots Asks Parley on Airliner Attacks
description: LONDON, Feb. 26The In ternational Federation of Air line Pilots called today for an emergency conference on air safety.

title: PRESIDENT URGES FEDERAL REFORM
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 26 President Nixon sent to Con gress today a special message seeking assistance in his effort to eliminate or reorganize 57 Government programs at an ultimate annual saving of more than $2billion.

title: Big Board Seat Price Off
description: The New York Stock Ex change reported yesterday the sale of a membership for $265, 000, down $10,000 from the previous sale Feb. 17. The cur rent price of a seat on the N.Y.S.E. is $260,000 bid, $300, 000 asked.

title: LFC IS EXPECTING A LOSS FOR 1969
description: The LFC Financial Corpora tion, a billiondollar savings and loan holding company list ed on the New York Stock Ex change, announced yesterday that it expected to report a net loss for 1969 as a result of losses that it had uncovered in its portfolio of loans and real estate.

title: Dr. Mead Backs Abortions
description: BOSTON, Feb. 26 (AP)Dr. Margaret Mead says she would repeal all abortion laws and give the responsibility to the church and the medical profes sion. The anthropologist said yesterday that all laws against abortion in the United States should be repealed simultane ously, so no one state would be swamped with abortion re quests.

title: Joanne Gaffney, Robert Bennett To Be Married
description: Mr. and Mrs. Arthur Thomas Gaffney of Douglas ton, Queens, have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Joanne Gaff ney, to. Robert Sanford Ben nett, son of Dr. and Mrs. Robert Edward, Bennett of Worcester, Mass.

title: Captain Leaves Hospital
description: FORT BRAGG, N. C., Feb. 26 (AP)  Capt. Jeffrey MacDon ald of the Army, whose wife and two daughters were slain last week in their home, was released this morning from Womack Army Hospital. The captain, 26 years old, suffered a knife wound in the chest and other less serious injuries in the attack, which he said was conducted by three men and a girl.

title: SACRAMENTS PLAN STIRS GREEK CHURCH
description: ATHENS, Feb. 26The Holy Synod of the Orthodox Church of Greece today criticized the Russian Orthodox Church's de cision to administer its sacra ments to Roman Catholics.

title: Civil Suit of Panther Leader Dismissed by Federal Judge
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Feb. 26 (AP)A civil suit by David Hil liard, a Black Panther leader, challenging the constitutional ity of the law banning threats on the President's life, was dis missed today by United States District Court Judge Alfonso J. Zirpoli.

title: EMMA HARRISON, EXTIMES WRITER
description: Emma Harrison, a former re porter for The New York Times who won a number of awards for her coverage of mental health news, died last night after a long illness. She was 48 years old and lived at 477 Franklin Delano Roosevelt Drive.

title: PRICES IN LONDON DRIFT DOWN AGAIN
description: Prices on the London stock market drifted lower again yes terday on lack of interest. Mar ket indexes slipped to lows for the year.

title: Volpe Will Weigh A Boston Artery He Once Sought
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 26 Secretary of Transportation John A. Volpesaid today that he was willing to reconsider the need for the central link in Boston'sdowntown freeway system  a project he had championed for most of a decade as Governor of Massa chusetts.

title: PREAKNESS DRAWS 158 NOMINATIONS
description: BALTIMORE, Feb. 26 (AP)  Silent Screen, the 2yearold champion of 1969, heads a list of 158 nominees for the 95th running of the Preakness Stakes at Pimlico race course on May 16.

title: Chemical Bank Appoints Executive Vice President
description: The Chemical Bank an nounced yesterday the appoint ment of George W. Cox Jr., senior vice president in charge of the credit division, as an executive vice president.

title: U.S. REPORTS DROP IN BATTLE DEATHS
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Feb. 26 (AP)  The United States Command's weekly casualty report today said 83 Americans were killed in action last week and 657 were wounded. The week before, 96 dead and 589 wounded were reported.

title: Illinois Street Gang Chief Sentenced to Die for Murder
description: CHICAGO, Feb. 26 (AP)A young leader of the Blackstone Rangers street gang, convicted of murdering a police radio dispatcher in a raid on police headquarters in suburban East Chicago Heights, was sentenced today to die in the electric chair.

title: Authority Focused
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 26 Arthur F. Burns has begun to leave his imprint on the Federal Reserve Board.

title: Nat'l Hockey League
description: LAST NIGHT'S GAMES

title: PLAYERS TO HEAR PROGRESS REPORT
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., Feb. 26  A meeting of the major league player representa tives at Miami tomorrow may determine the nature and the extent of labor peace on the baseball front for months ahead.

title: Roosevelt Entries
Corporate Slate Heavy
description: Bond prices staged another broad advance yesterday, spurred by the growing convic tion that some relaxation of credit is imminent  or al ready under way.

title: Canadian Bill Rate Drops
description: OTTAWA, Feb. 26 (Canadian Press)  New 91day Govern ment of Canada Treasury bills auctioned today: $140million at an average price and yield of 98.14 and 7.6 per cent. Last week, same amount and terms, 98.126 and 7.66 per cent. 182 day: $35million at 96.367 and 7.56 per cent. Last week, same tmount and term, 96.328 and 7,64 per cent.

title: Abbado to Replace Szell
description: Claudio Abbado will replace George Szell as conductor of the New York Philharmonic Pension Fund Benefit Concert to be given at Philharmonic Hall on Tuesday.

title: Oil Fire Fight Delayed
description: NEW ORLEANS, Feb. 26 (UPI)Windy weather delayed today attempts to put out a fire that erupted 17 days ago on an offshore oil rig. An In terior Department spokesman said it appeared that a new ef fort to stop the blaze on the Chevron Oil Company facility would not be made until Sat urday.

title: Theater: Georgy Goes to Broadway
description: WHATEVER it is that is wrong with Georgy? the new musical that opened last night at the Winter Gar den Theater, is wrong for too long. It has some good performances, a brightly lit erate book, a few charac terizations of a depth un usual in a musical. But it never takes off, never flies, never whirls you in the air With that special happiness.

title: Experts to Study Ruins Linked to Ark
description: WASHINGTON, Feb, 26 After years of scientific scof fing at reports that remains of a massive wooden struc ture lie collapsed beneath a glacier on Mount Ararat, a prestigious research organi zation has, at least in part, been won over.

title: Addict, 12, Tells Inquiry of Mainlining
description: A 12yearold narcotics ad dict who said that he took his last fix eight days ago shocked a hearing on drug addiction yesterday when he told legislators how he had become addicted.

title: Teachers Resume Talks in Jersey City
description: JERSEY CITY, Feb. 26 Negotiations in the teachers' strike here, stalled since before the walkout on Feb. 9, resumed tonight while teachers in New ark reported for work after set tlement of a 23day stoppage there.

title: Flight From the Campus
description: Morris B. Abram and Edwin D. Etherington are able men, and if elected, they will doubtless make good Senators. But had they not resigned from the presi dency of Brandeis and of Wesleyan to enter respec tively the Democratic and Republican Senatorial races in New York and Connecticut, they would almost surely have become important academic leaders. Be yond specific regrets over the loss to their own cam puses, their hasty departure raises the question: are these political trips really necessary?

title: Sports of The Times
description: EVEN now there seems to be an ele ment of unreality to the recollec tion, almost as if it never could have happened. But it did. Inconceivable though it may seem today, New York University once produced a football team that ranked annually among the nation's collegiate powerhouses. Although N.Y.U. did not win recognition as national champion, it never was far from the top and the virulent Violet performed with such spectacular eclat that it became the best show in town, regularly attracting overflow crowds of 70,000 to the Yankee Stadium.

title: COMPOSITE INDEX OF ECONOMY DIPS
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 26 The Government's index of leading indicators of the economy took a sharp drop in January and industrial whole sale prices showed a smaller increase in February than in other recent months, two re ports disclosed today.

title: Crew's Families Visit Leonardo Here
description: Ordinarily, life aboard a passenger liner in port for a fourday stay between cruises is boredom and somnolence.

title: SENATE PANEL BACKS A CREDIT CARD CURB
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 26 (AP) The Senate Banking Commit tee approved today a bill to ban distribution of unsolicited credit cards.

title: 50 Craft Glisten in Waters of Channel and 120 Pounds of Mackerel Appear
description: MARATHON, Fla.  More than 50 craft of the kingfish fleet, sportfishermen all, gleamed in the bright green water of Hawk Chan nel by midmorning.

title: Letters to the Editor of The Times
description: It is hard to speak of the Chicago trial with anything but bitterness.

title: Soviet Urges Security Talks
description: BERLIN, Feb. 26 (UPI)  Foreign Minister Andrei A. Gromyko of the Soviet Union called today for the convening of a European security confer ence as quickly as possible. In a speech in an East Berlin machinetool factory, he said that safeguarding of peace was the most important task facing all governments, A.D.N., the Fact Germany press agency, ??

title: SCHOOL BILL CURB BACKED IN SENATE
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 26 The Senate Appropriations Committee approved today a new health and education ap propriation bill containing a Republican spending limitation that may avert another Presi dential veto.

title: A.A.U. Competition to Begin at Noon in Garden
description: In 1965, the Amateur Ath letic Union held its national indoor track and field cham pionships at Madison Square Garden.

title: Davidson Conquers V.M.I. Five, 7246, In Conference Play
description: CHARLOTTE, N. C., Feb. 26  Davidson's topseeded de fending champion, playing without its top scorer Bryan Adrian, routed Virginia Mili tary Institute, 7246, tonight in the opening round of the Southern Conference basket ball championship tourna ment.

title: Brigid Brophy Puns in Response to Questionnaire
description: Brigid Brophy, the Irish author who lives in London, did not come to New York for the publication of her recent book In Transit.

title: Miss Pamela Sullivan Betrothed
description: Miss Pamela Morgan Sul livan, a researcher with the American Petroleum Insti tute, and William Curtis Liv ingston 3d, an arbitrage analyst and administrative assistant at Bache & Co., plan to marry on April 4.

title: Bendix Elects a Director; Expects 1970 Profit Drop
description: The Bendix Corporation yes terday elected Christian M. Car din to its board of directors. He is president of the Paribas Cor poration. His election was an nounced by Bendix following its annual stockholders' meet ing in Southfield, Mich.

title: Buffalo Five Wins, 7059, As Campus Trouble Wanes
description: BUFFALO, Feb. 26 (AP)  Buffalo, in a basketball game postponed from last night, led all the way today to beat Al bany State, 7059, before an or derly crowd of 1,100 students.

title: CONKLIN OPPOSES BANKSTUDY PLAN
description: ALBANY, Feb. 26  Senator William T. Conklin, chairman of the Joint Legislative Commit tee on Banking Law, rejected today the idea of establishing an independent committee to study revision of bank district lines.

title: Former Law Partner Says Carswell Drafted Charter of WhitesOnly Club
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 26A former law partner of G. Har rold Carswell has disclosed that Mr. Carswell personally pre pared the charter in 1953 for a university booster club that excluded nonwhites from mem bership.

title: Italy Urges France to End Geneva Arms Talk Boycott
description: GENEVA, Feb. 26  Italy appealed to France today to end her eightyear boycott of the Geneva disarmament con ference.

title: BONN SEES A LOSS IN FARM WORKERS
description: BONN, Feb. 26West Ger many's agriculture can expect to lose one million selfem ployed farmers and farmhands to industry by 1980, the Gov einment said today in a report analyzing the longrange pros pects of farming.

title: 13 Black Panthers, Faced With Demand to Behave in Court, Plan to Reply Monday
description: Lawyers for 13 Black Pan thers, whose pretrial hearings here have been halted pending assurance to the judge that the defendants will behave in the courtroom, expect to be back in court Monday with their answer.

title: Opulence and Responsibility
description: The plea of Senator Edmund S. Muskie, a possible Democratic Presidential contender in 1972, for in creased spending for foreign aid should help stimulate public debate on an issue that has been downgraded by politicians of both parties for too long.

title: 3 More Slide Victims Found
description: RECKINGEN, Switzerland, Feb. 26 (Reuters)The bodies of two small children and a Swiss army captain were re covered by rescue workers to day, but 13 more persons were still missing and presumed dead after an avalanche thun dered down on this Alpine vil lage three days ago. The bodies uncovered today brought the confirmed death toll to 16.

title: Upstate Physicist Leads List to Head City College
description: Dr. Robert E. Marshak, the physicist, has emerged as the leading candidate to become the new president of City Col lege.

title: GA. TECH IS LOSER TO JACKSONVILLE
description: ATLANTA, Feb. 26 (AP) Sixthranked Jacksonville pulled away from Georgia Tech in the final eight minutes tonight to defeat the Yellow Jackets, 8681, in a battle of tourna mentbound basketball teams.

title: Ski Conditions
description: The following reports were provided by the ski areas. Mes sages were filed at times indi cated in parentheses.

title: American Goal Given
description: A new United States com mitment to open world markets with measures to halt growing trends toward protectionism and discrimination was pic tured yesterday as the Ad ministration's basic tradepolicy goal.

title: 33,000 in Wall St. To Stagger Hours
description: Staggered working hours to ease rapidtransit strains at peak periods will start April 1 for at least 33,000  and per haps 100,000  employes in the Wall Street financial area, the DowtownLower Manhattan Association announced yester day.

title: Bus Riders Reminded: It's 30c or New Tokens
description: Passengers on cityowned buses were reminded yester day by the Transit Authority that tomorrow is the dead line for the acceptance of the old 20cent tokens as part of the payment of the exact fare on buses.

title: DARTMOUTH PLANS RENEWAL OF M.D.'S
description: Dartmouth College announced yesterday that, after a hiatus of nearly 60 years, its medical school would resume awarding M.D. degrees beginning In 1973.

title: McGrady Sets World Record for 600 Yards
description: Martin McGrady shattered his world indoor record in the 600yard run last night, but bizarre 35minute dispute after the onemile run became the asterisk of the Amateur Ath letic Union national indoor track and field championships.

title: Federal Prosecutor Criticizes the Chicago 7 Defendants and Their Lawyers
description: CHICAGO, Feb. 27 (UPI) The nation's young people are being lost to a freaking fag revolution, the chief prosecu tor in the trial of the Chicago says.

title: Yablonski Jury Recesses
description: CLEVELAND, Feb. 27 (AP) A Federal grand jury investi gating the slaying of Joseph A. Yablonski, United Mine Work ers insurgent, recessed today after hearing from three Ken tucky witnesses. It will begin the fifth week of its investiga tion Tuesday.

title: SORENSEN SPURNS ANY COALITION BID
description: Theodore C. Sorensen, one of four announced Democratic candidates for Senate, informed the New Democratic Coalition yesterday that he was with drawing his name from con sideration for the liberal group's endorsement.

title: Italian Jet Turns Back
description: ROME, Feb. 21 (UPI)The pilot of an Italian Alitalia jet bound for Israel turned back 45 minutes out of Rome to night after an anonymous tel ephone caller had told the air line that there was a bomb aboard the plane. No bomb was found.

title: 2 Trapped in Pittsburgh When 9 Floors Collapse
description: PITTSBURGH, Feb. 27 (UPI) At least two workmen were feared trapped when the top nine floors of a half finished apartment building collapsed today.

title: Million From U.S.See Britain
description: LONDON, Feb. 26 (Reuters) For the first time more than a million Americans visited Britain last year, a 30 per cent increase, the British Toutist Authority said today. Visitors from the United States totaled more than 1,145,000 in a year that set a tourist record in Britain.

title: PRIME RATE NEWS SPURS STOCK RISE
description: The stock market sniffed the magic aroma of lower interest rates yesterday as prices boomed ahead in the nextto strongest session of 1970.

title: 3 U.S. Ambassadors Meet 2 Days in South Vietnam
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Feb. 27 (Reuters)  Three Un ited States Ambassadors from Southeast Asia wound up a twoday meeting here today, a United States Embassy spokes man said.

title: Injured Tiger Is Forced Out Of March 11 Griffith Bout
description: Dick Tiger injured his left shoulder yesterday and with drew from a 10round fight against Emile Griffith scheduled for Madison Square Garden on March 11.

title: Repertory Time for Joiffrey Ballet at City Center
description: It's repertory timefor the momentat the City Center Joffrey Ballet, an occasion that gives oldtimers possible new insights and firsttimers a look at the standards.

title: Royal Wedding in Katmandu: Official Program of Bespangled Processions, Ritual and Pageantry for 9 Days
ABRAHAM KATZ, 70, GARMENT LABOR AIDE
description: Abraham Katz, executive di rector of Affiliated Dress Manu facturers, Inc., since 1954, died yesterday in Polyclinic Hos pital, after an illness of several weeks. He was 70 years old and lived at 63 East Ninth Street.

title: SCHOOL EQUALITY SET AS CRITERION FOR FEDERAL AID
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27 The Office of Education an nounced today that it would require every, school district in the nation to demonstrate that It was putting equal resources into all of its schools before it would be eligible to receive supplementary Federal funds for disadvantaged children.

title: VANDERMEER KIN TO STAY TOGETHER
description: Judge Justine Wise. Polier of Family Court yesterday placed the younger sisters and broth ers of a 12yearold Harlem boy who died last year of heroin poisoning in the tempo rary custody of their mothers, despite efforts by the Social Services Department to have them placed elsewhere.

title: Hicksville G.I. Killed in War
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27 (UPI) The Defense Department an nounced today that Specialist 4 William A. Aldag, of Hicksville, L. I., had been killed in action in Vietnam.

title: E.C.A.C. Basketball
Socialists Rebuff Effort By Rumor to Form Coalition
description: ROME, Feb. 27 (AP)The Italian Socialist party rejected Premier Mariano Rumor's pro posal tonight of a coalition, ap parently ending his hopes for fourway, centerleft Govern ment.

title: SAMUEL F. KANIS
description: JERSEY CITY, Feb. 27 Samuel F. Kanis, a lawyer who ran for United States Repre sentative in the 13th Congres sional District on the Republi can ticket in 1960, died Wed nesday night in Miami. He was 62 years old.

title: New Spacecraft Tested
description: EDWARDS AIR FORCE BASE, Calif., Feb. 27 (UPI)A craft shaped like a flatiron and de signed to fly both in the at mosphere and in space was flown to an altitude of 14.7 mile s in a test today that reached a top speed of 858 miles an hour. The National Aeronautics and space Ad ministration is testing the craft to develop a space ferry that can make the round trip from earth to a space station with out going through a costly splashdown.

title: MARIE DIONNE, 35, DIES IN MONTREAL
description: MONTREAL, Feb. 27 (Cana than Press)Marie Dionne, one of the Dionne quintuplets, died today after a brief illness. She was 35 years old and was the wife of Florian Houle, a court clerk here.

title: Aleutian Quakes Reported
description: AMCHITKA ISLAND, Alaska, Feh. 27 (AP)A moderately strong earthquake occurred early today in the isolated Aleutian Islands off Alaska, it measured 6.0 on the Richter scale, the United States Coast and Geodetic Survey reported.

title: Article 1  No Title
Bullets Beat Hawks, 114107
description: BALTIMORE, Feb. 27 (AP) Jack Marin scored a career high of 41 points, before and after a scuffle with Bill Bridges, and led the Baltimore Bullets to a 114107 victory over the Atlanta Hawks tonight.

title: U.S. Supreme Court To Consider Laws On Bank Mergers
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27 The Supreme Court has agreed to consider for the first time the impact of Federal anti merger statutes upon small banksthose having less than $25million in deposits.

title: TRADING LANGUID FOR 11 NEW ISSUES
description: A Florida realestate devel opment concern stood out in an otherwise lackluster new issue market this week.

title: SAIGON WILL GIVE DEPUTY NEW TRIAL
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Feb. 27 (UPI)  The Govern ment today granted a new trial to Tran Ngoc Chau, a 46 yearold member of South Vietnam's National Assembly who was sentenced Wednesday to 20 years in prison for al leged Communist activity.

title: City to Honor Synagogue
Agency Reassures Savers At LFC's 2 Associations
description: Preston Martin, chairman of the Federal Home Loan Bank Board, said yesterday that his agency contemplates no need for action at this time which would impede normal opera tions of either of the savings and loan associations owned by the LFC Financial Corporation.

title: Wechsler Sworn in Jersey
description: TRENTON, Feb. 27 (AP) Walter Wechsler was sworn in today as State Budget Director replacing Abram M. Vermeulen, who retired. The ceremony took place in the outer office of Gov. William T. Cahill. Chief Justice Joseph Weintraub ad ministered the oath of office.

title: Laird Says It Is Too Early To Set Date to End Draft
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27 (AP) Secretary of Defense Melvin R. Laird told a military audi ence tonight that it was too early to establish a deadline for ending the draft and switch ing to an allvolunteer military force.

title: RICHARD RAPPORT, EXBANKING OFFICIAL
description: WEST HARTFORD, Conn., Feb. 27Richard Rapport, for mer State Bank Commissioner and former vice president of the Hartford National Bank and Trust Company, died yesterday in Winter Park, Fla., at the age of 67.

title: Unruh Files for Governor
description: LOS ANGELES, Feb. 27 (AP) Jess Unruh, the Democratic leader of the State Assembly, paid the $982 filing fee today and officially became a candi date for Governor of Califor nia.

title: POMPIDOU ASSESSES REBELLION OF YOUTH
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Feb. 27 (UPI)President Pompidou of France said today that the worldwide youth revolt was a reflection of a crisis of civili zation.

title: Tension Runs High in Baghdad On Eve of New Political Trial
description: BAGHDAD, Iraq, Feb. 27 This is a city where the ringing of the doorbell after midnight produces a special kind of fear, for midnight to 3 A.M. is the time when arrests are most often made.

title: U.C.L.A. Crushes Stanford
description: LOS ANGELES, Feb. 27 (UPI) Curtis Rowe scored a career high of 30 points tonight to lead the University of Califor nia, Los Angeles, to a 12090 victory over Stanford in a Pacific Eight game. Rowe, who got 18 of his points in the sec ond half, sank five of seven from the floor in the opening half as U.C.L.A. raced to a 5639 lead.

title: The Great Lake of Cambodia Is Dotted With Floating Villages
description: THEAY KOM, Cambodia, Feb. 16  On a map, Tonle Sap, the Great Lake of Cam bodia, looks as though it were studded with islands, so dense ly is it dotted with villages. The villages exist, but they are not on islands. They float.

title: Bus Talks in Jersey Continue As Strike Deadline Approaches
description: Negotiations between Public Service Coordinated Transport and the drivers and mechanics of its buses, which haul nearly a million riders daily in New Jersey, continued last night on the eve of a deadline for a pos sible strike.

title: 5 Marks Set in School Track, Including U.S. Record for 600
description: The Eastern States schoolboy indoor track championships lived up to premeet expecta tions last night at the 102d En gineers Armory. Five records were posted, including a na tional flatfloor mark in the 600 and near national standards in the twomile run and twomile relay.

title: News Summary and Index
description: International

title: VINCO MAKING DEBUT IN NORMA AT MET
description: No Vinco, an Italian bass, will make his Metropolitan debut on March 19 taking the part of Oroveso in Bellini's Norma, and John Alexander will assume the role of Pollione for the first time in the same performance during the twelfth week of the Met's current season.

title: Market Place
description: WHEN there is a bull mar ket, it seems as if nobody questions anything. Manage ments make optimistic state ments, stocks go up and everybody is happy.

title: Eisenhowers Going to Expo
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27 (AP) Julie and David Eisenhower will represent President Nixon at the United States Day at Expo 70 in Osaka, Japan, July 3, the White House an nounced today. The Presiderit asked his daughter and sonin law to represent him after the Japanese Government invited him to participate in the day's ceremonies.

title: FOREIGN AIRLINES ARE SUED BY ST STATE
description: New York State sued 11 for eign airlines yesterday on charges of having polluted the air at Kennedy International Airport with the exhaust fumes from their let planes.

title: Israel's Airport Is Calm
description: BONN, Feb. 27To a travel er just returned to West Ger many from Israel, civil air traf fic in Israel seems placid com pared to the way it is being buffeted about in some other places.

title: Newburger Deal Completed
description: Newburger & Co., of Phila delphia and the Advest Corn delphia, and the Advest Com pany, Hartford, announced yes terday that they had completed their consolidation. Both in vestment firms are members of the New York Stock Exchange.

title: A TIMELESS SEEGER GIVES CONCERT HERE
description: There is something timeless about Pete Seeger. He has grpwn a big gray beard to mark the passing of his 50th year, and his voice has mel lowed, and maybe he does not bob about so much onstage as he used to, but his ebullience is still all there. His singing is as warmly persuasive, his play ing as dexterous, his spirit of humanity as infectious as ever.

title: ROLE IN CHARITIES FOR POOR IS URGED
description: The coordinating agency for 238 Protestant charities that raise $100million a year in the city is trying to get the chari ties to put poor people on their largely middleclass boards of directors and to aid poor peo ple in starting welfare agencies in their own neighborhoods.

title: ScientistEducator
description: FROM the quiet abstrac tions of theoretical phys ics to the clamorous social realities of an urban campus is the quantum leap that Dr. Robert E. Marshak has un dertaken in accepting the presidency of City College.

title: NEW PACT APPROVED BY LIBRARY WORKERS
description: About 1,500 maintenance em ployes, attendants and techni cians at nine city museums, libraries and zoos voted Thurs day night to accept a new con tract with the city. It will pro vide salary raises ranging from $1,150 for matrons CO $2,150 for supervising maintainers. The present salaries range from about $4,500 to $10,000.

title: National Mafia Moves to Curb Strife in Bonanno Family Here
description: Internal strife, murders, dis appearances, weak hearts and law enforcement have caused such havoc and confusion in the organized crime family formerly ruled by Joseph (Joe Bananas) Bonanno that the Mafia's national commission is reported to have appointed three temporary administrators.

title: Marines to Step Up Campaign to Ease Racial Tensions
description: CAMP LEJEUNE, N. C., Feb. 22Phase Two of an experi ment to defuse racial tensions among marines starts in the Second Marine Division March I and may, in the rather grim prediction of one unit leader, last forever.

title: GATT WILL WEIGH EASING FOR TRADE
description: GENEVA, Feb. 27The In ternational trading community refused today to commit itself to the launching of another ma jor attack on barriers to the free flow of trade in 1971.

title: Mortgage Law Passed
description: RICHMOND, Va., Feb. 27 (UPI)Governor Linwood Hol ton has signed into law a measure temporarily removing the 8 per cent ceiling on first mortgage loans in Virginia. The legislation was passed quickly by the General Assembiy yes terday as its first major piece of business in this session. The 8 per cent ceiling has stopped the inflow of mortgage money, since the interest rates soared attractively for lenders in other states.

title: Black Council Disaffiliated From Unitarian Church
description: BOSTON, Feb. 27The Black Affairs Council, a steering com mittee for programs affecting blacks in Unitarian Universal ist churches and societies, has been disaffiliated from the na tional assiciation of the denom ination.

title: Quintuplet Well on Way After a Few Tense Hours
description: Sarah Kienast, the second of the quintuplets born to Mrs. Margaret Kienast late Tuesday evening, caused a few tense hours for doctors at Columbia Presbyterian Medical Center early yester day when she again devel oped a respiratory difficulty.

title: SENATE BID MADE BY REP. M'CARTHY
description: BUFFALO, Feb. 27  Rep resentative Richard D. McCar thy of Buffalo, a Democrat who has been elected three time? from the normally Republican 39th Congressional District, an nounced his candidacy for the United States Senate today.

title: CRIME UNIT TOLD OF MAFIA MURDERS
description: The disappearance of a vic tim's deathbed statement and the resultant dismissal of a firstdegree murder indictment against a reputed arsonist for the Mafia led a legislative committee's investigation of organized crime into a new channel here yesterday.

title: India Gets New Bank Bill
description: NEW DELHI, Feb. 27 (AP) Prime Minister Indira Gandhi's Government introduced a bill in Parliament today to re nationalize India's 14 major banks. The original nationaliza tion bill was struck down by the Supreme Court, and the new bill is designed to meet the court's objections.

title: Black Student Protesters Quit Mt. Holyoke Buildings
description: SOUTH HADLEY, Mass., Feb. 27 (AP)About 150 black stu dents from five area colleges abandoned seven buildings on the Mount Holyoke College campus this afternoon, 13 hours after they took them over to protest academic ter rorism and atrocities.

title: GRAND PRIX OPENS FOR SNOW RACERS
description: LAKE TAHOE, Nev., Feb. 27 Lake Tahoe's North Shore welcomed a triple invasion to day as the $50,000 Kings Castle Grand Prix snowmobile races got under way.

title: PRINCETON DOWNS CORNELL, 65 TO 58
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Feb. 27 Led by John Hummer and Jeff Petrie, cocaptains, Princeton clinched third place in the Ivy League tonight with a 6558 victory over Cornell.

title: Westbury's Fastest Mile of 1970 Looms
description: WESTBURY, L. I., Feb. 27 From their respective New Jersey homes at New Egypt and Colt's Neck, Stanley Dancer and Carmine Abbatiello sent word today that the likeli hood is strong for the local season's first 2minutemile at Roosevelt Raceway tomorrow night.

title: REGENTS ASK HELP ON PUPIL ADDICTS
description: The State Board of Regents issued a policy statement yes terday describing educators as unable to solve the problems of youthful drug addiction with out the aid of students and communities.

title: A Price to Stun Grandfather
description: IN an age when tickless, tocless, faceless, hand less clocks have created more than a flurry of interest, some people still want grand father clocks that go ding dong not once but four times an hour and have to be wound every week. Or so the Herschede Hall Clock Company of Starkville, Miss., says. Otherwise the concern, which moved south from Cin Cincinnati in 1960 and has been in the clock business since 1902, would not be offering what it calls the most distinguished grandfa ther clock ever made in America and for which it claims the highest price tag in history. It sells for $3,400 and the designers, at a loss for words, call it The Clock.

title: Jim Dine, Expatriate, Returns for Retrospective
description: Jim Dine, artist, poet and exprinceling of pop, exported himself from New York to Lon don three years ago, with carcely a backward glance. ??how back on a visit, he still hates every minute of it.

title: Court of Appeals Will Hear School Line Case Tuesday
description: The state's highest court will hear an appeal on Tuesday against a ruling that has rein stated the proposed decentral ized school district lines in Manhattan.

title: Cardiologist Hits Smoking
description: NEW ORLEANS, Feb. 27 (AP) Smoking is an even greater health hazard in relation to heart disease than it is to cancer, a New York heart spe cialist said here today.

title: Mrs. Elizabeth Fisher Wed to Alton E. Peters
description: LOCUST VALLEY, L. I., Feb. 27Mrs. Elizabeth Ber lin Fisher, daughter of Irving Berlin, the songwriter, and Mrs. Berlin of New York, was married here this after noon to Alton E. Peters of New York, a partner in the law firm of Bleakley, Platt, Schmidt, Hart & Fritz.

title: ASHE AND RICHEY GAIN SEMIFINALS
description: MACON, Ga., Feb. 27 (AP) Topseeded Arthur Ashe of the United States rallied in the final set today to defeat Zeljko Franulovic of Yugoslavia and advance to the semifinals of the Macon international tennis tournament. The scores were, 175, 79, 62.

title: Topics: Government in the Marketplace
description: WASHINGTON.

title: Whipple, Name of U.S. Judge, Is in Log of F.B.I. Jersey Tapes
description: NEWARK, Feb. 27 (AP)A log of electronic surveillance of New Jersey underworld figures conducted by the Federal Bu reau of Investigation contains a reference to a person with the surname of the then Hudson County Prosecutor, who is now a Federal judge.

title: JET CONTRACT GOES TO PRATT & WHITNEY
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27 (AP) The Pentagon announced to day that the United Aircraft Corporation's Pratt & Whitney Division had been selected to develop and produce engines for the newest fighter aircraft planned by the Navy and Air Force.

title: Ruling Cuts Peak Traffic At Kennedy
description: The Federal Aviation Ad ministration issued a rule yesterday that officials said would reduce the peakhour capacity of Kennedy Inter national Airport  already sharply limited by eight monthold quotas.

title: OTTINGER CHARGES NEW M'TARTHYISM
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27  Representative Richard L. Ot tinger, Westchester County Democrat, charged today that Vice President Agnew and Attorney General John N. Mitehell were promoting a new McCarthyism by their recent actions concerning the news media and announced that he would introduce legisla tion to protect newsmen from Government intimidation and coercion.

title: Arraiolos Rugs and Crocheted Fashions Help Put Lisbon on Shopper's Map
description: LISBONThe surroundings are no longer much to look at. The area is shabby, part of a workingclass sub urb of Lisbon. The estate, which dates back to the 17th century, is large and also has seen better days.

title: Article 2  No Title
CAMPBELL DIVIDED INTO 2 DIVISIONS
description: When the hundredgrand horse races start popping up on opposite coasts, the hun dredgrand jockeys start taking to the air.

title: Immanuel Church Gets New Pastor Tomorrow
description: An installation service for the Rev. Raymond C. Schulze as eighth pastor of Immanuel Lutheran Church, Lexington Avenue and 88th Street, will be held at 11 A.M. tomor row.

title: Naval Exercise Planned
description: SAN DIEGO, Feb. 27 (AP) More than 40 United States Navy ships and three from Canada will take part in an eightday Pacific fleet exercise beginning Monday off the Southern California coast.

title: CARNEGIE PACKED FOR SAMMY DAVIS
description: I am a nightclub performer and that's all I am, said Sammy Davis Jr. last night to an audience that packed Car negie Hall for the first of three performances he was giving there. He appeared twice last night and will perform again this evening.

title: RunOff Due at St. John's U. After No Group Wins Vote
description: A State Labor Relations Board election at St. John's University yesterday to deter mine the collective bargaining agent for the faculty failed to produce a majority for any group. A runoff election will be held soon, according to uni versity officials.

title: EQUATION AHEAD IN OCEAN RACING
description: MIAMI, Feb. 27  With three races completed and three to go, John Potter's 57 foot sloop Equation from Oys ter Bay, L. I., sat on the top of the standing today for the Southern Ocean Racing Con ference championship.

title: Big 4 Meeting on Mideast Fails to Achieve Progress
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Feb. 27The delegates of the Big Fourthe United States, Britain, France and the Soviet Union  conferred for three hours today at the Waldorf Astoria on the Middle East but, according to diplo matic sources, made no prog ress on any point.

title: North Stars Get Worsley
description: MONTREAL, Feb. 27 (UPI)  Lorne (Gump) Worsley has been traded to the Minnesota North Stars, the Montreal Ca nadiens announced this after noon.

title: Carol Ferrigno Is Wed
description: PHILADELPHIA, Feb. 27 Miss Carol Ferrigno, daugh ter of Mr. and Mrs. Alfonso F. Ferrigno, was married here today to Patrick J. Birmingham, resident man ager of the St. RegisShera ton in New York. He is the son of the late Mr. and Mrs. Martin Birmingham of Phila delphia and has been previ ously married and divorced. Presiding Judge Ethan Allen Doty of the Court of Com mon Pleas performed the ceremony in his chambers.

title: RANGERS TRADE 2 FOR KINGS' IRVINE
description: DETROIT, Feb. 27  In a deal prompted by Don Mar shall's shoulder injury, the New York Rangers obtained tonight Ted Irvine, a 25yearold left wing, from the Los Angeles Kings in exchange for Real Lemieux and Juha Widing.

title: HelpWanted Ad Index Off 4 Months in a Row
description: The helpwanted advertis ing index in January dropped for the fourth consecutive month, the National Indus trial Conference Board said yesterday. At 202 per cent of the 195759 average, the index last month was 15 points below the December level and 22 points under that of January, 1969.

title: Grenades Kill Arab Boy and Wound 39 in Gaza Strip
description: JERUSALEM, Feb. 27Gre nade attacks in the Gaza Strip took the life of a 13yearold Arab boy today and injured 39 other persons, all but three Arab residents of Gaza.

title: A Correction
description: In an obituary of Jay H. Connaway, an artist, in yes terday's New York Times, the date of death and age were in correctly given. Mr. Connaway died Feb. 18 and was 76 years old. The statement that he never painted from nature' was also incorrect.

title: G.O.P. in North Hempstead Supports Rice for Congress
description: GARDEN CITY, L.I., Feb. 27  Raymond J. Rice, a 43year old consulting engineer from Manhasset, was selected today by the North Hempstead Repub lican Executive Committee as its candidate for Representative in the Third Congressional Dis trict.

title: GecrgiaPacific Net Gained 19.7% in'69
Dartmouth Stops Yale
description: HANOVER, N. H., Feb. 27 Dartmouth came back strongly in the second half tonight to overtake Yale and score a 6966 Ivy victory in Alumni Gymnasium.

title: James Grinder, Mrs. Noel Wed In New Canaan
description: NEW CANAAN, Conn., Feb. 27Mrs. Nancy Moran Noel was married here this morn ing to James A. Grinder of New York. Probate Judge Carl V. Nelson performed the ceremony in Town Hall.

title: Nixon Cousin to Make Debut as Rodeo Rider
description: FRESNO, Calif., Feb. 27 (UPI)  A 19yearold cousin of President Nixon, Monty Milhous, makes his profes sional bullriding debut to morrow at the Pacific Indoor Rodeo here.

title: PLAYERS REJECT OWNERS PACKAGE
description: MIAMI, Feb. 27The player representatives of the major league baseball teams met to day and rejected an offered package for a basic agreement with the owners, an offer that had to be accepted or rejected as a whole.

title: WOMAN MURDERED IN HOME IN JERSEY
description: LONG VALLEY, N. J., Feb. 27The battered body of a 28yearold mother was found sprawled in the recreation room of her home this morning.

title: PHILLIPS EXETER TO ADMIT GIRLS
description: EXETER, N. H., Feb. 27The trustees of Phillips Exeter Acad emy voted unanimously today to make the 189yearold pre paratory school coeducational, effective this September.

title: Soviet Said to Rule Grigorenko, A Dissident ExGeneral, Insane
