description: MOSCOW, Feb. 27  Former Maj. Gen. Pyotr G. Grigorenko, once the most prominent and outspoken member of a small group of Soviet political dis sidents, was declared legally insane today, according to re liable sources.

title: Tito Ends African Tour
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Feb. 27 (Reuters)President Tito re turned here by air today from a monthlong tour of eight East and North African countries.

title: Jersey Boy, 10, Electrocuted
description: PERTH AMBOY, N. J., Feb. 27 (AP)Frank Aquino, 10 years old, who apparently was playing on top of a boxcar in a railroad yard here, was elec trocuted today when he touched a hightension wire, according to the police. The wires run above the tracks at the Penn Central yards at the foot of Larrie Street where the acci dent occurred. The boy lived at 471 Johnstone Street.

title: Submarine Five Wins Title
description: PEARL HARBOR Feb. 27 (AP)  Submarine Forces Pacific stopped Amphibious Forces At lantic, 9885, last night to win the 1970 AllNavy basketball crown in three straight games.

title: James Bostwick and Scott Reach Court Tennis Final
description: James Bostwick and Gene Scott gained the final of the national singles court tennis tournament yesterday with semifinal victories at the Rac quet and Tennis Club.

title: Pollution Is a Growing Issue in West Germany
description: BONN, Feb. 27The struggle against pollution of the envi ronment is becoming a major political issue in West Ger many, judging by several de velopments here this week.

title: U.S.Poland Export Pact
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27 (AP) The United States and Poland have concluded a new agree ment continuing Polish re straints on cotton textile ex ports to this country for a five year period begining March 1 For its first year the new agree ment provides a total ceiling of 6.4 million square yards.

title: Farm Price Index Rises
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27 (AP)  Sharply higher prices for cattle and hogs spurred the Agriculture Department's farm price index to its fifth straight increase in the month ended Feb. 15.

title: 37 Are Arrested by Police In Raid on College in Manila
description: MANILA, Feb. 27 (AP)The police raided the Philippine College of Commerce today and seized 37 students and teachers, as well as guns and Communist books. The college president protested.

title: Penn Overcomes Columbia Five, 7157, to Win Ivy Crown
description: PHILADELPHIA, Feb. 27  Pennsylvania won the Ivy League basketball title and the resulting National Collegiate Athletic Association tourna ment berth tonight when its tall and perfectly balanced team defeated Columbia, 7157, before 9,260 screaming fans in The Palestra.

title: COURT UPHOLDS BAN ON 7 UPJOHN DRUGS
description: CINCINNATI, Feb. 27 (AP) Three Federal judges upheld today an order by the Food and Drug Administration that seven antibiotic drugs manufac tured by the Upjohn Company be taken off the market be cause they produce side ef fects.

title: PERIL OF SMOKING TO HEART QUERIED
description: A Harvard University re searcher, writing in a publica tion of the American Medical Association, says there is no conclusive evidence causally linking cigarette smoking to, heart disease.

title: Nigerian Court Orders 4 Missionaries Deported
description: LAGOS, Nigeria, Feb. 27 (AP)A Lagos court today con victed four Roman Catholic missionariestwo priests and two nunson charges of en tering Nigeria illegally during the Nigerian civil war and or dered them deported.

title: Hickel Will Decide in 6 Weeks On Approving Alaska Pipeline
description: Walter J. Hickel, Secretary of the Interior, said yesterday that he would make a decision on construction permits for the transAlaskan pipeline system in the next six weeks. He in dicated approval was likely.

title: Hunter and Queens Fives Gain City University Final
Trade Surplus Checked Policy Defended
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27Im ports rose faster than exports in January, thus checking the improvement of the United States trade surplus that had emerged in late 1969, the Com merce Department reported today.

title: Grumman Plans to Cut 5,000 Workers in Year
description: BETHPAGE, L. I., Feb. 27 (UPI)  The Grumman Cor poration announced today that it expected layoffs in volving 5,000 employes by the end of the year.

title: G.M. ROLLS SCRAP INTO USABLE SHEET
description: DETROIT, Feb. 27 (AP) The General Motors Corpora tion said today it had developed a method for reclaiming metal scrap left when fenders, hoods and other body parts are stamped out.

title: ANGER OVER DRUGS GROWING IN BRONX
description: You couldn't help liking Ralphie, said Henry Schecht man, the principal of Public School 60 in the Bronx. He was referring to Ralph de Jesus a 12yearold student at his school who became a heroin addict.

title: Brown Sinks Harvard
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Feb. 27 Outscoring Harvard, 298, from the foul line tonight Brown registered a 7972 Ivy triumph that dropped the Crimson into eighth place in the league for the first time since 1954.

title: U. S. Notes Low Acreage
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27 (UPI) The Secretary of Agriculture, Clifford M. Hardin, today praised Canada's action to curb her wheat surplus and urged other nations to take similar steps.

title: LASSA FEVER LINKED TO AFRICA BREAKOUT
description: ATLANTA, Feb. 27 (UPI)A medical scientist in charge of research on the highly virulent Lassa fever virus said today that it might have been the agent that decimated several population centers in Africa's subSahara region 15 years ago.

title: 16 YOUNG MEN SET FOR CAREERS IN TV
description: Sixteen young men from nearpoverty backgrounds were graduated yesterday by the Community Film Workshop Council following their comple tion of a sixweek course in the techniques of television jour nalism.

title: Figure in Jersey Mafia Case Denied Bail by High Court
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27 (UPI) The Supreme Court today de nied bail to Joseph Arthur Zicarelli, 57 years old, of Cliff side Park, N. J., who has been jailed for refusing to answer questions by the New Jersey crime commission which is in vestigating Mafia operations.

title: F.C.C Gives Broadcasters Guidelines on Lottery
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27 The Federal Communications Commission announced guide lines today on what broadcast ers can and cannot report about the New York State Lottery without promoting it.

title: Council on Reading Foreseen
description: CHICAGO, Feb. 27 (AP)Dr. Allen said last night that he expected President Nixon to announce next week the crea tion of a national council to assure that every school child in the nation learns to read.

title: U.S. RELAXES DRIVE FOR MINORITY JOBS
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27 The Nixon Administration has ended all pressure on Federal agencies to step up employ ment of members of minority groups, Robert E. Hampton, chairman of the Civil Service Commission, says.

title: Guard Units Patrol Tense Coast Town; 70 More Arrested
description: ISLA VISTA, Calif., Feb. 27 Order prevailed today in this university community where youths and the po lice have battled with stones and tear gas for the last three nights.

title: Executive Changes
description: Dr. Eugene G. Fubini, a scientist and engineer, has been elected a director and officer of the board of Texas Instruments, Inc. He served in the office of the Secretary of Defense from 1961 to 1965 and was a vice president of International Business Machines Corporation from 1965 to 1969.

title: SLAYER OF BROTHERS MAY QUIT BUSINESS
description: Albert Gelb. the Bronx phar macist who shot and killed two brothers trying to hold him up Wednesday night at his drug store, said yesterday that he might give up his business and leave the city.

title: CHEMICAL PRICES INCREASED BY DOW
description: The Dow Chemical Company announced yesterday that it would raise prices on 14 groups of organic chemicals covering 54 distinct products.

title: Train Accidents Up 60% In 5 Years, Agency Says
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27 (UPI)Train accidents, up 60 per cent over the last five years, reached a record of 8, 529 in 1969, the Federal Rail road Administration reports.

title: PHYSICIST NAMED HEAD OF C.C.N.Y.
description: Dr. Robert E. Marshak, a leading physicist who is widely known for his promo tion of international scientific cooperation, was named presi dent of City College yesterday.

title: AMEX LIST GAINS AS VOLUME RISES
description: The American Stock Exchange finished the week on a bullish note yesterday as the list ad vanced on expanded volume.

title: 2 Soviet Generals Indicate Aid to Arabs May Increase
description: MOSCOW, Feb. 27  Two Soviet generals hinted in sep arate newspaper articles today that the Soviet Union might in crease its military support to Arab countries to offset Is raeli strength.

title: Georgy to Close Tonight
description: Georgy, the new musical based on the film Georgy Girl. will close after its fourth performance tonight at the Winter Garden. The show, which opened on Thursday, has a hook by Tom Mankiewicz, lyrics by Carole Bayer and mu sic by George Fischoff. It was produced by Fred Coe in asso ciation with Joseph P. Harris and Ira Bernstein.

title: Show by Benn Reaffirms His Position
description: THERE are painters who seem to produce pictures in an effortless flow of ob servation, execution and real izationpictures that distill something of the pleasure and lan of the artistic proc ess in the very style they embody. To succeed, such painters must have a very firm hold on the structure of the easel picture, and a very natural, intuitive feeling for its internal dynamics, but the pleasure their pictures afford are only partly formal in character. The real source of pleasure in such pictures is a certain joy and quickness of perception that is funda mental to their conception.

title: Birth Control Law Disputed
description: BOSTON, Feb. 27 (UPI) William R. Baird, birth control advocate who is serving a threemonth jail sentence for distributing a contraceptive de vice, contended in Federal Dis trict Court today that the law under which he was convicted was unconstitutional. Judge Anthony Julian gave Assistant Attorney General Lawrence P. Co? until Tuesday to reply.

title: Bahamas Tax Plan Gains
description: NASSAU, the Bahamas, Feb. 27 (UPI)Sweeping tax conces sions aimed at attracting new industry to the Bahamas were approved today by the House of Assembly. Manufacturers will be granted exemptions from property tax and any other foreseeable tax until 1990 and duty exemptions will be given on imported machin ery, equipment and raw mate rials.

title: Hotel Baby Sitters: Freedom for Parents, Lollipops for Children
description: WHEN tourists empty out of New York hostelries to take advantage of the city's varied night life, they leave behind them, more of ten than not, that family stal wart, the hotel baby sitter.

title: $100, 000 Races Scheduled Today at Hialeah, Bowie and Santa Anita
description: MIAMI, Feb. 27  The Hia leah Turf Cup, elevated to $100,000 status this season, will be the main attraction for the final Saturday program of the Hialeah meeting tomorrow. Al ways popular with horsemen, foreigners as well as those from this country, this year's run ning has attracted a dozen par ticipants.

title: Pakistani Chief Acts to Curb Monopolies
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, Feb. 27 Gen. Agha Mohammad Yahya Khan, President of Pakistan, to day issued a law providing for measures against undue con centration of economic power, growth of unreasonable monop oly power and unreasonably restrictive trade practices.

title: TonMileage of Railroads Increased 4% in Week
description: WASHINGTON, Feb 27  Freight traffic on United States railroads in the week ended Feb. 21 totaled an estimated 14.9 billion tonmiles. This was four per cent above the cor responding week of last year.

title: AMERICAN HOCKEY LEAGUE
description: LAST NIGHT'S GAMES

title: Nat'l Hockey League
HUMPHREY PROMISES VOICE TO GOVERNORS
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27 (UPI) Democratic Governors de manded today a greater voice in national party affairs, and former Vice President Hubert H. Humphrey promised that they would get it.

title: Washington: For the Record
Nine N.Y.U. Wrestlers Gain Metropolitan Semifinals
description: Sending nine of their 10 men into today's semifinals, New York University took a 1point lead after the quarterfinals last night in the Metropolitan wrestling championships in the Violets' Alumni Gymnasium in the Bronx.

title: AUTO PRODUCTION CONTINUES SLUMP
Nepal's Prince Marrying Amid Dazzle and Pomp
description: KATMANDU, Nepal, Feb. 27With the snowdraped Himalayas for a backdrop, the lengthy wedding cere mony of the Crown Prince of Nepal began today with a be spangled procession watched by representatives from over 50 countries and several hun dred thousand Nepalese.

title: Theodore F. Shaker Resigns As A.B.C. Vice President
description: Theodore F. Shaker, group vice president of American Broadcasting Companies inc., resigned yesterday, acccording to an announcement by Simon B. Siegel, executive vice pres ident.

title: JOSEPH J. GANNON
description: DARIEN, Conn., Feb. 27 Joseph J. Gannon, a sales man ager for General Foods Cor poration in New York, died yesterday at Hartford General Hospital. His age was 59 and he had moved here a short time ago.

title: 11 Panthers Given Special Jail Status
description: From the day after their arrest last April 2 until Dec. 29, the Black Panthers await ing trial here on charges of conspiracy to bomb public places were kept apart, scattered among seven jails in four boroughs. Now the men among them are in the same jail with some free dom to consult each other.

title: COLUMBIA MEETING DISRUPTED BY 150
description: The monthly meeting of the Columbia University Senate was disrupted yesterday after noon by 150 chanting demon strators.

title: A Rapid Phototypesetter
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27 The Fairchild Camera and Instrument Corporation received a patent this week for its phototypesetting ma chine, which can compose 100 newspaper lines per minute from copy pre pared on tape. The company's graphic equip ment division at Plainview, N. Y., has orders for 15 of the machines from commer cial printers and from news that use offset.

title: Bridge:
description: THE final stage of the marathon match between the Dallas Aces and Omar Sharif's Circus of European stars, played in Philadelphia this week, has become a run away victory for the Amer ican experts. They lead by 160 international match points with 42 deals remain ing to be played.

title: LOUIS F. KELSEY
description: MOUNTAINSIDE, N. J., Feb. 27Louis F. Kelsey, a New Jer sey Bell Telephone Company executive, died today in Over look Hospital, Summit, appar ently of a heart attack. He was 51 years old and lived at 1370 Chapel Hill.

title: Joan Golub and P. J. Desmond, Actors, Plan April 5 Nuptials
description: Miss Joan L. Golub and Patrick J. Desmond, who have been courting backstage at the Ethel Barrymore Theater, where they are appearing in The Front Page, plan to be married on April 5.

title: Diane Amy Anderson Is Betrothed
description: SUMMIT, N.J., Feb. 27 Miss Diane Amy Anderson and William Blaine Asher Jr. will be married May 30 at the arboretum at Wellesley College.

title: Foreign Minister of Guatemala Kidnapped and Held for a Trade
description: GUATEMALA, Feb. 27The foreign minister of Guatemala, Alberto Fuentes Mohr, 42 years old, was kidnapped tonight and held for exchange for a univer sity student who was arrested yesterday.

title: Supreme Court Rejects Appeal Of Klansmen in Rights Slayings
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27  The Supreme Court refused to day to grant a hearing to seven Ku Klux Klan members who were convicted of conspiracy in connection with the murder of three civil rights workers in Neshoba County, Miss., in 1964.

title: A.T. &T. Regroups Executive Structure
description: The American Telephone and Telegraph Company an nounced yesterday a re grouping of its top execu tive structure, effective with the retirement of Ben S. Gil mer as president on April 1.

title: Model Homes for Americans
description: Operation Breakthrough, the Department of Housing and Urban Development's top priority program to meet the housing shortage, has an nounced its choices for the American homes. The 22 de signs released by the Gov ernment Thursday with the hope of mass production

title: 4 Rail Shop Unions Will Resume Talks As Deadline Nears
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2 (UPI)  Leaders of four shop craft unions announced today that they would return to the bargaining table for another at tempt to settle their 15month old contract dispute with the railroad industry.

title: Gets 15 Years in Infanticide
description: MIDDLEBURG, N. Y., Feb. 27 (AP)Mrs. Glenda Cooper, 26 years old, who was convict ed earlier this month of the hatchet slaying of her three children, was sentenced today to serve 15 years to life, con currently, on each of three mur der counts. Judge J. Robert Johnson of Schoharie County Court said he had no alterna tive... but to sentence Mrs. Cooper since the jury had found her guilty. The sentence was the minimum he could have imposed.

title: Gilbert Gets 68 for 138 to Gain OneStroke Lead in Doral Open
description: MIAMI, Feb. 27C. L. (Gibby) Gilbert Jr., a 29year old Hollywood (Fla.) profes sional, was unawed by the big names in the event as he led the $150,000 DoralEastern onen golf tourney today.

title: Queen's Portrait a Target
description: LONDON, Feb. 28 (AP)  A woman threw a book at Pietro Annigoni's new painting of Queen Elizabeth II in the Na tional Portrait Gallery today. The painting was not damaged and the gallery said it would not press charges. The portrait, showing the Queen in a severe mood, has aroused strong feel ings since it was first shown Wednesday.

title: Bus Overturns, Killing 3 Jerseyans on a Ski Trip
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, N.Y., Feb. 27At least three per sons were killed and two dozen were reported injured tonight when a chartered bus carrying skiing enthhusiasts from New Jersey to Lake Placid over turned on snowslicked Route 87 here.

title: New Look at Crisis Strikes
description: The most welcome aspect of the proposals President Nixon sent to Congress yesterday for better public protection against transportation strike emergencies is that they introduce fresh approaches into a field in which progress has been blocked for twenty years by prejudices too mossgrown to dislodge.

title: Clay Shaw Sues Garrison And Others for $5Million
description: NEW ORLEANS, Feb. 27 (AP) Clay L. Shaw, acquitted a year ago of charges that he conspired to kill President Ken nedy, filed a $5million damage suit today against District At torney Jim Garrison and others involved in the case.

title: Dilemma in Southeast Asia
description: Defense Secretary Laird's promise that President Nixon will not send combat troops to Laos without the consent of Congress is hardly reassuring, in the light of the secrecy that continues to surround already serious United States involvement there and the ap parent ineffectiveness of Americansupport efforts to stem a new Communist drive.

title: 3 POWERS READY FOR BERLIN TALKS, THEY TELL SOVIET
description: MOSCOW, Feb. 27The United States, Britain and France notified the Soviet Union today that they were ready to begin fourpower talks on problems relating to Berlin. Diplomatic sources said they expected the talks to begin by the end of March in West Berlin.

title: City Held Unable to Halt Housing Decay by Subsidy
description: The Lindsay Administra tion's top housing official de clared yesterday that the city lacked the capacity to imple ment the Rand Corporation's program for halting the wide spread decay of housing here.

title: Middlebury Leads Its Carnival; Dartmouth Skiers Are Second
description: MIDDLEBURY, Vt., Feb. 27  Middlebury overcame a fractional advantage Dartmouth had achieved in the downhill today with a solid team per formance in the 15kilometer crosscountry race to take a slim lead at the halfway mark in its 39th winter carnival.

title: 7 Hurt in IRT Crash; Other Lines Delayed
description: The city's subwaysthe target of increasing charges of deteriorating safety and maintenance  experienced new troubles yesterday, in cluding an accident in which seven persons were injured, a rider revolt in Brooklyn and delays for thousands of passengers.

title: Still Quiet in the Graveyard
description: The extent to which strikes drag on long after there is any conscionable justification for them currently getting gruesome illustration in the seven weekold strike of New York gravediggers. The employers have endorsed the recommendation Governor Rockefeller and Mayor Lindsay that all disputed insues be arbitrated; the union says no.

title: Rome Police Oust Students
description: ROME, Feb. 27 (AP)The police today cleared student protesters from the colleges of law, literature and chemistry at the University of Rome.

title: Fabric Flammability Test May Be Required by F.T.C.
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27 (AP) The chairmen of the Federal Trade Commission, Casper W. Weinberger, said today that the group was considering rule requiring the pretesting of fabrics for flammability before they are marketed.

title: Miss Custin a Consultant
description: Miss Mildred Custin, former ly president of Bonwit Teller, has established Mildred Custin, Ltd., retailing and fashion con sultants, which will occupy of fices at 767 Fifth Avenue on April 1. Miss Jerrie Rosenberg, formerly vice president and public relations director of Bon wit Teller, has joined Mildred Custin, Ltd., as vice president.

title: Duke's Daughter Wed To Subway Conductor
description: LONDON, Feb. 27 (Reuters)  Lady Kathleen Pelham ClintonHope, the 19yearold daughter of the Duke of New castle, and Edward Reynolds, a 20yearold conductor on the London subway system, were married yesterday.

title: Children to Benefit At Paradise Ball
description: A private philanthropist, who prefers to remain anon ymous, will underwrite this year's Paradise Ball on March 5 at the Plaza. The dinner dance aids 700 poor children in New York.

title: London Airport Strike Off
description: LONDON, Feb. 27 (Reuters) Firemen at London airport delayed strike plans tonight that would have closed the air port. After a lengthy meeting between union and manage ment officials tonight, a spokesman for the British Air ports Authority said the fire men had decided to postpone a strike decision until Monday.

title: Suns Sink Celtics, 134125
description: BOSTON, Feb. 27 (UPI) Dick Van Arsdale scored 37 points to lead the Phoenix Suns to a 134125 victory over the Boston Celtics tonight. Boston trailed by only 5 points, 105100, with 7:37 left in the game, when Van Arsdale scored on a 3point play and another basket to double the Suns' margin.

title: U.S SEXTET DEFEATS YUGOSLAVIA BY 51
description: BUCHAREST, Feb. 27 (AP) Len Lylyholm and Craig Patrick led the favored United States team to its third straight vic tory, a 51 triumph over Yugo slavia, tonight in the Group B tournament of the World ice hockey championships.

title: BRAZIL'S CHIEF BALKS AT DEMOCRACY SOON
description: BRASILIA, Feb. 27 (UPI) President Emilio G. Medici told Brazilians tonight that he could not surrender dictatorial powers and restore democratic processes to Latin America's largest country, as he had said he would do on taking office four months ago.

title: Nixon Offers Makers of Sheet Adjustment Aid
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27 President Nixon declined today to raise the tariff on sheet glass as the industry had re quested, but he offered the in dustry and its workers adjust ment assistance.

title: FUTURES IN WHEAT FALL AFTER RALLY
description: The announcement by the Canadian Government that it was making a move to cut wheat production this year caused a brief rally in the grain pits at the Chicago Board of Trade yesterday.

title: Books of The Times
description: HERE is a bit of a surprise: a very thorough telling of the events that led up to the massacre of March 5, 1770 (exactly 200 years ago this Thurs day), in which a group of British soldiers fired into a crowd in King Street, Boston. Five died, six were wounded. The incident has been cited as the first battle of the American Revolution. It has created a folk hero in the person of the presumably black Crispus Attucks, whose participation in the fracas has somehow been turned into a 20thcentury battle for civil rights. Above all, through the famous engraving by Paul Revere, showing the soldiers lined up in a file nonchalantly shooting into the crowd, and through the polemical writings of Samuel Adams, who would not let the case rest even after the courts had decided, the Boston massacre kept colonial rage hot and colonial feelings on edge through the period of the Revolution. As a propaganda vehicle, the event was custommade for the rebellious side.

title: CAHILL SON INDICTED IN MARIJUANA CASE
description: PHILADELPHIA, Feb. 27 John P. Cahill, 19yearold son of Gov. William T. Cahill of New Jersey, was indicted by the February grand jury here yesterday on a charge of pos sessing marijuana.

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS

title: RECORD HOME CROWD SEES NETS TRIUMPH
description: WEST HEMPSTEAD, L. I., Feb. 27Levern Tart poured in 38 points as the New York Nets, opening a big early lead, held on for a 122113 victory over the Miami Floridians at Island Garden tonight.

title: Organizers of National Book Awards Criticized
description: Roger W. Straus Jr., the president of a wellknown pub lishing house, sharply criticized the organizers of the 21st Na tional Book Awards yesterday for their selection of judges and the preparation of the three day book promotion program that opens here Monday.

title: MRS. MEIR TELLS OF ISRAELI NEEDS
description: MIAMI BEACH, Feb. 27 Representatives of Jewish com munities in the United States and Canada were told today by Premier Golda Meir of Israel that the Middle East crisis had heightened her nation's de pendence on increased Ameri can Jewish financial support.

title: C.I. Dies of Meningitis
description: FORT LEONARD WOOD, Mo., Feb. 27 (AP)Pvt. Steven G. Lagermann, 19 years old, of Affton, Mo., died of meningitis yesterday, the third victim of the disease this month this month at the Army post. Sev enteen cases of the disease have been reported so far this month an Army spokesman said.

title: Nixon Sends Good Wishes To O.A.S. on New Charter
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27 President Nixon sent a con gratulatory message to the Or ganization of American States, whose new charter went into effect today at ceremonies here.

title: SWISS SUSPECT LINK IN 2 AIR EXPLOSIONS
description: BERN, Switzerland, Feb. 27 (Reuters)  The Federal pros ecutor said today there was growing evidence of a link be tween the explosion on an Austrian airliner Saturday and the crash of a Swissair jet the same day, in which 47 persons died.

title: Vehicle Tag Date Extended
description: The deadline for renewing vehicle registrations that ex pire today has been extended to midnight, Monday, by the State Department of Motor Vehicles. The extension has been granted by the depart ment because its issuing of fices will be closed today.

title: Extended Forecast
description: (Monday through Wednesday) SOUTHEASTERN NEW YORK, EASTERN PENNSYLVANIA, CONNECTICUT, LONG ISLAND AND NEW JERSEYChance of periods of rain or snow Tuesday and Wednesday. It will be cold with daytime highs in the mid30's and overnight lows In the teens north and the low 20's south.

title: Nixon to Pick Patent Aide
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27 (AP) President Nixon announced today that he will nominate Robert Gottschalk, 59, of Mad ison, N. J., to be first assistant commissioner of patents.

title: CHARGES BY LACEY DENIED BY SHERIFF
description: NEWARK, Feb. 27  The Essex County Sheriff, Ralph D'Ambola, said today that Unit ed States Attorney Frederick B. Lacey was conducting a per sonal vendetta against him going back seven years when Mr. Lacey reportedly was re jected as the Essex County Re publican candidate for State Senator.

title: Shriver and Nixon Confer
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27 (UPI) Sargent Shriver, the United States Ambassador to France, who is widely reported to be weighing a race for the Gover norship of Maryland, conferred today for 15 minutes with President Nixon. The White House refused to comment on the meeting.

title: ART EXPERT CHARGE HOLDS GENOA DEALER
description: GENOA, Italy, Feb. 27 (Reu ters)The customs police to day charged Ildebrando Bossi, a Genoa antique dealer, with illegally exporting a Raphael painting that is now in the Boston Museum, legal sources said.

title: Penz of France Captures Giant Slalom Event in Canada's World Cup Skiing
description: NORTH VANCOUVER, Brit ish Columbia, Feb. 27 (AP) Alain Penz of France whisked down Grouse Mountain today to edge Werner Bleiner of Austria by two one hundredths of a second and win the giant slalom at Canada's World Cup ski meet.

title: TWO MORE YANKS AGREE TO TERMS
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., Feb. 27Bobby Murcer and Horace Clarke signed their New York Yankee contracts to day, leaving only Jerry Kenney unsigned, and he is expected to agree to terms on Monday.

title: Knicks Oppose Bullets in Finale Of Season Series Here Tonight
description: Coaches Red Holzman of the Knicks and Gene Shue of the Baltimore Bullets may be pre occupied with injuries tonight as their clubs conclude their regularseason National Basket ball Association series before an expected capacity crowd of 19,500 at Madison Square Gar den.

title: Not So Total War on Drugs...
description: While stoutly declaring a total war on drug addic tion, Governor Rockefeller has proposed an emergency program that would create additional delay and dimin ish the role of the state. Less a march forward than a retreat, it is in essence a program to dump the problem on the cities.

title: Giant Slalom to Miss Rauter
description: LES MOSSES, Switzerland, Feb. 27 (Reuters)Berni Rau ter, a 20yearold Austrian girl, won an international giant sla lom race today by beating Jacqueline Rouvier of France by a few hundredths of a sec ond. Gertrud Gabl of Austria, the winner of last year's World Cup and sixth in the race, won the combined award.

title: JERSEY POLICE CHIEF IS GIVEN SUSPENSION
description: OLD TAPPAN, N. J., Feb. 27 (AP)  Police Chief Charles Schuh has been suspended on departmental charges of pass ing to a fellow policeman money received from the wife of an alleged Mafioso.

title: ALCINDOR GETS 33 AS BUCKS TRIUMPH
description: MILWAUKEE, Feb. 27 (UPI) The Milwaukee Bucks scored the game's first eight points to day and breezed to a 131113 victory over the Detroit Pistons behind a combined 82point out burst by Lew Alcindor, Jon Mc Glocklin and Flynn Robinson.

title: Inventor Offers to Support Test Of Welfare Grants and Wages
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27A computer scientist from White Plains, N. Y., thinks that the Government is approaching welfare reform in the wrong way and is willing to put $500, 000 of his own money to prove it.

title: Ousted Rights Aide Says Nixon Fails to Give Moral Leadership
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27 Leon E. Panetta said today he believed that the Nixon Ad ministration had decided to cater to the votes of the Deep South states and that as a re sult the nation did not have the kind of moral leadership it needed in race relations.

title: RYDER BRANCHES OUT TO INSURANCE FIELD
description: Ryder System, Inc., a diver sified transportation service company, announced yesterday it has entered the insurance field by acquiring Southern Un derwriters, Inc., one of the larg est insurance service firms in the southeast, for an undi s closed amount of common stock.

title: Carswell Choice Assailed In Senate Minority Report
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27 (UPI) Four Democratic members of the Senate Judiciary Committee declared today that confirma tion of Judge G. Harrold Cars well would discredit the Su preme Court. More important, it would be a disservice to the finest ideals of the American people, they added.

title: REGENTS SUPPORT REPEAL OF BLAINE
description: ALBANY, Feb. 27  The Board of Regents voted 11 to 2 today in favor of the current legislative effort to repeal the constitutional bar against state aid to parochial schools.

title: BEN WEBER WORK IS RICHLY TEXTURED
description: Ben Weber, a composer who works slowly, carefully and well, is so unassuming and so undemanding of public atten tion that the excellence of his music is known and appre ciated by far too few of his fellow Americans. But almost every time he produces a new composition, those who hear it are enriched by the experience.

title: Adjusting to the Inevitable
description: LONDON, Feb. 27Even to raise the subject of American forces in Europe is to bring a glaze of weariness to the eyes of the average man. It is a muchargued subject, but it happens right now to be a timely and extremely important onefor both of us, Americans and Europeans.

title: New Haven Fare Rises Delayed by Penn Central
description: Commuters from Connecticut were promised yesterday a de lay of at least a month in having to pay higher fares on the Penn Central's New Haven New York commuter service.

title: 2 Wildlife Preserves Endangered By Oil and Tar on Florida Rivers
description: JACKSONVILLE, Fla., Feb. 27 (AP)Oil from a damaged barge flowed down the St. Johns River near here today, threatening a wildlife refuge. Across the state a tarlike sub stance floated through another wildlife preserve.

title: Japanese Catamaran Ferry Called World's Largest
description: The Rokko Maru, a 2,700 grosston catamaran ferry, described by the Japanese builder, Nippon Kokan, as the world's largest, is now making 70mile runs between Kobe and Takamatsu. She measures 274 feet with beam of 82 feet.

title: AGNEW DENOUNCES CHICAGO 7 TACTIC
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., Feb. 27 (UPI)  Vice President Agnew said tonight that the out rageous courtroom conduct of the Chicago totally obfuscated the constitutional question of tthe Federal antiriot law.

title: RHINOCEROS GROUP IN GARDEN BENEFIT
description: Rhinoceros, from Los An geles, provided a generally spectacular concert last night as its part of a benefit at Felt Forum of Madison Square Garden.

title: Antiques: American Empire Pieces in Ideal Setting
description: A VISIT to the BartowPell Mansion in Pelham Bay Park, the Bronx, should con vince anyone of the merits of American Empire furniture, pieces made between about. 1810 and 1840.

title: Canada Announces A Budget Surplus; Acts to Curb Wheat
description: OTTAWA, Feb. 27Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau's austerity program will net the Government a $455million budget surplus for the year ending March 31, it was an nounced today.

title: 2d Priest in 2 Weeks Joins Colombian Guerrilla Group
description: BOGOTA, Colombia, Feb. 27 (AP)For the second time in two weeks, a Roman Catholic priest has abandoned a Colom bian parish and joined Castroite guerrillas operating in jungle territory, military sources said today.

title: Sir Robert Bruce Lockhart, ExDiplomat, Is Dead
description: BRIGHTON, England, Feb. 27 (AT)Sir Robert Bruce Lock hart, an author and former British diplomat who was im prisoned briefly in the Kremlin in 1918 died in a nursing home today. He was 82 years old.

title: EASTERN HOCKEY LEAGUE
description: LAST NIGHT'S GAMES

title: Bulgarians Relish Yogurt, Wink at Nudism
description: SOFIA, Bulgaria, Feb. 19  A sales team of the state milk trust has just left for New York to convince United States food processers that Bulgarian yogurt is supreme.

title: BUFFALO STUDENTS OCCUPY BUILDINGS
description: BUFFALO, Feb. 27Students occupied four administration and classroom buildings on the State University campus here this morning without resistance and declared that the univer sity was on strike.

title: Princeton Fencers Score
description: PRINCETON, Feb. 27The Princeton fencing team swept the first round of bouts to take a 90 lead and then coasted to a 207 triumph over Duke to night.

title: TUGBOAT TALKS RISE IN PACE, GIVING HOPE
description: The tempo of negotiations to settle the 27dayold tugboat strike accelerated yesterday as both sides in the dispute met jointly for the second day in a row.

title: LONDON INDEXES CONTINUE LOWER
description: Prices on the London stock market again drifted lower yes terday on continued lack of buyer interest. The downtrend sent market indexes to lows for the year.

title: THEODORE PENNINGTON
description: YONKERS, Feb. 27Theo dore M. Pennington, who re tired in 1959 as a credit investi gator for the First National City Bank in New York, died here yesterday. He was 75 years old and lived at 66 Fairfield Road.

title: STUDENTS STRIKE AT NEW ROCHELLE
description: NEW ROCHELLE, N. Y., Feb. 27Students at the College of New Rochelle, a small, usually peaceful women's college, went on strike today to support a popular teacher who was de nied tenure at the Roman Catholic institution.

title: Debate on Broker Fees
description: Doing business on Wall Street historically has been profitable that very little debate ever arose about the prob lems of the securities industry. The problems, after all, were few. Today a major segment of the industry apparently is no longer profitable and the debate is raging.

title: 9 in Hartford Use Barbel To Punch Out Jail Escape
description: HARTFORD, Saturday, Feb. 28 (AP)Nine prisoners appar ently used a barbell to batter their way out of the Hartford Correctional Center last night.

title: Patachou Reports Theft
description: Patachou, the popular French singer, reported to the police yesterday that her handbag, which contained $22,000 to $25,000 worth of jewelry, dis appeared while she was having tea Thursday in the Plaza Hotel.

title: Students Occupy a British University Building to Protest Dossiers
description: MANCHESTER, England, Feb. 27Students occupied a cam pus building at the bleak Uni versity of Manchester today with traditional British re serve.

title: I Nat'l Basketball Ass' n
Site of Vietnamese Deaths Is an Old Battleground
description: DANANG, South Vietnam, Feb. 27The scene of the al leged killing of five Vietnamese women and 11 children by five United States marines is an area fought for longer than any other in South Vietnam.

title: PRESIDENT SEEKS NEW STRIKE CURB FOR TRANSPORT
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27 President Nixon, proposing the first major labor law changes in more than 20 years, asked Congress today for new ma chinery and broader Presiden tial powers to ward off crip pling strikes in transportation.

title: ... and Homefront Efforts
description: There has been a deplorable lack of attention to the drug problem at all levels of governmentperhaps most glaringly at the local level, for it has been here that the results of inattention have manifested them selves in astronomic death statistics. Mayor Lindsay's recent promise to triple the city's addiction sensitivity program for teachers underscores how very little has been done in the educational area until now.

title: Theater: A Reappraisal
description: MUSICALS come and go often with an alarming frequencybut Fiddler on the Roof seems to play on forever. At the Majestic The ater, this musical with a book by Joseph Stein, music by Jerry Bock and lyrics by Sheldon Harnick has re cently acquired a new Tevye in Paul Lipson. However, to call Mr. Lipson new to Fid dler on the Roof is some thing less than accurate.

title: Decline in Reliance On Federal Power Reported by Panel
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27 (AP) A belief that the Federal Government is the best agent, for solving the nation's do mestic ills reached its peak in the midnineteensixties but is now dead, a Governmentspon sored report said today.

title: Art: Dissent at the Academy of Design
description: LIKE a corpse twitching a muscle 40 years after embalmment, the National Academy of Design stirred in its grave this week. Nothing seismic in terms of the out side world, you understand, but enough to shake up the comatose little enclave at 1083 Fifth Avenue, some members hope. The jury of awards for the annual exhi bition, now in progress, de cided that there were no ei igible paintings worth the two $2,500 Benjamin Altman prizes in landscape and figure.

title: ExPueblo Man Is Killed
description: ANDERSON, S. C., Feb. 27 (AP)An Anderson man who survived a year's imprisonment by the North Koreans as a crewman on the Pueblo was found dead yesterday in his service station here. Today, Wesley Page, the coroner, at tributed the death to accidental carbon monoxide poisoning.

title: NEWSPAPER TALKS REACH AN IMPASSE
description: Negotiators for the typo graphical union and the four generalinterest newspapers here reached an impasse yes terday and temporarily re cessed their talks aimed at achieving a new agreement by March 30.

title: Two Are Elected to Board Of Children's Community
description: The election of Harding F. Bancroft, executive vice presi dent of The New York Times, and Mrs. John B. Coburn, wife of newly Installed rector of St. James' Episcopal Church, as di rectors of Greer Children's Community was announced yes terday.

title: Vietcong Exchange Shots With Militia In Streets of Saigon
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Sat urday, Feb. 28 (AP)Vietcong guerrillas and South Vietnam ese troops exchanged gunfire today in Saigon and terrorists set off two bombs in the city, military spokesmen reported.

title: RAILROADS TO ASK 6% RATE INCREASE
description: All but about three of the nation's biggest railroads have decided they can't wait any longer, but must seek another freight rate increase of about 6 per cent.

title: Sports of The Times
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., Feb. 27The sun, pale yellow and shapeless in a clear blue sky, is mild and gently warming, Joe Pignatano, the coach, is punching out grounders toward first base, where the stockbroker and restaurateur. Ed Kranepool, and the Scripto vice president and restaurateur. Donn Clendenon, are fielding some of them.

title: Letters to the Editor of The Times
description: Racist Policy

title: FUNDING IMPASSE ENDED IN SENATE
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27  Southern Democrats teamed up with Republicans in the Senate today to approve a spending restriction that may break the impasse between Congress and the White House over a health and education appropriations bill.

title: JOSEPH J. M'CADDEN, HUNTER PROFESSOR
description: YONKERS, Feb. 27  Dr. Joseph J. McCadden, who retired in 1962 from the educa tion department of Hunter Col lege after 37 years on the faculty, died yesterday at Law rence Hospital in Bronxville. He was 74 years old and lived at 10 Armstrong Avenue.

title: B.O.A.C. Pilots Offered Raise
description: LONDON, Feb. 27 (Reuters) British Overseas Airways Corporation offered its pilots to day a pay increase up to $3,600 a year for flying the Boeing 747 Jumbo jets. The offer would bring senior pilots up to around $24,000 a year.

title: Apollo 13 Test Succeeds
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., Feb. 27 (AP)The National Aero nautics and Space Administra tion successfully completed to day a flight readiness test for the Apollo 13 moon landing mission scheduled to begin April 11. Launching crews con ducted a practice countdown to assess the condition of the Saturn 5 rocket and ground support equipment.

title: U.S., Spain Agree on Base
description: MADRID, Feb. 27 (UPI) The United States Air Force has been given permission to reactivate its base at Saragossa, Government sources said today. Some Spanish observers linked the move with the closing of Wheelus Air Base in Libya.

title: Treasury Official Sees Gain in Inflation War
description: Charts E. Walker, the Under Secretary of the Treasury, pro claimed victory yesterday in the initial phase of the fight against inflation, but he warned that a reasonable degree of moderation in wage settle ments would be an essential ingredient of further progress.
